text:
Seeing that this place received 4/5 stars and 900+ reviews, I believed that this restaurant would live up to the hype. There were so many good reviews on the bone marrow and oxtail pho as well as many other dishes from the menu. However my experience here fell short. I usually don't write reviews but I thought I would share my experience.

First thing was when we walked in, there was a host stand but no host. There was a sign for patrons to sign in on a sheet with a name and number of guests. Our presence wasn't acknowledge until about 25 minutes later. Not sure if this is a Vegas thing because they're so busy (we had a similar experience at another restaurant) or that's how they operate.

Once we sat down we looked over the menu. Most of the dishes had unique twists on Vietnamese cuisine. But long story kind of short - we wanted to try the oxtail fries, they were out of fries. My friend and I wanted to try the bone marrow pho, they were out of bone marrow.

Since trying the bone marrow was out of the question I went with a basic meatball pho. After 30 minutes the dishes started to arrive to the table. This is also when one of the servers informed me that they were out of meatballs for the meatball pho. 
Are you F'n serious!?!? I mean bad enough you made me wait 30 minutes to tell me this but  those meatballs  for pho ( and French fries) are usually frozen.  You would think.. running a restaurant that serves PHO you would make sure you have some of them suckers in the freezer at least.  Manager probably wasn't on top of inventory this week.

At this point I was getting really HANGRY. Everyone at the table had gotten their food and now I had to look at the menu and decide what to get (being if they didn't run out of it already)
I decided to go with the oxtail fried rice remembering that there were rave reviews on the dish on Yelp. The dish came out about 15 minutes later and let me tell you... I thought you couldn't really mess up fried rice but.. this was pretty horrible. I don't know if they forgot to season it bc they were in a hurry to push it out since they didn't have any ingredients left in their kitchen for any other dish on that menu or what but.. it just tasted like i was eating steamed white rice with onions. Because there was a lot of white onions in it with maybe a bit or a shred of oxtail meat here and there. 
I ended up having to season the rice with whatever condiments they had at the table, which wasn't much. I should have known- any Vietnamese restaurant that doesn't have fish sauce or soy sauce on the table as a condiment should be a warning sign.  

I don't know..maybe we went at the wrong time or maybe that's just how they roll.. but I would not recommend this place to anyone- not even hipster foodies. This place is just overrated and over priced.
Great place, great food, awesome people! Abundant selection of libations, from craft beers  to high end Japanese whiskey. I'm a happy man :) Vy rocks!

I just had the worst experience here. It started with a cluster of a mess waiting for a table since there was no hostess or waitlist. We saw another aggravated couple seat themselves at the bar so we did the same. We ordered egg rolls, chicken pho, and rice combo. Simple enough right? No lobster this, no oxtail that. 

Am I suppose to ask for my side garnishes when ordering pho? Accept my apology if it's suppose to be ordered a la carte. My pho came out first and sat there as I tried to flag down any staff member. Fifteen minutes later, my boyfriend's rice combo comes out so we asked the food runner for the garnishes for my pho and fish sauce for his rice. By the time that came out, she brought along the eggrolls. I'm not even upset about the sequence of the food but damn, 2 of 4 of my eggrolls were soggy because it was placed under all the wet greens. I asked for our check since we seem to be adding on to the masses that were stressing out the staff. I am in the restaurant industry so I totally understand, but for such a beautiful business opportunity... staff up, get more organized, and be consistent. Smile even if you're stressed from all the big tops, I lived in Vegas prior and learned to treat the tourists kindly. This might be their first and only time out here so make their experience amazing. 

I couldn't eat anymore because I was just so upset with the experience. I was really hoping for a good last lunch before my flight. This just ruined it for me.

We went to this place two days, back to back because our first visit was so great. The second time around was a complete 180. They lost our reservation. They didn't bring us enough menus. The first time we came in, the server brought over the specials board and suggested different items since we had never been there before. This time, we had to ask about the specials and he didn't even bring the board, he mentioned the few that he could remember. We saw all the other servers bringing the specials board to the tables. Our share plates WERE NOT WASHED! They had food remnants from the last guests. When they brought "new" ones, they were also dirty! We asked for everything to be brought out as it was ready. We placed our order at 6:40, by 7:25 we had not received the appetizers or my sister's meal. We had to ask the manager and then the server about the missing items. When the pork buns finally came out, one at a time, and they were hard and inedible. By that time, everyone had completed their meal and my sister was not interested in her meal. I asked the manager to remove the buns, she apologize and said she would, but the check was presented with the buns. At that point, the server, Johnny L, was scared, and stopped coming to the table. He wasn't attentive anyways. We had other servers stop by the table more times than he did. The "manager", Vy, was too busy talking it up with her friends, to assist us. We were so impressed the first time and brought our family back to try it. Had high hopes in becoming regulars at this place. That's definite no.

Wow. I am impressed. Seriously delicious food. The house special oysters were incredible good and very very fresh. The grilled whole squid was fantastic and the best that I have ever had in a restaurant. Tasty and tender. The beef carpaccio was very good, too. Their pho is one of the best that I have tasted. I am very picky when it comes to pho and I have tried a lot of pho in the US and in France. Service was very good and friendly, too. I cannot wait to get back again.

a great place to get food other than pho. I didn't get pho this time but next time I will. I had a sample of the broth and it was really good. 
Must haves.....oxtail fried rice and the pepper garlic lobster! The oxtail fries was hella good too. They put a good amount of oxtail in both to make it better than other places. 
I'll be here on my next visit to vegas after a night of drinking of get some pho.

I am Vietnamese living in Orange County, the largest Vietnamese community in the country, just to put my expectations into perspective.  Hate to be so blunt but If this restaurant were in Orange County, it may last for about 6 months at most.  Ordered the lobster pho. It was totally bland and devoid of any true pho flavor. 50$?! I was totally confused.  The presentation was nice tho. The big bone soup was similarly bland. However the meat and marrow from the bones were tasty. We also ordered the ox tail fries. The fries were loaded with meat and gravy. Good value but again, not much with taste. 
The service was good. People were friendly and helpful. The food came out quickly.  the ambience was nice. 
Im glad I did try this place as the concept is good and novel.  However, I would not come back
I have to wonder if the chef is truly Vietnamese or familiar with how pho should taste. Maybe they had a bad batch of the broth. Having read through some of the other reviews, I see others thought similarly about the blandness of the broth. 
Sorry, This place missed the mark.

Live down the road and last night was my first time in.... WoW! Bartender Seth amazing the ox tail was out of this world! 

~Hands down, one word DELICIOUS!!

The food quality was not very good. The flavors were neither authentic Vietnamese or well executed fusion. Confused as to what their objective is.  It definitely isn't tasty, fresh food. Wish Chada Thai would have been open :)

District one is an amazing restaurant. The service is great, fast and friendly. I highly recommend ordering the oxtail fries as a starter .The oxtail meat is tender and an egg on top just makes it that much better . I also recommend the lobster pho , the broth is delicious on its own and the lobster is fresh and delicious.

Thank you District One for not acknowledging your potential customers.  Was there today and waited to be seated. Place was not busy at all.  Two employees looked at me and went on their merry way. No one said "we'll be right with you". Nothing. We were looking forward to try this place for our Vegas vacation. Thank you for not giving two sh**ts.  Kai the owner,  we loved your Pho So 1.  Please talk to your employees on being more welcoming your customers.  Very DISAPPOINTED.

Place is nice good vibes friendly staff order the ox tail Loco Moco it is amazing!!
A+++

This place is outstanding. I'm visiting Vegas for a few days and decided to get away from the strip and try something new. The place is a nice sports restaurant with excellent Asian food. The fried rice was awesome along with the noodle soup.  I will be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Some good eat here, personal favorites pho Tom and fried pork belly buns. Everything I've had here is very tasty, portions are generous and prices are just right. Fish tacos (sashimi) you'll find them on the appetizer menu ... They are tiny so don't expect full tacos. Happy hour is a good time to try the appetizers.

I've dined here twice and both times the food was incredibly tasteless. 
The first time I dined at this establishment I had the whole squid. It was so tough and chewy, I had to send it back!
The second time, I thought I'd give them another chance and  I ordered the spring rolls and whatever they've in it that's crunchy tasted old and spoiled , like it's been cooked for days, then I had the oxtail loco moco and too much onions in it.
The basil that was brought out for the pho was dried and not fresh.
I suggest you hire a new cook and come out with fresh ingredients.
But on the positive note, I think the service was exceptional!

This place took over for some Cajun seafood  restaurant and had the same feel to it. All was well at first. I ordered the coconut mojito which took forever to come out. I think because they were car I up a fresh coconut to serve it in. I hope. The food took a while to come and when it did, it was just ok. I ordered the pork belly rice bowl and my wife ordered the pork chop. Her pork chop was overcooked and dried out. My pork belly came with an undercooked egg and in a dish separate from what is anticipated. Despite this I hoped initially that the food would be ok. At the end of the meal I felt unwell. Ended up getting sick. Wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend, although the servers were nice-ish.

This is the best Vietnam restaurant in town with their fusion style dishes and awesome Vietnamese coffee that's just addicting. I highly recommend the ox tail fried rice. 

the only reason it's not a 5 star is because their hours have changed and now I can't frequent there at 1 am in the morning after a night out. 

I hope they change their hours back!
Sooooo good! Delicious twists to traditional foods. Amazing beef carpaccio! And oxtail pho.

The Happy Hour $1 oysters are great quality. Fish tacos amazing. 
Chefs special oysters are next level.
Loko moko was delicious 
Oxtail very tender and slow cooked to perfection. 
Vietnamese coffee is stroooong

As much as I want to give District One 5-stars....I can't. First let me be clear: this is a 5-star place. The food is amazing and I love the atmosphere. Sadly...the service was disorganized & nonexistent. The servers were very nice & when ours was present he was helpful but we spent more time waiting for him then we did speaking with him. Additionally, our food was run out by different people at different times - I was practically finished with my bowl of Pho when they brought the veg plate out for it. But the biggest disappointment of the evening: PARKING!  There was none. I parked in the shopping center next to it and walked; my friends parked across Jones & played Frogger trying to cross. This isn't the best area at 7pm on a Saturday night. It doesn't change for the better at 9pm. 

The menu District One has on their website is wrong. I had my heart set on lobster pho when I arrived but when I found out 1) the menu online is wrong and 2) the price was more than whats online I couldn't justify it. 

I really wanted something different so went with the rib eye pho. OMG is was delicious. Lots of noodles, perfect broth & the rib eye melted in my mouth. I hate going to Chinatown but I will just for this. 

Spring rolls were disappointing. Bland. Too much mint. Not sure what the crunchy pork was inside the roll. These are traditionally made with the pork and shrimp on the outside of the roll visible through the rice paper. And nowhere near the amount of mint crammed into this. It had absolutely no flavor and the peanut sauce wasn't about to help change it.  

Oxtail pho I heard was gorgeous, too. 

Shrimp skewers weren't cooked through. My friend is an idiot and doesn't send food back so she literally threw $8 away. ($3.99/each)

Came here for my birthday and overall I was very pleased. Will definitely come back...but not at 7pm on a Saturday night.
Great food! Great service all friendly and helpful. Good atmosphere. Spring rolls and egg rolls to die for!!!
Awesome service and the oxtail fried rice! Delicious!!  Will be back for that lobster pho

Hi 
There is nothing I can say bad about this place .
From when we arrived till we left...great service and food.
India (totui?) was our waitress and she is awesome. 
We got there at happy hour and beat the crowd. 
Fried buns and garlic noodles
Will definitely be making a come back and u have to try the coconut ice.cream

I got referred here by a friend who has been raving about it since it opened. Decided to give it a try today and was very impressed. I am no stranger to phò and this place has now taken the title of my favorite Vietnamese joint in town. I got amazing, timely service and the food was to die for. Ox tail phò was incredible and so were the tamarind chicken wings. Atmosphere is nice too. Great restaurant. I can't wait to bring my friends and family back here! Loved it.
This place has really good pho the meat is so tender it melted in my mouth I got the pho with the meats. I could only imagen how good the rest of the food is, I will definitely be back!!
First time here at district one and I'm glad we came. Ask the Chef to do a tasting menu for you and you won't be disappointed. A must try restaurant here in Vegas.

I came here based on a friend's recommendation. This place is awesome.  Staff is super friendly. Food is flavorful and the meat is well-seasoned and tender.  Best of all the prices are super reasonable.  The shaken salad n rice dish are fantastic... I really can't over state this, the meat was awesome. My wife had the pork buns steamed not fried and they were delicious... They have pork belly.  My friend got the shrimp n pork papaya salad and she loved.   I would visit this establishment every time I visit Vegas.  The drinks are a little pricey at 12 bucks each and the place isn't on the strip but the food and service is well worth the drive.
Awesome combination of Vietnamese food and American dining style. I always have the spicy beef noodle and spring roll. It's reAlly good!

On a late night run to White Rabbit, we came across District One. It seemed really packed in a strip mall location but we figured we'd give it a shot. The restaurant is new and has a great, hip vibe. The decor is American and is geared towards a younger crowd. We were seated and ordered some drinks. Looking through the menu, we ordered Oxtail Fries, Shrimp Spring Rolls, and the Ribeye Phö. Phö Kim Long used to be my main spot but this new place blew them away. The portions are bigger and the food has intense flavor. You know how you go to a restaurant and wash your hands, then you have to touch the dirty doorknobs to get out? Well, this spot has the sinks OUTSIDE of the bathroom so that you can wash your hands and keep them clean. All around, this place has the perfect vibe, great, friendly staff, amazing food, and the right set up. They close at 3 am so you have plenty of time to get there after a night out. So, try it with your friends. You won't be disappointed. Promise.

Went here a few months ago for a business dinner and was more than pleasantly surprised. We were a large group and you could tell that the place was full of locals and mostly non Westerners (which I took as a good sign). The place is beautiful and had a very relaxed atmosphere made all the more inviting by its lovely and charming owner. Certainly not an expert on Vietnamese food but coming from NYC I can tell and appreciate well crafted food and this place definitely has it. From the Big Boned Soup to the Beef Carpaccio everything was wonderfully prepared, fresh and full of flavor. If you are in the Las Vegas area I highly recommend checking it out.

One of my local favorites! They truly have an amazing place here! Lovely staff and amazing food!
My recommendations:
1. Belly Buns, you can get them steamed or fried! (I prefer Fried!)
2. Shaken Beef, healthy and delicious!
3.Fish Tacos, these were amazing fresh yellow tail cooked in citrus! 
4. Oxtail Fried Rice was average but it was good! 
These aren't in specific order just some of the few things I have tried.

Love the interior of this place. Place to just chill with your boyz. I had the "District One Combo Platter" you can ask for both short rib n pork chop for extra $3. Love the house kimchi that came with the platter as well as Chinese sausage. My wife had the "Pho Ox Tail" Ox tail was just cook perfectly! We ordered coconut ice cream in coconut as dessert. We asked our server if we can have the coconut juice from the coconut n he bought us cup of coconut juice. Thanx Aaron!
Just awesome place to eat. Price is reasonable for the amount of serving and the goodness of their foodhappy tummy.

Tried the carpaccio and the belly buns. Carpaccio is a must-try. Everyone has pork belly bao buns nowadays,but District One's were the best I have had so far. I want to go back and try other dishes,but it will be hard not to order these two items every time. Very friendly service.

First of all the food was great we had the pork belly cooked in young coconut juice, crispy eggroll, combination plate w/short ribs and a fried egg on top of rice, raw oysters...prepared with a thin slice of jalapeno and caviar on top. I did not like the flavor of the oysters even though they were prepared fresh. But all our other dishes were delicious! I would eat here again.
We also had a 2 yr old that they tolerated...which is always nice.

I love pho and have been to lots of places.  But I just love this place because of oxtail pho.  It is very flavorful. Also I like oxtail fried rice as well. I will be back to try more dishes.  I would love to see if they shorten up their prep time.

Well been here 4 times the partner of the establishment, Christina, is very welcoming and sweet. The bartender that took care of my friend and I, Adrian, was great, remembered our names and very attentive to what was going on! 

The food is great from what I tried which were some of the daily specials, fresh shrimp on a bed of salt, Serrano pepper wings, some speciality oysters. In my opinion were all great. Flavor was on point as well as the overall quality of each plate. 
The cocktails I had were the Vietnamese donkey and the coconut mojito. Both very delicious, balanced and refreshing. 

The atmosphere is very nice, music and tvs for those who enjoy just hanging out having a drink and some nice bites. 

Highly recommend this place to any one looking for a laid back place with great service and great food 

5/5

This is the best Vietnamese restaurant ever!!! I love this place. Christina and Kai are awesome. I had a fish tacos. It's soooooo good!!! You have to order this one. I had a fresh oysters. It's really refreshing. One of the best oyster I've ever had. They have a full bar now. They have so many drink to choose from. They are open till 4am now on weekend. This place is gonna be pack soon!!! Come check it out!!

Favourite Pho place in Vegas! My husband and I go here every time we come visit.  We have never been disappointed.  We always get the Oxtail Pho and the Big Bone.  These are both a must try dishes! The Big Bone makes the pho broth very rich and flavourful.  We also order a side of rice noodle with the Big Bone.  I have ordered the Lobster Pho and this was also very delicious.  It's about $35 .. Worth it to try.  Happy hour and reverse happy hour is our favourite time to go for the oysters!! How can you can beat half price oysters? Service is also very friendly and fast!

I have only been to District One twice. The food is nothing special. I have tried the Five spiced hen over tomato rice and pickled veggies. I thought there was no point in adding the pickled veggies in the menu since you barely get anything. I love that the tomato rice had a lot of flavor and also the hen. Tomato rice and hen were perfect. I have also tried their Oxtail Pho. I honestly think there is nothing special about that. The broth is just a regular Pho broth and the Oxtail seemed a little overcooked. 

The menu is small compared to other pho places. I think District one is a Viet Fusion restaurant. They don't have everything a usual pho place would have. They don't offer many rice dishes or the drink desserts. So if you're looking for your typical Viet food, I wouldn't come here. 

I would probably go to District One once in awhile for the Five Spiced Hen over Tomato Rice only. The prices at District One are higher compared to any other pho places in Las Vegas.

The environment is more hip and clean compared to other pho places though. It is very modern I would say. There is a bar and seating is very nice. 

The service was good. I have only gone to District One once during lunch and early dinner (4AM). There were only 3-4 other parties the times that I have gone there.

Every year for my birthday I try to find a new spot to have my dinner. With the help of yelp ;) I stumbled upon District One. I decided to give it a try based off all the positive reviews. 

First, I wanted a place that was open late because the second part of my night didn't start till much later so I was pleased that they were open until 2. 

I loved the interior. It's not typical fancy birthday dinner type of decor (but that's not really my style) It was very relaxed, and even though we were dressed up, we felt very comfortable and we were able to relax and have a good time.
I was a little hesistant at first choosing this place because most of my friends had never tried this type of food before but luckily everyone found something to fit their taste buds :) 

Our server Jason was very helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable. A couple of my friends got spring rolls confused with egg rolls, but they took them back with no issue and brought them back what they meant to order :) 

I had the fried pork belly buns and the beef pho, which both were super tasty! I'm a lover of soups and this one did not dissapoint. I also tried a peice of my friend's egg roll (very good) and some pork chop from her combonation meal, which was also really good and flavorful (she said it was better than her mom's lol). My sister complimented the chicken wings and said the sauce that came with them was very good. I also tried the chicken fried rice: nice, moist, and had a little kick which I didn't mind. At the end of the evening I recieved the coconut ice cream for my b-day treat...it was delicious! My friends even ordered some for themselves. All in all I had a very good experience that evening and left full and happy:) Thank You District One for making my birthday even more memorable. 

If asian fusion is your thing (or if you just want to try something new) I highly recommend trying District One, you won't be dissapointed!
Had bomb ass Oxtail Pho..  Best Pho in town.   Atmosphere is trendy and hip.  Friendly staff and real authentic Asian food a twist..

Incredible Pho joint in the Chinatown district of Las Vegas. This place lifts the level of your everyday Pho. If you go to Vegas get off the strip and try this place. I typically rate Pho by the broth and the broth here is so flavorful. It just takes all the ingredients of whatever soup you order to another dimension. Will come here again on my next trip.
Overrated and over priced!! They ran out of everything and didn't notify us until 30 minutes later. Okay service but bland food

First we love the decor, the atmosphere and how clean this place is. 
Everyone is very friendly and helpful. 
They have sake on tab! woohoo! They also carry such a large collections of wines, beers and Japanese whiskey. U gotta try Japanese whiskey such as hibiki, oh my it;s so smooth and trust me, no hangover the next day. 
We ordered a lot of items on the menu, overall we are pretty content about the foods. 
Oysters with house special sauce is very fresh, the tobiko on top adds a different texture to the oysters, we totally love it. 
They said they only serve fresh crawfishes. Yup, no frozen crawfishes for me! Their sauce is less intense than other places in town. But i love it, less garlicky feeling the next day thank you!
Tamarin crab was good. I wished the sauce was a little thicker but its still good, a balance between sour, sweet and salty. Yum yum!
Their egg rolls serve hot and crispy. They have taro inside, my favorite in town.
Their beef wrapped in betel leaves are yummiest. You can taste the lemon grass in every bite. It's very moist and well seasoned. It goes so well with the green onion and peanuts on top.
We tried the pho oxtail and both agreed that its totally authentic. The broth is richer than other places, not too strong of the pho spices. It is not easy to make a good pho broth, you can kill it when putting too much spices. This place got it right, got it right!
Oh and their beef carpaccio, I have never had it this way before. The truffle oil is such a smart move. I enjoy every bite of it, the beef melts in my mouth.
Overall there are some room for improvement but for such a new opening place, it deserves a five stars.

Love the ambiance and location (don't dig that parking is 60 minutes max and impossible to find on a weekend), and the greeters got us seated immediately on a busy weekend. The food is a swell Asian fusion that is cheaper than expected for a swanky industrial-club like atmosphere (seems like a great place to bring a first-date). However, the food was not as OMG as some of the yelp reviews had persuaded me to believe. My steak and egg rice plate was not bad, and the portion size of stir-fried beef, a soft-fried egg, and ketchup fried rice was just right. But the flavors were just okay, about on par with any decent Chinese restaurant. But for $14.95 (their online menu prices are out of date), I wasn't blown away. Our party of six stayed well past finishing our meals, and the servers were attentive and didn't rush us. There was a server error however, where we ordered the oxtail fries but they mistakenly brought us something that may have been garlic fries. We ate a few before we noticed the mistake, and when we let the server know, he took the half-eaten garlic fries away and made us wait for the correct order. I know it varies from place to place, but I'm used to servers leaving the wrong dish on the table as a comp when they make a mistake--especially when it's an appetizer that they're just going to throw away anyway (hopefully \:0 ). Oh well. When the oxtail fries finally arrived, they smelled great--but honestly, they weren't anything really revelatory. I assume their fries aren't fresh-cut. They seemed frozen, but I could be wrong. Their service was fast and friendly, and the prices were okay, and they have that hipster factor going on. I'm not opposed to going back--would like to try out their spin on pho.

I obviously don't "get this place" while I appreciate the decor the food leaves a ton to be desired.  Honestly I don't care if I am eating at a bus stop out of a paper hat if the food is good I will eat there every day.  This is literally the reason I hate trying new places.  When I arrived for a late lunch around 2pm the place was pretty busy. I later put two and two together and figured the only people drinking a bottle of Veuve on a Monday afternoon would be the owner and his friends.  

I ordered the rib eye pho, I may not be an expert but I have had pho at more than 20 places in Las Vegas and LA including staples like Pho Kim Long.  The pho at District One tasted like they took beef jerky from Wal-Mart and soaked it in hot water then threw in some "Fresh vegetables" also from Wal-Mart with maybe a dash of MSG but certainly not enough to add any flavor.  It was the worst Pho I have ever had. Period. I am writing this review absolutely starving because I took two bites and realized that even the entire bottle of cheap Hoisen sauce couldn't improve the flavor.

When I told the server it wasn't good and I just wanted a box and the check (In hindsight I don't even know why i would bother taking it to go.) She didn't include any utensils or sauces so she must have imagined I would just throw it out. She did give a half hearted apology and offer something different however I was so disgusted with the food so far I couldn't picture anything else on the menu edible.

Here is the worst part of the entire experience, I believe the level of ineptitude transcends anything thing the "chef" could ruin in the back of the house. So I have already voiced my frustration with how awful the food is and I am actually offering to pay for it as opposed to just walking out and telling them where to stick it. I put my debit card in the $8 check and she promptly returns to inform me there is a $15 minimum on CC transactions. REALLY? Do I have cash? No... I don't have cash.

I will go ahead and lay out the reasons why this pisses me off so much.

1. $15 dollar minimum! Seriously?  This is illegal according to the Dodd-Frank Financial Reform Bill

(3) LIMITATION ON RESTRICTIONS ON SETTING TRANSACTION MINIMUMS OR MAXIMUMS.  (A) IN GENERAL.--A payment card network shall not, directly or through any agent, processor, or licensed member of the network, by contract, requirement, condition, penalty, or otherwise, inhibit the ability (i) of any person to set a minimum dollar value for the acceptance by that person of credit cards, to the extent that (I) such minimum dollar value does not differentiate between issuers or between payment card networks; and (II) such minimum dollar value does not exceed $10.00

2. This is stupid, what do you think their average transaction for lunch is? I'm going to go ahead and say their average check is just under $15. You are only going to piss people off with these kinds of restrictions. This may have flown 15 years ago but when the lady selling tamales out of her van started accepting credit cards on her iPhone it made this place look ridiculous.
When McDonald's started allowing credit card payments, they found that the average purchase size increased from $4.50 to $7.00 (source: NPR). A broad study across multiple industries conducted by Dunn & Bradstreet found that purchase sizes were 12% to 18% more when paid for with credit card.

3. I am obviously already having a bad experience, why not just proactively handle the problem and when you drop off my check let me know "for next time"?  Would it really have been that hard for her do think autonomously without me needing to get more upset than I already was?

In conclusion: Don't go here. It isn't worth the hassle or frustration, maybe the owner should put down his noontime Champaign and get in the kitchen. I don't know what else can save this place from becoming yet another mediocre eatery in a city that deserves better.

My wife and I have been here many times. Great food and drinks. Creative and thoughtful. Beautiful decor and great service. The staff is always attentive and accommodating. (Even when we bring our kids ) Go to dishes include oxtail fried rice, veggie pho, spicy beef pho, oxtail fries, and oysters. The daily specials can be great as well. Also a great late night place. Many of us that cook on the strip come after work.
I went there for a late night bite, instead I got a late night experience! I love everything about this place! The food is outstanding!

Came here with a friend and his sister (both locals) at their recommendation before heading to the airport to return home after a business trip.  Initially, I was a tad put off, for as we entered the establishment, the hostess, possibly the manager, completely ignored us for several minutes, favoring she was chatting with near the bar.  Eventually, she came over, seated us, and returned to her friend and a group of young gentleman sitting near the bar.  She never left that spot the rest of the time that we were there.  In my opinion, not the best managerial customer service.  But I digress...we arrived during Happy Hour, so I ordered two orders of the pork belly baos and one order of the tamarind chicken wings.  The service was very friendly and prompt.  The food was delicious!  Definitely, an excellent recommendation from my friend.  Definitely a locals place, but worth the drive if you are staying on the Strip.   Hopefully, the manager will learn to be a bit more attentive to all of her customers.
This is the next to go to hotspot.  The owners of this restaurant are friendly.  Fast and convenient service.  The food is phenomenal!  See a lot of promising things for this Vietnamese fusion.

Biggest problem which will be a disaster to one unsuspecting customer one day (like a child, senior or disabled person): Currently, their handrail exceeds the width of the platform you must walk on to get to your table. This gives the illusion that there is no drop off/step down when in fact the drop off is over a foot deep between the step off and the handrail. The whole purpose of a rail is for people to hold onto it and to prevent them from falling off of a ledge. Here, if you reach for the handrail, you fall off the ledge. One member of our party who had recently undergone knee surgery, almost fell off the platform due to the handrail illusion which would have been disastrous. I hope the restaurant fixes this and takes this seriously before someone gets seriously hurt. Inconsistent food with good service. Atmosphere is cool and light-hearted.
Great customer service. I highly recommend the xo tail pho and grill whole squid.  We also ordered the ox tail due to the great reviews but I found it to be average.
Lobster pho was the best pho i have wver had, hospitality of everryone was great and the gentleman kai remembered our name which made me happy cause i know he deals with alot of people...

I saw all the great reviews, so I ordered take out. I ordered the short ribs and fried rice. Instead I ended up with white rice?. If it was not for the friendly staff I would have 
rated it 1 star. I loved their oysters on the half shell. Half a dozen was the price of a drink@ the bar. Oh yea. I will try again. Just because I liked the staff. Will just check my take out.
Tried the ox tail pho today and it was ok. Ox tail was good..soup was just ok.  Atmosphere was cool. Service is fast and friendly. Clean place.
Oxtail fried rice with garlic noodle sub. On point. And I don't know where else you can get oxtail pho.

I'm a little disappointed in this place considering all the hype I've heard about from others. The experience that I had wasn't as close to what others may have gone through. I came here with my boyfriend a little before noon way before the crowd even started to come in. We had ordered the pho nam, braised pork belly and egg rolls. The pho nam wasn't as great as expected. When coming to a vietnamese restaurant, you'd think the flavor would have some tradition in there and not a bland flavor. It seemed as though the broth was altered and not as delicious as you'd expect. As I waited for my dish to arrive, the braised pork, we started to notice that the other customers who came way after we ordered started to get their dish before mine. We asked the waiter/waitress where my order was as it had already been ten minutes after the pho came out. They said there was a back order in the kitchen. How the heck is there a back order when no one was there yet when we ordered?! great cover up...but not really because we told them there was no one here when we ordered and they just looked stumped......... by the time it finally did arrive which was 20 minutes later.... the food looked like it had been sitting under the warmer the whole time and so did the taste of it. 

For a place that received so many great reviews, highly disappointed. Rather go to their parent company Pho So 1 which actually makes great food and has the food come out in time instead of making up excuses. The Only Reason they are getting two stars is because they decided to give us 15% off our meal. So for that they get an extra star.

They have a really good selection of Japenese whiskeys. I tried two different kinds and I wish I could remember which ones. This got me in the mood for the meal--unfortunately it took 30 mins for appetizers and nearly an hour for food to come out. What we ordered ended up being small dishes, and it was surprising because the menu's didn't make them sound that way. The food was good over all. We sat in some weird corner with a bunch of empty cardboard boxes behind our table, so it wasn't a very classy experience. I'd suggest looking at pics of other people's dishes here on yelp to get an idea of the size of the plate before you order it.

Great happy hr and they have 2 (one late night).

The Pho is out of this worldrib eye for me)! And the fried pork belly buns are yummy. Or you can get them steamed. 

Happy hour also has .50 cent wings.

I heard about this place and decided that the next time I was in Vegas I would check it out. Luckily I was here this past weekend with some friends! I came here for one thing and one thing only -- the Lobster Pho. At the seasonal price I paid $40 but it was worth every penny. You get a whole lobster chillin in your bowl of pho and he just stares back at you as if he were saying "eat me!" The broth itself was lobster in flavor and it was delicious. My boyfriend can vouch for that because he's Vietnamese :) Our friends ordered pork belly buns, pho tai rib eye, and steak and eggs and were pleased with their dishes. District One gives out generous servings and their service is quick and great. I might have to make this a traditional spot to eat at every time I'm in Vegas. Thank you District One for a wonderful dining experience!
Ordered the lobster pho and bun bo hue. Both were super tasty. Service was excellent. Will definitely revisit the next time i'm in vegas!
Bringing my friends in for game night and my lady for date night. One stop dining experience. Ask for chef Khai!

Good food, Friendly servers but service is a little bit slow even there is a lot of them and not that much people. Double Down porkchop is good. 2 stars for their menu, not so attractibe at all. printed and on the clipboard. hope they could improve on that

Awesome food and even better service! 

The wait was a bit long due to a very busy Vegas weekend, but well worth it. Price point is on the higher end of Vietnamese food, but the quality is obvious. We had the double down rice dish, oxtail pho, oxtail fries, and oxtail fried rice. All delicious. 

The cherry on top is how warm and friendly the staff is!

Stopped in for a quick bite while we were in town. Came here about 4 months ago and thought the world of this place. The ambiance was super cute for a Vietnamese spot, definitely different from your normal pho place. Since the time we were here last, they jacked up the prices a few dollars! $14 for oxtail pho?? I can get that back home for $7 and it's way tastier. Also tried the pork belly braised in coconut juice... $10 for 3 pieces of pork and 1 egg. I think my grandma would freak out if she knew I paid that much for "thit kho". Service was great but not sure if its worth it to come back.
Steak and eggs are really good for $12.99... 2nd time back this trip!  Literally I will be back here every time I come to Vegas!!  Better than my anjin I give 5 stars and is triple the price!

We went in around 2pm as a party of 3. The place was not busy. We ordered one beef ball pho, lobster pho, and veggies as appetizer. We sat waiting for an hour all while the server told us it'll be coming out soon. Then she comes over and tells us she's hungover and never put the orders in. Appetizer finally comes out. 30 min later the phos come out, but she brings oxtail pho instead of lobster. Beef ball pho is fine but she doesn't bring any of the topping veggies so we sit for a while again. One member of our group is pescatarian so she can't eat it. After making this many mistakes our server doesn't make eye contact with us anymore. Manager explains that they're busy and doesn't seem to realize the server never put out order in in the first place. The food was good and the manager gave us 2 complimentary desserts, but we're not coming back. 2 hours for pho is beyond ok.
Was there last Sunday really good food environment was great and the service was awesome

I was there first and last time, we order pound of shrimps and never got it, we were waiting for half hour and then we ask a waitress she said she forget,  and then we ask for check, they gave us wrong check, service worst ever, soup was too salty,

Even though we waited for 30mins while there were so many empty tables. I still like their lobster pho so bad. The lobster is fresh and so big which worth the price of 39.99, the most expensive pho I ever had, lol. The hostess was very thoughtful to bring us water and let us seat in before we order cos we have a pregnant lady with us. The kitchen was really slow so we waited another 15 at the table before we can take the order.

I tried pork belly buns & oxtail pho.  I'd definitely come back here to eat those again & try their other food on menu.  I've tasted better beef carpaccio elsewhere, depending on your wallet, I'd save my $12 for something else.
This place never disappoints. Food is always amazing and great service and staff. Plus they're Pokemon Go friendly!
This s*** was bomb!!!!!!! Best Vietnamese restaurant I've been too. Lobster pho was amazing. Everything I thought it would be. Bone marrow soup was delicious. Can't wait to come back to Vegas again

I came here and had the oysters and they were fresh. I also tried the lobster pho. It was delicious and the service is just great. They are always there to make sure everything is great. I would recommend this place.

This is our go to pho place during every vegas trip. That doesn't mean that all they have is the typical pho and vietnamese food. The pho here is decent at best, but they have other items worth noting.

Oxtail fries - delicious!! I love this here and its a nice change if you don't want noodles or rice dishes. The meal is very tender and flavorful, topped with a nice crisp egg cooked over easy. 

Spring rolls - These were really good. I really enjoyed that they put the crunchy eggroll wrap in there that usually is in nem nuong. 

Pork belly buns- My favorite thing here! The buns were delicious and the pork belly slices were melt in your mouthhhh. 

Garlic noodles - I added chicken for 3.00. This was my entree but the most disappointing. The noodles were p bland and flavorless with only a hint of garlic and the chicken did not make it any better. I had to add soy sauce.. Incredibly disapointing, I would not recommend this at all. 

Service was good and attentive and the ambience is nice. Very clean and spacious establishment

My BF and I were in Las Vegas for the weekend and decided to try this place out! When we got to the restaurant, we were seated right away. We looked over the menu and figured out what we wanted fairly quick.  We waited a little long to get our orders taken, which was odd, because it seemed like there were more workers than customers! When we looked around seriously each table had a worker tending to them!! One of the managers (I assume) went up to us to apologize about someone not helping us and got someone to take our orders right away. I appreciated that. The service was great after that! 

On to the food, we had the pork belly buns and the fish tacos for our appetizers. Both were delicious. Just wished they were bigger or served more in a dish, but that's my inner fatty talking! My boyfriend had one of their steak dishes which he said he enjoyed! I had the slow braised pork belly in young coconut juice. That dish was soooo good! I love pork belly and that meat was so flavorful and melted in my mouth!! It was on point!!! 

I would definitely check this spot again and try their other dishes!!

District one is own by a respected individual name Kai.  From a real estate agent toba restaurant owner.  Enough of his creditablity.  They have this rice dish, ox tail fried rice. It's amazing.  And their pho's is on point.  Highly recommended

Good food & service. We went for lunch ordering the pork buns, big bone marrow soup, steak & eggs sub the rice for garlic noodles, short ribs and rice combo. Everything was yummy and the booth had plenty of space for our kids. The customers continuously came in on a Sunday for lunch, I can imagine the dinner and late nights are packed.
Papaya salad was awesome. Chicken pot also very tasty. However pork belly was not very tender.  Squid was overdone. Easy to get a seat. Nice service.

Came to try the sea snail. DELICIOUS!!!!!
Some skinny kid name Richard took my order really nice kid greeted me with a smile. Another reason I love coming here.

District One is not your typical Asian restaurant. It is cool without looking or feeling like it's trying hard.  The food is amazing and the drinks are strong. We love our server who remembers us by names.  Will definitely come back!
Every time I'm in Vegas I stop here. Every. Time. Sometimes twice a day!  For sure the carpaccio and it's a toss up for the main dish as everything is delicious.

We had the big bone soup, the house special oysters, oxtail fries, oxtail fried rice and the vegetable dish (i forgot the name of the dish). Everything tasted bomb and the prices were just right. definitely coming back here!

Food was delicious. Pho broth was good. Lobster tasted freshand delicious. The rice chicken had good presentation and tasted delicious. Portions are very fulfilling. Would definitely come back when we go to Vegas again.
I enjoyed my meal, the ambiance, and most of all the music! Try the oxtail fried rice with oxtail gravy, it was very good.

This place has a cool vibe to it. The decor is modern. We came with a group of friends last Sunday. We just wanted to check it out cause we heard good things about it. The drinks were delishhhh. Their happy hour deals are hard to beat. I didn't see anyone ordering Lobster Pho. I just wanted to see what it looked like. I will definitely check out the food next time i'm in Vegas.

The waiter TK gave us the best dining experience ever and we dine out at least 6 times a week. TK was very attentive and made sure out experience here was great .  The food tasted very good but his service is what made me want to come back again just to see him . We were very impressed and will recommend all of our friends to specifically see him when we come back .  Asian fusion food and service at its finest .  Ask for TK when you dine here .  He's a young tall asian guy and I think he works the night  shift .
My favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas. Atmosphere is fun, food is yummy, the oxtail pho is awesome, place is clean.

Visited vegas this weekend and had to eat here! Its our late night stop. Big bone soup is so good with bone marrow still in tact. You cant go wrong with their ox tail froed rice. Lobster pho was too expensive so we couldnt get it.

This restaurant is awesome. The food was great. The waiter even better,  his name was Cory fabulous. My brother, his friend and myself had the best Christmas dinner in years. Cory was patient, helpful, and prompt. We tipped 30 percent and Cory was worth it. I hope people in Las Vegas are taking care of the workers in Las Vegas because the tourist aren't. Vegas strong.

Tried District One because my coworker recommended this place. I had the oxtail pho and my wife had the oxtail loco moco. The pho was ok but the oxtail was not soft enough to fall off the bone which made it hard to eat. The oxtail loco moco was also ok but a little on the salty side. Service was good and the staff was very nice!
I have been there a few times. Often always good.  Nothing was horrible but nothing stood out as delicious.  The great thing it's open late.

Had a great lunch here: garlic serrano wings, beef lemongrass in betel leaves, pork spring rolls and the Pièce de résistance, shrimp with D1 goodness. 
Major props for shrimp with heads on. 
REALLY looking forward to them getting their liquor license because the meal warranted some serious beer. 
Our server was excellent and attentive. 

A few gentle suggestions since I know they are brand new: 

1. The little pieces of garlic/serrano didn't really stick to the wings. The pieces that fell into the accompanying daikon salad were delicious though! Would love to have more of that flavor on the actual wing or maybe a special dipping sauce?

2. Would love to see Bánh mì on the menu. 

3. Also, could use a delicious baguette to soak up the D1 Goodness in the shrimp boil.

4. Maryland blue crabs added to the seafood boil menu when in season.

Can't wait to go back and have BEER.

This place is worth checking out, I've been here twice, both times my meal has been excellent. Lobster with black pepper sauce is too die for. Oxtail garlic noodles were super tasty. The beef carpaccio is delicious. The belly buns are super good. My husband has had the Oxtail pho, and the bone soup, both were very good, but the flavor of my meals was superb. I can't complain about anything other than their computer system, both times we've been stuck waiting over a half hour for our check. For that, they lose one star. The service otherwise is great! Their happy hour is fantastic!
had the lobster pho...eh, it was ok. if i wasn't expensing it i don't think i would have paid $50 for a bowl of pho.
Had the ox tail pho and the ox tail fried rice. Both were delicious but the fried rice was my favorite. I also recommend the flight of sake if you're a fan of sake
Absolutely amazing! The lobster ph is incredible. I plan to come here every time I'm in Las Vegas. The bone marrow soup is awesome too. And the coconut mojito is great!

Food is pretty good. Restaurant stays pretty busy regardless of the time. We ordered the pho and it was very flavorful. Portions are pretty good for 2 people. So we ended up sharing and ordering an appetizer too.
Love the oxtail fried rice..I ordered vietnamese regular ice cofee and Vy recommended the Hennessey Vietnamese ice coffee...Soooo good..Jason C. our waiter was awesome. They have happy our too.
This place is a real deal. I had the oxtail fried rice. Everyone loved their food. Great service, clean bathroom and the place are nice. Lobster Pho and Fried Rice is what my friends recommend.
We tried this place since we were in town.  I had the oxtail pho and boy was it delicious.  The meat was so tender that it fell off the bone with ease.  This place is a must try.

We stopped by for a few drinks and snacks en route to another place.  The atmosphere feels familiar and fresh.  Full of locals and visitors alike, District One gives off an aura of welcomness.

Cozying up to the bar, we order some drinks then peruse the menu.  A few items jumped out right away.

The grilled squid with spicy mayo and sea snails in an aromatic broth.

I really wanted to like both dishes, but a few minutes too long cooking proved both items to be a bit chewy and less enjoyable.  The flavors for both were quite enjoyable.  The broth of the sea snails was exceptional despite the chewy shell inhabitants.  The squid remainded me or the same I saw in travels oversea, but these were overcooked a bit too much.

Another friendly and knowledgable bartender provided an upbeat, casual environment providing some other dining options for us to try.

The menu seemed to cover a lot of different food types and the energy of the restaurant was upbeat and energetic.  I'll give this place another try, but will look towards items of the meat style for eating.
Two dishes that I always order when I'm with my man:  vietnamese beef carapaccio and goi ga :9 Never fails to make me happy

First time eating here and I gotta say would definitely recommend to friends, family, strangers, etc..
We came in not knowing what type of cuisine they served and our waiter came over completely ready to answer any questions/uncertainties that we had.
With their Vietnamese cuisine today we ordered:
-Pho Tai (?)
-Spring Roll
-Fresh Coconut (drink)
We didn't order much since we weren't sure so we shared the meal.
I enjoyed every single bite. 
My favorite dish is the Spring Roll and District One nailed it. Keep it up.

Second time here. This time we brought the clan! 6 adults and 6 kids from toddler-7y/o. Customer service again exceeded my expectations. This was also our friends first time here and they absolutely loved it!

Even with the kids running around and being "kids," the staff didn't seem to mind and still maintained bearing, and while keeping up with our requests. Food delivery was spot on, and they really made us feel welcome.

The ribeye and oxtail pho are dynamite! The Serrano wings are bomb, and the fish tacos are tasty and refreshing and pairs well with the Japanese hefe.

I'll be coming back again for happy hour! Thank you guys for making our night worthwhile!!

Great place for date night!  Clean, fun, incredible food and awesome service.
My hubby had wings, fish tacos and steak & eggs and loved all of it.
I ordered the lobster pho....AMAZING
Our server, TK was so attentive and V is so friendly.  
They even have extra outlets and USB ports to charge your phone at the bar.
Get in your car and go to District One now! You won't be disappointed.
Great food and service.  The ox tail fried rice and beef carpaccio was amazing.  Definitely will be on my visit hit list for vegas.

I made a reservation on July 4th through Yelp and the reservation was confirmed. However, I don't know how to rate this visit because the restaurant was actually CLOSED on July 4th!!! I don't know which party should be responsible for the loss of our time.....

We went to district one because of my pho obsession. I have heard a lot of hype about the lobster pho. We ordered it and it had tasted like someone had scooped up the bottom of the ocean and put it in a bowl. It was so foul tasting we had to throw in half a bottle of sriracha and hoison sauce just to get it down. It was so bad we couldn't even finish it. When we got the bill and saw that they charged $50 for one bowl of pho I was pissed! 
I'm giving it two stars because our server was nice and the spring rolls where good. 
There are much better and much cheaper places to go for pho in Vegas!
Love this place awesome time great price even better customer service do yourself a favor and go here if you don't you stupid I have spoken

We sat at the bar for happy hour and they didn't have the fries we wanted. Our bartender was super friendly and apologetic about it. When we got our beers we loved the glassware and asked if we could buy a couple of the glasses. She came back and told us they were on the house! Wonderful service,  made us very happy.

I've never been there before, my roommate always picks up food from there. I got the shaken beef salad to go.. And not even halfway into eating it.. I found a LIVE BUG on my lettuce!!!!!! Obv they don't wash their lettuce and I am totally grossed out. The dressing is good but after seeing the bug.. I feel like there might be little chopped bugs in everything else.
The food was awesome. The service was a little off, but not bad by any means. I would recommend this location to others.
Pretty good food and atmosphere.  They have an amazing beef carapacio and my favorite is the grilled squid!

The sake flight is probably one of my favorite things here. The pho is amazing; I love it. However, you can drive down the street and get some for the half the price...only reason for a 4 star review over 5. Definitely check it out if you want to treat yourself to a classier vibe/sit down Asian fusion place.

Im a sucker for good pho !! The broth, clean and hearty! The noodles were fresh, the meat was tender and wonderful. The staff were all smiles with cheerful conversation. Everyone there was happy and enjoying their time, customers and employees alike! I don't know if it was the warm atmosphere, the aromatic tea I had or the Wealth of brothy deliciousness from the kitchen but I left with a full belly and a fuller heart. Thanks so much D1, I'll be back
Amazing Asian food! Get a variety and go all out. Don't miss the in tail that was my favorite. But honestly it's all great. Amazing cocktails and fun atmosphere is come back.

I had a great time eating lunch here.  I was looking for a place to eat that was off the beaten path of the strip and offered something truly different and satisfying.  I found District One and I really loved their twist on common asian and Vietnamese dishes. I ordered the Garlic Noodles with thinly sliced cuts of beef. It was served hot and fresh and it was delicious with just the right blend of garlic flavor and of course, the noodles were perfectly al-dente. They have a Vietnamese Iced Coffee that will bring you right out of a hangover - or perhaps even a coma. The waitresses and staff are all first-rate and extremely professional. I'll be visiting again next time, especially since my party was served fast and the bill was totally reasonable considering the amount of food and alcohol that was ordered. Unfortunately, I was the DD on this trip so I didn't get to enjoy any of the drinks, but everyone said the bar here is top-notch and the Vietnamese Donkey (it's a drink) was awesome.

omg oxtail pho and lobster pho. the pho broth is so clean tasting. 

super friendly staff, casual late night eatery, good selection of alcohol. 
if you want asian fusion food, this is the place. excellent seafood choices. 
if you want really good pho, this is the place.

I've been here a few times before. In fact this time I brought my family who are visiting from out of town.  Tonight MUST be an off night.

Upon entering, the hostess never greeted me, or even smiled at me.  I had to approach her. When she sat us she didn't know the difference between a booster seat versus a high chair.  (Admittedly, I didn't know the difference when I had my first job) 

The waitress was definitely trying her best, but she made too many mistakes to just overlook. We ordered the steak on the side. She even confirmed with us that we wanted it separate from the bowl of Pho. It was in the soup.  We asked for an extra spoon 3 times before getting it. The coconut water we asked for took asking twice for it and nearly 10 minutes. 

Then, the runner bringing the food out just held the food right in my sister-in-law's face rather than placing it on the table. On top of all that the rice was under cooked.  The beef carpaccio was less than lackluster. 

I MIGHT be back.

Broth was amazing and I've had a lot of pho in my life but never worth yelping. Server Endera (sorry is spelling is wrong) but she was great! Attentive and made truthful recommendations! thanks again! Will be back!

I love it!  The oysters always taste so fresh and the veggie pho is my go to.  The tacos, although small, pack a wallop of taste.  But I reiterate, they are SMALL.  They have Kronenberg Blanc on tap here and it's one of my favorite beers.  District One is a Pho restaurant so stick to the hits.  Also, if you get the big bone soup, be prepared, it is LITERALLY a big bone in some broth.  Go for the oxtail, you get bone, meat, and pho, not just the broth.  But those are small caveats to a great place.

It's disappointing after hearing all the great reviews. Ordered pho rib eye and pho oxtail. Soup is underflavored. Oxtail is not tender enough. Crispy egg roll is good but overpriced. Lastly stay away from Shrub drink unless you want to drink vinegar.

Attention to detail, all of the elements are on target.  Friendly, accommodating service, interesting atmosphere and then there is the food.  Subtle things that some places miss, spice or seasoning a little bit lazy or haphazard, not here.  Straightforward, cared for and obviously well thought out, not over the top, but delicious, clean, and flavorful.  Like the academic so intelligent she can make physics relatable, the kitchen here has spent the time necessary to master the wonderful art of your grandmother's cooking and then present it in an approachable way.   They then change the game by slightly altering the traditional and making it modern, making it seem like it was or should have been that way all along.  No one dish stands out, they all do...this is a place where I try something new every time...because I can.

I've been here every time I was in Vegas, and the foods were so good. This restaurant is a an Asian Vietnamese Fusion, they offer ox tail Pho, Lobster Pho , which are really delicious. The fish tacos, beef cappuccino, grilled squids  and the king crab legs are the best things for appetizers. I mean everything were so good, you should definitely come and give it a try. Good place to hang out, chill w friends, full bar with all kind of drinks you can ask for ....and good foods of course. We came as a group and the foods gone in second!!

And also you should save room for their coconut ice cream as well. It is just tasty as the one I had when I was back in Vietnam
Amazing staff... amazing food.. amazing atmosphere! Owners are so humble and welcoming.. had my bachelorette dinner here and the staff took great care of us!
Very interesting concept. Service was really fast. They really transform the Viet cuisine to the next level. Lots of options for you to share among a group if friends. I'll definitely come back!
Just okay food - ordered vegetable pho which was practically flavorless. The oxtail fried rice was just okay but didn't taste freshly made. The belly buns were a bit dry and stale.
Came yesterday for dinner.  Decided to come again today with more friends.  Tried more dishes.  Delicious food!  We will come again next year when we are in town.

The yellowtail mini tacos (3) are definitely something to write home about and they have a good mix of Pho and regular entrees. 

Very cool vibe inside with bar, table, and booth options. 

Reasonably priced at about $9/plate and a unique beer selection. 

As a pescetarian, I was disappointed in the lack of veggie options but I should have called ahead to check the menu because I believe that they change it often. 
There was a mishap with my Wonton Veggie order but the server and manager comped the soup and offered us a complimentary dessert. ----business done right

Ate out here last night. food was good and we did not have to wait long, i had pork buns for appetizer and pho as many antree. Out od all the pho restaurants I've been to, this place have the most protein meats, thank you! Service was great, the waitress was very attentive. 
4/5 will come back and recommend

Brand new restaurant (6 weeks they said)... Found it on Yelp because my cousin's gf wanted Asian for her bday dinner. 

Hands down, best birthday dinner I've ever been to.

There were 6 of us in the group, and we decided to do everything family style. We ordered 5 appetizers and 4 entrees. The place was about 3/4 full, but our waters were always refilled by the time they hit half full. The food all came out hot, and in a perfect progression just as we were finishing up what had been brought out first. 

Everything was delicious, and I'll definitely be bringing other friends here when they come to town.

Me and the bf have been wanting to try this place for a while now and take the fam here, so I thought why not try it out first before bringing the whole clan over. 

The atmosphere is really great when you walk in. Cute decoration and definitely brings a modern look to a Pho restaurant! Big plus because it doesn't terribly smell like Pho and have you worrying about your clothes when you walk out! They give you the option to either sit at a booth, open tables, bar or in a section somewhat closed off for tables.  The first time we came we asked for some recommendations and were encouraged to try out the lobster pho at $27.99 and yellowtail ahi tacos at $8.99, so we went ahead and did that. The tacos were soooo good. However, it was pricy for only only three small tacos. So I guess it really depends on what you are looking for: quality vs. quantity. The lobster pho was ok as far as taste (didn't wow me like I would expect) but the idea and look of the plate was cool. as far as the service, our waiters were great and very informational on the menu. I was a little distraught with. who I think, was the owner or manager. Both times I came to the restaurant, she spent more time trying to impress the "big buyers" and didn't stop to see how the other tables were doing even though those customers were right next to them. So that docks my service review a little. I also mentioned it to a friend of mine and she mentioned she noticed it the few times she went of the selective service. So for my review the first time around, I give the restaurant a 3 for food and 4 for service!

My second time later that week I brought my family and ordered the oxtail soup and hue spicy beef noodle soup for me and the BF. Defffff redeemed themselves this second time around. I loved both soups and the oxtail was so soft it basically just came off the bone easily (I'm sorry no pictures for the second time around tho!). The service was all around the same as the first - good waiters, manager tended or paid notice only to other higher paying customers. But all in all, second time rating is a 5 for food and 4 for service!

Definitely coming back again and again... But It won't be for the lobster pho! Love this place!

Service was very friendly and food was fresh tasting.  My friend and I shared 4 plates and we both really liked 2 of them, then thought the other 2 were just "OK".
Possibly my favorite was the pork belly slow cooked in coconut juice, but the crispy egg rolls were also a winner.
The wok tossed clams and beef wrapped in betel leaves were the dishes that I would pass on.  The broth on the clams could have used more flavor and the beef rolls were slightly dry inside.  
The portion sizes were good

This place is amazing!!! I took my friends from out of town (LA) and they absolutely loved it. A few days after our first visit, my friends requested to eat there once more before driving back to LA. Our favorite menu items were the fish tacos (a perfect light crunchy shell with diced yellowtail inside), spicy beef noodle soup, their oysters are to die for( topped with caviar and a light ponzu sauce for dressing), the beef carpaccio has plentiful of flavors and melts in your mouth, their spring rolls and fried egg rolls are great, and their lobster pho is one of a kind. I love it here and will be  coming back often. I don't care about what they wear or what shoes they have on as long as the food is good and their service is friendly. The staff is awesome and their manager crystina made sure our whole experience was perfect. And it was! Thank you crystina and district one for two great dinners during this past weekend!!

We had trouble finding a place to eat while in town. This place is solid. My GF and I visited this place 2 nights in a row. The menu has a nice variety to enjoy each visit. The staff and their service was great. They will not disappoint. If this place was in San Diego, I would be a regular.  Im now going to eat fish sauce glazed chicken wings with oxtail fried rice.
Fucking amazballs! Drinks are great, the food was just as good! Oxtail phó was just what I needed the next guy I came in, and my son ordered the oxtail fried rice. That egg on top was perfect!

We have been here a few times and brought friends & family when they come in to town. No one has been disappointed. There's just too many delicious dishes to mention. We have our favorites like the chicken wings, garlic noodles, squid and my husband has to have the coconut ice cream. They are open pretty late and in prime time they are busy.
Try this place.... great atmosphere. Upbeat and clean. Staff is super friendly. Food is really good.  I had a bowl of Ox Tail Pho. Prices are friendly also. This is a must do again !
went to get a take-away. Excellent service & easy atmosphere. Good choice of IPAs on the tap. Food was as good as advertised! Going back

For some reason this place reminds me of an asian Yardhouse. It has the whole bar set-up and then tables all over. One thing my Bf & I noticed was that there were a TON of waiters/waitresses. It was kind of bizarre as there were about 20 of them.. and it seemed like they knew all the customers or something as they were basically hanging out at their tables. Another thing I found weird is not everyone who worked there was dressed the same -- most were in their assigned Tshirts/uniform/whatever, but some girl was in a romper & another guy in baggy shorts & a T. Highly confused here. I am assuming that we came in at a less busy time.. and that this place is probably a popular hangout place as it gets later. We ordered a few things on the menu, and I wouldn't say anything was terrible, but everything was extremely average.



stir-fried dunginess crab in tamarind sauce -- That day they were offering the crab with spicy aioli sauce.. I prefer spicy to sweet/sour (tarmarind) so naturally I wanted to try the crab with the spicy aioli. In my state of hunger and excitement to try everything, I didn't realize they had brought out the wrong dish -- the crab with tamarind sauce! I already had my fingers shoved in the crab legs (which were of decent size) and a few crumpled up napkins (in attempts to contain the mess which comes with cracking crab claws) when I realized everyone at the table diagonal to ours was staring at me. The duration of this staring was equivalent to the amount of time it took me to consume about two crab legs.. obviously I felt awkward as 1)there is no classy way to eat crab legs in public 2)how do you not feel awkward when the table next to you is essentially gawking. Was I supposed to offer them some? Then it hit me --- the waiter had brought me their crab legs. It all made sense when the four of them got up and left less than 5 minutes later. 

Welll - my apologies for eating your crab legs, but in all seriousness you guys didn't miss out on much. I didn't think they were that fresh, and for the price it wasn't worth it.

Shigoku oysters -- The oysters were probably my favorite of everything we ordered. They were fresh & I loved the flavor. Not much else to say other than.. if you are an oyster lover like me, try these!

Pork belly buns with peanut sauce -- this was pretty average. Buns weren't fluffy.

Fish tacos with yellowtail, avocadi, cilantro, tomato  --- Again, average.

Whole grilled squid --  I always order this when I see it on a menu so I had high expectations of this.. Sadly I was disappointed as it was way too tough. Almost sent it back (and we NEVER send things back), but I guess we were in a good mood that day.

Bun bo hue - This was good. The broth was full of flavor, but for some reason it really irritates me when they don't serve it with the blood cubes as advertised. I know some pho places will ask you if you've ever had them before (and if you say no they automatically assume you won't like it so they don't include it) but at least they ask! I don't have any real complains about this, but if I were really craving bun bo hue, I would probably just go to an actual Pho place for it.

This place didn't WOW me as much as I had hoped it would. I want to say I'd be back, but I don't know. Maybe.
It's really good here. Came with my parents even they are impressed with every dish. Pork belly rice, short ribs, oxtail etc.

My first time at District One Kitchen. My son-in-law had told me about the place and said how great the food was. I had their rib eye pho with a side of veggies and spring rolls. It was very very good! I will definitely go back to try something else on their menu! This place is a keeper!!

The food was good with generous portion size. The ambiance was great and enjoyed the look and feel of the restaurant. The food was ok, but there is a lot of competition. The plus is their variety, you might have to go to a few other restaurants if your friends all want different things or you all might agree on this place.

I have been hearing about this place and I made a reservation for my birthday. The atmosphere there is really cozy and really nice. The staff are friendly and always there when you need them. Their food was really good. I like the oxtail friend rice and the platter combo was good. There was one thing I didn't like was the Chinese sausages. It was bit hard, but other than that it was good. I would go back again.

#19

I recommend eating at District 1 because it has great service And really good food, and drinks! 



District 1  has great service because the waiters are patient and they cook their food fast.  Their drinks are also nice and cold and refreshing. But the bad thing about their can be some bad parking sometimes.


The food is really good and their fresh like their, unions, bean sprout, limes, and their leaves. Also their pho is really good like the pho Lobster and other types they have.

Delicious Surprise

Asian-fusion is consistently good. My date and I shared a oysters, fish tacos, and hot wings for appetizers, and then main dish: the beef brisket and flank Phó- it was absolutely delicious and way too much food! The server was a huge help. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

District one was the best of the Asian restaurants in Las Vegas by far. My friend had belly buns and they looked very good. I had a saki on tap which was also good. We've been here before and have also been very pleased. Delicious gourmet food!!

The pho was delicious, but on the smaller portioned than I would have liked.  I tried the lobster pho and didn't regret it.  The presentation of the lobster was superb.  They even de-shelled the claws for you!

Ok four stars for having Delirium on tap!!!!!  Food is good and their HH is excellent.  Wings are delicious and they even have Fernet Branca on tap!  Lighting is a bit strange and a little to bright. They have some cool old fashion bulbs, but then have some bright led type near the bar...just a bit bright.  I think if they had all old style bulbs, I'd give this place 5 stars!  ;)
Love coming here! Deep fried belly buns is a must! Also try the fish tacos which are amazing and always fresh! Must try the beef carpaccio I really love that mostly!
The porkbelly buns were a combination of sweet and yummy with a little salty kick to compliment it. The price here is kinda expensive our tab was $400 for 16 people

I was craving for Kalbi so we decided to try this place. We were originally going to the Chinese Noodles place just down the shopping complex but the line there was too long. We tried the chicken wings and they were probably one of the best wings I've ever tried in a long time. They were spicy and had chopped jalapenos all over it. Even the jalapenos were good to eat because they tasted like they had just been chopped. The chicken had the right amount of crispiness. For my entree, you guessed it, I got the Kalbi beef ribs. The serving size was definitely enough for two people. It was really good also. It was served with en egg, Chinese sausage and riceThe meat was very tender. The staff were also very attentive. They checked on my friend and I a lot to see if we needed anything. The establishment is very spacious so you don't feel like your moves are restrictive. Lol I will definitely come back to this place.

I loved how this place looked! It definitely didn't look like a typical Asian restaurant with upbeat music. For appetizer, we ordered the "belly buns" and it was so good! Very flavorful. I got the "double down" pork chop for my main entree. The pork chop was very tasty and the egg was cooked perfectly.

Whenever I'm in Vegas, I have to make a stop here.  A lot of people come to check out the Lobster Pho, but I come back for the other delicious items on the menu! 

A modern, hip take on a pho restaurant, District One offers items that take it up one level.  They are known for their lobster pho, which features a whole in the bowl!  It's quite tasty, and the broth has a delicate balance of traditional pho and the exquisite flavor of lobster!  However, set at market price, it has pretty hefty price tag, typically above $40 a bowl.  I recommend getting a bowl for the table and sharing it along with another item per person.

The Bone, which features a hearty serving of bone marrow in pho broth is a delicious go to! Use a straw to slurp the marrow out!!! Does not come with noodles.  If you are looking for something more traditional, the Oxtail Pho will hit the spot.  Speaking of oxtail, the oxtail fried rice is one of my favorite things here! 

They have Hennessy Privilege in two here!  I suggest you get it! There is also a Hennessy iced coffee which is insanely delicious!  It's Vegas after all!
great food and great service:) will come back:) love their beef pho soup and spring roll:)

Not a good choice for pescatarians. I wanted to try this place out because of the other great reviews but my choices were extremely limited.  

PROS
The service was great. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and sat immediately.  I liked the ambiance as well, nice dim lighting and a relaxing vibe. 

CONS
I was very limited on what I could eat but if you like red meats and oxtail dishes you may like this place.  My only options were pretty much the papaya salad and the fish tacos.  Fish tacos were super tiny and both were pretty forgettable, unfortunately.  

This wasn't the worst place I've ever been because the service was great but would I go back again? Easy answer, no thanks!

Two words: LOBSTER PHO. Wowwwza!

Brought here for a cute little date night, the mister ordered for us (since he had been here before). We didn't really do our usual his/hers order, but shared everything:

We ordered:
- CRISPY EGG ROLLS: Four fried eggrolls cooked to perfection served with large lettuce leaves with all the fixins like pickled carrot and mint leaves. Wrap an eggroll with the lettuce, sprinkle some of the garish and dip in the side sauce. The perfect appetizer!
