- THE ORIGINAL WHOLE MAINE LOBSTER PHO: This is listed as market price and was about 50$, but so worth it if you are a lobster lover! A generous 1.5 lbs whole maine lobster in a yummy lobster pho broth with rice noodles. A foodie must try!
- CRISPY BIRD'S NEST NOODLE: Chicken, beef, shrimp, fishballs and assorted vegetables on top of a full plate bed of crispy noodles, softened by a delicious gravy. This was so good and filling, and only 14.99!

Everything was not only presented well, but was extremely full of flavor. We left full and satisfied for sure! Service was good as well... And would we return again? Oh, absolutely! 

Maybe the only downfall was we waited for seating for a good 20 minutes despite there being a lot of seating. I originally asked if a booth was available and the hostess told me she would let me know. 5 minutes later she asked if we still wanted to wait for a booth or were okay with a table, as there still were none. I said, "Oh okay, a table is fine!" She comes back another 15 minutes later and asks us the same question. -___-

Went there last night; very convenient hours for those of us working late on the strip.  Setting was very clean, modern, and a good hang out spot.
Overall, the pho was the highlight and very delicious but other items weren't as flavorful and just missed the mark a little bit.  Here's a break down:

Fish taco: just ok, kind of fishy but it was a good concept.  Needed a flavorful relish or something else.

Spring rolls: crunchy and the garnish (perilla leaf, lettuce, mint) was amazingly fresh and abundant. (I hate it when they only give you one perilla leaf or mint).  But the radish and carrot chips could've been marinated longer.

Manila clams: good and full of clammy goodness but again, not super flavorful.  Lacked salt and maybe more herbs.

Cornish game hens: well cooked, sauce was good, tomato rice could've had more flavorful.

Ribeye and flank pho: we got this just to see how their standard pho was and it was deeeelicious.  Beefy broth with a hint of sweetness.  As with everything else the garnishes were super fresh.  Tender meat, and a lot of it.  It definitely makes me want to try more of their pho.

Service:  I don't care about service that much especially because service at a lot of Asian spots on spring mountain is almost non-existent but this place was just odd.  Our wait staff were all young and very nice, but you could tell they lacked experience.  They sort of seemed to want to talk to each other and hang out with their friends who were sitting at another table.  One time we wanted another beer and tried to make eye contact with one of them and he just looked at us and waved awkwardly and turned around and sat down so he can talk to his friends some more...was hilarious and very weird.   And then 3 of them cleared our table but none of them offered to get us our check.  It's like if I opened a restaurant and hired my little brother and let him hire all his friends. 

But all in all I love that we have a new late night pho place!

This dining venue is absolutely yummy, and one of my favorite places. They're also open late which is a convenience.  I recommend their special scallops sashimi,  hamachi tacos, steak and eggs, or the kalbi! All of those items are pure satisfaction to my little taste buds.

Expect a real treat when coming down to district one! My coworker recommended that we try this little gem! It's not your traditional farm fresh selection, so be ready for something different! Best selections: Black peppered lobster, pork belly buns, and bone marrow pho. House Oysters are a must have also !!!! I've visited here three times and have almost had everything on the menu. So far, so good...no complaints on the food. However, BEWARE of the bar! Drink knowledge is far below acceptable, so don't be upset when you don't get what you want...or they have no idea how to make your favorite cocktail. Yet if you like soda water in your old fashioned, this is the bar for you (Hah). Four stars for great food and atmosphere. Minus one star for lousy bar.

Made reservations for a birthday dinner, great service and food!

We ordered a lot of food, but can't remember all the names:
Pork belly fries -okay
Squid -okay
Pork belly buns- GREAT
Bone marrow soup- okay
Thit kho -okay
It is my favorite restaurant now! I went there again this afternoon and had two Pho, beef carpaccio, oxtail fried rice for party of three. Always so happy with the service and the food quality!

Alright..on a Sunday night at 2am...how are so many restaurants fully booked! Come on..this is Vegas!! Isn't everything opened until very late?

Sadly, this was a huge disappointment. We were all sober, so this is not a biased review. 

With a party of 6, we ordered:
1) Pho oxtail: 3/5 eh, okay
2) Belly buns; 2/5 bleh...the buns were cold...
3) Garlic noodles 3/5 nothing special
4) Oxtail fried rice: 5/5 WOW!!! that was DELICIOUS!!!
5) Fried calamari: 3/5 eh, again, nothing special
6) Green papaya salad: 3.5/5 yum! fresh and refreshing!
7) House special oysters: 3.5/5 fresh! Try it. 

Apparently at 2am, it is HH. So make sure to ask their HH menu :)

District One is an interesting place. The food was flavorful and they had great presentation. The portions however, weren't really fit for a meal, more of a "fast food" id recommend this for a one time experience

Whenever we would come to Las Vegas, we would have to visit this place at least once. We love their oxtail fried rice and oxtail fries. The oysters are very delicious too. 

Now that we're locals, we can eat here all the time. The best thing about this place is they open super late.

This place has definitely improve since it open.  The menu has been diversified but at the same time very simple and clear.  I like how they make some of the simple dishes, creative.  Of course, this first time back I was very un-original and ordered the pho thai ribeye steak and the spring rolls.  The spring rolls were plump and fat, meaning they were large and delish on it's own, but their peanut sauce for dipping has quite a bite, nutty and spicy!  The pho thai ribeye steak was a lot, I wish I had a larger stomach!  The broth was less MSGish, which is good, for me...I didn't leave with a feeling of heavy greasy tummy.  The flavor and aroma in their pho was just enough!

As dessert, I split a Vietnamese coffee with a colleague...talk about quality coffee!  The coffee they use is strong and aromatic.  Let's say once I left and went back to work, I was wired!  

This is definitely a place I will return over and over again to try all the new creative dishes they have.  Next time, lobster pho!!!

My friend sent me a picture of his lobster pho and I immediately knew I had to come eat here. So the next time I went to Vegas, I made the trip out to District One! 

Unfortunately, my boyfriend and I didn't have too much of an appetite so we ended up sharing a lobster pho and dessert. We also ordered an extra dish to go, fried rice with chicken, I think. It was decent, but there wasn't really anything special about it. The rice was also just a tiny bit dry. That lobster pho was an all star, though! I really enjoyed the soup, which was full of flavor, and of course the lobster itself. It also came with a decent amount of noodles. It was a $40 pho, so probably not going to be a regular meal for me, but the novelty of it was fun. And getting to post a picture of it on IG.

For dessert, we got the coconut ice cream, which came in an actual coconut. It was delicious and worth every penny. 

The service and ambiance was great and I would definitely come back again for that pho.
Came here for the Ox Tail Pho and bone marrow soup. Everything was good! Great service and food. Not much you can ask for.

Just goes to show you gotta go to Chinatown area to get great Asian food. I do not usually care for pho but I loved it here. I ordered the mi wonton which was a huge bowl of goodness. Sampled my friends beef pho. I also had the pork buns which was delicious. The service here was perfectly attentive and the bartenders were so friendly. I came here for a night out with a group of friends and they accommodated our party without a glitch. Even separated the bill for us easily. Kudos to this place. I will definitely come back soon.

Introduced my brother and sister in law to District One Kitchen. They moved to Vegas and wanted to know where we go when we're in town. Food is tasty, service is great, very friendly. We each ordered something for ourself and shared the other dishes. They had plenty of leftovers to enjoy! They loved it!

The food is amazing. Everything recommended and ordered was great. My favorites are the oxtail pho, carpaccio, garlic noodle with steak and eggs, and coconut ice cream. Haha I could add more but then it's be the whole menu. I'm not a seafood person but the oysters were to die for. The lobster pho is a whole lobster in your pho. 
The service is great too, very attentive and the servers are always making sure we were happy.
Over priced, bad portion size, lousy atmosphere!  Menu is ridiculous not sure what kind of restaurant this is. Way overpriced!

My kind of place and very unique for what it is. Great bar with great bartenders, interesting whiskey collection and great food! I had the oxtail fried rice, fried whole fish and steak carpaccio. Everything was excellent! Will return for sure!
Awesome place. Awesome service and of course awesome food. Had the special Lobster fried rice.  OMG. Need to come me back again

Came here with a couple friends for dinner, no wait and the food was delicious. We ordered the Vietnamese beef carpaccio, oxtail fried rice, and chicken wings. All which were amazing full of flavor. Probably one of my favorite Vietnamese fusion restaurant in Vegas so far. The staff was really friendly and awesome with food recommendations! Awesome experience.

This place is for the Gram. Much like the Ice Cream Museum, don't do it! We were lured in here by Insider's marketing video of their Lobster Pho. The video made it look so good that we had to try it when we came down to Vegas. Little did we know, their Market Price for a 1.5 pound lobster would be $55.  Okay, no fault of their own since we didn't do our due diligence and called ahead of time and ask for the price. They had other "Gram" worthy Phos from Oxtail Pho to Bone Marrow Pho.  I saw some other people order the Bone Marrow Pho and it seemed like they had the hardest time sharing a bowl of it and scraping the good stuff from it. 

My family and I ended up ordering their other dishes from Pho to Bun Bo Hue to Rice Dishes.  None of them were worth the price and definitely not worth the time. I'm glad we didn't try the Lobster Pho or I would have walked out regretting that I paid for something so ridiculous.  Social media sure does cloud your judgement.

Came here for the surf and turf pho and it did not disappoint. Market price lobster is very expensive but it was almost worth the experience. The broth was well made and there was a generous portion of the lobster. The rib eye didn't wow me, but it was good. Service was friendly. The restaurant was clean. I would recommend this for a great off the strip option.
First time here but will definitely be back with more people! Food was so good there was no time for picture taking! I can't wait to explore more of their menu!

This place is a fun bar. With a great happy hour menu. 

This time we I tried the wings sans flour, delish , they come with serrano chilies. Also had the coconut pork belly, fragrant tender and juicy it came with a medium soft boiled egg, it was so perfect. Also ordered the flank pho dry , didn't wanna fill up on broth . Anyway it was perfect, I added the veggies and lime and got my fill of pho.

Love this place,  fun food , fun atmosphere, will be coming back.
We ordered 5 spice chicken took a long time to get it and when it came chicken was RAW BLOODY!!service was slow at midnight .paid bill in full.

Been coming here for quite some time and normally love it.  However we were there tonight and ordered the house special oysters like we normally do and we were upcharged on our oysters without even being told.  The server had told us about some kind of oysters and I asked if it was more and he said yes, so I told him no.  All we wanted was the regular house special and we were charged double the price.. apparently management can't do anything about either according to our server even though it was their mistake.  So make sure you're very clear on which oysters you want and clarify it a couple of times(never had to do it before but if I ever go back I guess I'll have to)

I'm a newly converted pho lover and have only enjoyed it when my friend's mom makes it from an oxtail soup base, so I can't say I have too much experience judging tastiness, but it was good enough for me lol.  From what I heard this place is owned or co-owned by my friend's cousin Nelson (Hi Nelson)..correct me if I'm wrong...which is a cool little addition to have found out.  The layout of the place reminds me of Boiling Crab back home, but the decor is very modern while the ambiance is relaxing/casual.

Food wise we tried the tacos which were a hit for everyone and the pork belly buns that were also bomb dot com.  My friend had the rice dish with pork belly and kind of wished that it was larger portion, but luckily his brother ordered pho so that compensated for him not being full.  Other than that we all ordered the oxtail pho and no one had any complaints about it not fulfilling their expectations.

Service was good in terms of refilling water and taking our orders, but it took a while for them to grab our bill so we had to walk up to the front cashier and wait for someone to notice us.  Other than that minor minor hindrance, the visit itself was worth the drive and this has become a new addition to my must-go's whenever I'm in town.

This is our second visit, highly disappointing. The quality of the food was definitely not there. We ordered the double down, rice came out extremely dry and hard, the same goes for the Chinese sausage. Both the pho and spicy noodle came out hot which was nice but the side garnishes were obviously old. Our server forgot our two appetizers and when we asked about it, went about about it as if "okay..whatever." Would not return.

I love everything about this place, from thecool décor to the food...THE FOOD is amazing, we got pork belly buns...to DIE FOR! Fried rice was amazing...and the drinks are so tasty and refreshing! I'll definitely be back!

I have heard of this place for a long time. Nice decor. Service was good. Their Lobster Pho is something worth a try. But all the credit goes to the Lobster, good size, great meat and well cooked but the Pho soup was just ok. There is no taste of star anise nor cinnamon as the regular Pho always has. Try it out for your curiosity.

Celebrated my 40th birthday with my husband and close friends.  Had the best time there.  Food was great, service was great, and our waiter had jokes too! Highly recommend the restuarant.  I would go back there everytime I'm in town.
This place is great. They have a fantastic beer selection on tap, great food, and Christina has a wonderful staff. Love D1!!

Such a good place to try !!!! The Carpaccio Truffle Oil and peanuts it's the best I've ever had ! Pho was real tasty ! 
Nice music, nice service .... Make it a perfect improvised Date :-) we will be back (soon).

This restaurant is located in the Mountain View Plaza. They create a fusion of Asian and Vietnamese Cuisines. They have Happy Hour from Monday to Friday 5pm-7pm and Monday to Thursday 12am-2am. There is a young camaraderie and casual feel in the atmosphere, and there are plenty of seating. If you enjoy the sports channel, they have at least 10 televisions at every angle. So it doesn't matter where you sit, you will always find something to watch.

Even though the menu looks simple, the meal that they create are full of flavor. I chose the Garlic Noodles ($7.99) with Chicken ($3) and Mix Vegetables ($3). My order came with egg noodles sautéed in wok fried garlic, tender chicken, broccoli, slice carrots, onions, chunks of zucchini and yellow squash, and cilantro. I really love the garlic noodles and how they leave a little crunch in the mix vegetables. It taste perfect!

What intrigue me most is how on point the service is. It didn't take long for the food to arrive and during my meal they ask if everything is okay. They also come by to refill my drink and I really appreciate how they handle payment efficiently.

Wholly cow! I've been here plenty of times but this is my first review. Had the special crab and noodles and it was the perfect blend of garlic and spicrs. The noodle was nice and chewy and not like over done noodles at some chinese restsurants. Come here anytime and you won't be disappointed.

While visiting for a few days in Vegas, I was introduced to this cool hip asian fusion establishment that served an amazing vegetable pho soup along with some delicious spring rolls and of coarse desert; ice cream served in a coconut and the creme brûlée. Absolutely one of the best asian fusion restaurants with great friendly service that makes you feel right at home. This will be a for sure stop for me next time I'm in Vegas.. Try it out.

Went there this past Spring break with the family. Great service and great food. We had Oxtail pho, Beef ball pho, chicken wings, garlic fries, Wonton Noodle, Spring rolls, Pork buns and Spicy beef noodle. Beef ball tasted like it was homemade, definitely a plus. The chicken wings were on point. I was little disappointed in the spicy beef noodle; it was missing that spice, again it's a fusion restaurant I shouldn't put too much into this noodle, as it takes one of a kind restaurant to get it right.
Lastly, I got the "Big Bone" soup, as saw the waiter bring it from the across the restaurant my mouth drop as it holds true to its name THE BIG BONE. It was it bone with lots of bone marrow which I took a straw to suck the marrow out. The soup was not salty but full of onions, yet so good. It took about 6 of us which me, my brother in law, my husband, two sisters in laws and my son to somewhat finish this. We be back for another round of the Big Bone Soup, pho, chicken wings,Spring rolls, garlic fries, but pass on the Spicy beef noodle.

They ran out of sake bomb which sucked because my friend and I really wanted one. The pho was okay, but when I return I'm not going to be ordering pho. The meat didn't cook and even when we asked for a hotter soup it still wasn't hot enough. This place is not bad though I liked it & the atmosphere is nice. I'll definitely be coming back to try the other food they have.

First time to Las Vegas and first time trying lobster pho. It was amazing. The lobster pho was so good I didn't have to add anything else to it. I was able to eat it has the way it came out as. Definitely coming back here when I come in town. The service was quickly and the people there are so nice. It was my birthday and they gave me free homemade ice cream. It was so yummy!!!! Go check this place out for their lobster pho
Ox Tail Pho and BBH.... Gahhhhhhhh...

Came here with a big group so we tried a little bit of everything. After you get enough dishes here you notice that most dishes come with a fried egg which I think is nice since they were all cooked well. While the service was good my only complaint was the waitresses would talk things up like the donkey or the pork belly in coconut nice which we found to be just okay. 

To Get:
Pork belly sliders: favorite dish of the night
ox tail fries: Better than Bachi Burger's
Garlic noodles with beef
ox tail fried rice
Whole grilled squid

Okay:
Pork belly in coconut juice
big bone soup - a hip bone? in pho broth. 

Skip:
coconut mojito - Way way too much ice, barely anything to drink
donkey drink - I prefer a real moscow mule.  But it does come in a cool cup
Food is great and music is awesome! Great selection of tunes. Literally all of my music I listen to haha oh yea and the food is great lol

This restaurant was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. Service was great! I got the surf and turf pho with the eye round steak raw on the side ($35) and my bf got the ox tail pho. Prices are on the higher end of course because its lobster and ox tail --- but I was very pleased with the portions. The ox tail broth was better in my opinion because its more similar to the traditional pho broth that I'm use to however I thoroughly enjoyed what I got. Next time I want to try the bone marrow broth -- also I highly recommend coming early when they open to skip the wait and have access to every item on the menu. A few of my friends came later after 1pmish and tried to order the bone marrow but they ran out so something to keep in mind!

Cool place to check out and loved that they offer a variety of food options. I came here for a quick lunch and ordered the serrano wings, papaya salad, and five-spice cornish hen with rice. The food overall was fine and a nice change from your typical Vegas food. 

serrano wings- a little plain, but nicely crisped

papaya salad- love the peanut flavoring, and the nice chunky pieces of shirmp

five-spice conrish hen- the chicken has some nice spice to it and the sauce is a nice complment

BIG BONE SOUP! That's all you need to remember about this place. Yeah, they have other Asian fusion/Vietnamese style dishes, but the BBS is the star of the show. The soup itself is $18. If you want noodles it's an extra  $5 served in a separate bowl and $3 for rice. It took me a good 45 minutes to eat the soup. The bones have so much meat, tendons, and marrow that it takes time to work through each piece of bone. I was filled with joy as I was cutting off pieces of meat and mixing it up with the noodles. The marrow is flavorful and there is a lot of it. You could easily order 2 bowls of noodles and split the big bone. 

We did order some appetizers. Belly buns and  spring rolls. Buns were tasty. I would order again. The spring rolls were good but I have had better. 

It was kind of weird how they brought out our food. There was a large party of about 20 people and about a half full restaurant, so our orders were coming out sporadically. They brought my wife's dish out and the noodles for my soup before the appetizers. Then the belly buns came out, but no soup for me. Finally, the soup showed up and my wife was pretty much done with her dish. Then a few minutes later the spring rolls showed up. I took away a star for the kitchen service. The server, Blanca was nice and she apologized for the service. I understand. It was a little inconvenient but the BBS made up for it. 

Drinks were good. The Hennessey Cafe Sua Da was excellent. Slow dripped Vietnamese coffee with Hennessey over ice for $15. Well worth it. Plus it gave me a nice pick me up after a long day in the sun. 

I did appreciate Blanca and her kindness during our visit. She was excellent at her job and made us feel welcome. 

Great place to visit if you're looking at getting away from the strip. With tip we paid just over $100. There are also some kareoke spots in the shopping center and near the Chubby Cattle if you are looking for Korean bbq. We took a Lyft frim the Orleans and it was a 5 minute drive. Give them a try and take on the Big bone soup. Happy eating!

Went for Happy Hour and the service was pretty good. The egg rolls were meaty and stuffed with pork. The fish tacos didnt have much fish in them for the price paid but they were satisfying. The cornish hen was dry and lacked flavor. It looks good in pics but I'll go to Krung Siam for their version which is juicer and spicier. Liquor is not on the happy hour menu but their well vodka is Belvedere which went down really smooth at $8 a pop. Id go back to try the oxtail fried rice and get another order of the garlic fries and egg rolls.

We came for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon and had a delicious meal. We started with a dozen raw oysters (blue point, $1.50 each), then ordered the coconut pork belly with an egg and the steak and egg dish. My son had the steak pho. We were very pleased with the oysters but thought the main dishes could have used a little work. The pho was delicious! We had some drinks as well and were happy with their draft beer selection. The decor is relaxed and stylish and we enjoyed a nice leisurely lunch. Our server was very friendly and made good suggestions. Definitely worth the $8 Uber ride from our hotel, this unassuming strip mall restaurant was one of our favorite spots we visited all week!

Nice late night place to eat but food was overall average and overpriced for the portions. Highly lauded black pepper lobster ended up being very salty and skimpy on the lobster. Service was nice but sort of unavailable at times.
The best pho in town! I love to go here after i get out of the club! Its the best cure for hangover

Being Vietnamese in town, sometimes you crave a good bowl of pho to cure your hangover, and this is the place to do that with the oxtail pho. They have other variety of food that are little americanized, but it's a good touch. Would come again after 3 750 ml of tequila

I might have accidentally found my favorite pho place here by pure chance! D1 has taken over Nem Nuong as my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.

It looks like, food wise, a lot of the kinks have been ironed out since opening. Fortunately, I was able to come here during HH, and I can proclaim that D1 has one of the best food HH in town. I agree that the .50 cent chicken wings are a bit on the smaller size, but they are tossed in this awesome asian glaze that's loaded with these delicious roasted Serrano peppers. And DO get the beef carpaccio! It's all that and a bag of chips! Tender, meaty slices of raw beef tossed in this sweet and sour soy marinade..  Can you say heaven? I liked the mango salad, it was extremely bold with garlic and fish sauce that complimented the delicate ness of the mango and vegetables. Oh, and the oxtail fries? Better than Bachi. Game over.

Let's talk about the pho. Now, it's hard to find a good pho in Vegas. Let's keep it real. But D1 has the best one in town. The broth is very beefy, which I like. The rare beef is amazing, as well as the brisket. The bean sprouts were fresh and crisp, as well as the lime and thai basil. The best part about it was they substituted Serrano peppers instead of using jalepeno. Brilliant!

The food here is 5 stars in my opinion. What killed it for me was the service. Where was everyone? I know we came in a big group, but the place was empty, and they had 3 servers, and a couple bussers. Our water was rarely refilled, and we saw the servers just standing in a corner just goofing off with each other. Such a shame..,

This place has a talented kitchen, no doubts about that. But, they need better training and management in the front of the house. I was thinking about dropping this to 3 stars because of the bad service. The food is extraordinary... So I'll give em a pass. But fix it!! Lol

It took me a while to realize this but Distrct One was on Munchie's Chefs Night Out. When we got sick of eating the food available on the strip we looked further outward and found Distrct One Kitchen and Bar. We came around dinner time on a Saturday night but was seated almost immediately upon arrival.

What drew my here was the Lobster Pho. Little did I know it was going to be $50 for a bowl...so we decided to grab some quick bites before heading out into the night. We started off with the Fish Sauce Glazed Chicken Wings. Fried perfectly on the outside and still retaining its juicy tenderness inside, the fish sauce glaze was spot on. While pungent, like any fish sauce type dish, it still had that perfect balance of sweet and tangy but nothing overpowering your palate. With the pork buns, I greatly appreciated the addition of pickled carrots and radish that added another layer of texture. The pickled vegetables really helped balance the heaviness of the oyster sauce and fatty pork. And that fatty pork...soooo tender..so fatty...so guilt inducing. We finished out the meal with their oxtail fried rice. For the $12, you get your money's worth with their generous portions and plentiful amount of shredded oxtail. I loved finding the random large clumps sprinkled here and there. Coming with a fried egg helped add a savory texture to the already flavorful fried dish.

Service was decent. They were quick to seat us and explain the menu. Once our order was taken we were rarely checked on beside the refilling of water. When it came to paying for our bill they disappeared with my card for quite some time before returning with the menu. 

Now seeing how great our meal of apps and side dishes were, I really wonder if the Pho Lobster would be worth $50. If they can take items as simple as chicken wings and fried rice to a new level, I'm excited to see what they can do with Pho.

Came here for dinner on Friday night and it was pretty good. I ordered the oxtail pho which had good flavor and 2 huge oxtails. The oxtail meat was tender and fell off the bone easily. I also ordered the snails which was one of their specials. It was so good. I wanted to try the razor clams but they didn't have it that day. But the snails were delicious - very sweet and most of the snails were a good size. Service was good from the hostess. I had a lychee martini  - at first they didn't have lychee because they ran out but somehow they got some for me. From the pictures, I thought the restaurant was more fancy but when you enter the restaurant, it has a more casual dining vibe. I will definitely come back to try their bone marrow soup, lobster pho and maybe some of the desserts. Highly recommend - especially for the unusual items like razor clams and sea snails!

Food and service always great at this place! Parking & wait to be seated is probablymy only complain.  

Overall, I will always come back to this place

As soon as we stepped in, we were greeted promptly and was sat immediately. Our server gave us some options since it was our first time here. Loved the lobster pho! My kids enjoyed the pork belly bun and hubby loved the steak and egg.
Good happy hour. steamed pork buns, oysters, and chicken wings. my favorite were the wings. can't wait to go back again and try other items

Unless you are going for one of their signature dishes (e.g. Lobster Pho), District One Kitchen & Bar is nothing special.  The appetizers we ordered (Pork Belly Bun and Egg Rolls) were mediocre.  I had the Oxtail Loco Moco special, which had too much fresh onions/cilantro for my taste, but was overall pretty good.  The pho-infused gravy was ingenious and the oxtail itself was SO tender!  My friend had one of the standard pho and he seemed satisfied.

The atmosphere is more modern here than your typical pho restaurant, which was cool.  It is also a bar, including overpriced alcohol/beer, but it supposedly has a pretty good happy hour.  The service could use a little work, as most of the dishes were served without the server even speaking to us.  

In my opinion, unless you are going for one of their signature dishes, you may as well go to one of the many cheap, authentic pho restaurants around every corner in Spring Mountain.
The pork belly sliders were amazing! The menu is pretty small but everything we had was great! The house oysters are hands down best ones we have had in Vegas.

Wow! Pretty perfect to me! Open late till 2am. It's my first time here and I'm blown away. I had the pho veggie and it's a generous portion with an amazing broth...and only 7.99! For real. I'm eating the leftovers tomorrow. Lots of other stuff on the menu that I will have to come back and try. I also had some oysters that were on special. They were also lovely and topped Caviar. Looks like they have a full bar but I had a craft beer  and happy with that. Highly recommend, it's a great place.

This place is dope!

Ordered Belly Buns and District One Combination Plate (short ribs) & tried some of my friend's Oxtail Fried Rice. 

I absolutely loved it here. Not only were the portions great, the quality of food was A1, the service was pretty spot on and the design and atmosphere was cool.

The restaurant vibe was great. I liked the design and how it was clean. The location is a little hidden in the plaza & I can imagine it being hard to park there late at night, but I was there in the afternoon pretty much right when they opened so I had no problems. 

Highly recommended !
Great place. Good people . Will be back with friends. Vi was very helpful with her knowledge. Love this place

I was lucky that this place was open so late on a Monday night and even more lucky to discover their unique menu.

They have a great selection of pho, soups and Vietnamese fusion based dishes - not to forget a great drink menu as well.

Rib Eye Pho which was great.  Serving size was huge, enough for two people. The broth was extremely rich and flavorful. They're very generous with the amount of rib eye as well as mint on the side to add yourself.

Big Bone Soup was filling, as well as tiring.  They give you at least two large knuckles full of bone marrow for you to dig out yourself.  I couldn't tell what kind of broth they used, but it was different than the pho. Highly recommend if you're a bone marrow fan at all.

Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio, I highly recommend as an appetizer to share.  The warm oil they drench it in is so rich and it's all topped with crunchy garlic chips to wrap the beef slices in.

Vietnamese Donkey - their version of a Moscow Mule with lychee vodka.  Wasn't too strong, maybe not strong enough but easy to drink.

Overall the service was great and the food was even better. I would definitely hope to visit this place again and recommend it to my friends.

Tried the bone marrow soup and the Surf+Turf pho. Delicious! 
Bone marrow soup was huge but had no noodles or meat other than the bone marrow, so I had to pay extra.
The surf and turf was half a lobster and some beef in it. That was very good! I think it was about $35 for surf and turf and around $25 for the bone marrow soup with added noodles. Staff was awesome!

Super great service. Everything was good except for the pho, our group of 6 tried 3 different ones and the flavors of the broths was off, had a strange aftertaste. Sweet place though and can't say enough about how cool the servers were and how quickly the food and drinks came out.
Very nice place and spacious. Food was excellent especially their pho soup . Service was fast and well organize.
Great food! I love the oxtail fried rice! Great service too. They gave my Aunt coconut ice cream for her birthday and its so good. I will come back again.

Great atmosphere. Came in for lunch with my girlfriends. Service was quick initially, all the servers help with all the tables, but since they're all running around its hard to get their attention later when you want to order more. Ordered the beef carpaccio, oxtail fries, spring rolls and rib eye abd oxtail pho. Broth was great. Everything came in good portions for 4 people. Total came to about $70. Definitely would recommend.

We came here the morning after EDC and it did not disappoint. We were all drained and hungover and the food def made us feel better. We ordered the papaya salad and the oysters to start off. Both were very fresh and delicious. The oxtail fried rice was amazing! Our waitress was very nice and patient with us. I would def recommend this place if you are ever in the vegas area.

This review is based on what I observed in my first visit...

I wanted lobster pho or the surf and turf pho, but for the price tag of $49 (I think) and $35 respectively, I compromised with oxtail pho which was a lot more reasonable at $14. After all, pho is pho right?

The oxtail soup was clean. It was refreshing and the meat was falling off the bone. Good size meat pieces too. 

As the lobster pho passed by, it did look like a legit size/portion and looked AMAZINGLY good, but still don't know if I would be willing to fork out the cash. 

The service was good and the menu looked very interesting. I'm looking forward to going back to try other items on the menu.

Knocked this bad boy of a place off my bucket list and did it all for the gram! Lmao. Of course I had to order the infamous bone marrow pho to accomplish that task.. This thing is friggin huge AF. The bones are literally the size of my head. I was surprised that I was able to finish too but it was that good. Also ordered the oxtail fried rice which agrees with a lot of other reviews as a go to dish. 

I don't know if I'd order the bone marrow again but I still have no regrets. That was quite an experience in itself. *pats self on back* 

Great place. Clean and the vibe is pretty chill. Service was top notch as well.

Keep it up!

Overall I have to say it is one of the best Vietnamese places in town!  It's young & hip AND authentic.  I ordered the lobster pho to share, oxtail fries of course, and a few other appetizers which were all tasty.  I'm not a big french fry person, but I highly recommend ordering them.  They do a happy hour each day and I definitely plan on coming to that.  The staff is young & friendly. They will talk to you and recommend items as well as just chatting.

This is my 3rd time coming here and this time I am truly convinced that they should get the 5 stars. Each experience got better and better for me, and the service compliments the food very well. 

The ambiance of the whole place is very urban and trendy. The music goes well with their overall theme, and it ties the whole place together. All of the servers were knowledgable with all of the dishes, especially with the weekly specials they have. They checked in with us every so often and our glasses were never empty.

We ordered the spring rolls to start off, and I have to say that they are a must try for everyone. Each of us got an entree, but the ones that stood out the most would have to be the oxtail fried rice as well as the oxtail pho. The oxtail here is very tender, and we finished every single bite of it.  

In conclusion, If you want great Vietnamese fusion with exceptional service to top it off, definitely come and give them a try. Sadly, I wasn't able to try the lobster this time, but I plan to in the near future!

Finally had a chance to try this place with friends and we had a great time! The coconut mojito was amazing and almost a meal itself. If we weren't in a hurry to make it to our show, I would have taken the time to scrape all the meat out of the coconut. It was cool and refreshing and not overpoweringly strong. The food was excellent as was the service. Will definitely head back!

I've always driven by this place, consistently drawn to their unique sign, and finally decided to give it a try. My friends and I decided to stop by during happy hour on a Friday. To start, the restaurant was clean and nicely decorated, though nothing was as eye-catching as the sign outside. 

We were seated immediately which was also nice, however, their happy hour options were pretty limited and to be honest the food and drinks overall seemed a bit overpriced. I had a red lantern cocktail which was pretty delicious, but kind of small given the price (I believe it was $13-$15). I ordered oxtail fried rice which was a little greasy, but good.

One of my four friends didn't receive his order until the rest of us had already finished our food, perhaps an hour or so after we were all seated. It pretty much ruined our experience there since they had cleaned off our table by the time my friend received his food, which he said was only decent (he ordered the claypot chicken). 

Overall, the food and drinks were decent but definitely overpriced. I spent $35 dollars for one plate of fried rice and one drink, didn't seem worth it to me. Service wasn't terrible but the food arrived very late. We would probably not eat here again for these reasons.

D1 is hands down the BEST Vietnamese/Fusion spot in Vegas. My family and I make it a point to eat here every time we visit.  They are always able to accommodate our group of 16+ which is a plus. We love the friendly staff and atmosphere. We have tried almost everything on the menu and have not been disappointed yet. Big Thanks to the District One family for always taking such good care of our Family while we are hungry in Vegas.

Summary: flavorful Vietnamese food, addicting cocktails  in a sports bar style restaurant

Atmosphere: dark, sports bar like with TVs everywhere. 

Service: easy going but attentive. Gave us honest personal opinions and didn't steer us wrong. 

Cuisine: get the CHICKEN WINGS- with fish sauce variation (not on the menu). They are crispy and smothers in a sweet, salty sauce. CHICKEN CLAY POT is delicious. Flavorful but not rich or overwhelming. PHO TIA NAM is also recommended if you like how the broth is altered by adding in beef before cooking. The anise and nutmeg flavors are subtle, perfection.  I would NOT recommend the BELLY BUNS. they are good but not great. They are lacking something bright to cut the fat. They vegetables are not really pickled and lack flavor. I added a squeeze of lime to the last bite which really made the last bite not so boring. 

Cocktails are thoughtful and fun. I had the coconut mojito .... I am obsessed with coconuts. This cocktail is served in the freshly cut coconut used to make this cocktail. It. Is. Delicious. 

Dessert: got the PANDAN LEAF CREME BRÛLÉE. Light flavor of pandan and coconut. Very good but I wish they had a fruit garnish to complete the dish. Maybe mango or berries; either would balance out the dish.

Food was awesome, service was almost non existant. 

I ordered the menu basically.Fish sauce and serano wings, pork belly bun, shrimp skewer and Beef Carpaccio. I empty plated clubbed all of it. Favorite dish was the Carpaccio by far.

Where I had an issue was the service. We he 5-6 different waiters/waitresses and not one gave off the impression they were our server. They were all really friendly but it was no wonder our order was wrong twice and had to wait 20 minutes for shrimp after I finished everything else.

I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say it was an off night. The food was too good to not want to go back. Especially when I saw bone marrow soup and lobster pho at the table next to mine.

Not my favorite Vietnamese place in the valley. I got the birds nest platter and I thought that they could have added more flavor to their sauce and I personally like having mushrooms in mine. The beef was fatty and I didn't eat it. The shrimp was good but could have added more, since I didn't eat the beef. Their spring rolls are TO DIE FOR!!! Some of the best that I've had! Great service but just doesn't have the flavors I want here. Will come back to try the lobster pho tho.
Damn! This is my new favorite Pho restaurant in Vegas! I got the Lobster pho and the Oxtail pho. Both bangin as fuck and it didn't give me diarrhea so that's a Nguyen Nguyen Nguyen!

Oh, wow.  Where do I start?  One of my friends brought me here.  It's in the old Ragin' Cajun, but it's nothing like that.  The menu is only what I can call "Asian Eclectic."  I had the whole Maine lobster pho, my friend had the razor clams in lemongrass and Thai basil.  The staff are great and the service is fantastic.  To quote a TV show I like, "You Gotta Eat Here."

Good service, and a chill atmosphere, but meh, just not feeling it. 

The food is pretty subpar. All the "fusion" items are generally overpriced and/or not that tasty. Oxtail fries, for example, were hilariously bad at $12. Literally one mouthful of meat, ghetto gravy from a packet, one a tiny fried egg, a couple handfuls of fries tossed haphazardly on a longish plate. The more "traditional" items are a bit tastier, but with all the Asian food joints in the area, why would you come here to pay more for those?

The drinks, which should have been a good backup, simply weren't that great either. It's interesting that they have so many random Asian beers aside from the usual piss-in-a-cup suspects, but most weren't particularly good so it's a moot point. And what's with the warm pint glasses...?

If you absolutely must have Asian fusion, go to Bachi instead. Sure, their menu is a bit more burger-centric, but it's far better anyway.

My family checked this place out, the ambience was pretty good it has a modern, hip look to it. This used to be craving Cajun. I tried the braised pork and it was tender tasted really good. I didnt get the chance to order their specials . I will definitely come back and try out some of the other dishes on the menu.

This place should be the benchmark for Pho restaurants. The service has always been good, the food is tasty and flavorful, and the price is awesome. I'd pay more for that quality but I won't complain if you keep the prices the same.

My family and I visited District One for the first time and we loved the appetizers and Pho. We came during their happy hour and ordered nearly everything on that menu! The staff were very attentive and our waitress Julia was fantastic and engaged with everyone. The Serrano wings were so delicious, not spicy at all, but crunchy and perfectly seasoned. We actually ordered another dozen later on! The garlic fries, beef carpaccio, egg rolls, pork belly buns (delish!), and papaya salad were tasty. The fish tacos were ok, the flavor wasn't that outstanding/bold. We ordered the ribeye Pho and the broth was flavorful, and the noodles perfectly cooked. I tried the Bloody Mary, which was pretty good. The ambience inside was very modern and clean. My mom was with us and she was happy with everything...which is a rarity since she's hard to please, especially with new fusion/modern places! That, plus the awesome service is what makes it 5 stars! Definitely a must visit!

I have gone here at least four separate times. Different hours of the day, different days, with a +1, a group of 8, and most recently by myself for lunch break. Jason is an absolute delight and always very friendly. There are a few of the waitresses I've met and thus far they've all been very nice as well. I have only ever had a long wait for food ONCE and that was in my party of 8 (my college graduation night a few weeks ago) for about 5 different appetizers. Ordered a second round and that came within five minutes! Crazy fast, can't complain! Glen is a great chef! Matcha green tea drink is sooo good and my aunty really loves the coconut drink. I always order the Veggie Pho for my meal and it always comes quickly and DELICIOUS! Five stars.

There's always something new to try here at District One and it's all good! Special today was the sea snail and the oysters that had fish roe (caviar?) sprinkled over it. We really like the big bone soup and the oxtail pho. Also tried the oxtail fried rice and wasn't disappointed. The servers are young which normally means impatient and abrupt but not the ones here. They're all nice and polite. Would always come back here and and bring friends from out of town, too, to show off one of the great dining options in Vegas. Why only 4 stars? They did have a little slip once but they made it right.

This is just based off of what we've ordered on Nov 12th 2016.
We've watched Munchies and thought, we gotta try this place out one day.
Friends raved that this place is a must try, so we finally went.

Ordered one of their specials
-Rice Rice Baby! = Lobster Fried Rice MP $50 - tasty, but we tasted the fried shrimp more than the lobster.  Overpriced.  I wouldn't order again.
-Craving For Seafood? = House Special Oysters (12 pc) $21.99 - worth the price and very fresh and Ono!  I would order again.
-Appetizers = District One Beef Carpaccio $12.99 - not bad.  I might order again.
-Special for the day = snails (forgot price) - very gamy, gritty.  NOT A FAVORITE.  Not like escargot elsewhere.  Never order.
-Appetizers = Belly Bun $7.99.  Okay.  We weren't suppose to order something we can get elsewhere, but i like braised pork belly and we can make better at home.  I wouldn't order again.

Nice workers.  We had two servers.  Younger guy and a little bit order gentlemen.  Never got asked for refills on our drinks, like the people that came after us.  But overall, this place is okay.  Not such a hype.

But they are apparently famous for their Pho.  So next time, if we get a chance to want to go back again, we will try their Pho.

Love it!  The service is top notch, the restaurant is clean and bright, and the food is awesome.  One thing we were actually quite impressed by was the wine selection.  For a small Asian restaurant they have very good wines on their list at a very reasonable markup.  Their food is definitely a mix of items that are traditional and "new", but everything was prepared really well.  We opted for the special Kauai fried/grilled shrimp was were really tasty head on Santa Barbara prawn sized shrimp with some chili sprinkles.  I had the Hue noodle soup which had a very fragrant and spicy broth that hit the spot for me.  The beef salad was also really good.  I would say the only thing that was just ok were the oysters.  They weren't bad but there was nothing special about them at all.  

Another restaurant added to my regular LV Chinatown list! 

BTW, this plaza is FILLED with great places.  Another one of my favorite places is Shaanxi Gourmet a few doors down. Q Bistro next door is pretty decent for big portions and food to eat with your beer!
Very delicious. Good place for big parties. And to chill with friends. Or even go to the bar and get a drink.

I wish Yelp would allow me to rate 3.5 stars.  I don't want to put 4 because price keeps it from being 4 stars.   

       We had:
Oxtail fried rice (excellent)
House oysters (good, small)
Garlic serrano wings (very good)
Pork belly bao (very good)
Fish tacos (good, very small)

  The decor is very nice inside and they have a very cool bar setup.   I will definitely come again.


     ****Went again today and added Oxtail Pho to the list of things tried.*****
Oxtail Pho (excellent)
Oxtail fried rice, again (superb, hard to believe better than the first time!)

Am bumping to 4 because the food is that good and everyone who has gone with me has enjoyed the decor/service.   They even split the Pho for us, no problem.

******* So much for customer service.  They decline to split the Pho anymore, switching gears and trying to tell me they never did that in the past.  ********
My first time here at District One and I must say the food and service are spot on! I ordered the oxtail fries and spring rolls. Looking forward to returning and trying the Lobster Pho!

Last month, we saw an article in the local Vegas restaurant review.  It gave it rave reviews.  So, we decided to try it out.

Since that review, we have returned 4 times!  Yes, the place is awesome.  And, we wanted to make sure that we tried all the dishes.  The food is rather unique and quality is great.

Here is our review:

1.  Service - Excellent.  I have no idea why some reviews are negative.  Every time we are there, there are usually 2-3 people waiting on us.  They properly fill our drinks, ensure that our finished plates are removed, and always ask if we need anything else.  In addition, the manager comes around and checks to see how everything is going.  Honestly, usually, services at Viet and/or Chinese restaurants are very subpar.  However, we think District One's staff and service are exceptional.

2.  Atmosphere -- it is a bar.  I think it is laid out quite nicely and not too noisy.  Only issue that I have are the steps going up to the next level.  If people don't watch their step, they can have an awful spill.  Maybe, they can install a little ramp or something... Other than that, it is fine.

3.  Food - absolutely amazing!  Here are our recommendations from our 4 visits:

a.  Appetizers -- usually, we order from the day's special.  
    
Here are the appetizers that we totally enjoyed:
 - Razor Clams -- very good, tender, and flavorful (note: this is our favorite appetizer)
 - Snails -- surprisingly, this was HUGE!  
 - Shaken Beef Salad -- is one of my favorite dishes.  Greens checked!
 - Taco Talapia
 - Roasted Squid 
    
Here are the appetizers that we think are "okay"
 - Pork Belly cooked in coconut.. it was a little bit too "fatty".  :)  I enjoyed it, but the wife stayed away due to the amount of fat on the meat.  
- Pork Belly Buns (same as above)
- Scallops - I was a bit disappointed.  Scallops are usually more plump.  The sauce actually overwhelmed the scallops.
- Oxtail loco-moco something... Hawaiian style -- this was not good

b.  Entrees
- Lobster Pho -- okay.. so, it is a bit pricey.. think we paid $30.  But, oh my, this was so good and worth it.  We loved this dish.  Pho was very flavorful and one dish could be shared with 3 people!  So, it even out about $10 bucks person.  Love the presentation!!
- Lobster with Noodles.  again, this was a bit pricey -- about $70.  I think this was cooked in some tamarind sauce and served over noodles.  Personally, I thought this was good, but not great.  I rather have it served over fried rice.  
- 5 Spice Chicken w/ side of yellow rice.   Very good dish.  Love the spices and the chicken!
- Oxtail Fried Rice (unlike the Loco Moco), we enjoyed this dish. 
Note:  next time, we will try the other pho dishes...  

c.  Dessert (there is only one on the menu)
Nothing beats the Vanilla ice cream w/ peanuts served on a coconut "meat" shell.  It serves 2; unless, you really have a sweet tooth.  My family love this part of the meal!

Overall, we love this place.  Service is great, food is awesome, and the price is reasonable.  This is definitely now one of our favorite places.  

Cheers!

What the pho? Lobster pho! Had to try this place out when I was in Vegas for the weekend. When I came here I was a little lost getting to the restaurant. I weren't familiar with the area because I was from California. When getting to the right spot looking from the outside it wasn't the greatest place to be at because it was outside Las Vegas strip, but walking in the restaurant was something different. I love there decoration. And I full bar! A plus for me in my book. Never seen a pho restaurant that had a bar. Going back to my Bowl of Lobster! I order the pho lobster even though they had some other choice I wanted to try but I came here for lobster so I had to try that first. Warning the lobster pho had a market price. So ask for the price before ordering! When I recently went there I guess it was $50 a bowl which was outrageous. But I had to just try it out. When they brought it out the plating was really nice. They actually peel the lobster before hand for you and lay it back out. Wow.. Less work for me so I can enjoy my food. The broth was really good, overall the whole dish was really good but it wasn't worth what I was paying. Will be back next time if I come back to LV! A must try place if your traveling to Vegas or your living there..

I travel enough that I try to eat at anywhere OTHER than where the tourists eat but, when local friends recommended what seemed like a Pho restaurant in a strip mall, I'll admit that I was skeptical. 

The only thing that's "strip mall" about District One is the parking lot. The décor is modern, witty, fun. The music playlist is an eclectic mix of indie bands and classics. And the food tastes like it should be hand-served by a top-tier chef in a restaurant on the Vegas strip.

My wife ordered the Lobster Pho. She almost cancelled her order after finding out that it was served to look like a whole lobster (with head and tail on either side of the chopped lobster meat), but our server assured her that the head and tail would be discarded. Sans extremities, the pho was delicious.

My Steak and Eggs was amazing! Fried rice, white onion, over-easy egg. The only thing that distracted from the savory flavor of the bits of medium-rare beef was that my wife kept asking me to share.

We loved the sake flight and the extensive wine/beer/liquor list.

Though comfortably full, we felt compelled to taste the créme brulée and the coconut ice cream. Both were fantastic. 

A whole wedding-party-full of folks arrive tomorrow night. We'll be recommending District One to every one of them.
The lobster pho was ridiculously yummy!! I wish this was closer to my house so I could eat it all the time! Open one in Henderson please!!

We went to District One Kitchen & Bar for happy hour on a Wednesday evening.  We sat at the bar and the enthusiastic charming bartender was very friendly and told us what he recommended. Due to being so famished, we ended up ordering everything on the happy hour menu.   Everything was wonderful and delicious.  My favorite was the wings which were spiced to perfection.  Make sure you try the tacos, they were simply amazing. I will definitely go back to try some of the other sea food on their menu.

Mediocre at best. I was looking forward to our meal. We came at the tail end of happy hour but the restaurant wasn't overly busy. We ordered from the happy hour menu - egg roll, pork belly steam bau, garlic fries, spicy wings, oysters and carpacio. Fries came cold - we had to send them back. Egg rolls and pork bao weren't much better. Drinks were weak - at one point they wanted the martini glass as they had run out - it was about a third full. Overall the food wasn't that great - we also ordered from the regular menu - pho gau, chicken clay pot (rice undercooked and sauce very salty). The table next to us seemed to be having a better meal - with the owners personally checking in periodically and delivering the food, which looked piping hot and a lot better than what we got. With food options available, I doubt I will come back.

they ran out of lobster pho (only reason to drop by). 
their other pho was pretty msg'd out otherwise i guess if your hometown pho is already pretty dope, coming to vegas for viet is a step down.  
i love the fact that they have a bar and it's a laidback interior.  otherwise, keep your viet urges till you leave sin city.  o yes, service and timeliness was almost worst than your average chinese hole-in-the-wall (too bad!)

We had lobster pho (MP was $49.99) and Oxtail pho with ice viet coffee. soup base is good, except the 1.5lb lobster was abit expensive. if you dont mind the $$$, you would enjoy the lobster pho. I would go back again for oxtail pho. Nice atmosphere.

Good to have this restaurant nearby! Mostly Vietnamese, with a twist of fusion.

We had Fish Taco, Steak & Egg, Mekong River Style Noodle Soup and everything was tasty! The ambience was good too.

My friend and I tried out this restaurant about a week ago.  We both liked the atmosphere, decorations, etc...However...we both were disappointed. The reasoning behind the three stars is that they completely forgot us.  We ordered an appetizer to start off with which we got.  When it was time to order our entree, we were forgotten. It was almost an hour when our waitress came up to us and asked us if we wanted dessert and we told her we didn't even eat yet.  She looked at us like we were joking.  We told we were not and told her we didn't receive our food yet.  Throughout the ordeal, our waitress also failed to tell us that my friend's order ran out.  Why couldn't they have told her that sooner than later when we nearly waited almost an hour for our food.  So my friend had to re-order and ended up getting the Oxtail Pho instead.  The reason we were forgotten, a few large parties had come in and that's why we were forgotten.  It's unacceptable! Just because a large party had come in, you catered to them first when we were already there hours on and haven't eaten yet.  We finally got our food, after nearly going on now for two hours of waiting.  I sent mine back because it was filled with onions.  I had them to take it off.  After all of this mess, it was quite pretty funny how they kept checking up on us every minute and second when the staff nearly forgot us for hours.  My friend and I were not impressed how they handled this mess.  To top it off, we were billed at the end and all we got was a big apology.  So at this point, going back to District One not for awhile until they figure out how to fix a mess like this because it can happen to anyone as well.
Had the shrimp today AMAZING! Again with the Ox Tail Pho! Starting Friday they are open till 4am!

One of my favorite spots to eat at when I'm in Las Vegas. first off the servers here are friendly as it can get and the vibe is just great there. 

Now with the food....Let me tell you that the ox tail fried rice, man I can eat that all day every day. Everything else I have ordered was also delicious so all I can say is you better come here when you're in vegas!

Best fried rice ever! The Oxtail fried rice was simply amazing! Every bite of rice was filled with meat. Rarely happens with fried rice.  Next time I go, definitely going to try the bone marrow pho. Looks crazy!

Say yes to Vietnamese food!! It's not your average pho place. This is the place you would want to go if you really want some good, real Vietnamese food. 

First, lets talk about the oxtail pho. It's packed with so many flavors of the bone! You would only find something like this if you walked into a Vietnamese or Chinese household and they've been cooking that bone for hours! Very generous of the oxtail as well. The Five Spiced Roasted Cornish Hen was different. It was like a twist of vietnamese com tam thit nuong with all the sides and sauce but no porkchops or grilled pork but with a chicken. Two huge chicken thighs. The portion of the bone marrow soup and the chicken rice dish was big enough to share. Oh, I forgot about the appetizers! We got the belly buns which were okay.

We stumbled on to this place during a business trip. glad we did , clean, Reasonably priced & food was awesome.  We had the steak salad and a shrimp pho.
Will definitely will return here . great atmosphere. Staff was very friendly  but a little slow.

Their bun bo hue's broth is one of the best I've had. It's a huge portion even though it doesn't have all the other usual meats (pork leg and blood) Price is not crazy like their other dishes. Just 10.99 a bowl. Husband got the oxtail fried rice for 14.99. I'n not a fan of fried rice so definitely think that's over priced. I tasted it and it's a bit on the oily side and nothing great.

District one is okay, but their menu is a lot smaller than any Viet restaurant in town and is definitely more expensive. My bf and I ordered the beef Carpaccio, big bone soup, pho-ghetti, and stuffed jalapeños. The food was slightly below average. Beef Carpaccio didn't taste fresh and the meat was brown in some areas. Big bone soup was more for presentation than practical for eating.  Stuffed jalapeños were really bland. Their special, pho-ghetti was actually decent, but that was it.  Don't think I'd be back. Price and food wasn't worth it.

Amazing amazing amazing. Best Bun Bo Hue I've ever eaten. I've been to District One in the past, and never had anything bad. Everything is super fresh, flavorful and I would highly recommend anything on the menu. Take a larger group, order 1 of everything, and TRY. You won't be disappointed.

Where to begin?  The vietnamese fusion idea was not appealing at first but then my drink came.  Vietnamese donkey drink (I think thats what it was called) was delicious and refreshing.  A lychee vodka mix it was by far my favorite drink.
Then the food came.  Their take on the papaya salad was incredible.  The oysters were also incredibly delectable.  The lobster pho was eaten by a friend and he said it was awesome.  A whole lobster was put into the pho making it a complete lobster dish.  I will be getting that next time.  All in all a great place with great service.
Come here for the Pho and the cocktails. They have a lobster Pho that is off the chain! Emily is an excellent bar tender who has a real talent for craft cocktails. Great spot for a casual night out.
Tamarind crab was superb, a little spicy but worth it. Chicken wings good and the rice was good. I would go back. Curious how this place is at night.

Superb fusion of American and Vietnamese cuisine.  on the table are plates of oxtail fried rice, fried oysters, mekong river soup (made with beef, fishball, shrimp, and pork)... Dungeness crabs and Branzino.  

All entrees are well prepared and are an explosion of taste. Yummy to my tummy.  Can't wait to revisit.

Do you want to hit the jackpot without even going to the casinos in Vegas? Go to District One for a meal! Ten of us went there for the first time to try out their signature oxtail dishes. We happened to met one of the co-owners, Vy, who was very accommodating, explained the menu to help with some of the group with dietary restrictions. The oxtail dishes did not disappoint. Many of us ordered the oxtail pho - enough for two people. I suggest that you split the pho dish and then order other dishes to try out. The oxtail fries, oxtail fried rice, pork belly buns, or short ribs are just some of the tasty, reasonably  priced dishes. If you're not into oxtail, give it a try. You might be converted - they cook it for many hours in a bone marrow broth, seasonings, so it's so tender -- and gluten free to boot.

Aside from the excellent food, there's a full bar, great decor and friendly staff. District One is definitely on our Las Vegas MUST DO list. You won't be disappointed.

Been here twice now and I haven't been let down.

Do yourself a favor and order the wings and the belly buns. Hands down the most amazing iterations of these plates that I've ever had.

The Vietnamese Donkey is an amazing cocktail.

Service is on point, the staff is friendly, and they love to give you clean plates.

My kind of spot.

Also try the wok tossed clams. Be prepared for garlic overload but it's truly worth it.

Bathrooms are clean and the sinks to wash your hands are out of the bathroom. Much more sanitary.

My chiropractor told me about this place months ago and I finally checked it out on my birthday weekend.  I remembered the name when looking for late night food and they were open at 2am.  My bff from Phoenix and I checked it out and we ordered Vietnamese beef carpaccio,pho tai rib eye, chicken clay pot.  We ordered way more than we expected.  The carpaccio was sooo good, the pho was huge and there was a lot of meat, the clay pot was a simple dish.  I was warned, it's very home cooking if that's what your feeling like, but it was simple compared to the first two dishes.  This was more food than we knew how to deal with.  They found out it was my bday weekend and brought us coconut ice cream with peanuts on top in half a coconut.  This is my new favorite find of the year, I keep saying I'll go back just for the coconut ice cream thing and tea but keep going back for food.lol

We went back a second time before she left Vegas, got the carpaccio, split a bowl of pho, and got coconut ice cream thingie.  Then I went back again and got the fish tacos, then ice cream thingie.  This group was brought to a table in front of me and someone with the worst perfume was in that party, I whispered to the guy who was serving me and asked if I could go to the bar, he was cool with it and said he could smell it too.  So I chilled at the bar with hot tea and coconut ice cream thingie talking to the bartender Paul.  Today I brought my mom since I'm recovering from something and wanted hot soup.  It's been hit and miss taking her to fusion places but this one is SEA - Vietnamese based and the spring rolls and pho were perfect.  They were worried the coconut ice cream thingie wasn't hard enough yet, like it was soft serve, but it was still good.  Mom really liked it.  We were super happy.  I bragged on fb.  We might get a defcon group out here in August.  I'll probably destroy a few coconut ice cream thingies between then and now.

THE BIG BONE SOUP!!! The lobster pho was tasty too but was a little over cooked and tough. The big bone soup, however, is worth every penny. I ordered a side of noodles to add to it and could not finish. Two people could eat this and be really full. Definitely an experience worth trying.
This place continues to make me happy! Their oxtail fries are amazing! IPA on tap and their pho broth is the best I've had in town!

Food... since we only ordered pho and egg rolls, can't make comments on other food on the menu but as far as pho and egg rolls go, don't eat here, just DON'T. There are way better pho and egg rolls place in town. 
Service... people are nice I have to say, but that's as far as it goes. To me they are lacking some common sense or proper eating etiquette. During our meal ,we got asked so many times "How is everything?" While we are trying to eat hot pho, how do you expect us to answer you when you can clearly see we all have mouthful. Not only we were "checked on" by our server but other 4 different girls stopped by and asked the same questions over and over. Can't we just have a peaceful meal? When we do need them to pay bills, no one can be found!!! 
Tips... by the end of the meal, all of us were so annoyed just want to pay the bill and leave. They have the iPad bill pay at your table which is convenient but the tipping system starts 15%, we really didn't think the food and service deserve that but didn't have much choice there. 
We won't be coming back here for sure.

Went here with friends and was extremely impressed with the quality and flavors of the food. Great for sharing entrees and appetizers. Full bar at your disposal is a plus. Friendly staff. Go here! Trust the fat kid.

This was my favorite restaurant then they opened. I went at least twice a week. The food was incredible and I couldn't get enough. Over time they stopped serving most of my favorite dishes and the food became very inconsistent. I asked what happened, apparently they lost their chef. After several disappointing meals I stopped going.

Food you won't have anywhere else... whole snapper spring rolls?!?!  Where have you had that?  Not only that, they gave us a quick lesson on assembly.  Dip the rice wrapper in hot water, and start filling! I love customizing and fixing my own meals to my tastes.... so this dish worked for me. I've had a lot of wings in my life, but I like the way they fry and season theirs.  
If you are into any sport, there are plenty of tv's and probably atleast one that you can request the "game" of your choice.  The drinks and bar area is nice, especially if you are solo or just a couple. 

Another positive is they were very flexible with my reservation, which had 3 revisions.  I hate doing that, but they gladly accommodated.  

Probably the best part is that our 8 other guests, who have never been here, completely loved the food too!
Delicious Vietnamese food. Nice ambiance and good service. Lobster ribeye pho was super good and so it was my husbands whole fried fish!  Portions are good and drinks are great.

I went here for happy hour and the quality of the food is amazing! I ordered their fish tacos(yellow tail tuna in a wonton taco shell) and their belly buns(braised pork belly in a fresh Chinese bun) with a vodka tonic. The staff was really friendly. They were getting ready for their one year anniversary party. The bartender invited me come back to their celebration which was really nice of her. Looking forward to my next Las Vegas trip so that I can sample some of their main dishes.

After seeing them on IG for awhile, myself and my girlfriend made it a point to check them out while we were in Vegas.. If you're a visitor checking this place out, it deep in Vegas lol. We order a lot of food, so we can get a little taste of everything. We got the the chicken wings, garlic noodles, combo plate, pork belly sliders and the spring rolls.. The only thing that I really had a problem with was the garlic noodles being a little dry.. All the food that were ordered had great flavor to it.. The menu looked like there were a lot of other great things to try.. I have my eye on the lobster pho for next time. In all the food was good and the staff was very friendly. I will definitely be back to this place again.


Yelp 100 challenge 2016- 3/100

Great clean spot for Vietnamese and Viet fusion food.   Looks like they had a full bar, but that's about the last thing I could look at early today...
The place looks clean, and modern and is a cool spot to hang out, have some food and drinks, and chit chat.  

The pho is pretty delicious and hits the spot. Broth is tasty. Bean sprouts and leaves were crisp bright and fresh.  They've got the usual types of pho (Tai, chicken) and even shrimp pho.   The lemongrass beef was also nicely grilled.  Looked a little charred but couldn't taste any bitterness on it.

The mission was to come to Vegas and rock out at Rock in Rio. The side mission was to find delectable grub and not settle for overpriced offerings on the strip. The answer...hook up with a buddy who knows how to cut through the grime and find us some grub. Who knew we would find grub so good we would come back three times in a span of 24 hours kind of grub because that is exactly what I did here. 

This place is unique. You see the word "fusion" tossed around now a days like casual sex at pool parties. But this is fusion at its best. It's fusion because for the most part it has stayed true to what it is. You have your choice of pho here but not like anywhere else. Here a few things stick out like ox tail, lobster, and ribeye pho. Crazy right? Then they have the big bone marrow soup, which is exactly that but hot damn it's good. I have come back three times now for the ox tail fried rice. This is perfection. It's carefully blended ox tail soaked up in every particle of rice topped with an egg over easy. It's awesome and flawless. I would not do anything to change this but ask for more. I tried the ox tail fried rice and put it in a bowl. I then topped the bowl with broth from the bone marrow soup and I think I died for a moment. It was definitely a few moments in time that paused because my taste buds didn't know how to process the information my taste receptors were communicating.

Also tried their wings here, and spring rolls. Those were delicious. I wanted to get to the garlic noodles but I couldn't make myself move past the fried rice.  I'm still here so who knows? Maybe I'll make it for a 4th time before leaving?

Update: yes we did make it a 4th before leaving Vegas. So four times in 48 hours. 

Now you go try it and you try not to come back 4 times. Tell Kai the owner how much you love it and he might just give you shots of Jameson.
lobster pho was the reason for my visit.  pretty good but not worth $40.  worth a try tho.  their shaking beef salad was on point.  good ambiance and good service overall

Best new place in Vegas!! A must to try and come back for more. Super friendly and knowledgable staff. Vee and Crystina are awesome!! The food is outstanding! The beef carpaccio was full of flavors I didn't think would taste a good as they did. The braised pork belly will leave you filling full good size portions. Worth the wait for this place.
This place is flippin' fantastic!! Food is amazing-- had the Oxtail Rice and Beef Carpaccio-- wow!

I remember the days when I used to get excited about going out for Kobe Pho. It sounded so extravagant. And the local place that served Kobe pho wasn't even using Kobe but people were still getting excited over it.

Move over pseudo-Kobe, Now, I have a new love, LOBSTER PHO. 

Ok I know it sounds excessive, but I came here to Vegas to have an entire lobster in my pho. No regrets. Was it delicious? Yes. Was it expensive? The market price was around $49 for a 1.5 lb lobster so it was worth it. 

First of all, I pictured myself breaking apart a lobster in a bowl of pho. So I brought handi wipes picturing the worst case hand messiness scenario. This was not the case. The lobster was already extracted and placed on the shell of the lobster. Every last bit of meat was extracted, I was pleased to find whole claws while digging through my pho. The broth needed no add ons, and was pretty solid. I drank the whole thing and even that the bowl was HUGE this was a lot of broth consumption. 

While the Lobster Pho is a major attraction and so instagrammable and photogenic, there are a lot of sleeper hits on the menu that might not get the attention they deserve, including:

-The oysters in house special style. We got blue point oysters since they ran out of the other oysters and with ponzu, tobiko and topped with a serrano pepper they were outstanding. I'm not sure how I can go back to oysters with just cocktail sauce and lemon.

-The crispy egg rolls with pork and taro were a great appetizer selection. Crispy overload. The pork was tender and the taro was a surprise ingredient.

I wasn't too impressed by the green papaya salad. Given the choices, I would have gone with the Shaken Beef Salad. 

I am intrigued by the Big Bone Soup and Pho Oxtail they have here. If I ever plan another trip to Vegas, I'll be hitting up this spot again.
This is by far the most unique and amazing Vietnamese fusion. Can't wait to return!  Bravo.

amazing. 

the best pho in vegas

I've been here 5 or 6 times and I've gotten the rare ribeye pho,  the spring rolls and the calamari.. all 3 exceed expectations. 

they have a maine lobster pho that i will try eventually.. noone else offers it

i usually go to my local place for pho when i crave it but i will come here when i want a lil extra

quality service and quality food

cant go wrong here

The service has always been good here. It is very spacious, great variety of Asian dishes, and a great selection of cocktails. I LOVED how the glass of champagne comes with your own mini bottle and the original champagne glass. It makes it feel classy. The oysters are always my favorite here. Tried the oysters that come from Japan and they were REMARKABLE! The oxtail pho was tasty. I want to keep coming back to this place. Definitely recommend it.

vietnamese with a sophisticated hip feel to it.  perfect for vegas.  kimlong is good but the place you will be impressed.  eat the oxtail fries and Carpaccio.  then eat the lobster pho or bbh. chicken and rice is fire too

Late night rendezvous??? You've come to the right place. Open and serving food unroll 2am.  A wonderful Asian fusion restaurant, with a hip Vibe, and an even hipper liquor list. If you want only one thing from the menu just to get the big bone soup. It's essentially Pho but with a GIANT beef bone in it,  so you get all that good marrow and tasty bits in your broth.  The spring rolls are delish, and they have a lot of really great beers on tap as well. Service was fast and accurate, and the staff is really friendly. I loved the music selection the night we went.

Good beer selection. 

Got the oxtail fries. A little too wet making the fries soggy, but flavor was there. Nothing a few flips in a scorching hot sauté pan can't fix.

4 stars for service, bartender and the great variety of beers here! 

I hear they have great food here, but didn't get to try much due to eating dinner about 5 minutes before coming here.

This would be a 5 star review if the price was lower or the portion size was larger. The pho broth and meat were really good. You don't even need to add anything like the hoisin sauce. I usually load up on hoisin but this time I ate it straight up the way it came. Service was great, they greeted and answered our questions. They came by and checked on us, also easy to flag down.
