It was a good experience. And the best part is the way they set up the sinks out side the bathroom.

This place is absolutely great. From the Oxtail Pho to the pork belly buns, the food is scrumptious. I try to bring my parents here at least every two weeks or so. Their Big Bone dish... wow. 
The staff are always on point. This place rocks!
Here for Happy Hour and their fish tacos are perfect. The Oxtail fried rice was the best dish with their big chunks of oxtail. $1 oysters. Great rexaled vibe here
Good service. We made a few comments on the fish tacos because it wasn't fresh and the manager took it off from our bill. It was much appreciated! Thank you again:)
Food was amazing ! Started with 4 appetizers including the delicious oysters. The lobster was A1 quality! First time there but definitely won't be my last.

Never had Pho before. Why not try it at a restaurant that's been featured on food network for their lobster pho? Because it's not my thing, that's why! I feel I can't offer a fair review because I took one bite and was done. We had 3 plates. Plate of 2 skewers, lobster pho another plate, think it was wings. A mule and beer we paid 98$.
The food was below average,  waste of time coming here.  My bff and I were disappointed.

Oxtail fried rice (6/5): so good meat is so soft and tender. DEFINATELY GET THIS!! Who knew fried rice could be so flavorable!

Oxtail pho (5/5): pretty good, has meat that falls off the bone . No need for sriracha or hoisen! The oxtail meat is super flavorable and easy to take off the bone.

Bone marrow soup (4.5/5): its so big! They also offered to help us deconstruct it so its easier to eat, so of course we accepted. It came back as a beautiful tendon marrow soup. The soup is similar to the oxtail pho soup but a little more fatty.

Definately stop here if you are near the area. The service is pretty nice, too. They give you gloves so you won't ger your hands messy but it was unnecessary for our meal.
I heard about their lobster pho and just had to try it while visiting Vegas! The dish was delicious ... but a tad pricey, even for market price.
Great Vietnamese fusion spot in Vegas. subtle spins on traditional dishes as well as straight forward recipes done right. Great job D1 Kitchen.

I got the rib eye pho which was VERY needed after NYE clubbing. It really helped with my hangover lol. The broth was pretty good with good flavor. The service was a little slow though. Overall I liked it and would go again when I'm in town

Interesting take on Vietnamese fusion...a little on the pricey side.  Servers seems to be in training still so not very attentive...forgetting small things like utensil and water.

Probably would go back.

Ambiance - typical commercialized modern bar scene. This place is attractive to barbies and Bros. Good thing I only come here for the food. 

Fresh Spring Rolls - Distinct for its fried egg roll skin that's within the spring roll and for its generous portions of shrimp. The peanut sauce contains freshly roasted peanuts and is mixed in a combination of hoisin sauce and peanut butter.

Pork Belly Bun - the sliced cucumbers and carrots are not enough to cut the fattyness of the pork. However, I'm sure others would disagree.

Fish Tacos - typical Mexican style fish tacos. Therr was not an Asian or Vietnamese twist to these standard mexican fish tacos. Not sure why these are even on the menu to begin with.

Beef Carpaccio - everytime me and my bro come here we order this. This is our favorite dish here and we highly recommend it. I just wished they would use wagyu :(

House special oysters - fresh, bright, sweet and sour flavors. Topped off with flying fish roe, ponzu sauce, and green garnishes. 

Oxtail Fried Rice - the texture of the chewy oxtail meat blends well with the garlicy fried rice. Medium portion size, enough to share with another person. The texture, more so than the flavor of this dish, is what stood out for me.

Also, I think I saw a Chinese porn star here. Possibly another reason to come?

This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas. The service is always great (Adrienne and Thomas are wonderful). The food is just... INCREDIBLE. My favorite is the big bone soup and the pork belly buns. Happy hour starts at midnight, and they have $1 bluepoint oysters. I love this place. Also, don't forget to try the beef carpaccio. It's made with truffle oil and its to die for!

What a great first time experience. Not your typical Chinatown restaurant. Definitely more on the American modern style setting. Kinda gives a feel for a wing house dining setting especially with all the large flat screen TVs located all around the restaurant. Food was delicious. Service was a little bit slow. I felt like the server could have checked on us more often. 

We order two appetizers: the fish tacos and pork belly buns. Our tacos came out first, and the buns were still missing. I had to ask the server if it was still coming out because she came to bring our entrees which was the pork chop combination rice plate and I had the shaken steak and egg with tomato rice. So I was a little disappointed the belly buns came out last considering I ordered it as an appetizer. Why is it even an appetizer of it's gonna come out AFTER my entree? that why I'm giving it 4stars verses the 5. Feel like the ball was dropped there.

Out of all the items we ordered... All though my shaken steak was great, it wasn't phenomenal. It was a little too oily, although the flavor and taste was great. Even though I will be back for it. I think the one that really stuck out for me... Flavor and taste wise was the fish tacos. I must say it was to be one of the best fish tacos I've had. 

It was all good but it was missing a bit of a wow factor for me to give it 5 stars.

I don't normally write reviews but it was really good that I felt compelled to write one. We got here around 2 pm on Labor Day weekend and it was packed; however, my bf and I were 7th on the list but since there were only 2 of us they asked if we could sit at the bar. It was completely fine with me since we were only intending to have a light meal. 

Once we got seated at the bar, we were promptly greeted by 3 different bartenders and asked if they could bring us water. A couple minutes later, they asked if we would like some drinks. I wasn't going to drink so early, but their cocktail menu was so tempting I couldn't resist! I ended up getting the Vietnamese donkey which was their version of a Moscow Mule. Ugh! So delicious! Would come back here just for their drinks as all the other ones looked so enticing. 

We ordered the Oxtail pho, spring rolls, and steak and eggs. Although the food took a little longer than expected, I understand it was a busy weekend and the restaurant was packed. The service, the quality of the food and drinks, as well as great atmosphere well made up for the slight wait. 

Thank you District One! Will be back!

People: service is okay.  The staff doesn't anticipate needs very well and it does not feel warm.  Maybe some training and exercises in smiling. 

Product: Come here for the appetizers, specifically the belly buns (steamed, avoid the fried) and the egg rolls.  The red rice is bland; tastes like steamed rice with a packet of ketchup.

This is definitely a place to stop by when you're in the area. Not like your average Vietnamese restaurants. It has some unique items on the menu and all their food has so much flavor. It was pretty impossible to order just one thing. But their portions were so huge, thankfully both times we went we were in a group so we were able to share food. 

The first time we went was at night. I was pretty drunk so I didn't really know what to order. I ended up getting the Oxtail Fries. SO FREAKING GOOD! It was pretty big so I took it home and sadly it wasn't good in the morning. My boyfriend got the Oxtail Pho and he let me taste it and I loved it. My friend got the Wonton Soup but I didn't try it until the next morning since she ended up taking it home. 

The next morning when we were all leaving Vegas my friends decided to come back again. This time we had an even bigger group. I just ordered the Oxtail Pho and Fresh Coconut. I was able to finish my noodles but I ended up giving away my Oxtails because it was too much for me. My boyfriend got the Oxtail Fried Rice. One of our friends got the Lobster Pho. I loved it, the Lobster was very meaty and the broth didn't taste like regular Pho broth. It pretty much just tasted like Lobster, no other way to really explain it. My other friend ordered something that was like sauteed Green Beans? I wish I remembered what it was called! That was probably my favorite dish out of everything we all tried. 

They had a wide variety of alcohol and I was so tempted to try the Vietnamese Coffee mixed with Hennessey. But I didn't want to leave Vegas feeling weird since Vietnamese Coffee is already strong for me. Plus alcohol was pretty expensive. 

Customer service was great. Food came out pretty quick. It is a bit on the pricey side but I feel like it's worth it. I can't wait to come back to Vegas just to come back to this place!
A great Asian restaurant in Las Vegas. It is very clean and modern style.  Food taste good and fresh.  We went twice in 3 days.  Kids liked it too.

Oooooh em gee!!!

Serrano wings, fish taco, braised pork belly, steak and egg, ribeye pho!!

It was amazing.. Everything melts in your mouth, I can't wait to come back!

However.... On our steak and egg the egg was more than overcooked, it could've been a frisbee!! We requested a new one and OMG the same thing except the yolk was runny. Serious?! Hahaha I still can't figure out how amazing everything is and the egg is your failure... Isn't that like the very first thing we all learn to cook?! Lol.

Yum!

Took my grandma and Uncle who were visiting from Hawaii.  We drove from CA to meet them and I heard about this place.  Took a chance and we tried their pork belly buns and pho soups.  My Grandma them had the ribeye pho and I got the Ox-tail soup.  Both great dishes!  It is really big so be hungry or split the soups.  The pork belly buns were awesome!  I would definitely order those again.  We will be visiting them soon.

Every time my sisters ask if I want to get district I'm just like YAAAAAASSSS ugh this place is SOO good, the ambience is always soooo casual and so chill I love it and the food omg lets me tell you, their soups and their food is 5/5. So delicious, and if you haven't tried their lobster pho yet it is so unique and authentic yet so delicious but so expensive (so worth it though) the servers are really nice and the food comes out moderately fast. And what I love most about coming here is that they open late and so therefore while all the other restaurants are closing around 1-2 am this place gives you an extra hour to eat and I love it. This place is the perfect place to eat late at night and their food is so delicious I mean go try the oxtail fries next time it's well worth it I promise. Oh and price range may be easily $$ or $$$ but it's worth it I swear
The best oxtail fried rice in town , usually I asked them to add fresh chilly when they cooked it to add more spicy to it  and also their chicken wings are so good .
Employee was annoyed because they were closing soon. Other than that the food was amazing. Hats off to the chef!

The food is exceptionally delicious! Creative food choices/ selections, good liquor options and beer is cold when served, and prices are affordable with the Asian Fusion cuisine. The portions are generous and the staff are friendly but service lacks attentiveness. The few times I've been there we had to flag someone to get our order. I have yet to try half of the rest of the menu but I definitely recommend everyone to try it out! Will post a couple photos that I enjoyed! :)

After being ever-so-rudely blown off by the host at Chada, we found ourselves here for dinner at the bar with football and an awesomely knowledgeable bartender who guided our dining choices.

PORK BELLY BUNS: Simple, tasty, perfect. Inhaled the trio.
VIETNAMESE BEEF CARPACCIO: Highlight of the meal, large portion for an appetizer with great mix of flavors and textures. This dish is what brought my overall rating up from three stars to four.
OXTAIL PHO: Dish that brought me in here. Simple ingredients, tasty broth, enjoyable but not a dish I feel that I have to have again. Ample meat portion!
RAZOR CLAMS: Chef special, stir fried razor clams in garlic and peppers with a kick of spice to them. Cool presentation, but wouldn't get again. 

Dinner for two with two beers (Boston Brown Ale, so good!) came to $60 before tip, largely due to the razor clam special which was unexpectedly $18. Would have rather had two different appetizers instead. Good place to watch the game in a low-key setting with tasty food.

EDIT: Dropping a star due to inconsistency. Came back a couple of times and dishes always seem to be hit or miss. Recently, their porkbelly rice dish was 99% fat and none in our group cared for their take on papaya salad. The buns are always good, garlic noodles are chewy and fragrant, and the fish tacos are a HH-only item for me because they're good but tiny... but I feel like ordering outside of my few go-to dishes is risky.
Trendy place in Chinatown in Vegas.  Everything we ordered was yummy.  I had the ox tail pho...wow...that was good!

We came here based on a recommendation from a friend and I only found it to be alright. We got the oxtail pho and the broth was only alright. For the price, I was expecting a bigger portion. This is definitely the most expensive pho I've ever gotten and it just didn't live up to expectations. The oxtail was pretty good because it was tender though, but other than that I'm not impressed. We also got the pork buns, which were pretty good, but it needs some caramelization or something to contrast the texture. It was just all soft and I got tired of eating it after one. We probably won't be back.
This place have empty tables and they won't seat you till there are more people in line. Poor

Really good food! We ordered the pork belly buns and pho lobster.

3 pork belly buns for  $8, the meat was really soft with a good amount of hoison sauce.

Pho lobster $49! It is market price so the price changes. Expensive but been eyeing it for a while so I had to try it. The bowl is huge and big enough for two people. 

The soup broth was really good! The lobster tasted fresh as well, I was definitely satisfied. Definitely good, but for  $49, I wouldn't order again.

Everything we got tonight was awesome!!! The food was phenomenal. We came in for a late night snack and ended up ordering a few apps. We started with the beef carpaccio, it was an unique twist but really tasty. After we ordered the pork belly buns, fish tacos, and oxtail fried rice. We actually ordered the fries but I'm so happy theres was a mix up because I'm sure the fried rice was better. It was my favorite thing we ordered! 
Overall I'm excited we tried a new place and we will be coming back soon, they have a happy hour 12 to 2 that were gonna be sure to check out!

My husband, friend and I (party of 3) came into district one to eat lunch. Only 4 tables were occupied and there were 4 servers so to have great customer service shouldn't have been an issue. We were seated by a window and it took about 5 minutes to get a server to help us. When we started looking around for help a gentlemen came to our table with waters, and as he was about to leave I told him we were ready to order. He didn't seem very friendly and as I said thank you he just walked away.. 
We ordered 2 oxtail loco mocos, one fish taco, and a spring roll. The food was alright. Definitely different, but the taste was just alright. Especially for the small 3 fish tacos with barely any yellowtail, it's bit overpriced. 

Maybe I'll come back and give it another try. With a different server and different items on the menu.

Wow.  What a night.  I love this place and this was one of the worst experience I have ever had with the restaurant.  The food is amazing like always; but the service was horrible. Anna was not the best.  Beers came out after appetizers.  Then the incorrect beer came out.  On top of that, she rarely checked on us.  Didn't get our main order until we flagged her down; but once our main dinner came out it was incorrect again.  At that point I had enough.  I asked for a manager to give us another server because at this point the service was ruining the whole experience for us.  Aaron came out and immediately corrected the situation and he is the only reason this review is getting a 3 star and not one.  The food is to amazing to stop coming here; but I will definitely make sure Anna is not serving us after this night.

Waited a long time to be seated and the food was worth the wait. We had OXTAIL FRIED RICE, that was awesome ! 
BELLY BUNS 
BLUE POINT OYSTERS
All were exceptional ! Highly recommend

I haven't ate the food here yet, so I will update later.......if I do end up going one of these days.

So, why the 2-star review?

I made reservations through Yelp on Christmas day for 9 people.  Well, 1 person couldn't make it that day, so I called to change it to 8 people.  When I called, they said they didn't take reservations for that day.  They why did they take the reservation in the first place?!?  With that being said, maybe it was a Yelp mistake (although, they should have worked with Yelp on that).  Even if it was, couldn't they at least make an effort to try to accommodate me?  Even after I explained it to 2 different people, they basically told me they couldn't do anything.  Can you imagine not having dinner reservation on Christmas?  How embarrassed was I?!?  

Luckily, Vegas is filled with many other options, so we went some place else.  But, nonetheless.......

the lobster pho wasn't worth it at all. It was just a normal pho soup and a regular lobster in it. Even the lobster wasn't that good. It was salty, not much lobster flavor, and it's $56 a bowl. Do not recommend. Other food like the big bone soup. It is just a few big bones and lot of tenders. It gets gross after a few bites. The other phos are like the normal pho, tons of MSGs, taste good, make you want to drink a gallons of water afterwards.

District One - Vietnamese restaurant that is lounge and bar style. Incredibly great service, average check ranging from $13-$15. The food looks beautiful yet it's not the best, however the service is so nice and great that you can't even complain. I would give this restaurant 4/5 because how great the service is.

I love the food here but the one favorite dish I always order is the big bone soup. It's so amazing to eat all the marrow and cartilage in delicious beef pho broth. The best part is that they do it tableside. It is perfect for two people to share and you can add a side of pho noodles. It's the best thing on the menu for everyone that I have brought to try. 
The beef carpaccio is also amazing. The truffle oil and peanuts on top provide a nice dressing and it's light and fresh. It's a must order. 
The other favorite is the grilled whole squid. The dipping sauce is a spicy aioli which is cool and sharp. 
The garlic noodles are also good but I would always say remind them more al dente as sometimes it is too mushy for my taste. 
I know a lot of other reviewers like the pork belly buns but I didn't like the sauce and would pass. I am more of a purist where I don't like sauce but that is personal preference. 
My hubs loves their lobster pho with egg noodles. The lobster comes pre cracked so you can eat it easily without being messy. It is his favorite cheat meal. 
The only disappointment is the big bone broth. We have called to reserve but have shown up and it is not available. Or called to see if they even have it available and were told yes of course and shown up and our waitress has said they were already out for the day. 
Today, on our honeymoon in Vegas there was no bone broth. Instead we settled for the oxtail pho with no noodles. I thought they would give us 4 oxtails to share since we went sans noodles but we got 3 tiny pieces, how are two people supposed to share that esp after expecting a hearty bone broth soup? Sad face. Hopefully next time or take it off the regular menu!

Vietnamese food with a twist !

SETTING:

Very modern restaurant. 
Nice large wooden tables and booths.
The decorations on the walls reminds me of seafood restaurants like boiling crab or crab hut, etc.

The waitress here is nice and very informative.

FOOD:

Vietnamese Iced Coffee $3.25
This is authentic Vietnamese iced coffee. The one where you have your coffee beans pressed on top in a metal filter that is placed on top of a cup. Then you mix it yourself with condensed milk. The flavor is a little bit stronger but it is delicious!

Oxtail Fries $11.95
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!! I thought I wouldn't like the gravy because it looked very gelatinous, but it was actually very creamy and tasted like oxtail infused. There are bits and pieces of oxtail, but I do think that they need more meat. Otherwise, the fries are delicious!!

Pho Lobster $35
Never would I have thought that I would find a bowl of Pho costing $35 !! But it was pretty much worth the price. They give you a whole lobster! They even cut up all the meat for you so it's easier for you to eat and it won't get messy! The pho broth soup is good, but other then the lobster, its pretty plain. BUT the lobster tastes fresh and chunky.

Hue Spicy Beef Noodles $9.95

This is basically Bun Bo Hue, but named slightly differently by the way. The soup broth here has a strong distinct flavor... kind of like strong mint leaves. The broth wasn't spicy at all. This soup was ok. I've had a lot better elsewhere.


Overall, food here is good but there are not many options to choose from.

Food was very good-above average-but the service is what got this place 2 stars. 
We waited 14 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us. Finally the waiter came and took our order.
Food came out expediently as they weren't that busy. We were joking because we thought our waiter went home as we hadn't seen him. We had to pull someone to our table and asked for our waiter as we hadn't seen him since we ordered.
He informed us- "he went home". OMG-serious ? We started laughing. Then he informed us he was supposed to be taking over but forgot about us. Lol lol lol
The service is the reason I won't return

This is my favorite new restaurant. There's a good variety on the menu and I can't wait to try every single dish! Here are my recommended dishes: tamarind crab (the best crab ever, albeit a bit messy to eat), fish tacos (most reviews recommend this one), spring rolls, pork belly buns, and crispy birds nest. Besides the good food, the service is superb.

Ok where else can you get Lobster Pho??? This was one of my clients Resturant and I was excited to try it because the menu is too cool for school. 

Being a foodie and with family and friends visiting from out of town it was fun bringing them to a spot that is jealous worthy. 

The Resturant is a trendy joint with a cool bar. Great place to hang out on a Friday night or anytime. The lobster pho is awesome with or with out beef, the oxtail fried rice is super good and the happy ending coconut ice cream was a perfect sweet treat. I would have it without peanuts though because it wasn't sweeten or salty just raw crumble peanuts. 

Can't wait to go back to try all things oxtail. Prices are ok not so crazy food is awesome and place is cool. My new favorite pho place!

After 2 visits, District One didn't disappoint!  Food is creative and delicious.  A little bit of soul food, Asian fusion style.  Plus light, more fresh palette choices too.  And the beer and whiskey choices are tasty!

The best Oc tail pho in town, love the decor and the best customer service. The owner is really nice. I'm very happy to see what he put together here. He really bring the Vietnamese food to another level. I will come back here and referral my friends here. :)

Love this place. Been here a few times and every time i'm NEVER disappointed. Easy to find location, tons of parking, super friendly staff and knowledgeable about the menu.  The drinks here are also good.  From the ox tail loco moco, the lobster pho, and the other items on the menu you just cant go wrong! Good for groups and even just yourself and have a seat at the bar. This is a must try place. For dessert top it off with the coconut ice cream!

This place is so great! First time trying it here on my trip to Vegas. I got the District One Rice combo plate, didn't think anything of it, just a normal short rib + rice plate but it was awesome. Really liked the short rib sauce, portion was really big too. I'd go back here again if I visit vegas in the future. Haha

I don't think we have many Lobster pho spots in NorCal so had to check this place out. It's in a outdoor plaza (free parking) with a boba spot and some other stores. Came with a party of 4 on a Thursday night (we had a reservation). It wasn't too busy when we got there, maybe like 15 people or so inside. 

We ordered 2 lobster phos, an oxtail pho and a dozen oysters (think they were Blue Point). When the oysters came out, we actually asked our waitress to replace one of em' because it looked like someone picked at it; was super flat n not plump. Normally we don't make a huge deal about stuff like that but it looked weird lol. Anyway, they tasted alright; feel like I've had fresher tasting ones before. The pho... it totally made up for it tho! I got to try the broth from both the oxtail and lobster phos. They were really flavorful and the oxtail meat was tender. With seafood, it's always at market price so it was like $50! Pretty pricey bowls of pho but it's cool to try something new.

The highlight of my Vegas trip.  The lobster Pho is worth every pennies. We also ordered the chicken with Chinese sausages, it's taste so yummy!  On top of all the yummy food, their service is also 5 stars!

I came here from my friends' suggestion. I ordered the fried belly buns and they were so good. They also had fresh coconut drink and alcoholic coconut drink too. I dont like their services somehow because some of them cared for the customers, some was not, but the store was very comfortable.

Was visiting Vegas for the weekend and decided to check this place out on our drive back to Cali. Came here for Sunday lunch around 1:30 p.m. Place was packed but our wait wasn't that long, a little less than 15 minutes. We got seated in one of the large booths by the window. Since it was 105 deg outside, we weren't in the mood for pho. Instead, we tried two of their rice dishes - the rice combo platter that came with short ribs, fried egg & Chinese sausage and the pork belly with boiled egg & pickled veggies. Both were good but nothing special. We also had the coconut ice cream for dessert, which was served in a coconut shell. You can scoop up pieces of coconut and mix it with the ice cream...delish! Service was excellent, and we'll definitely come back here on our next trip to LV...and maybe try one of their pho.

First time here and gotta say I was impressed! For a place located in Chinatown the place is quite big, modern, clean, and just different from the rest of Chinatown. My mom came here with her friends before and she wanted to come back for Mother's Day lunch. 

We came in around 11am and was seated immediately, our drinks were taken quickly and the server came over to greet Happy Mother's Day and told us about their specials for the day. 

We got a bunch of stuff to share and pretty much liked everything we ordered, some were more impressive than others but not a single bad tasting dish. First of all I was so impressed with how quick the food came out, we literally did not even wait 10 minutes after putting in our order before the food started coming out. 

We got half dozen oysters just plain and half with their special sauce, oysters were cold and delicious, sweet and their homemade sauce was really good, not too strong to where it over powered the freshness of the oysters. We got the Vietnamese beef carpaccio and WOW that was so good!! I'm usually not a fan of raw beef but this was sliced super thing, the sauce was sour and salty, the fried onions on top, everything just worked! We got oxtail fries and oh boy was that good! Drowned in delicious gravy with lots of oxtail meat and an egg on top, probably the best oxtail fries I have ever had (better than the one at Bachi). We also got sea snails which my dad really liked. 

My sister go the Lobster Pho and said the broth was a little too salty, she added limes and stuff and its as ok. Everyone came to try the lobster pho but for $50 I don't think it was worth it. It didn't taste bad by any means but the only special thing about the pho was the lobster. Their special for Mother's Day was lobster fried rice, now this was worth it! The fried rice obviously had lobster, eggs, fish eggs, the sauce was amazing, it looked amazing, smelled amazing and tasted amazing!! Everyone enjoyed this dish. 

My brother got oxtail fried rice and this was really good, a little bland compared to the lobster fried rice but I like it, a healthier and lighter option. I got the bird's nest crispy noodles, I love the way they fried the noodles, so crispy and delicious. I also liked that they did not drown the noodles in too much sauce, the noodles was still crispy towards the end of the meal. I do think their sauce was a little too salty for my taste, but overall still good. 

Overall I really liked the food, they have some unique dishes that really caught my attention. Service was great, drinks were constantly re-filled, they picked up dirty plates and offered to switch out our dirty plates during the meal, everyone was very friendly and attentive. Price point is not crazy either, the whole meal was only pricy because of the lobster pho and lobster fried rice, without those two dishes the check would have been a little over $100 for 5 or 6 dishes! Will definitely come back to try other dishes and re-order a few!!
Their pho bowl is full of flavors.  Husband ordered the big bone bowl he said it was delicious. Will have to cone back and try the turf n surf pho or whole lobster pho.

Garlic wings with jalapeño, snails in lemon grass and leek broth, razor clams in oyster sauce, oxtail fried rice, spicy grilled whole squid (my favorite) , green papaya salad with shrimp, rib eye pho & kalbi plate... Wow couldn't go wrong with any of these!!!  Looking forward to trying other items off the menu like the Grilled whole Kauai Shrimp & Live Whole Lobster Pho which was voted for best use of whole lobster in Las Vegas Weekly.  Best thing is Chef Khai out does himself each week with new special creative & delicious dishes!!  Do yourself a favor and check it out...& bring your crew!!

I'm so sad that I didn't get to try this place sooner but I have to say this is by far the best restaurant I have been to in Vegas. I had ordered the oxtail pho and OMG I barely didn't have to put anything extra in it. The broth taste so smooth and the portion was pretty decent side. My husband ordered the steak and eggs and it was very delicious. He couldn't finish his food because it was a lot for him. We also got the chicken wings as an appetizer, that was good too. On a spicy side but good. Kind of a little disappointed that I didn't get to try any of their dessert because I was so full but next time when I come back, I will!!

O M Fn G

Ox tail pho is all you really need to order.  We started off with garlic-serrano wings.  Tasty with a kick and fried perfectly.  Moist on the inside.  Also ordered the pork belly buns.  Only thing lacking was the peanut sauce.. a true peanut sauce u get on spring rolls would've made that dish amazing.

Ox tail pho.  Omg.. best thing I've eaten all year.  Pictures don't do it justice.  Just get it.

Have eaten here three times, last time was a phoned In Carryout.  Dining in the food was excellent and large portions. Oxtail fried rice was delicious , steaming hot and fresh with an over easy fried egg on top.  The spring rolls are also a great appetizer 2 rolls cut in half for 4 total pieces a good value appetizer for $5.99.  Enjoyed several wings next visit during their happy hour along with some tasty beers. Sat at the bar late night, very friendly male bartender and did a great job with our group of four.  Third visit was a phoned in Carryout. Must say I was disappointed.  Portions were smaller than the portions when I had dined in with the fried rice and especially the garlic vegetable blend.  When I opened the to go container, I thought it was a joke, barely half full with veggies . For $11 at a local place like this I find it unacceptable. At Joel Robuchon I would expect it, not here!  I almost wanted to drive back and question the portion,  don't have time for that. Previous two dine in visits were great that's why I had returned.  Come on District One , veggies are the cheapest , in your unfair portion it would have cost me $22 if not more to fill a to go box with sautéed veggies :(   please see photo I posted 
I hope you address this and change it accordingly
Nice interior. Good services. But foods are kinda overpriced. I ordered lobster pho, I know it's mkt price of lobster but the taste was just Pho. It was nothing special. Not worth
Absolutely fantastic service and phenomenal best soup ever I ordered the Pho Ga chicken with broccoli and bok choy added!  Super cool atmosphere with good music and comfortable seating.

This place gets 5 stars especially due to our last visit. I've been coming here since it's opened, and pretty much just get the same thing-oxtail loco moco. The best thing ever. Now the pho is good, don't get me wrong.... but I just prefer pho so 1, more meat and slightly bigger portion there. I would have given this place a 4 star, but this last visit the entire restaraunts staff was so accommodating. We had originally thought we had a party of 8.... it grew to a party of 15. They were happy to move us. Service was quick. My water was always full. And the staff was very attentive. I think they have been working on this because my last few visits prior the staff didn't seem as attentive. Great job district one! Everything on the menu is delicious. I just wish I could get a bowl of kimchi. Lol

I don't really understand what the hype is for this place.
However, I do appreciate that they open late. The interior of District One is quite interesting. I would say it reminded me of boiling crab but definitely a more upgrade version. The tables were quite spacious which is a huge plus for me.
The service was mediocre, I wished they were a little more attentive but I don't blame them since they were getting ready to close. 
For appetizer we went with their oxtail fries. The fries were on the salty side. I probably won't recommend them unless you really like salt!
As for entrees my friends and I decided to try their pho. Usually when I order pho tai I like my meat on the side because I hate overcooked meat. However, I decided to leave it in my soup. My friend requested to have his meat on the side. 
When we got our noodles, I noticed the soup wasn't really hot. My meat was still pink after 8 minutes! It wasn't even medium rare it was RAW. As for my friend his meat was just plain not cooked. We asked if we could have our phos reheated. They gave us a bowl of hot broth instead which was fine with us. 
Overall, I never experienced pho like this before. I definitely wouldn't recommend my friends or family to try this place.

I have got to come back again. I really love how everything seems on the menu. Since I couldn't decide, I tried the District One Rice Combo with Pork Chops. So delicious. Very tasty.

Obviously, this joint isn't your standard Vietnamese Pho joint. It's wide open, the servers speak English, and it doesn't that scuzzy feel that we all love about Pho joints. Service was very good, and it even has this sports bar area with lots of TVs tuned into your favorite sporting event or sports show. I'm not sure how I feel about watching College Football over Pho, but I'm willing to give it a try!

There are way too many good looking items to not come back again, so I will!

Food was good as usual...
Finally got to try the Bog Bone soup. 

Today our server was a super fail!

I visited here for the lobster Pho which is really good. The broth is tasty and the lobster is fresh. My friend ordered oxtails fried rice and garlic chicken wings which also delicious. Service is great, will come back for more!

First visit wasn't a great experience. I've given them a second chance and glad I did. Been back several times and haven't had any other bad experiences. People have bad nights once in awhile. It's not a common thing here. Food is delicious. Staff is very friendly.

When you eat out enough you know when you have found a gem of a place to eat. And my family have found one that we hate to let others know as we want it all to ourselves. However since I've discover many a place from yelp I can let this one to the public too. District 1 an Vietnamese inspired fusion restaurant located just North East on Jones and Spring mtn. 
As soon as you enter the place you realize you will have a pleasant time. Very welcoming atmosphere and not too loud on the decorations. The wait staff are very pleasant and since it's not "grand opening" yet you are bound to be seated pretty soon. 
PRO's::
Plenty of TV 's to watch anything. 
Music not too loud which is always good 
Fast food preparations 
Fresh food and moderately priced
Crazy Japanese Whisky selection ( a few that you will not find in the States. )
Draft beer selection is pretty impressive for a non gaming establishment 
Liquor selection is great , high end alcoholic favorites that I will not able to afford lol and less expensive one for working class. Lol. 
They even have a Sake on tap " how ridiculous is that ". 
I've spoken to the owner and requested they carry Carlsberg ( now am not a fool and know most times owners don't give a damn unless am spending crazy amounts of money here,... But to my amazement the next time I came here. Guess what. my beer ) I felt the love and it's now my fav place to chill and try their tapas style menu and sip on chilled beer and stare at the expensive liquor. Lol. 
Am not much of a sea food person but my wife swears that their selection is fresh and loves the fish tacos / razor clams/ lobster pho/ and Dungeoneous crabs. The list can go on but I'd bore everyone. So go child this gem of a place and you will not be disappointed.

I want to give this place more stars because my food was delicious but unfortunately my last two visits had terrible service. I am not one to complain, but they just made their second strike with me last night. My first time I got the oxtail loco moco and my boyfriend got the shrimp with the D1 goodness sauce. The loco moco came out in 10 minutes. It was super flavorful and came in a big portion. My boyfriend's shrimp came out 20 minutes later which makes the cooks or servers seem really inconsistent. Not only did he wait 20 more minutes, but the shrimp was cold, not cleaned properly, and the sauce was tasteless like some unsalted vegetable broth. Luckily, we got it off our check since we were dissatisfied. We came in last night and ordered the wings as our appetizer, the oxtail fried rice, and the braised pork belly. Our server asked us if we wanted to have the appetizer come out first or have it all come out at the same time as the entrees. We asked to have it come out first. After waiting, we both receive our entrees both from different servers for whatever reason. Our wings came out 10 minutes after the entrees which wasn't a big deal, but it made the server look bad. All the food was so delicious, but we noticed that our server just seemed to act like she wasn't even serving our table anymore which is funny because I don't know how hard it is to serve ONE table. She would walk by and avoid eye contact and we kept trying to get her attention by raising our hand and etc. We ended up having to ask other servers for a to go box and the check since we were waiting for almost 20 minutes to grab her attention but she was too busy talking to her friend/co-worker who was standing right near our table. Since the other servers didn't bring us what we needed my boyfriend stood up and acted like he was about to leave and she still didn't give two shits to the point where we could have dine and dashed. He had to basically ask her loudly for a to go box and the check since she started walking away from the area of our table after she was done talking to her friend then she asks us if we want dessert. Are you kidding? She is a fucking joke of a server. Serving is such an easy job especially if you only have ONE table. I don't like tipping badly because I'm a server myself, but she didn't deserve the normal 20%. I know she wasn't new because I've seen her before so she needs to be retrained or something.

Based on a Yelper friends review, I had this place in mind since I Love Vietnamese food. I have to say it didn't quite meet all my expectations, but when you consider all the elements: food, ambiance, service, and price, I would agree that District One is not bad. 

Loved the ambiance (lots of room, not much waiting, good for large groups). Service was good. 

The food had mixed reviews in our group. Me personally, I thought both the chicken pho and lobster pho were delicious - the broth packed in the flavor. I also like the rice combo dish. We choose kalbi, which included a side of lop chong sausage and sunny side up egg. Disliked: not a fan of their papaya salad nor the fresh spring rolls. I also didn't care for the vodka mule drink, nor the coconut cocktail. 

Stick to beer or wine, play it safe. 

Otherwise not a bad place to meet up with friends. 

I still think my little hole in the wall mom n pop Vietnamese place would run circles around this place as far as food goes. But ...this is a better fun hang out choice, in my opinion.

I was super excited that my crew decided to eat at District One yesterday, 'cuz this place has beeeeeen on my bookmark list of places to try once I moved to Henderson. So of course the big question here is, does the hype live up to what everyone says it is?! Well, let me start off by stating that I didn't get their most ordered item which is the Lobster Pho or Bone Marrow Pho or even the Ox Tail Pho (it's too HOT outside for Pho, right now) with that said I will be back to try those items when it gets cold outside...

My hubby, homegirl and I arrived on a Sunday morning at around 11:15ish and there was no wait- we were seated right away. Jennifer was our server, who provided the perfect amount of customer service! She provided great recommendations all of which we practically ordered: 

1) Garlic Serrano Chicken Wings: 5 Stars. Great crunch and a spicy flavor kick. I loved the slices of serranos sprinkled atop the wings. 

2) Ox Tail Fried Rice: 5 Stars. I can eat this all day! The rice is cooked perfectly, there are tons of pieces of beef ox Tail; add sriracha, and this dish is bomb! Great portion size, we shared this between 3 hungry people. *wink 

3) Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio: I love me some raw meat, of course the best I've ever had was in France- but who's asking. Lol. This particular Carpaccio wasn't that great. I would give it a hard 3 Stars, that's it. Idk what it is but the sauces on the meat seemed to have cooked it a bit so it wasn't as raw as I prefer. I love me some truffle oil, but it gave a weird taste. Would I order this again? Probably not. It's not a true Carpaccio dish, in my opinion -also for the price it's not worth it.

All in all, District One offers delicious food in a cool-hipster ambiance environment. I would totally come back to try the Pho!

Found this gem on a food blog. Glad we took the blog's advice. The pho was excellent. I've had a lot of good pho in my life living close to Little Saigon in Westminster. This place was on par with what I've sampled in the past. Have to say an incredible "thank you" to our server, Cory. I cut my foot in the Uber we had taken to the restaurant. I asked if they had a bandage and he happily obliged. Great service! Great food! And what a whiskey selection!
1st time visiting this place. The food and atmosphere was pretty good. Would definitely try this place again for our next visit.

I love this place. Great food, good beer, and awesome whiskey selection. Everyone is always friendly and welcoming and makes you feel at home. The best part is that all of these great things come at a great price. I always feel like I get more value then I pay for. Only draw back is the parking on weekend. It gets really crowded in the parking lot because of all the other businesses but I brave it to visit this awesome place.

Haven't been here for years but damn this place cleaned up foreal. Love the decor love the music and the bartender is so cute haha her names Emily. Got the coconut pork belly. Came with rice and pickled Vegies. My boy got the oxtail fried rice and man booooooom dot com. I've never seen such a talented bartender off the strip definitely recommend this place

Came here around 7p on a Saturday night.  Was busy but not overwhelming, we were seated quickly and given menus.  They have a decent sized drink menu when it comes to alcoholic beverages, but as I am not really a drinker I got water.  (This is because I don't drink Soda lol). Waiters and staff were great at making sure all of our drinks were full. 

After looking at the menu,  they have a variety of items,  from different kinds of fried rice and pho, spring rolls, skewers, noodles etc.  

We opted for a couple appetizers to start with, 
Spring rolls and Belly Buns. 

Both of these were good,  spring rolls definitely taste better with the peanut sauce. Came with 4 rolls. The belly buns were delicious and a great start to our meal.  Came as an order of 3. 

As for my meal I got the Pho Bo Vien.  It came steaming hot and Delicious and Of course in an enormous bowl, with a plate on the side for toppings.  I always add lots of hoisin sauce and bean sprouts.  I left completely stuffed and satisfied.   

We were able to split the bill easily and left with a great dinner experience.

Had a wonderful experience here. I had to catch a flight two hours from when I entered and service was fast enough where I made it with a lot of time to spare. My friends and I ordered...
Bone marrow soup
Oxtail pho
Half a dozen of oysters (blue point?)
Oxtail fries

Let me tell you. Everything was delicious. I got here ten minutes before happy hour ended and the server informed us so we quickly got a few oysters for $1.25 each. The size of the bone marrow soup was HUMONGOUS!!! It was larger than our head. The oxtail fries were surprisingly BOMB. I actually wish I had more room in my stomach so I could finish it :/

The pho was amazing as well. I think it is a bit overpriced, but I'm originally from the east coast so maybe there's a general price difference between the west and east coast? The broth tasted homemade for certain and the portion was huge as well. I would definitely come back again the next time I'm in the area.

I really wanted to try their lobster pho but it's $50 so.... maybe when I'm rich or something, I'll come back to try it.

The menu has so many good options. I went with the pho oxtail, which consists of two big chunks of oxtail, noodles and broth.

The oxtail falls off the bone and is kind of delectable. The noodles are okay. The broth is very light and complemented with green onions and herbs. I would've liked it to have more complexity but it ultimately was satisfying.

The grilled Bok choi on the side was a great complement.

If I return, I would get the oxtail fried rice.

Service was great. There was no consistency to who served us but everyone was inviting, attentive and gracious. Can't ask for more from that standpoint.

There are a lot of TV's in this place so it's a sneaky good place to watch sports. Beware the TV's are small (seems like 40" or less).

This place used to be my favorite hang out spot, seems like they have changed few things on the menu laterly. They are not very genius portion, from food to drinks. Also I have noticed their food are away more salty than before. Hopefully they will change back to the original setting!:)
Awesome pho ox tail soup, beef carpaccio, oysters were bomb with ponzu sauce and fucking caviar! Ohh and coconut ice cream bomb.

this place is great!!!! Great I tell you. Came here at midnight on a Monday. We wanted to try the lobster pho but it was sold out. Oh well, my fiancee got the oxtail pho with beef meetballs. I got the spare ribs + the porkchop with rice and a fried egg. We also got the pork belly buns for appetiver. Wow those pork belly buns were amazing. Very nice and perfectly seasoned a must try. The portions of both of our dinners were HUGE!!! Great place cannot wait to come back here with friends.

What a great experience trying modern Vietnamese food! So here's my reviews on the dishes:

*Oxtail fried rice was perfect! There was a good amount of meat.They give you a good portion to share with at least 3 people. 

*Yellowtail tacos were delish! They tasted like ceviche fish tacos. I just think they were a little small for $6 for two tacos.

*Sea Snails were okay. They gave you at least 10 and they're the big sea snails too. I just thought they needed more seasonings.

*Pork Buns weren't that good. It was kinda dry and the meat was small. I wouldn't order it again. 

Adrienne was our server and she was great and attentive! I would come back here and
try their pho!
Top quality food, great atmosphere, awesome staff and wide alcohol selection. Our go to place for pho!

I love this place, it's a trendy  Asian fusion pho restaurant with a bar and Tv's all around. Located at shopping center, with plenty of parking space, off the Las Vegas strip. Usually I come here on a Sunday before leaving back to LA. It a casual restaurant and service is great. 

Here are my favorites....

Ox Tail Fried Rice it has fried eggs on top. 
Bone & Marrow soup, 
Oxtail pho, 
Slow braised pork belly
Belly bun
Shaken beef salad
Clay pot chicken rice

I didn't really like the lobster pho, I like my lobster to have its own sauce and not drenched in soup but that's just me but I know this place is known for this specialty.

And of course real Coconut juice and Vietnamese drip coffee.

First time here, saw all the reviews and recommendations and decided to try it out.  Customer service was good but food was kinda blane.  Had the lobster pho everyone has been raving about and to me was not worth the $45 I had to spent for the lobster.  Also has the chicken wings with fish sauce it was a bit salty.

Went here on a weekend night and surprisingly we got seated right away! I was expecting a long wait, but the host told us it would be about 10-15 minutes for a table. She also offered us bar seating (must be 21 and over) which allowed us to be seated right away. So my boyfriend and I decided to sit there instead since we were so hungry.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It reminds me Urban Seoul or even a boiling crab. Staff was friendly and attentive.

I ordered the oxtail pho and my boyfriend decided to go with the most popular pho lobster. We also ordered half a dozen of fresh oysters and king crab legs with aioli! 
1) oxtail pho: The broth was so yummy. It was very clean! I was happy not to see an immense amount of oil cruising around. And they were generous with the oxtail! 
2) pho lobster: It had a nice presentation with the whole head and tail in there. I just wish there was more lobster. Pretty good.
3) oysters: So fresh. blue points.
4) king crab legs with aioli: Was pretty mediocre.. I expected a lot more of a taste to it for such a price.

I would definitely come back!

By far the best pho I have ever had! They also served me one of the better bloody mary's I have had as well. Prices were decent and fair. I ordered the surf and turf pho which is half lobster and half beef flank. They were definitely generous with their meat portions but the bowl of pho came out to $35, which I should have asked about before ordering.
Beware the wait! My group of 3 people had to wait over half an hour but the hostess was very sweet and accommodating, she offered water several times to everyone waiting.

Where do I even begin???? First of all, the Staff is so friendly, nice, and on top of their game! Our server who was not Vietnamese was pronouncing the dishes like a pro. I complimented her pronunciation and she said that she learned how to say the dishes correctly to communicate with the kitchen. How awesome is that?! 

The wait is hefty when you are hungover, but everything worth having is worth waiting for! 

I had oxtail pho. It was soooooooo good. It could maybe use another hour in the pot for that fall off the bone meat, but the broth and flavor was super tasty. I washed it down with a vietchelada.

My table also had bún bò húê and they really liked the flavor. 

The coconut ice cream dessert is a must! 

Thanks District one for putting the cherry on top of a great weekend!

One of the better spots for pho in Vegas!!! I came here late one night and was blown away by how much better the pho is compared to the other spots around the area. It's a little further west from the strip but it'd definitely worth the drive, or cab ride.

The interior of the restaurant is more of a sports bar, since they do have a full-service bar at the restaurant. It seems like a great spot to catch a game or two since there are TVs lined throughout the restaurant. The tables are nicely distributed across the restaurant so you don't feel like you're crammed. It's clean throughout the place and the service is exceptional. They definitely go out of their way to make sure you're happy. If I could describe this place in 2 words, I'd called it a "Hipster Pho" place.

I got an order of the pho tai rib eye ($9) and I was really happy with my choice. The amount of meat that they give you is really generous; not to mention, the meat is really tasty and tender. On top of that, the broth is really flavorful. It's definitely not 100% free of MSG but you're not complaining when you're eating there in the wee hours. 

I'll definitely be back!

Food is great and the prices match. Service was good, we were a large party. 
I had the Pho Tom and it was so good.

I've been here like 25 times....so why am I now just writing a review? With that being said, I have probably tried everything on their menu atleast once. They have a full bar inside, with plenty of seating areas.
Some of my favorites include: house oysters, oxtail fried rice, garlic noodles, and shaken beef salad.
From the bar: Kronenberg, vietnamese coffee with Hennessey, and vietnamese donkey. Catch me here at happy hour or any hour, sometimes just for drinks. Many times, when I have visitors from out of town, they request to come eat here.
Parking can be hard to find during dinner time or late night due to all the other businesses in the plaza. 

Just go....you wont be disappointed.

This place is D bom!!!! The lobster pho, oxtail fried rice, and coconut ice cream for dessert. It's a "must go to" restaurant in Vegas or you never been to Vegas......  service is excellent and price is inexpensive considering the quality and amount of food you are getting. Love this place. Never missed everything we visit Vegas.

I can't believe it's taken me this long to check out District One. I'm a pretty big fan of variety and District One has it. Not only is the food pretty darn good, but the place is CLEAN, with a full bar, and service staff that not only speaks English, but is very friendly, too. D1 has my favorite things to eat in LV: pho, peel and eat crawfish/shrimp in spicy sauce, and fresh spring rolls that actually has fresh herbs in it. Kudos to D1 for paying attention to details: gloves, a bib, and extra bowl pre-set on the table for the shells rather than dumping the shells on the table, egg rolls presented on a bamboo tray, spring rolls looking fresh, cut in half for easy consumption, and did I mention the restaurant is CLEAN?! 
On my first visit, I ordered crawfish in spicy D1 sauce and fresh spring rolls. The crawfish were huge and succulent and the sauce was nice and spicy. I mean, my lips turned a shade of red that I wish I was a lipstick color. However, I would have to say that I do favor Hot n Juicy's sauce, but I have no problem batting for the D1 team if they continue to be consistent with their service and food. Looking over their menu, I can't wait to come back for more because I know I'll be a regular for sure.
Simply AMAZING! Love everything from the atmosphere to the food -- great establishment! First Stop: Lobster Pho and Oxtail Fries = success! Until next time!

I have taken clients to this restaurant on multiple occasions.  The menu is diverse enough in type of food and price to meet the tastes and wallets of most.  If you haven't gone to China Town in Las Vegas, this is a great place for westerners learning about Asian food. The staff is friendly and the menu is in English.  As an attorney who works regularly with Chinese lawyers and clients, I have been to numerous establishments in China Town and I believe this is the best place for Pho, fish, and Fusion foods.

The spring rolls are SO addictive! Perfect flavor, great amount of crunch, love that they aren't afraid to use the fresh herbs in the roll! That's my favorite part! The peanut sauce is a good compliment to the roll!

Over hyped, over priced.

Had the famous whole lobster Pho. Great picture, but taste was average. Broth was lacking in flavor and lobster was nothing to write home about.

Ox tail fried rice was average at best. Meat was shredded too thin to get the full oxtail taste, would of preferred solid chunks. 

Baby bok choy was great. Cooked very well and another in a delicious garlic sauce.

This place was such a great find! I was visiting with family while on a business trip. The plaza is so nondescript you may pass it except for the metal backed signage that stands out. 

The staff is very pleasant and the food is delicious. The only reason I am giving this place 4 stars is... 

1) We arrived around 3:30pm and the sunlight was bouncing off the cars in the parking lot, right into our faces. They have shades but didn't have them rolled down. Booths line the windows and were full with patrons so it might have been inconvenient for them to pull them down right then. The windows span the entire restaurant though. 


 2) I tried the oxtail pho. It tasted amazing but the meat was still on the bone. Getting the meat off was a little difficult and it was also boiling hot. I don't know if my expectations are too high but I don't enjoy burning my fingers to get the meat off. I tried with a fork but it was too hard. I wouldn't mind it on the bone if the meat was falling off. 


We also tried the pork sticky buns, beef lemongrass wrapped in grape leaf, and ribeye pho. All were amazing! I did notice that the ribeye pho broth was definitely different than the oxtail. The ribeye was a little darker and heavier. The oxtail lighter overall. Both very good just different. This place is a must try if in Vegas!

Love that it's off the strip!!! The menu is pretty simple and well thought out.  Loved the oxtail fries and the giant bone soup! Please note that you can order it with rice noodles, but since we were cutting down on carbs, the right thing to do was to go noodle-less! 

Drinks are pretty legit and can't wait to go back. Glad that there's a bunch of Vietnamese spots in vegas where I don't have to break my wallet in
The food its salty and the service it's bad. I'm not happy and my whole family not gonna come here anymore...

The establishment has a great atmosphere. Their are servers everywhere so with my experience I had no problems getting my orders right away. 

First I ordered my first sake ever which one of the server recommend to me he said it was one of thier brewed drinks not sure what the name of the sake was but it had a coconut finished which was refreshing. 

Also I ordered pho rebeye which was great the broth had a clean flavor which complimented the rebeye and the noodles. Did not really add anything to my broth just been sprouts for crunch and chili for heat. 

Lastly I ordered the pork belly bun which was yummy!  And the pork was very tender.

Everything was great! Especially the food! After hearing all the hype about this place we decided to give it a try. We left completely satisfied. 

Oxtail Fried Rice- $12.95
Belly Buns- $7.95
Crispy Bird Nest Noodle- $13.95
Vietnamese Coffee

Everything was worth it! Great service from the hostess to the servers the only reason why I am giving 4 stars is because our hostess told us that our server would come by and share the daily specials with us. We where never informed on any specials but we did over hear another server inform the table next to us about the deals they had on our way out. If I had heard the deals prior to us ordering we would have ordered more!!

Without a doubt one of the best restaurants I have ever had the pleasure eating at. The flavors were nothing short of amazing with each plate that was served. We were a big group, 7 of us, but they were able to sit us down immediately. We started with apps, which were amazing. If you're a drinker I would recommend trying the Vietnamese Donkey, their version of a Russian Mule. The twist was fantastic, I ordered a few. For dinner I had the king crab which was just enough to satisfy my hunger without making me too full. 

When I go back I will absolutely try the lobster pho - a friend of mine ordered it and said it was out of this world. I've been to many Vietnamese restaurants but have never seen anything like that. Very impressive. 

The ambience was incredible, very cool and laid back. Music was on point. If I lived in Vegas we would be regulars. When I go back to Vegas it will be the first place I dine at. Can't wait!

Went for the first time with my friend and daughter. I liked the layout and modernness of the restaurant. It was around lunch time when we stopped by, and even for edc weekend we were seated right away. Our host/server were both very nice, they smiled and were very friendly and was able to suggest. Went to wash my hands and it was interesting how there were sinks outside of the bathrooms. For myself I just wanted to wash my hands and my daughter needed to use the restrooms. Which were very clean and they didn't smell.

I had ordered the lobster pho, Spring rolls for my daughter. And oysters to share with my friend. He had ordered for himself the cube chopped beef with I believe garlic noodles and an egg on top. Also an appetizer of fried chicken. two Vietnamese coffees. And for desert, coconut ice cream. I think that's their only desert for now.

Lobster pho- the broth was good, but not great. I felt like it lacked flavor. The lobster was good too, I liked how they pick out the tail and claws for you. The noodles taste like any other pho noodle, it was not too soggy. However, that was it. It was just a boring bowl of lobster pho. the thought of it was like "Ooh..." and the taste was like "eh..", Nothing wow.

Spring rolls- I enjoyed the crunch they added in the Spring roll.  But I wish there were more meat and noodles, the greens took up more then half of what was inside. The sauce was ok. My daughter normally loves Spring rolls but this one she only ate half.

Beef w/ garlice noodles- noodles and beef were plain, barely much flavor. I felt so bad for my friend that ordered this, since he was from east coast and I wanted to take him to a restaurant that he would love. This dish didn't do it. 

Oysters- yummy! I really enjoyed this and the sauces and flavors they added to the oysters. Would definitely order this again. Pretty small ones though.

Coconut ice cream inside fresh real coconuts. AMAZING. Never had anything like this before! coconut ice cream with I think green jello on the bottom! very creamy yumminess on top and nuts sprinkled as well. I very much enjoyed this desert and would come back for more. It was not too sweet for me and my friend and I thought it was just enough sweetness. Must try!

Disappointed in our main dishes, desert and oysters were great. I will come back because I want to try the rest of the menu.

The place was neat and artsy. A good place to hang out with some friends if you want to bring a lot of friends. The food was alright, not really the best. The servers were very accommodating although parking was a bit of an issue. Just be there early if you want to enjoy the food.

Once I heard they served a beautiful dish called "Lobster Pho," I was sold.
I made it a mission to include this on my short vacation to Las Vegas.  Nice little setting in a strip mall.  The lights were on the dim side, making it a little more intimate.  I liked the modern decorations/graphics along the walls.  TVs in every corner so we were able to enjoy the basketball game while dining.  They even have a bar if you just want to grab drinks and relax.

Now comes the exciting part, FOOD.
Appetizers:
Oxtail Fries - 3 stars.  I would compare this to poutine.  Nothing too special in my book. I believe it was $11.99 and for the portion and quality, I wouldn't get it again
Shaken Beef Salad -  4 stars.  If you're Cambodian, it definitely reminds me of Loc Lac without the rice.  Delicious flavor and generous portion size but $11.95 could be pricey for most.  
House Special Oysters - 5 Stars!  Mmm, they were really fresh and had great flavor!  This definitely made me crave oysters more often.
Entrees:
Steak  & Egg - 4 stars.  Amazing flavor of the beef on top of lettuce and tomatoes.  Egg cooked to your preference.  We substituted the rice for the garlic noodles which was an additional $3.00, so the dish came to a total of about $15.00.  It was good but I don't know if it was worth $3.00 good.  
Lobster Pho - 4 stars.  Boy, did I enjoy that lobster.  It is based on market price and ended up being $40.00 when I went.  They give you the entire lobster, head included with the meat cut up so its more convenient for consumption.  The broth was okay.  Of course you can't expect beef broth pho so it was a little different on my pallet.  They also didn't bring bean sprout and didn't have limes so I had to resort to lemons.. meh.  Great food experience but I'm not sure I would get it again for that price.

Service was a little slow, granted we were a big group.  They were only able to split the check 4 ways.   It wasn't too busy when we went, which was a Saturday night.  Dining here was definitely an experience!

Oxtail pho was bomb!  Not sure if it was worth the price tag, but it hit the spot for sure after a long day of drinking.  The pork belly buns and oxtail fried rice were great items to share as well.  This place is worth an uber ride off the strip.

Lots of unique menu items and isn't your typical Vietnamese restaurant.  My friends and I decided to venture off of the strip for some good Asian food and decided to come here.  The oxtail pho caught my eye since that isn't something you see too often in Vietnamese restaurants, at least in Dallas.  The broth was delicious and there were large chunks of meat on the bones.  I liked how the broth wasn't oily and tasted very clean.

Service was quick and staff was attentive and friendly.  I'll be back here when I visit and am in the need for some pho.

I was recommended by some acquaintances for this restaurant and I would have to say it is overall just.... OK.... but not something very specail

You walk in here and it is definitely a modern vietnamese fusion restaurant that attracts mainly the younger crowd with their style and taste of their dining room. I do like it, im 25 years old, but personally its not what I expect when I like some Vietnamese food, would rather have some average spot with no style serv me some good flavorful pho. 

For their food, most yelpers here probably will not agree, they probably had an off day but I had the Ox tail pho and it was just mediocre. Some of us has the same thing, and others had some appitizers and other kinds of pho, I forgot which ones. 

What I was amazed from my pho was the oxtail itself. two giant pieces of ox tail thats probably enough to feed a lion, fell right off the bone as im picking and eating it. was very easy to eat it. Though the broth with the pho, completely bland to me. When I have Vietnamese food in boston, the broth is usually at its bold flavors in restaurants I go to, but this one was just so disappointing to me. 

My mother also had pho, I dont know what its called but its just simple slices of meat, but she didnt eat any because it looked like it was all fat. Im aware prime brisket is 50% fat but this seem to be 75%. meh...

Also had some appitizers, soft shell crab was pretty good, pork belly bun was as well, but we had the leaf wrapped beef, tasted bland as well. 

For their service, definitely on point. I was with embarassing asian elders who doesnt know the vibe of respect of talking too loud and sounding rude all the time. the server I had was definitely cooperating and it was great, it didnt seem she was bothered. We got everything we ordered and such.

For the money, its just okay, I can pay $15 for ox tail pho, and I would definitely try lobster because it's defintiely something new. but for now, I would have to give this 3 stars for just being a mediocre place. hope they do something about the broth though

Remy Cointreau hosted a private event last night I had the luxury of attending.  Every morsel was an absolutely delicacy from the sashimi tacos, the oysters on the half shell to the Peking Duck. The mixologist outdid themselves with a variety of holiday cocktails.  I will return here soon for the Ox Tail Fried Rice which I've heard is to die for.  Fun atmosphere. Cool vibe. Great spot.

Awesome service .... Great food. I love the snails :)
Beef carpaccio is the best, I love almost every dishes.
Great place and food! A little different from regular pho, they have lobster or oxtail. I always get the steak and egg and substitute the rice with garlic noodles!  mom always gets the belly bun too

The Hennessy Vietnamese Coffee was decent. Either Viet coffee is the best chaser in the world or there was no alcohol in there. It's Vegas, we're here to get a little twisted, wish there was a little more Henny and a little less coffee. Sereno wings packed some nice heat and flavor, cooked perfectly. Oxtail Fried Rice was delicious. Fried runny egg on top gives it nice presentation before you gobble down the whole thing.

Just found out about this spot so decided to check it out, actually have been here twice this week and this is what I think. 

Pho tai - one of the better bowls of pho that I've had. Nice quality meat nice flavor too the broth. 

Calamari - seemed like the frying oil needed to be replaced, spicy aioli sauce was awesome not bad. 

Garlic Serrano pepper wings - I'm actually a huge fan of these one of my favorite things on the menu. Really tender and juicy with a nice spicy kick to it 

Beef carpaccio - it had been sitting under a heat lamp so the exposed meat was a little cooked, also not bad. 

Combo rice plate (pork chop, kalbi, Chinese sausage) pork chop was way over cooked, short robs were decent couple of the cuts were completely fat, Chinese sausage was good. 

1lb of shrimp - kind of like the hot n juicy style boiling crab ish shrimp boils. The "d1 house season" was pretty good shrimps were a nice decent size. Over all pretty good for a 1lb of shrimp. 


Overall this place is a wicked little spot. The food quality could be improved a little bit, but definitely will be back!

Man, I can't stop thinking of this place. I am Vietnamese and I want to say this is one of the best pho I had in my life- Sorry mom! Please don't disown me!

I'm not sure it was a long night of drinking and that I was super hungry. But everything we ordered were so damn perfect. 

Surf'n'Turf Pho: 1/2 lobster with Ribeyes steaks slices. $35. Not only the toppings tasted fresh and perfectly cooked/prepared, the broth was very tasty. It was full of flavor and very aromatic. It was so good that I did not need to add any sauce in my soup because it was perfect " just the way you are". I'm drooling while writing this review.

We ordered the grilled squid and ox tail Fries (not in picture) as well. They were good but I was too full after finishing my pho. Yeah the appetizers came after the pho. But it's all good. I'm glad I saved my tummy for the delicious pho. Yummmm! I drank all the soup, technically cleaned my bowl ! no shame! 

Oh and they have Hennessy on Tap! Right? How awesome is that? I don't see this too often. So yes... while in Vegas, Why Not! 

I will make it as an tradition to visit this place every time I visit Vegas now. Highly recommended!
Service was great but the food was subpar. A lot of grease and was served luke warm. Unique menu I am going to give it a second try.
I enjoyed the ambiance of this location. For the price of the food, I expected more quality. Unfortunately, I felt that my dish needed more salt and didn't find a dish I would come back for.

Enough variety to satisfy our hANGRY and hungover party of ten. Everything we ordered was excellent: spring rolls had big shrimp, the egg rolls were served with greens to make wraps, my shaken steak was tender and the egg was cooked perfectly over tomato rice, oxtail in the pho was falling off the bone tender, lobster pho was good, bun bo hue beef had a slight spicy kick, the Mekong river soup was comfort food at its finest, and big bone bowl had tasty marrow in a fatty broth. And we drank our fill of electrolytes out of fresh coconuts! Thumbs up all around! Chicago approved

This place used to be the cravin cajun, our usual go-to if we're ever craving for shrimp. They closed down and luckily opened up a better joint to replace it!

Glad we tried this place out because it's really good! Ordered a cider beer along with 2 appetizers. They were super delicious! My main dish was the rice platter combo with pork chops, and the sauce that came with it is EVERYTHING! It also came with an egg, which made it ever better. Who doesn't love egg on everything??? Okay, well maybe not everything, but you guys know what I mean.

Our waiter was super consistent, always made sure we were okay and not the annoying type of waiters neither.

Overall, this place was satisfying. Can't wait to come back here when I'm craving for an Asian dish!

Oxtail pho! Yum yum yum!

I kept seeing this place pop up on yelp so decided to give it a try. Turns out, pho so 1's owner's son runs this place! My family and I have been going to pho so 1 for years so when I found out, I was super excited. My mom got to the restaurant first and she was waiting outside.  As soon as Khai saw her, he ran out and told her he'd get a table started while she waited for the rest of us to arrive. What awesome service. We felt like VIPs :P

Not your typical vietnamese pho place. They have the common pho combos and also offer a variety of other fresh seafood items. I got the oxtail pho. It was ~$12, on the pricey side for pho... but totally worth it. My bowl came out with 3 huge pieces of oxtail! It also comes with a side of dipping sauce for the meat. Mix them up and squeeze a little bit of lemon and its delicious!

My sister got Mi Sate. It came out and looked delicious but it definitely was not. It tasted like someone took half a jar of peanut butter and mixed it in with her soup. Way too peanut-y and sweet. Not a fan.

One other minor complaint I have about this place is that my very Vietnamese mother had a difficult time ordering the specific pho combo she wanted. Their menu had the basics. She typically gets pho chin tai nam... not on the menu. Totally not a problem but when she tried to order, both my mother and the waitresses were confused. Neither of them spoke Vietnamese. I don't mind this at all but I know my mom wasn't too happy. She'd be more comfortable with going to a solely Vietnamese speaking establishment so I probably wont be coming here with my family but I know for sure I will be back with some friends! I really wanna try the Lobster Pho!!!!!
So bomb. Unique menu, weekly specials, amazing pho!

Talk about another hidden gem in Vegas. I have been meaning too check this place out after hearing the buzz and looking at the pics it all looks really really good. I really am digging the sign/logo of the restaurant. If that doesn't make first impression from the moment you walk into the restaurant be surprise got upscale feeling too the place, even though bar area not that big really like the set up, and for any sports fan love the fact five widescreen all set up just like see at sports book bunch together. The prices are supa reasonable up and down the whole menu. The portion size for tapas style is really good size more so then other tapas style places been too in my experience. Love the diversity of the menu also wide range from cornish hen, bone marrow soup, more tradition pho dishes, or beef salad. Just talking about the entrees. 

I no idea best place too start my District One Kitchen & Bar experience but the Hue Spicy Beef Noodle Soup was on my radar. It the perfect soup too clear my running nose and sinus. Boy did it not disappoint! The broth had nice kick too it. But not over the top that not enjoy the full body of the broth. One of the best things about it is diversity of meats in it. Counted four different ones in the bowl. Really each time dug deep find another different treat in every scoop. It nice hearty Pho dish. Any sign of good Pho is no need too add anything more too the broth. The appetizers was tough but went with the Beef Buns. Talking about Buns in my last review Beef Buns brought back that same urge Bun crazy! They do have peking duck buns too believe but went with the pork buns. Talk about addicting get three per order but popping them down so easy wish order half dozen or hell could have done dozen. Really that good!! The pork is cooked nice crispy outside, moist inside, and glaze or sauce cooked in was fabulous could have ordered plate of pork! The topping of think hoisen or oyster sauce combine with garnish of julienne carrots and couple other things. The steam bun itself was the perfect Steam Bun with the perfect filling. 

The service was awesome. I torn between the tacos and beef buns waiter recommending the beef buns. Save the tacos for next time. No doubt be few more times because lot of good stuff on the menu. Just happen ran into fellow yelpers Misti and Bobby. They were kind enough ask if wanted too join them. It was just me doing my yelp diligent checkout out all the ONO spots in Vegas. Lol!! Impromptu UYE with the one and only Misti Y and Bobby Y. Thanks. 

Trust me if not checked out District One you need too. It really good food at reasonable price that we al can enjoy!!

I love this spot!  My go to when I want pho. Their super model is the lobster pho... Everyone get your cameras out. My serious guilty pleasure... Hands down the big bone soup.  I am addicted to bone marrow.  As bad as that is I could eat it 3 times a week if I had it my way.  By big it's colossal!  The large amounts of marrow is so gratifying.
