If you are too shy to get your hands on this dish they will help you out.  The server threw on some gloves and went to work.  She scooped out the marrow, cut the meat and tendon, you are good to go!  Pair that with a side of rice, SO BOMB!  I have been plenty times where the big bone soup is not ready yet, or sold out.  At times I'll call in advance. 

However, when all else fails there's the ox tail pho.  The meat is so tender. This dish is also delicious and satisfying.  I take mine no noodles side of rice. 

The oysters are always so good here with the tobiko. Pork belly is bomb too.  I think everything on the menu is worth trying. The only thing was the snails I didn't care for, too large and chewy. 

I appreciate everyone who works here. Shout out to Tony and Christina!!

The decor and atmosphere is great! The service is good but not exceptional. The variety of different Pho is awesome and their portions are pretty big. Each time I visit Vegas, district one is always on my list!

If you're ever looking for quality Asian food off the Las Vegas strip, you need to try District One!

My family and I came in just in time for their happy hour! (Happy hours are Mon-Fri 5pm-7pm, Sun-Thurs 12am-2am.) The atmosphere is very modern and styled similarly to Boiling Crab, with lots of wall decor. They also had a really good reggae playlist playing in the restaurant.

Our server, Jewel, was super sweet and attentive throughout our meal. She constantly checked up on us to refill our waters or to ask how we liked the food. She was really knowledgeable about the menu as well; a majority of the food we ordered were recommendations from her!

BELLY BUNS - 3.95 during happy hour, 6.95 regular price
You have the option of getting the buns steamed or deep-fried. We tried them deep-fried for that extra crunch and texture, but I've heard they tasted just as good when steamed. Definitely get these, as they seem to be a favorite among District One-goers. I'm not a huge fan of pork, but the pork belly was sooo good and juicy. I recommend!

OXTAIL PHO - 13.99
The pho is a little pricier than the bowls you could get at some of the Vietnamese places deep in Chinatown or elsewhere, but for good reason! They were extremely generous with the oxtail, and it was cooked to perfection; not too fatty, which is how I like it! The broth was just the right amount of salty, and I didn't end up with one of those nasty MSG-headaches after my meal. Broth-to-noodle ratio was perfect!

SHORTRIB RICE - 12.99
This was my brother's order, and I was able to get a few bites in before he finished it all! I believe it comes with steamed rice topped with an egg (anyway you want it), short ribs, Chinese sausage, and pickled carrots/radish. 

OXTAIL FRIED RICE - 12.99
Again, the oxtail wasn't lacking in amount; there were pieces in every single bite. The rice wasn't too bland or too salty. The rice is also topped with a fried egg. So so so good, and enough to share with one or two others. I recommend this one too.

Overall, the food was extremely satisfying and didn't leave me feeling too full or gluttonous. I definitely see myself coming back the next time I'm in Vegas! It's open until 2am too; perfect for late night cravings!

(SIDEBAR: I ended up forgetting my wallet here and didn't realize it until I was back in my hotel room at the Vegas strip. Thank you so much to the District One staff for their integrity and safeguarding it until I made it back out to the restaurant to pick it up!)
The food is unique and special. Very fresh, I've been coming here since day one , Quality !!

This used to be the Cravin Cajun place. I hadn't been to either but I was headed somewhere else for dinner and this place caught my eye. I thought maybe it would be good.

It wasn't bad but wasn't something I would go back to, either. 

It has an upbeat atmosphere. Everything is kind of new inside so it looks nice. There is a giant chalkboard that somebody spent a lot of time writing the signature dishes but the chalkboard is back in a corner so being a new customer, with so much other noise going on, I didn't even notice it until halfway into my meal. There's also an 8 foot picture of their lobster pho advertisement that is also positioned in a way that only the hostess pointing it out, I would've noticed. In a dimly lit place, these types of signs need a highlight light to get noticed.

The hostess asked if I wanted a booth but I was by myself so, I decided to sit at the bar. There was a guy bartender that seemed to be eyeing me like he was going to take my order. If I sit at a bar to order food, I prefer to order from a server but I've never been here so I just go with the flow.
The lobster pho obviously is something they are trying to push. I decided to try that. The price is listed as 'Market Price.' My personal opinion when a guest orders something listed with this label is that the server should suggest the price. Only after it is ordered. And, this is why...

A woman dressed in plain clothes who appeared to be either a manager or maybe even the owner because she was sitting with guests and overriding the register and accepting a delivery ( which was strange for 9pm on a Saturday night, but...who am I ). But, she casually walked by while I was eating and asked how it was. So, lemme get to that...the important part.

The lobster pho had the full shell as garnish. It was hollow but the only thing that gave the dish substance. The broth was clean and flavorful but was bare. There were the typical pile of noodles in the bottom of the bowl but the entire dish was 1. Broth 2. Noodles 3. Lobster 4. Couple slices of onion...from most to least. The flavor was right but I was hoping for more so when this manager asked me halfway through, I couldn't really give a correct assessment. If she asked me at the moment of service or after I was finished, I would probably have had more to say but asking while my mouth is full is an indication that something isn't right. 

Like I said...it wasn't bad but it wasn't anything to knock my socks off. Although the dish is actually more traditional than the Americanized versions that are so popular, it was only so so. And, if the bill is going to show up $40 for the pho and $5 for tea, I would prefer to have known what it was going to be priced because what started as a so so dish dropped immensely upon learning what they value as such. 

On a side note, the bartender was a little personal with his questions. I understand a bartender is supposed to be a sort of quasi therapist for patrons but he acted more like he was a reporter with his questions. And, I wasn't ordering any alcohol. But, he found out that I'm involved in a community event beauty pageant for girls. He told me that one of the servers was competing but, I think he was trying to grab my attention. Problem is, while trying to get the girls attention that he pointed out to me, she was almost running from me. I didn't recognize her but she was in work clothes so I just wanted to verify. He told me her name and I still didn't recognize it so I'm wondering if this is the same as the price of the pho...deceiving and in the end, a disappointment like getting a Thai massage without a happy ending. 

It's a shame because the broth was good. The place has an upbeat atmosphere but the location is bad and the prices are a little inflated for being in a rundown area and getting surprised with a fifty dollar bill for soup and tea kills any good taste in my mouth. I know seafood is not cheap but I was thinking that would be the sugar on top. Instead, it was like eating a bowl of rice and after finishing, finding out it was actual fried meal worms. 

I don't think I'll return again.
Delicious Ox Tail pho! Definitely a necessity when your visiting Vegas! Perfect dish for replenishing!

Came here on a Sunday night for dinner with some friends. I've never heard of this place so I was really excited to dine here. Atmosphere was really nice and relaxing and it wasn't too busy. 
We ordered some drinks at the bar before we got seated. The hostess was really sweet and sincere.
She sat us at a big booth, that was able to sit the 6 of us. We started with 2 orders of the fish tacos. 1 taco each person and they were mini. Tacos were good, but literally were a teaser. I then ordered 2 fresh springs rolls that came with 4 per order. They were your average spring roll, but still very good.
Then we were ready to order, I ordered the oxtail fried rice with an over medium egg. My bf ordered the District 1 combo rice platter which came with short ribs, kim chee, chinese sausage, and either your choice of garlic noodles or white rice. He chose the white rice.
Our friends at the table ordered the Birds nest which was crispy noodle chow mein, and also got an order of the grilled squid which was really gooood and not rubbery.
Everything was cooked really good and tasted even better. 
I would definitely come back to this place and try their lobster pho, which is their most popular menu item.

The lobster pho was okay I think it looks better than it tastes I would not order the lobster pho next time I'm glad I got it for an experience but I don't recommend the lobster pho to anyone else everything else on the menu was pretty good very reasonable in price great service very great atmosphere  here I will be back

Our waiter was great he helped me narrow down the menu to pick the oxtail with the spicy hue broth which was amazing! Everything we ordered was incredible, the food wasn't the only great thing! The customer service was as well! Our waiter was very accommodating, helpful, and knowledgeable. I wish I could remember his name and will update this if one of my friends remember! He was nice enough to special order the edamame with the garlic and Serranos. It was so delicious! Next time I am in town I will go out of my way to come back!

Late night Vietnamese bar food to the MAX. We visited around 10pm and noticed the service at the bar was better than waiting to be seated. Pretty simple ordering. We did the spring rolls, garlic & Serrano pepper chicken wings, and Pho ga soup. Everything was awesome. Very modern feel to the space with a lot of TV's. I guess not your typical Asian spot. Food was so good, a lot of beer and cocktail selection. I'm now a big fan of this place. Open til 2 am on a Sunday. Very good!!!!! And Paul at the bar was wonderful.

It was so hard deciding what to order here because everything sounds amazing! One of my new favorite spots in Vegas. I will definitely come back and try other food from their menu!

Hue Spicy Beef Noodle (Bun Bo Hue)
Steak & Egg rice dish- steak was seasoned very well with the tomato red rice 
Bronzino? Carpaccio- the seasoning was so delicious!! i've had food with truffle oil but this had a great balance to it! the slices of fish were too tiny though which was kind of disappointing. 
House Special Oysters- super fresh!

Was brought here by local who was taking us around after a business meeting that ended after midnight! We were so happy this place was open til 2am as we arrived just before 1am.

It was fairly empty when we arrived, and they were kind enough to let us sit at a larger table they had already cleaned for the night. The server was pleasant. All we really wanted was to try the bone marrow soup so we got 3 orders (for 5 ppl- 2 shared as it was 17.99 for 1) I also wanted to try the Oxtail fries so we got an order for the table.

Oxtail fries were great- loaded with an egg on top. Not a huge portion to share, but worked fine with us as there were a couple ppl who were not too hungry. If you're coming starving, I'd say it would be a sufficient appetizer for 3-4 ppl max.

Now, the best part was the bone marrow soup! One- it was HUGE. I quickly saw why it was 17.99 lol.  It was also a fun experience as we put on plastic gloves to really get all the marrow and such off the bones. A server came by to explain how & was really helpful and patient while teaching us how to get the most out of the soup. And YUMM it was amazing. My friend put some hoisin sauce in hers- but I loved it without just fine! 

We had to box it to go, even though we shared it! Definitely worth it and will be back. If you're a fan of bone marrow, it will not disappoint! 
They even bagged up the bones for me to take home to my doggies. Now my dogs will love it when we go too ;)

This is a quick update on their veggie pho. I'm still a fan of District One, but I didn't get a chance to eat their oxtail fried rice again, but it sure still looks amazing! 

As I continue my journey on slowly becoming a vegetarian, I went with the veggie pho. The broth was hearty, light as it's *crosses fingers* made with vegetable broth. I did wish that there was some more in the mix though. It only came with the rice noodles, broccoli, and carrots. I was hoping for some tofu or something that made the pho more complete. 

Overall, the pho wasn't bad, but I just wished there was more to it.

First off... WOW! My wife and I Shared a Half dozen oysters and Mekong Noodle Soup. The Mekong was very tasty. As I watched everyone else's order, they all looked amazing. If I didn't have a big breakfast earlier, I would have definitely ordered either the Big Bone Soup or the Lobster Pho. Service was amazing. I would definitely return and recommend for other. Great Check out spot for LV.

My wife and I came here with our family friends for dinner one night. First of all, I loved the ambience of this place (full bar, tvs, chalkboard walls, etc.). Very hip and modern I would say. We shared the following:

Crispy Egg Rolls $4.95

Spring rolls $5.95

Green papaya salad $7.95

Oxtail Fried Rice $12.95

District One Rice Combo Platter $11.95

Hue Spicy beef noodle soup $9.95

First off, the one unfortunate thing was that they ran out of their bone marrow pho! :( But anyways, the food here was awesome! I would say the best dish was the combo platter with pork chop (or short ribs if you prefer), kimchee, fried egg, and chinese sausage. That dish can easily be shared by 2 people as the portion size is pretty huge. I would say the oxtail fried rice was the least exciting dish as it only had oxtail, egg, and onions. I wanna try their cornish hen and pork belly dishes next time. We will be back! 

P.S. Oh ya, they got happy hour too!

Was introduced to this place by another friend visiting Las Vegas. Great food, great drinks, great people!!! The owner, servers and bartenders went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. 
Added this to my must have's when in Vegas!!!
Food and service is amazing! The oxtail fried rice is definitely in my top three best fried rice in vegas if not number one. This is a must checkout if you are around the area.
Very tasty. Spicy Hue Noodle Soup was bomb!!! I saved the left over broth it was so good and took it home and made a second meal with the broth. I will be returning:)

Some of the girls wanted pho since they were a bit hungover. I'm not a fan of pho but as long as they have vermicelli and other dishes I'm good. We took an uber here but there seemed to be plenty of open parking spaces in the lot. The inside is pretty nice. A definite fancier version of most Vietnamese pho places I been to. It's pretty big and spacious and a bit dim. Very inviting, good setting for big groups. The menu is more updated, instead of just pho. So pretty good for someone like myself who does not want pho. They have a little bit of everything for everyone.

_Crispy Egg Rolls ($8.99) Pork, mushroom, taro. I don't know if it's the taro or a certain oil they fry this in, but this was one of the best crispy egg rolls I've had. The crunch from the egg rolls was nicely fried, the inside was fresh and was nicely packed with ingredients. Simple but lots of flavors, it was a tad sweet and had a nutty flavor to it. I loved the greens that came with it. You can dip the roll in the fish sauce then wrap it in the lettuce, it takes it to another level and makes you feel a little less guilty for eating fried food hahah.
_Spring Rolls ($6.99) Shrimp, pork, vermicelli, lettuce, peanut sauce. This was good and pretty standard. The rolls were fresh, the ingredients inside were a generous amount and the flavor was light and subtle. Of course this isn't complete without that yummy sweet and nutty peanut dipping sauce. 
_Steak & Egg ($15.99) Shaken beef, white onion, fried egg, tomato rice. I ordered this, since they did not have the vermicelli bowl. I was skeptic to get this at first since most shaken beef I have are always salty. So I asked the waiter if possible to make it less salty or easy sauce. The tomato rice was good, different from white rice, but just adds a nice little sweetness and acidity to the dish. The beef itself was okay, well cooked and all evenly chopped. The sauce was still salty but I've had worse so can't complain. The egg was a bit raw and runny so they were nice enough to recook it a bit more. The dish taste way better with the eggs, when you mix it altogether. This dish overall was okay, I think the rice and egg alone was the best part. 
_Baby Bok Choi (8.99) Wok fried, garlic. Pretty good and standard veggies. The garlic flavors were great and tasted really good when I ate it with my shaken beef.
_Spicy Pork String Beans ($10.99) Ground pork, chili, green string beans. The whole group loved this. My gg, whom is allergic to garlic ordered this without the garlic, but I guess they forgot the memo. The flavors were great though, lots of garlic aroma, a bit of a kick and the beans itself were perfectly cooked. It had a nice little bite to it, white still being soft as well. 
_Coconut Ice Cream. They were nice to give us free desserts for the mess up on the garlic mishap on the green beans. Presentation was pretty. Served on a small coconut bowl. The flavors were light and refreshing, it had a bit of that icy texture to it. There was also small bits of coconut inside and topped with crushed peanuts. I love peanuts so this added an extra roasted flavor to the ice cream. I will say though, the more I ate it, the more it tasted like vanilla ice cream with hints of coconut. Either way a good dessert. 
_Green Tea Creme Brulee. This was pretty darn good! The green tea custard was nice and silky. A very subtle hint of green tea. The brulee on top was perfectly caramelized and sweet. A small size which is great to just end the meal.

Service was good, and yes pretty pricey for Vietnamese cuisine, but you are in Vegas so high prices are to be expected. I don't mind paying as long as the food is good. Nothing is worse than overpriced food that isn't even good. I would come here again, and try their popular oxtail pho.

Husband and I finally decided to try  this place after talking about it for months. Location of the restaurant appears to be in a very popular and busy plaza but parking is ample to accommodate the crowds. My husband ordered the very popular "big bone" bone marrow pho. He enjoyed the flavor and highly complimented the taste of the broth. The soup naturally required a lot of messy work to eat and for $18 I would think it included noddles but thats an option for an extra $2. Overall though my husband gave it a 4/5. I ordered the double down which included Kalbi short ribs, Chinese sausage with a side of rice topped with an egg. Very hearty dish and good portion. I had enough leftover to take home for another meal. We ended our meal with their coconut ice cream served in an actual coconut. Delicious and the perfect end to a great meal. The highlight of our meal was definitely the pho. Can't wait to return and try more of their yummy noodle soups!

Omg! I cant even right now. This is the best vietnamese cuisine i have ever eaten in my life. The king crab, the beef tatami, the squid, the oysters, the pho, the lobster.... Incredibly delicious. The staff and the owner are super nice and friendly. I come here every single time im in Vegas and Distroct One never dissapoints me. Highly recommend this place to everyone out there.

Consistently delicious food, friendly staff, love the daily special menu, often with great new items.  Non traditional Vietnamese restaurant so don't expect some of the usual dishes like banh xeo, special pho, chao tom, etc.  The oxtail pho, fried pork buns, beef tartar never disappoint.  Best green mango salad ever; perfectly flavored, with octopus (if it's available)!   Wish it's a regular on the menu and not a special item!  Delish sea snails, a must try; another perfectly prepared dish served in a lemon grass broth with ginger prepared fish sauce: the flavor of the snails really come through.

District one has a great atmosphere and even greater food. The only downside to this place is the parking. It took my husband and I almost 20 minutes to find a parking space due to the limited amount of spaces shared between District One and about ten other resturants. Needless to say once we finally parked and made our way inside we were slightly on edge. Once inside headed to the bar to calm our parking headache. The bar has an impressive menu of speciality mixed drinks, beer, and wine. Once our table was ready we ordered the oxtail fries and beef pho. The oxtail was so tender and flavorful that it almost melted in my mouth. However, I wish the fries were fried slightly longer so that they would be a little more crispy to hold up to all of the oxtail gravy. The beef pho was great, the broth was flavorful and not too salty and there was a good ratio of meat and noodles. Delicious food but next time I come I will make sure to ask for extra crispy fries.

This place came highly recommended. I will say that it certainly lived up to the hype. 

I had the oxtail fried rice. This dish was delicious and came with a generous amount. You could easily share this dish with someone. 

My mom got the lobster pho. Let me tell you that was the best pho I have ever tasted. The broth, it's all about the broth. Great portion size and very tasty. 

My husband and friend got the garlic noodles with dungeons crab. It was huge! They even shared with us and still had leftovers. It was well worth the money. I will be back for sure!
Jason is one of the most rare quality people you find this days.    It takes me 4 yeas to try. Big bone marrow soup and it was worth every day of it..

Not impressed. Over-priced, mediocre food. Big Bone Soup for $18?(That's what you get, lots of bones . . . hardly any meat and veggies)  Lobster Noodle Soup for $50? What????? (1 medium sized lobster over-cooked and tough) Extra bowl of noodle soup for $5? What?????  Garlic Baby Bok Choy dish for $9???? Coconut Ice Cream for $8? (and you can't eat the hard coconut meat). And finally, $35 buys you a well-decorated/garnished Red Snapper deep fried. WTF. We had 4 couples and paid $312 including $36 tip and still had room to eat more.!!!!!!!!. We would have spent less and had a better meal someplace else. Well, live and learn. Not going back. Not recommending.

*EDC WEEK/ LATE REVIEW*

I would've rated this place higher if i haven't called 5-10 minutes before I arrived confirming if they had the bone marrow and was lied to. Considering I was only visiting Vegas and was really looking forward to this meal I am beyond lost for words on how whoever picked up the phone straight up lied to me.

 On Monday after picking up around rental car we decided to go to District One based on the many recommendations we got from friends and online. When we got there, I asked for the big bone soup which they said they didn't have. I was fine with that considering they told me to come earlier on Wednesday (I flew out Wednesday night) cause they are closed on Tuesday. Fine. So we ordered the oxtail fried rice, baby bak choi, garlic serrano wings, pho tai nam and the pho oxtail. All were nothing short of amazing but I reaaaaaaally wanted the bone marrow. 

Fast forward to Wednesday, I call the restaurant to confirm they have it so I don't waste my time and money going there and they don't have, the female who picked up the phone said "they have it at the time of the call but they don't have the lobster" fine I didn't want the lobster anyways. So I call a uber and rush over to district One, ask for the a table for two and then was told they didn't have the big bone pho at all, and didn't have it all day. 

Are you kidding me. I literally rushed over full of joy and left with nothing but hated and a tummy empty of bone marrow :(. It's alright though, I went to Hobak BBQ (review to come) and that was one easily of the best korean meals I've ever had I am still hoping for the next time I come to Vegas they still have this so I can try it :(.

I'm coming back to Vegas in May hopefully it's available then. Will update

I find it rather strange that I've passed this place about a million times but have never tried it.

As of my new year resolution, it's time to end old ways and start off fresh! And that means fresh pho!

At first glance at their menu, their pho a little bit more pricier than most places but the broth seemed to have a little more flavor than other noodle bars that I've previously had before. It's also a little bit more salty for my own tastes, but comes with plenty of meat to fill you up.

I also got to sample their cooked ika (squid) with spicy mayo sauce. It's not bad and has a decently charred crust layer to chewy squid ratio on it. While glancing their appetizer menu, the prices can add up pretty quickly but I'm sure they're a decent discount on their happy hour times. Call me cheap but I just felt for a pho place though, most of the items seemed a little more outside my casual dining-post college grad-hard not life-price range.

The interior is clean and comfortable, but service was slightly slow. Maybe I just came at a bad time? I wouldn't mind stopping by again one day if I'm close by and too lazy to drive elsewhere, but it didn't really seem much to me to be a stand out from the crowd kinda place tbh.

District one felt more like a district three star out of five. But maybe I can try it again later on and have a change of heart?

My friends and I were in town for a convention and being huge pho fans, we decided to make our way to District One. I've actually been here before didn't realize it until I walked the restaurant.

All and all, the outing to District One was a positive one. Staff was super friendly and attentive. We all had a lot of fun trying the different things. There were definitely foods we enjoyed, and then there were things that we were indifferent about.

Sashimi Tacos - I enjoyed them, but there's hardly any fish in them. Also hard to justify the price.

Oxtail Fries - AMAZING. That's it! If you are with a group, get this and share!

Lobster Pho - I am kind of on the fence about this one. Nothing wrong with it. The dish did taste good, but given the price, I felt a little underwhelmed by it. Don't get me wrong, I totally finished every last a bit of it, but my opinion... let's say it like this... If I had to choose the oxtail fries or lobster pho as an entree, I'd go with oxtail fries. I think this dish is a great experience, but I don't see myself getting the lobster pho again.

All and all. A very positive experience. Definitely would like to come back and try some of the other dishes. 4 out of 5 stars. Unique experience. Attentive staff. Mindblowing lobster pho would have propelled my rating to 5 stars. Oxtail fries is a must!

My boyfriend and I absolutely love this place! The location is right in the heart of Chinatown but it doesn't make you feel like it...like you're cramped in a small restaurant, touching elbows with the next couple. It's very spacious - you have options of sitting at the bar, nicely spaced out tables, or booths accommodating large groups. 

We're addicted to pho hence our regular check-ins here! This is one of our favorite spots in town. Pho Tai Nam is my go-to dish to order. The secret is in the broth and it is delicious. My boyfriend, on the other hand, loves to mix it up. He likes the Pork Belly Buns, Hot Pepper Wings, and always has room to devour those Crispy Egg Rolls. I think the Vietnamese Coffee is to die for.

I love Happy Hour! Monday thru Friday 3pm-7pm and Sunday 12am-3am. There are specials on drinks and appetizers.
Oxtail pho and lobster pho were the biggest hits with our large group. Also loved that carpaccio!

I so wish I could've loved this place because I was dying to try it! 
Our server was nice. But the food was ok. Definitely overpriced. We were told the special was razor clams for an appetizer not being told the price, it was 4 bites for $16! Ridiculous! Our check for 2 people with tip and no alcohol was about$100.
Had their pho which was actually tasty, good broth. That oxtail fried rice not only took long to get but was so not worth the wait nor $16! It was super greasy and loaded with tons of fat! Yuck! The pork belly buns were cold and dry. Ugh.....
The spring rolls were different....had some weird crunchy thing in the center and some type of herb that I just did not like. And their peanut sauce was bland. Uhhhhh, no matter what I ordered other than their pho was cold, dry and yuck. Even their chicken wings were over cooked! Not a happy customer. Maybe next time I come I will just have their ice cream, if I there's a next time.

Came here with my cousin and aunt this past weekend while in Vegas and I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious the food was here!

For appetizers, we ordered the Vietnamese beef carpaccio dish and some garlic serrano pepper wings. The carpaccio had this super yummy sauce, which my aunt loved so much she ate it with rice! It wasn't too salty! The chicken wings were BOMB. Nicely crisped and seasoned, these wings had a kick to them! For my main meal, I ordered the pho tai nam, which came out in a pretty big bowl. They were super generous with the meat portion too! The broth was delicious and didn't taste too MSG-y as some of the pho places do in San Jose. My aunt ordered this claypot dish and my cousin ordered the spicy beef noodle soup and both seemed to be enjoying their dishes as well! 

The service was very attentive here although it was pretty busy. Our waiter even boxed up my pho and our other dishes for us to take to go! I am so glad I got to eat some yummy Asian food in Vegas. Most of the time I stay on the strip and most of the Asian restaurants there are terrible. I will definitely be coming back when I'm back in Vegas! :)

I love the atmosphere and decor. 

The food is overall ok. I got the oxtail fries and lobster pho. The oxtail fries is good! The lobster pho is meh. Presentation is beautiful, but the taste is not that great. Lobster was kind of overcooked :/

I'd give it a 3.5! Will see if their other food is better!

This will be my go-to pho place. Broth is made in house and yummy. Lots of basil, asked for more bean sprouts. Didn't care for the ribeye, but I'm willing to bet that was just my preference and it was fine. Decor is trendy, and the place had numerous TVs with ESPN playing. They closed at 3:00, which means they will be open late enough for when I finish my swing shifts. 

The booth was pretty uncomfortable, but not to the point of dinging them a star.
Great Bun Bo Hue, better than most places  in LA.  Seafood was also very fresh.  Great place to eat.  Friendly staff and excellent service.  Will definitely stop by next time I'm in vegas again!

Don't under stand how they sit people and how they heck do they have only big ass tables and if there's only a party of two then your waiting forever for a group to finish eating and then I call to see if I should reserve they said don't need to because it's only a 10 min wait so I get there and nope I am wait for 45 min!! I will say the food was great but I can't say I will be going or recommend!

Best service in Chinatown. The ingredients are of the highest quality and it comes out in the end product.

You have to try the lobster pho!

so far this place has yet to disappoint.  they are known for their bone marrow pho, which I have to to try cause they sell so fast, but their other pho dishes are good. 

it's a little more north than china town, which gives locals a chance to done without so many tourist around.  staff is friendly and have seem to gotten to know my friends and I for coming so often.  

won't disappoint.  check them out!!

So good, fresh, unique. I love the oxtail pho, so flavorful; grilled squid, bok choi & garlic, beef carpaccio, yellowtail sashimi tacos, fresh coconut, coconut ice cream, macha crème brûlée. All amazing.

The food was awesome!  The house oysters were delicious, we ordered a 2nd order.  The bone marrow soup was crazy big and the broth was great to sip on.  The belly buns were a good appetizer.  The carpaccio had a ton of flavor but I thought the slices were too big since it was hard to cut into smaller sizes with just a fork.

Had the lobster pho last time and even though it tasted pretty good it wasn't worth the $50 in Vegas. 

Ordered the shrimp pho, grilled squid, pork belly clay pot and fresh coconut water. 

Pork belly was braised so well and flavorful, delicious! Grilled squid was a good snack with a nice dipping sauce on the side and the shrimp pho was what I need from the long week. Clear broth yet so tasty with everything added in, I like how much lime they gave. Shrimps were the prepackaged supermarket shrimps though. Still good! Gave like 10 shrimps :) . 

Coconut water was great! Hydrate yourself in that 116 degree weather. Will come back on my next visit to Vegas!

I love this place. They have the best bo luc lac! It's to tasty and flavorful and was quickly eaten! We order that, the giant beef bone marrow, the chicken clay pot, cornish hen with rice, and a few other dishes. The oysters on ice with caviar, soy sauce, and a thin slice of jalapeno was a big hit. It was delicious and quickly devoured. Everyone there was so friendly and service was very fast. I'd definitely go back here when I'm in town again =)

Very nice professional service. Ordered the shaken beef rice plate entree and short ribs rice plate entree, both are delicious. The flavor is bold and flavorful. Would recommend anyone visiting Vegas and craved for a good rice plate meal. They also have a full bar here.
First time try out the Lobster pho noodle, whole lobster served, pretty good. Nice and friendly service. Try it out if in Vegas.

If you come here, order the lobster pho...a must try!!  Yes, it is the most expenisve thing on the menu, but it was well worth it.  I am usually not a big lobster fan, I prefer shrimp over lobster, but the pho and the broth made the lobster stay juicy.  It was a dish to share!!  The pho and broth were very good, clean and the noodles melted with ease.   I would come back to order this again.

We also order the fish tacos, which I thought was okay.  The shell overpowered the fish alittle bit so was hard to taste the fish iteself.  We also got the oxtail fried rice which was good but alittle too greasy for me.  

The service was on point - they were friendly and checked back here and there.  They also changed the TV station for us without hesitation - wanted to watch the basketball playoffs.  The noise level is alittle high due to the TV and more of a sports bar atmosphere.

Fusion Asian food in a sports bar type setting.  Ambiance is chill, slow, and great for guys night out or just any hangout.  Fun names for cocktails and unique combinations.  
food sounds innovative....lobster pho sounds luxurious..

shared cubed sashimi tacos in a fried wonton like shell.  it was light and good way to start.  Also got the combo rice plate with korean short ribs, over easy fried egg, chinese sausages, and veges with side of fish sauce.

Ok everyone......when I FINALLY got my bowl of Pho, it tasted great.  So did the spring roll. The price was also reasonable. This review is more about the marginal service and snooty/snotty attitudes of all the staff which is a deal breaker in my book.  2 of us got our Pho 30 min after everyone else at the table. I should have known this was going to happen because the dimwit waitress was STRUGGLING to take our order on the fancy iPad. Then she made up some lame excuse about they ran out of broth and it needed to be heated up. Blah blah blah........save it already.  
And finally some stripper chick walked in the place, exposing her side boob to all in attendance.  I, and my family, can't unsee that.

I've heard amazing things about District 1 since I have moved away. Everyone always raves about the amazing food and service here so I was very excited to come here. 

I didn't get a chance to order and explore the menu when I came here for my first visit but I had ordered the oxtail pho and vietnamese coffee. I was very impressed with the flavor of the broth of the pho and the portion size! They are very generous with the meat here and the oxtail was very tender and fall off the bone goodness. 

I know the bone soup and lobster pho is a huge hit here. I am looking forward to coming back here to try the rest of the menu.

TRUST ME when I say there aren't many good pho places to eat in Las Vegas. I lived there for 6 years and am very particular about my pho. If you are visiting from out of town this would be the place to try!

A fun and modern pho place to grab a bit for lunch and dinner. Prices are higher than typical pho places but It's only a few bucks, which is okay considering the nice decor. 

I like the spring rolls here. For 7 bucks you get two large rolls each cut into four pieces. The fried rice here is very good also!

Yummy fusion food! I was sad that they were 86ed on calamari!! But we will definitely be back to get it! Out coconut water was amazing! Special my coconut Mojito!! The food was inconsistent though! We ordered papaya twice because it was so good! The first one disappeared fast! The second one was dry and tasteless we ended up sending it back and getting it to go. It took so long! The other food is definitely worth coming back for! Until next time!!

I'm a recent Las Vegas transplant and I was looking for a good place for Pho. I came to Yelp since I'm not familiar with restaurants yet and saw all the good reviews and comments about District One, so I decided to try this place. I was greeted warmly and was given the option of booth, table or bar since it was just myself. The waitress asked if I wanted to see the specials and took my drink order. The specials were actually on a small chalkboard which she kept propt up on the seat at the next table for me.  Since I did come for Pho, I got the Pho Tai (ribeye) and the Surf Clams which were a daily special.

The Pho came out first, and in a much larger bowl than I've had in the past. You do get your money's worth for 7.99! No limes available, but the lemon gave it its own interesting flavor. I've only known Pho from the East Coast, and it pales in comparison to this bowl of heaven. Even the noodles were far better. The surf clam came out on its shell, with some garnishes and hot sauce. I'm not certain of the spice because I didn't ask, but it certainly packs a whallop. If you do not deal with spicy foods, I would suggest avoiding this (unfortunately.)

During dinner, three people came over to help. I'm not sure if it's an LV thing or not, but it felt like there isn't one person assigned to a table but rather everyone helps out. That's why I have the place 5 instead of just 4 stars. You help each other out, you help the customer out. Cheers.

This place is still a staple that we visit everytime we come to vegas. The oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice are the top 2 dishes that we order.  The spicy hue noodles is decent as well but sometimes they bring the bowl with a lot of oil floating at the top of the bowl.  Probably best to ask them to try avoid getting so much oil in the bowl

When in Vegas the BF & I usually go here Saturday mornings after fun Friday nights at a club. Hydrate with the fresh coconut water and beat that hangover with some pho! The pork baos are pretty yummy! And you get more servings than at momofuku. 
It's a nice, chill restaurant off the strip for pho, and Vietnamese coffee.

Came here two days in a row!

I have a soft spot for the pho with rib eye.  My goodness, melts in your mouth.  The cornish hen, the pork chop, everything I've had is spot on.

You can't go wrong here.  The servers are so nice, the prices are really low, I'm coming back.  Plus they have ice coffee... I'm sold!
Lobster pho was 50.00 not worth 50. Pay 15bucks more and goto Ceasars seafood buffet instead.

A friend and I happened upon this place when trying to find another. We decided to stay and luckily enjoyed excellent service. We had oysters and calamari for appetizers which was phenomenal. The oyster toppings were exquisite! I ordered the oxtail pho and requested it a bit spicy. All I can say is DELICIOUS! It had me craving pho for days after we left. We both ordered specialty drinks which weren't much to rave about. I definitely recommend giving the food a try, you'll be hooked.

Great food....great service...no wait for a table on Valentine Day. The fried red snapper with sweet & sour sauce was so yummy. 
Thank you guys!
This place is more a westernized version of Vietnamese. Double down was good and the Mekong noodle soup had good flavor and generous portons. Do not get the papaya salad. Tasted a d smelled rancid.

This places really sucks the worst place I been to in Vegas. They don't have half the food in their menu the food takes like 45 min to come out. I don't know why the pho takes over 50 min to come out when you just add soup and make the noodle.  I would never come again

We went yesterday for lunch. The vibe was great, reminded me a little of the boiling crab. The food was so and so. There's certain things that tasted better than others. We had both the steamed and fried pork belly buns, good... But I've had better. Their garlic noodles smelled so great but lacked a little flavor. My favorite dishes were definitely the fish tacos! Add a little hot sauce and it was amazing. They also stir fried crab in a black bean sauce for us, it wasn't on the menu but we had seen something similiar on their Yelp and had asked for it, nonetheless they delivered. A+ for accommodation! Great service, friendly, clean, and food came out in a timely matter.

One of the best asian fusion restaurants I have ever tried--top notch food, service, and ambiance! I've heard so many good things about this place and now I can finally say I've tried it. This restaurant is unlike any other pho restaurant you expect it to be. In fact, upon arrival, you are nicely greeted by a host and directed to your seat within seconds (this could have also been due to the fact that we dropped in early for dinner). The lighting inside the restaurant is dim and the comes equipped with a bar and cushioned table booths as well! District 1 definitely puts a modern twist to the typical pho restaurant. Here is a list of what we ordered:

-Hot Jasmine Tea: Not too pungent, not too bland. Perfect for a cold winter night or if you are sick.
-Grilled Squid Appetizer: Very flavorful and huge portions! Perfect amount of chewiness and flavor. Comes with a full squid (size of two hands); tentacles included!
-Pork Belly Steamed Bun Sliders: So yummy! I wish there was more. They offer two different kinds of buns--crispy or steamed. We opted for the steamed and it was magnificent. Comes with three sliders. Pork belly was flavorful and melted in your mouth. They also have an option to add one more slider if you are planning to share this dish amongst an even number of people.
-Oxtail Pho: Very plain, but still very good. The broth for me was a bit too salty, but the oxtail melted right off the bone. The chunks are gigantic, but the texture of the oxtail makes it super easy to eat.
-Shigoku Oysters: this was a special the time we went. Raw oysters from Washington. Each oyster is $3.50. Man oh man were these oysters goooooood! The sauce they put on top of the oysters were spot on. It left me wanting more!

The service was also top notch! They even offered free beer flights of a new beer they were trying to promote when we were dining. We didn't taste it, but it was a very sweet gesture! Will I come here again? YES YES YES! I can't wait to try all the other options on the menu!

Came here on a recommendation of my cousin so we took her here for her birthday. This is located is the Chinatown (Asian area) of Las Vegas so you're going to have to drive out of the tourist-ridden strip. 

I ordered the grilled squid which was way overcooked and chewy so I can't recommend that dish. However, I told my waiter and he gladly sent it back and I ordered what I originally wanted: District One Rice Combo Platter with Short Ribs & fish sauce. Absolutely delish!

This place is unpretentious and serves really good food at reasonable prices. We had a Filipino server and he was personable and funny. Great location among many other Asian restaurants and worth the extra miles to get there. Very hip, good food. Go explore! :)

Great food, service is quick and food is great! They also have speciality drinks that are awesome at the bar. Very casual, great place to come for even appetizers and drinks. Kid friendly. Desserts are yum!

My friends and I went to District One for the first time last week while in Vegas. 
I was the one that suggested it but all my friends loved it after trying the food. I could not get over how delicious the oxtail fries were. And for my entree I ordered the lobster pho that yelpers were raving about, the lobster was cooked just perfect. 
We all ordered something different to share and everything was phenomenal. 
I am not a dessert person but the coconut dessert was amazing. It wasn't too sweet, but sweet enough to cure your sweet tooth. Something about that coconut dessert, once you start you can't stop.... Until you realize it's gone!

Came here on 2 occasions: Dinner and Happy hour 4-7PM
A) for dinner- def recommend for their regular menu. Great scene 
Veggie pho- delicious for being all veggies
House oysters- during dinner- Super pricey and not very tasty- btw the 3 of us we ordered 12 and there was a HAIR in one of the oysters which threw our appetite out of the way for the oysters so we didnt even eat them
Shaken beef salad- delicious deep fried beef- very flavorful and DEF recommend 
Notifications stout- Deep and chocolately
Shrimp Bloody Mary- see attached pics- so much stuff inside but not very strong

LOBSTER PHO or lobster fried rice is supposedly the thing to try here: didnt try in- because it is 45$ per order for approximately a 1.5lb lobster


Happy hour: see attached pics- drinks and food (Friday Afternoon)
DEF NOT RECOMMENDED FOR HAPPY HOUR- the food was terrible and not I understand why this place wasnt more busy for happy hour especially with such a nice venue and space. But after eating, my hubby and I both said this place probably had the worst happy hour ever. We actually left feeling unhappy. 
- kronenboug blanc-witbeir: Great beer- Def recommended
- Dogfish Head - Seaquencg Ale- Sour sour sour beer, not for all
-Oysters 1.00 a piece- THEY LOOKED SUPER SUPER OLD and dried out. I returned my first order of 6, just to have them bring me a set of oysters (which looked like the ones i just sent back) that were old and dried out and stuck to the shell because they looked like they had been previously shucked and just sitting in the fridge- They also tasted old (not juicy, not salty with the brine from the inside of the shell)- Worst worst oysters I have ever ordered and I cant believe i didnt get sick after trying one 
- Serrano fried chicken wings: regular deep fried wings- no flavor at all. When they say serrano fried chicken, I was expecting a sauce that would make the wings more flavorful. But the serrano chiles looked like they were fried in oil with garlic and then just pour with oil over the wings- DEF NOT RECOMMENDED- order came with 6 and my husband and I couldnt even finish the order- and we love chicken wings
- deep fried and regular pork buns: DEF recommended and you can get one of each since the order comes with 2 buns

Overall: happy hour was super disappointing but the dinner menu is more promising
4 stars for dinner menu and 1 star for happy hour

Not sure if ill be back except for the veggie pho

Ordered the Steak and Eggs, where the rice was stale, the steak was cold, and the eggs were likely bad. Woke up a few hours later to severe food poisoning that left me throwing up, nauseated, feverish, and aching. Never again

This place is truly some of the best fusion of American and Vietnamese fusion food I've ever had. Located about fifteen minutes from the vegas strip, district one is superb at bringing intense flavors to each customers dish.

Some of the dishes they are known for are the oxtail fried rice, the oxtail pho, the Mekong soup ( I believe it's made with beef, shrimp, fish balls, and pork. Also there known for the Grilled squid and the fish tacos. So when my wife and I took out friend there we offered half the menu, Lol...with no regrets. We had to eat the oxtail fried rice, pork buns, grilled squid and a few other entrees. 

The oxtail fried rice was a bit salty but very unique in texture and taste. We enjoyed it and would definite try it again. The grilled squid had ok it had a few to much of a burnt taste to it and I couldn't enjoy it like I thought I could. The fish tacos we ordered didn't come with soft tacos like I was hoping they would. They were very small in size and reminded me of fried wontons. Although the fish was very small the fresh vegetables on it had great flavor and was refreshing for my tastebuds. 

All in all we were satisfied with our good and the staff is very nice and attentive here. They provided excellent customer service and had no problem helping us with our orders and offer us their sound advice about dishes.

Overall we had about six dishes and our bill was about seventy dollars and that's before the tip. The serving sizes are decent and filling. Another great aspect about this location is that there open from 11am- 3pm everyday. That's definitely great when you wanna late night meal and don't wanna deal with the crowds.

There are so many options to try in Las Vegas.  Somehow I ended here to try their massive big bone soup.  It was a great experience to try to finish the bowl, which I failed.  The best part is the richness of soup flavor.  It is one of the best soup I had.  

I surprise hit was the spicy soup.  I am going to talk my family to go back to this restaurant before we end the vacation to go back to the east coast.  

If you are visiting Las Vegas, I strongly recommend you try District One.

Wooosh!! Out with the old in with the new. Out of the ashes of one of my favorite crab eating joints in the city a new restaurant is born, to replace what was once the Cravin Cajun. I've been through many of meals devouring king crab legs in what once was until one solemn day I pulled on the door only to find out it would not open no more, the Cravin Cajun was no more...

What can come next?? In my small world I would wonder who would fill that void and that space?? Until once day upon one of my travels up Jones I looked up and saw the sign...and it read "District One"......huh what is this I asked myself....who has replaced Cravin Cajun?!? Vietnamese fusion with flair? Has this been done before? Beyond Phô? I thought to myself "I MUST TRY THIS".

I tossed and turned over the loss of Cravin Cajun and waited before trying District One as if it would be a sin, I couldn't disrespect the nonexistent King Crab gods, NO I MUSN'T I would cry out, until one day after reading numerous reviews from fellow yeeps on District One I decided it was time to stop mourning and move on. If other people can get over it then I can to!! So myself and Ellen F. went there for lunch and oh it was good...

I wasn't ready to try the King Crab legs so I ordered their 5 Spice Cornish Hen with a side of the famed Oxtail Fries. I was tempted to try their Phô Ga but why when you can have it at a ton of  places down Spring Mountain (the pictures looked good btw) , let's live a little!!

I very much enjoyed the roasted hen, seasoning was good, rice was equally delicious. The oxtail fries were off the heezy! Whatever the hell sauce it is it is damn bueno. The service was fantastic, I had different servers come up to my table multiple times to ensure the lunch feast was coming along smoothly and that I had an ample amount of water to wash down this Vietnamese fusion. 

I actually regretted not trying the crab legs and other interesting sounding menu selections but due to my time constraints (1 hour) and limited freedom regarding lunch (little thing called work, yuck!) I could not. Next time though!!! As I will be coming back. Oh and the prices are more than reasonable, if you haven't tried it yet it's a must among Chinatown revelers.
They have the best whole fried fish. You have to try it. Their oxtail fried rice and fish tacos are also on point. If you love authentic Asian food then this is the place.

How did Southeast Asian cuisine become so extraordinary? District one nailed it for me. The decor is inviting and friendly which is always a good sign. The menu selection is overwhelming with the array of choices. Where do I even start? They have snails, lobster, ox tail, and even oysters! They bring out the chart of specials and we decided to get the black peppered lobster, surf n turf pho, and the snails. Snails can be done in a few different styles and we picked the spicy Thai chili. It was such a delight. The flavor of lemongrass and chili and spice combined well. Take it from someone who does not enjoy spicy food as much. I'm a weak one but I sucked it up for this particular dish. The black peppered lobster was my favorite and the noodles were wonderful. We actually didn't realize the dish came with noodles until it came out. The server are really sweet but I felt like our particular server was so so. The music playing was nice but the speakers were directly at our table which made it difficult for him to hear what I was saying. The last thing we had was the coconut ice cream. It is served onto of a coconut shell with real coconut. It was a great treat. Overall, it was a great experience and I am definitely coming back!

4 stars is what this place averages and rightly so. With quite a few traditional Asian restaurants in this center and across the street this place offers traditional Asian dishes with a twist. 

Had the oxtail fried rice - excellent. A bit greasy, but it's OXTAIL!

Chicken wings - meh......could use a little kick of something either spicy or sweet, they were just kind of there 

Bao - good, missing something to stand out and knock you off your seat, but good

Bone marrow soup - good. Wife thought it was too salty, I thought it was right. Like the fatty tendon and meat you can pick off. Fun and different.

Service was great. Didn't catch her name but she was very active, filled up water constantly (any foodie knows Asain restaurants usually get an F- on this) but she was great! Helped us pack up our take home and did it all with a smile.

Cost wise it was fair. Chicken wings were a bit expensive for what you got, fried rice was well worth the 8 bucks and the soup and bao were fair.

More than anything this place can clean your standard Asain food palette with something different. Will come back and order the fried rice and soup.

Outstanding service by the bartender ! Ate alone at the bar, had a speciality Bloody Mary & took the recommendations of the bartender for food selection. I had pork belly bao & crispy wings for appetizers, wings were outstanding & bao was pretty good. Then I had the oxtail fried rice, very good large portion, full of meat & veggies. 
Trendy Asian fusion, good food & excellent service, I recommend.

The first place I want to go to when I'm craving some good pho.. Not even just any pho..  oxtail and lobster pho for very reasonable prices! The oysters and pork belly are also amazing. 
I also love how spacious and clean  the restaurant is.. 

District is now my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas!!

- very good and quick service
- depending on what you order the portions can be a good size.
- ordered a few different items with my group and everything tasted very good. 
- prices are fair

Total Hipster Pho spot. Loved the interior and food is Delicious!!!!!!!!!! Oxtail heaven  My fiancé and I shared the oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice is. We got a side of the oxtail locomoco gravy and mixed with our fried rice and I almost cried, burst of flavor! Definitely will be back!!

Well the food was good and the atmosphere was cool BUT when the meal came to an end I was incredibly light headed and my gums were numb. I knew immediately it was due to MSG in the food, I'm sensitive to it and can tell almost instantly when I've consumed a decent amount. We stopped the waiter to ask and he admitted that the do use a lot of MSG. I wouldn't mind so much if it was written on the menu so that I would have had the choice to avoid it. I'm sure the reason the food tastes so good is bc it is altered so much with MSG.....if you're sensitive to it, or prefer not to consume it....this place wouldn't be my first choice.
The best oxtail fried rice!!!! I cant fins anything comparable in orange county. Not only they do not skimp on the oxtail meat, their fried rice is very tasty and full of flavor.

I came here for lunch with a friend based on fellow yelper reviews.

The place was quite nice, and service was good. We had the belly buns, pho, and the oxtail fries. The food was great and reasonably priced. I would come back for sure.

The food here was great and waiters were very friendly. The broth for the big bone was so good. We also order the surf and turf pho and that was ok, not worth $35 but it did taste great. The big bone was 17$ and you can add the noodle for $2 more. The location based off value is not amazing since it's considered a high end viet location, however the food is amazing and I do recommend you to try it when you stop by Vegas. You won't regret it!

I love how District One isn't just a pho/Vietnamese restaurant. Very extensive menu that will suit anyone's craving. They also got a long list of specials too. 

Parking, like most plazas in Chinatown is small and compact. We kinda had to stalk a few people to find spots. My friends and I were here on a Saturday evening...pretty close to prime time dinner hours and didn't have to wait for a table. Place was busy too. Our waitress was attentive and kept our drinks filled. I wouldn't say the food were over-priced but it's definitely not your typical "Asian prices." Visitors from So Cal MIGHT get a sticker shock since we are so used to $6.50 pho and $8.99 HK café rice plates. 

We ordered egg rolls ($6.99), two bowls of chicken pho ($9.99 each) and one of their specials; oxtail loco moco ($9.99 I think.). Everyone was pleased with their dish. Food came out pippin hot....that's always important to me. I would love to come back again and try other entrees.

Busy place on a sunday. Place was pack. First time try sea snail and It was actually good with Thai flavor. Raw oyster so fresh, sauce is a bomb, you definietly try it .They also had ox bone soup with giant bone ever and it was delicious. Definitely will be back when I'm in town. Service was great and fast. we feel like home ( Sai Gon ) when we came to your restaurant.

Came here last night with my family as recommended by my parents. The parking lot in ehich the area was located was a little packed, but we found a spot within minutes. A little quiet for a Saturday night, a few people at the bar and some tables filled so we were seated right away. The menu had variety of choices, as far as the drink goes. I had the Coconut Mojito, my brother got the Donkey (i think? it's a Russian Mule type of drink) and my mom got the Mango Daquiri. According to them, their drinks was nice and strong. The presentation that came with my Coconut Mojito was impressive. It came with actual coconut and they even brought me the left over coconut milk. 

Appetizer: We ordered the Oxtail Fries and calamari. I'd give that a 4.5/5. The fries were nice and crispy. It came with oxtail meat and fried egg. I never would've guessed how good this combination was, but man it was delicious! The calamari was good, but it wasn't anything special. 

Main Course: I ordered the Bird nest crispy noodles. I was a little bit iffy with the price ($14.99) but when they served it, I was blown away with how big it was. It could easily serve 3-4. The sauce was really good, they went quite a bit overboard so I give that a 3.5/5. My fiancè ordered the Steaks and Egg. The tomato rice it came with was tasty and the steak was a bit sweet, but full of flavor. Needless to say, he licked his plate clean.

Initially I was going to try Pho Basa last week, however they were closed for the day.  Lucky for me, District One was open and YELP suggested I go there.  Okay!

We arrive and the servers are friendly and seat us fairly quickly.  We're told it's happy hour and that's just awesome.  

Being an Asian Fusion restaurant, their menu items all intrigued me.

I tried the Yellowtail fish tacos off their HH menu and OMG these were amazing.    Though appearing quite small when they serve the two tacos to you, the flavor of the yellowtail, avocado, cilantro, cherry tomato, and lime was out of this world.   I wanted to get 2 more orders of these.. but alas, I had to try other things.

The shrimp papaya salad was good.   It would have been great if it came with those flat shrimp chips that I've been used to back in Chicago.   Something to balance out the tanginess of the dish.

They must really know how to make very good pork belly because we ordered it two ways and both dishes were fantastic.  The pork belly in the steamed buns were yummy, bite size treats.  The other dish, Slow-Braised Pork Belly in young coconut juice was just so soft and tender and it came sitting in the sauce w/ a boiled egg as well.  


There were plenty more unique offerings to try and they also offered a variety of Pho/Soups on the menu.  One thing I'll come back to try some time is their Lobster Pho.  I keep hearing about it and I want it!

Our experience here was good.  The service was fast.  And the food was delicious!  5/5.

Came here for the lobster pho. For $49, we got chicken both with a small lobster that came with 4 pieces of lobster meat. They even gave us small portions on the noodles. The service was okay. Also, ordered Vietnamese coffee which was not made before hand. We have to wait an extra 15 minutes at our table and MAKE our drinks. Very disappointed in this place overall. I won't come back.
OMG!  I love their Oxtail fries and Loco Moco.  Enough said.

Expensive pho I paid nearly $40 for the lobster pho. Was it worth it? Not really I mean the soup base was good, but I know I won't be going back for a $40 pho it's good for experience I guess. We also got kim chi fried rice now that was good
What can it be better then a whole lobster in a Pho? It's off the strip but still always busy. A hot noodle soup after drinking is always nice.

Every time I go to Vegas I stop by here about two to three time before I when home ... Food is very good ... A little salty but I know why they wanted you to drink more. The food range from French to Vietnam with an American twist I quess  that is why they call it fusion. You must try all the dish and pick your favorite as for me the wings and service is the reason why I come back every time ... All my friends love the fish Tacos
Food was amazing!!! I had never had a pho broth as good as this place! Taste just like home made.

My boyfriend and I came here because I had this place bookmarked for the longest and it also has high reviews. So we decided to finally try this place out. 

We ordered the pork buns and "large" shrimp skewer for appetizers. For the entree, we ordered the bun bo hue and pho tai nam. 

Pros- food tasted good 

Cons- the waitress was unattentive and slow
No urgency 
Service was suuuuuper slow 
Portions are small 

Overall the experience at District One with its service and small portions overshadowed its food and quality. I think I'll stick to the traditional pho restaurants.
At my favorite place to eat pho but it doesn't matter what u order here everything is delicious. The service is great and the ambiance is good.
So good. The service the food. Everything so good. Late night spot found to soak up alcohol

You know Chef Kai knows whats up when you see the whole lobster in the pho!!!!  All that flavor from the lobster shell makes the broth even more rich and flavorful!  Our friends came to town so we brought them in for the lobster pho, big bone soup, and the coconut ice cream.  They have never been to a pho restaurant with such a hip concept nor a full bar! Hennessy with your pho?? WHY NOT??? when in Vegas... don't miss out!!

I think they have a lot of good food aside from what I ordered with my friends. Of course, we came here for the lobster pho! We ordered two different ones that they offered (one was lobster and beef pho, and the other was just lobster pho) and an oxtail fried rice. Surprisingly, I actually like the oxtail fried rice more.

I didn't like the lobster pho as much because I expected the broth to have some lobster or seafood taste to it. It was a good base for regular pho, but not good enough for lobster pho. I wish there was more seafood/freshness in its broth. It just felt like they boiled the lobster and placed it into the pho--meh. Disappointed. BUT THE OXTAIL FRIED RICE! AHH! It was really good. They definitely did a good job with that--please do yourself a favor and order that okay? Yes.

I like the way this place is set up and the staffs are super nice. As I was walking out of here, I saw many interesting dishes that people ordered. When I come back to Vegas, I definitely would LOVE to come back here! Eating the lobster pho once is enough, after all it's MP and with was $50 at the time of our purchase. Not worth $50!

The service and food is always good when I come here. The Oxtail Fries and Belly Buns are good appetizers! I always get the Oxtail Pho, which never disappoints. Getting the meat from the oxtail can get a little messy, but at least it's interactive. The Vietnamese Donkey and Coconut Mojito are excellent! Parking can be and issue sometimes, especially for dinner. You have been warned.

I like the atmosphere of the restaurant.  We went at a busy time but felt like we weren't attend to that much at all it took forever for us to put in our order and getting our check.  We had to chase down one of the bussers and even after that we still waited another 15 mins after already waiting 20 minutes for our check.  We order the big bone and lobster pho which are amazing.  Also we order the garlic Serrano chicken it was pretty good and the papaya salad that was OK I just like the shrimp.  I thought it was a different type of papaya salad so I didn't enjoy too much.  It's a little on the sour side for me.

Service is impeccable! Oxtail fried are delicious. Oxtail pho is absolutely amazing. Oysters on the half shell are fresh tasting and meaty. I love this place and am happy it is so nearby. Will be a frequent customer for sure!
Friendly staff.  Limited vegan options.  No veggie broth for hubs.  My spicy beef soup was ok, not great.  10% off for hour wait because told 20 minutes.  My fault for not getting details about food.

Heard good things about this place so me and the wifey with a couple friends decided on a whim to come here at 10 pm on a tuesday night. Good to know they are open everyday from 11 am to 3 am. 

After going over the menu, everything looked good on paper. I went with the Oxtail Fried Rice and Edamame. Wifey went with the Grilled Squid. Our friends got the Fish Tacos and Bone Marrow soup.

For the appetizers the Edamame was lightly grilled and sprinkled with sea salt. Taste was just ordinary. As for the Fish Tacos they give 3 little taco shells that look and taste kind of like deep fried won tons. The actual fish (which was not much) was yellow tail.

The Oxtail Fried Rice was very salty. I think they put too much soy sauce. I could only eat about 3 spoonfuls. That's too bad because tastewise, I dont think it needed that much salt.

The Grilled Squid was on point. Nicely seasoned and grilled. The spicy garlic aioli sauce that it comes with complemented it very well.

The Bone Marrow soup comes with a huge bone. Literally. Im not into that so I cant really say if I liked it or not.

Service was great. We never had to ask for refills on our waters especially me because of the excess salt that I had eaten.

Overall, the total tab was around 70 bucks including tip. In my opinion, the food is great with the exception of the Oxtail Fried Rice. I think the pricing is bit much based on the portions you get. The Beef Carpaccio was recommended by my Yelp friends after seeing my check-in here. Im sure I will find myself in the area next time so a second visit will be pending.

Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #190

Boyfriend and I were in Vegas for the week visiting from Canada! We heard about this place from Facebook and a bunch of friends did recommend us to check District out.
My boyfriend and I have a food blog so our trip to Vegas was mainly for the food!
We enjoyed the atmosphere, service and food very much.
We ordered the lobster pho because we saw a couple of videos on Facebook about it... We knew we had to try it.

It was good and I understand why it was $50, but I wish there was a bit more pho noodle in it. Overall it was tasty and beautifully presented.

We also ordered the baos; both steamed and deep fried.. Delicious and beautifully presented as well!

We will definitely come back to District One the next time we're in Vegas!

Thank you for the wonderful experience! Great fusion dishes! We will definitely recommend it to our friends and blog followers.

I have tried many Pho places in town. This happens to be my favorite now. The soup is very clean taste so fresh. The seafood selection is amazing as well. Each time we go we try something new and it just gets better.

Where do I even start?

My family made me pick the dinner spot - I am always looking for something new (to me) and with some adventure.  Yelp it is - Yelp delivers again!

Typical Chinatown stripmall - check.  Non-typical entry and ambiance.  Man, they could serve burgers in this place and be poppin - well done to the interior setup and decorations!

Happy Hour.  Til 7pm.  Nice.

Tried the ENTIRE Happy Hour menu.  Superb.  Oysters??  Top 3 in town.  Crazy.  

Pork Belly Buns - bam.  Yellowtail Fish Tacos - Bam.  Asian Beef Carpaccio - BAAAAM (unreal - must must order - doesn't matter what you eat.  Get this.).  And for good measure - awesome cocktails and lots of cool drafts.

Great service from Aaron and the owner; attentive.

Will. Be. Back... Lots.

Go.

Now.

I have a new favorite. I get new favorites often but I'm pretty sure this one will last a while. This joint has a chill decor that makes you want to hang out. The staff is knowledgeable and on the ball. The menu is creative and so freakin full of tasty offerings. The bar menu is the best I've ever seen. I have had their house special oysters which are now my fave of all time. Try those wings. Dank. Green papaya salad was refreshing and spicy at the same time. Omg. The oxtail fried rice is legit! 8 treasure noodles were exploding with flavor. I will be here OFTEN! BONUS HAPPY HOUR MENU! Can't wait to try that out. Don't pass this place up. Oh and CLEAN! Just do yourself a favor and go.

Been wanting to come here for awhile, but it is always packed and I don't like waiting.  We got lucky today, with no wait...  

Excellent Service!!! Great Food!!!! Good Portions!!!!  Will be back for sure.... now I know it's definitely worth the wait!!!!

I was very dissatisfied  with my first visit to this restaurant. I saw some nice pictures from friends and I wanted to experience the same. Early in the afternoon they had run out of two popular dishes (big bone soup and lobster pho) as well as their coconut ice cream. I know certain dishes in restaurants do run out due to popular demand but in those cases I would expect the staff to at least suggest alternative dishes. They didn't even do that or show much empathy to the fact that I was disappointed that they didn't have what I wanted. This staff lacks customer service and pride for their food and restaurant. What I got was a waitress that alternated with another waiter while they clearly displayed a miscommunication of service. At the beginning these two made them selves available to take our order at different times when we had already given our order to one of them. Then they alternated breaking the news of the dishes they ran out of. In my opinion one unavailable dish is permissible , two is cause for concern, and three means they may need to fire their purchaser. They have good product but the business is amateur. My visit was 1/3/15

Im a very picky person when it comes to food, so I stick to what I know. 

But it's a really good spot to eat after a night of partying...

You cant go wrong with the Oxtail pho, oxtail chili cheese fries, and the steak and eggs.

5/28/17: DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU HAVE A BIG PARTY.  We had a party of 14 people.  The manager told us it would be a 45 minute wait.  We waited the 45 minutes and the manager told us it would be another 30 minutes if we wanted to be seated altogether.  He then seated half of our party and proceeded to tell us it would be another 30 minutes for the other half of our party.  

The manager  blamed us and said that we should have been waiting inside (even though we were inside) to talk to him and that if we wanted to split our party WE should have told him, however, he did not give us this option when we first put our name down.  All while this was happening, the hostess was seating other parties that had come after us.  

However this is all beside the point.  We were quoted a wait time of 45 minutes and there was no communication from the manager about the extended wait time.  The manager also did not even attempt to try to accommodate for our party.  

Very disappointed in the lack of communication from the manager, as well as, how rudely the manager treated us.

New fave place! I am Viet and was skeptical about spending more money on Viet fusion food but this place was awesome! Went here twice in the same weekend. Once at 1:30am in the morning and again during regular lunch hours. Love that its unlike most Viet restaurants where you just eat and leave. Here you can linger. Both visits food was solid. 

Eats:
- lobster pho: $29.99 for a approx. 1.5lbs of fresh lobster in a bowl/platter of pho. This is a steal!
- bone marrow soup: flintstone-size bones in broth. More than one person can eat so share!
- steak and eggs: hubby gulped this down before i could taste but looked yummy
- beef carpaccio: awesome flavor and texture. Eat!
- scallop sashimi: fresh and amazing flavor served w/ crunchy scallop skin. Woah!
- pho tai rib eye: awesome broth really developed. 
- rice combo platter w/ pork chop, short ribs, and chinese sausage w/ kimchi and fried egg. Loved the kimchi variant and that my egg oozed yolk

Aside from the food, whats best about this place is that you can lounge since its set up to rival any sports bar w/ comfortable seating and enough tvs to watch all the games at once. Take your sports bar loving hubby!

I've never seen lobster ramen before. This was the real deal. There was a huge lobster inside the bowl. It was 30 bucks and for good reason. This place is beautifully built as well. We came with a large party and they were able to accommodate 30 hungover guys. I had the pho tai. Everyone got something different. Only one person ordered the Lobster pho. It looks crazy. This is the must order item when you come. Instagram worthy photo haha. 

Recommendation: Lobster pho

Worth it! Food was amazing, flavors were great, portion sizes was just right. Had the Oxtail Pho. Daughter had Rice Combo Platter w/ Short Ribs. Fiancee had Claypot Chicken. 
Oxtail: meat was so soft and tender,  you could suck the meat & gelatinous goodness off the bone easily. broth was flavorful and def fresh tasting. 
Claypot: I was a little apprehensive that it would taste just like one thing.  But, it was done well, you can taste the components separately. Sauce wasn't over bearing to the rest of it. Although it doesn't say it on the menu, this does come with rice.
Rice Combo: was tasty! Love eggs with Asian food. When you layer your bite with meat the Viet pickled carrot n daikon to use as a sponge for the fish sauce - yummy! 
Definitely will visit this place again.... For sure will try the oxtail fries next time.

One word. OYSTERS. Seriously, whatever they put on them is sooooo good. This place is not your typical Vietnamese restaurant. It's very modern interior and menu make this place stand out compared to the other places I've been. Their bird's nest chow-mein is another must-try. The way they plate their dishes is super cute and the service very attentive.

This restaurant has bomb oxtail fried rice! Their pho is also good but the main thing I usually go to district one is for their oxtail fried rice. They have nice servers, they're younger so people should come them some slack. They're always nice and see them working hard. Anyway, they have a good bar as well. And this decor is hipster style so it's definitely trendy. Come check this place out, definitely won't be disappointed

Found out about this place from Chef's Night Out a segment from Munchies on Youtube. District One is known for it's lobster pho that goes for marketplace value of $50.00. We made reservations for 11:15am and realized we're coming in right when they opened so we really didn't need a reservation. The interior is very hip and modern looking with our hostess being very friendly and our waiter being informative funny and very attentive to our needs. What i liked when we ordered was that our waiter asked if we will need separate bills which is great as we don't have to bug the waiter/waitress if we can all have separate bills at the end of our meal so we divided our group into two to get 2 separate checks (to make it easier for our server). 

I ordered the specialty ox tail loco moco after seeing it on yelp. The dish was very rich and heavy; it came with plenty of ox tail and the egg was cooked perfectly sunny side up however it did not come with a meat patty like normal loco moco and may have helped with the richness of the dish. The Ox tail fried rice is what i should have ordered as it was balanced in flavor and would be good if it came with little side dishes (like korean style banchan). My friend complimented on how good the Bun Bo hue and big bone marrow soup was.

The Lobster pho is basically pho that comes with a whole lobster. I must say that this dish is all hype imo. The broth is not infused with lobster it's just regular pho nothing to special about it. The lobster itself was over cooked to a rubbery chewy meat; though it looks amazing in photos and video it is what it is; basic pho with overcooked lobster for $50.00. The Vietnamese donkey which is a beefed up version of a moscow mule was extremely refreshing  the strong ginger taste is welcoming and the drink is just well executed.

many people believe the Lobster Pho is this restaurants staple, but for me the ox tail fried rice is where it's at.
