We came here after a long night of drinking because we heard such great things about this place. We had about 15 girls and they were able to accommodate us pretty quickly. 

Me and two of the girls came first and we were pretty hungry already coming into the restaurant. When the other girls finally got there we decided to order the Pho because we knew it was the quickest thing..boy were we wrong. Everyone else got their meals before us...rice dishes, wonton soup, etc. We waited a good 30 minutes before we just couldn't take it anymore. We started to complain to our waiter and they kept giving us excuse after excuse. They stated they were were backed up in the kitchen. One of the girls asked, don't u have to just boil the noodle and put it into the soup? And the waiter made a comment that they were making the broth fresh at that moment. My family had a pho restaurant growing up so I knew that it was not true. It takes hours to make the broth and it something that should have been brewing since the morning. 

When the pho finally came, we were still unhappy because the flavor wasn't that great either. this place is completely overhyped.

Pretty sure this was the last actual complete meal I had before EDC weekend and it did not disappoint! We went with a party of 20+ and they were able to accommodate us on a short notice. Friendly service and our server were very knowledgeable of the menu/drinks. I had the oxtail pho and the broth itself was delicious. Portions are big too. We also tried the beef carpaccio, wings, and the pork belly buns- all amazing choices. 

This is not your typical viet/pho fare and the prices are higher than expected. With that said, I'll be returning next time I'm back in Vegas!

Service sucks... The server we had seems like he was having a bad day. But whatever moods he was in, I am not coming here to see it. The server wouldn't have gotten any tip from me, if it was me who is paying.
Yummy Lobster Pho! Well worth the drive. Opens at Noon for lunch stays open till 4am!

This place has great Asian fusion type foods, a little Vietnamese with the Pho noodle dishes, some Hawaiian dishes with the Ox Tail Loco Moco and stuff in between. I had the District One Short Ribs, lap cheong sausage, rice, and a fried egg were delicious!

The menu to this place is pretty condensed but they do have daily specials that they tell you when you're seated. The menu is very unique and appealing.

I would have made this a 5 star review if it wasn't for the wait to get my food. The beau got his food very quickly but mines did not come out until 15 minutes later! Don't get me wrong, I do not mind waiting 15 minutes to get my food. I understand things have to be prepped and cooked but c'mon, you have to time things correctly. You can NOT just have one person eating while the other stares for 15 minutes. 

Other than that the food was amazing!

5 Spice Hen w/ Tomato Rice -- The spices used on the chicken was pretty good. Chicken could've been a little more moist but none the less pretty well cooked. It was also a good portion. It looked like a whole chicken (or should I say hen) was used. It was about $13, which was is a good price for the portion. 

Oxtail Fries-- This was part of their specials & not on the menu. It was fries with oxtail, gravy, chopped green onions, and an over easy egg on top. The flavors really burst in your mouth. It was very unique. Honestly, I thought it was going to be like Carne Asada Fries but it had no resemble to it at all! Very good. That was about $9! I thought it was going to be more expensive! 

Vietnamese Donkey-- This is their touch of Moscow Mules. & we all know I order that everywhere I go. This one was a lot sweeter than most moscow mules I've tasted. They used a Lycée alcohol and you can defiantly taste it. It even comes out with an actual Lycée fruit that I appreciated very much. This was $12, which I thought was on the pricer side but hey, its alcohol! 

Besides my rant in the beginning of the review.. service was pretty decent. Our waiter was very informative when asked questions about the menu. It seemed that he knew I was getting upset about the long wait for my food so I felt he was avoiding my eye contact but other than that.. SEE YOU AGAIN SOON DISTRICT ONE!

Second time here, amazing like the first time! I've been dying to come back for the grilled squid and beef carpaccio. Besides those two, I also wanted to try the sea snails. Last time I ate snails was when I was a lot younger and these were huge compared to the kind I used to eat lol, they were great.

For entrees, my table got the fish tacos, coconut pork belly, and oxtail fried rice. All were amazing! Oxtail fried rice is definitely good for sharing. We were all stuffed and had to take some to go, but still made room for dessert of course haha. Pandan creme brulee and coconut ice cream were just as amazing. Jason was our awesome server, thank you Jason!

They also have one of my favorite beers, Kronenbourg Blanc 1664! My fiance (quickly) enjoyed his Matcha cocktail, as did I with the Tropical Blue 

Long story short, everything was amazing. We will all be back for sure, and I most definitely recommend this place!

Stopped by this place for lunch with a friend and was pleased.  The inside of the restaurant has a clean, down to earth bar decor that's casual and relaxing.  The menu is simple offering classic Vietnamese dishes.  Our server was great,  friendly and helpful. We ordered the oxtail fried rice (their popular choice) and shaken beef with sides of pho broth.  The oxtail fried rice was superb!! The shaken beef was good too. The pho broth was one of the best in Vegas. Great food and service,  reasonably priced.  Highly recommended.

My boyfriend and I are visiting from out of town and I really wanted some PHO Glad we decided to try District One. My PHO had such good flavor and was fresh, my boyfriend had the "daily special" Ribeyeamd loved it. We'll definitely be back since we are here in Vegas every few months and I highly recommend District One

District One is probably one of the trendiest places that you can order pho from. Almost everywhere you look has a TV screen that shows live games. A huge plus for me was that they had NBATV. The music is also nice, setting a "hip" atmosphere.

District One has an impressive bar selection. Usually, I would order a Blue Moon. Enter: Kronenbourg Blanc. I was introduced to Kronenbourg Blanc at District One, and I am glad that I have stumbled upon it. I haven't found many restaurants that offer it, but it's better than Blue Moon!

I ordered the steak and eggs. It contained small cut pieces of steak, tossed around in some sauce, tomato rice, and a fried egg. Not your typical steak and eggs, but this tasted pretty good.

They have pho oxtail as well here too, which I recommend. Their broth is better than most in Vegas which are bland. Another famous dish they have is the lobster pho, which is great for pictures. Not to also mention their Big Bone soup, which consists of a huge bone where you can stick a long spoon in and get all of the bone marrow goodness! 

Great atmosphere, place to watch the games, and grub!
Been here several times.  I really like their Oxtail fried rice & their matcha smoothie.

Most of the time I try to avoid fusion places. But this place does it right. Besides the fusion, they do have traditional Vietnamese dishes. They're known for their lobster pho. I have ordered that before and it was great. Do expect to pay a price for it though, because each order comes with a whole lobster. 

For appetizers, make sure you get the oxtail fries. This is a great dish especially with the sunny side up egg on top. I will normally order the oxtail pho or the bone marrow pho. The broth here is pretty good. Very clean. They cook the oxtails down until the just fall of the bone.

If you're up for a drink, try the Hennessey Cafe Sua Da. Never would I have thought Hennessey would pair perfectly with Vietnamese coffee.

As good as it gets. Ordered the Ox Tail Pho, Ox Tail fried rice, and whole fish. All were great. This place has the best pho broth I've ever tasted. It's a bowl big enough to share but it's so good you'll want your own. I could tell the fish was fresh and came out perfectly cooked. There's a sauce on the plate that was also great. I love a good fried rice and there are few places that do it well...district one does a great fried rice. It tasted like there might have been just a little too much msg/salt for my wife, but I loved it. Phenomenal.

Food was 5 stars. Service was 4 stars but the food stole the show. Not one dish was bad.  If you want the bone broth soup, go early. We dined at 7 and they were out. But watching the diners lucky enough to get it, i can see why it is so popular! What a find! I would definitely come back to explore more of the menu.

All I have is say is "WOW!!" This place is absolutely amazing. From the service to the cute decor and.. The food! Omg the food. So good! Was not expecting the different types of flavors and dishes that this place had to offer. Definitely not your typical Vietnamese restaurant that you find in china town. I want to say it's more of an Asain fusion with a primary focus on Vietnamese style cooking/flavors. My group and I ended up ordering family style which I felt was the best way to try more of the dishes because the menu had so many options to offer! Everything sounded so tasty! 

There wasn't a single dish that we didn't enjoy, but I highly recommend the shaken beef salad, pork belly with boiled egg, beef tacos (my favorite!! Not on the menu), steak and eggs and Ox tail pho. Hands down best pho I've ever had. I usually have to add hoisen sauce to enhance the flavor but this was perfect the way it came. The food was so flavorful and the quality was perfect. The steak was so tender, blew my mind away!

If you're around the area this is definitely a place to check out. You won't be disappointed:) I know my friends and I will be returning a visit real soon

I came here a month ago with some friends visiting from San Jose. Honestly, I came here because TimothyDeLaGhetto came here so I decided to see what the hype was about. 

Vibe: 5/5
I really liked how the restaurant was laid out and designed. It felt like a very hip Asian lounge that had good food and drinks. The walls had interesting pictures and designs definitely were something to look at. I come from San Jose so I definitely liked the Vietnamese fusion vibe they got going on.
Service: 5/5
Service was wonderful, we were seated right away and the staff answered any questions that we had. One of my friends is almost deathly lactose intolerant so the waiter was very thorough and explained what everything was made of, so we really appreciated that. Well done.
Food: 5/5
I wanted to order the Lobster Pho, however, I had just eaten right before so my stomach wasn't up for it. Instead, I ordered the Ahi Fish Tacos and Mekong Boat Noodles. The Ahi Tacos were simply delightful. The ahi tuna mixed with the fusion of vietnamese herbs were perfect. A great mix of Mexican, Japanese, and Vietnamese dishes. I loved it. The Mekong Boat Noodles were on point as well. Not the best I've ever had but it definitely hit the spot.

I highly recommend this place for the creativity and boldness that they are wiling to experiment with foods from different cultures.

Never tried lobster pho but heard this place was famous for the dish... of course, we had to try it. Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted by a server. We only had to wait 5 minutes on a Friday night. The decor was trendy/hipster of Vietnamese-American fusion theme. Service was great. The server took orders without needing to write it down on a notepad for a table of 6, which was quite impressive when she recited the orders. Food arrived slowly one by one. The cocktail took a little long to arrive and the lobster pho was the last to arrive (that's why I took away the 1 star). Everyone finished their meal by the time lobster pho got to the table but it was definitely a surprise. The flavor profile of the broth and the amount of lobster in the bowl was amazing! We also ordered fish tacos, calamari, and king crab. All were delicious. Note: fish tacos had raw fish so it was very light and almost like a ceviche. The taco shell was lightly crunchy which made it a great appetizer. Happy to have lobster pho checked off my bucket list

I quite like this place. Well, I like their service. 
And what I also like is they also have a bar as well. Warming atmosphere and space booth. 
We order egg rolls, spicy beef noodle and fried rice.  Along with 2 beers. Fried rice doesnt stand out to me. Egg rolls presentation was very nice. Crunchy, hot and tasty wrapped with lettuce and pickle veggies dipped with fish sauce. The (bun bo hue) spicy beef noodle will be off my list on my next visit sorry. It's too greasy To the point I can't even scoop a spoon of soup enjoy. Ended up just ate all the noodle and meat.

The interior and exterior of this restaurant is beautiful. Everything looks fancy, classy, and very modern. The inside is very spacious with lots of seating and big windows to light up the whole place with the sun when it's out. 

The menu is small but has most of the popular Vietnamese dishes. Their specialty is lobster Pho, and variations of that, which is unique and different but usually when I go for Pho, I am looking for the beefy broth and the rare steak. So I didn't end up trying this. 

I ordered the ribeye Pho which is $9.99. The Noodles were so soggy. I can not stand super soft Noodles like this in my pho! The beef was good and they gave me a good amount for my Noodles but I barely ate any of my noodles. The broth was okay, it was plain but livened up just a little with extra hoisin sauce and sriracha but still didn't have the strong beefy flavor I crave for when eating pho. 

We also ordered the spring rolls which were $7.99, I have never paid such a high amount for spring rolls before. I expected that we'd be getting more than the other restaurants that have egg rolls for half the price. It was only two spring rolls, just like everywhere else. They did use larger wraps, though, there are still cheaper places that use the larger wraps as well. The spring roll sauce was good. The veggies were super fresh and crispy. The pork was a little tough and the wrap had hardened already before it came to our table. 

Our order was taken quickly and food came out right away but after that we were forgotten about. We had to ask a different waiter for our check and a water refill that was needed long before we asked. 

There are many other pho places to try before I'd go back to this one.

Just one of the best restaurants off the strip, period. The food is amazing, the service is great  and the ambiance is lively!

Been here twice already and have not been disappointed at all. The wait staff are incredibly polite and  courteous. The wife and I have had the Vietnamese Mule, which was tasty and very well done. We have tried the following:

 Chicken Pho - The Pho broth is delicious and the wife and son loved it. What my wife liked was how her clothes didn't smell like pho after eating it, like if you go to a normal Pho restaurant.  My son was all about the broth.
 Lobster Fried Rice - Outstanding. Incredibly flavorful and presentation was just delightful!
Garlic Serrano Fried Chicken -  Fried chicken with a wonderful kick to it. Just delicious!
 Oxtail Fries - Heavy but really full of flavor to comfort the palate.
Clay Pot Chicken and Rice - just outstanding! 11 year old son loved it.

We look forward to coming again and trying out more things! For what you get and what you pay  - No brainer. This place rivals Mr. Chow or a good handful of restaurants on the strip... IT is just sooooo good...! Try it! You will not be disappointed.
The Phó is on point, love the Happy Hour Specials, must try the Sashimi Yellow Tail Tacos!!! Service is 5-Star!!!

Came at 10:55pm. Seemingly not too busy. Currently everyone already had their food. Ordered 2 bowls of pho rare beef. Waited for half an hour and still no signs of our pho bowls. This is NOT the first time this happened. We were patient most of the time. This time we just walked out. Now writing this as we are driving to Pho Kim Long. Better wait time and better service. Will never come back.

This is a super modern and trendy place to go to. Don't be fooled by the Americanized Vietnamese flair, it's actually quite good I was very surprised myself. I was expecting it to just be mediocre. The flavors are very similar to the traditional Vietnamese cuisine you would expect. 

The reason I gave it four stars is my entree the 'double down' I got it with short ribs, was very burnt and all of one side was completely black I could barely taste the meat. I would recommend sticking with the Noodles. 

However some delicious dishes I like are:

The Spicy Hue Noodle soup: a bit spicy but very delicious

The Mekong River Noodle soup: very similar to traditional Vietnamese soup 

The Pho Tai Rib eye: the meat is much better quality than regular pho stores

My first time at this restaurant...
The food was generally tasty.
Service was awesome and everyone was super friendly.
I would go back.

I was skeptical about paying for expensive pho but I was pleasantly surprised! This place is very accommodating for large groups. Everyone enjoyed their food. The shaken beef salad and fried birds nest noodles was really good. My friend had the lobster garlic noodles and said it tasted really good. I had their Viet chalada and I loved it. Their bar has a lot of options.  Will definitely come back!

I am very close to 5 star here but can't do it. I think it's because the pho and the bun Bo hue didn't quite blow me away. I am at 4.5 stars though.  The place is immaculate clean and hipster inside.  Bar is a nice added touch and it's always busy. So that's a great sign. I would go back but would try some of the other menu items. Service was 5 star. Try it you won't be disappointed

The pho was lackluster but the spring roll was very interesting. It was fresh and they added fried onions or something in the middle to give it a unique taste. 
Also the waitress was very cute, but don't tell my gf I said that.

What can I share that hasn't been shared already? I brought my family here for happy hour.  My less than one year old daughter loves their ox-tail big bone soup broth with rice.  My mom likes their veggie pho but always says she wishes that it had more asian veggies in it. We all liked the pork belly buns and fried chicken wings that you'll find on the happy hour menu. I had the pho tai. It was just what I needed.  Service was awesome.  We ordered a few drinks, a sake bomb and a donkey...one of an asian variety seeing as though it came with some lychee in it. Yum!!! I love FRESH lychee!! We spent about $100 for dinner, for the 3 of us. We tried so many things and made a night of it, really. Goodness, I cannot tell you how wonderful the service was.  The probably 8 or so different servers that came to check on us were so fantastic. We never had to search for them. They anticipated some of our needs. They watched to see if my lil one needed anything, aside from a change of clothes because she wanted to swim in the big bone soup broth because it was so good. LOL. This was definitely a unique dining experience, drinking a donkey, slurping out bone marrow, and waving our hands around because the wings were so hot. It was a fun time. And again, service was impeccable! The happy hour menu is a great deal. I hope more people will come in for happy hour. I'm sure you won't leave UNhappy!

items we ordered
drink: sake bomb
drink: Vietnamese donkey (I think was the name of it)
pork belly buns
spicy fried chicken
veggie pho
ox tail big bone soup w rice 
pho tai
1/2 dozen oysters
egg rolls

Outstanding Food, and Drinks, Great Service, Noisy

We really enjoy the food and the people who work here.  The food is amazing and fun to try.

We used to go here 3-5 times a week. Always ordering a slew of food, bringing friends, family and associates and recommending them left and right. Then we stopped completely. 

Gone are the days of our favorite lobster pho, braised pork belly and oxtail pho. The food is delicious. The service is abysmal. 

What happened district one? Why'd the servers get so sour? 

Competition in Vegas is fierce. You were top contenders on being amongst the best of the best. And then- kaploot. 

BUT-- not to take away from the food. It's delicious. The service just needs work.

Great food and service. We came here for the first time and came in right before they get full. We ordered garlic noodle, pork belly buns, oxtail fried rice. i loved fried rice and not too much saltiness and liked buns but these were a bit too much taste. Garlic noodle was ok not so special.
I want to come back here if I come back to Vegas for sure and would order something different next time.

The only thing i'd watch out for are prices... very easily can you rack up a $60+ bill on very little!

Steak and Eggs are delicious!!!!!

So I've been here twice I still don't understand the hype the food is mediocre tasting and well overpriced. I ordered the fish tacos on both occasions, the first time they were... Ok the second time I think they forgot the fish. Some of the bowls of pho looked pretty good they must have been the $29 bowls. The service and atmosphere I would give a solid 4,everything else gets a weak 3
I was greatly disappointed given the 4 stars when we went there tonight for happy hour.  The 4 items we ordered as recommended by our server were unimpressive.

Pricey place. However, the food is awesome. I had pho 3 ways. Beef pho, then beef stock with lobster, and then finally lobster stock with lobster. Haha. All 3 were great. The sea snails were is nostalgic from when I was younger with the ginger mixed fish sauce. Again pricey but good.

Great food, great prices! I love this place. Especially because they close at 2 am everyday! Awesome option for people who work in the industry, quality food late night can sometimes be hard to come by off the strip. Located in the same shopping center as Chada Thai (another amazing spot) on Spring Mountain and Jones.

My favorites have been the Slow Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice served with boiled egg and pickled veggies $8.95, Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio $11.95 (looks different from most carpaccios but trust me, it's amazing), and the Five Spice Roasted Cornish Hen $11.95. Everything I've tried here has been extremely flavorful and unique yet very homey feeling. I've also tried their Oxtail Fries $9.95 and they've been alright, I'd skip these here and go to Bachi Burger if you're craving Oxtail fries instead. Here, the sauce is thinner and more gravy like. Another item that I've been dying to try but have not yet, is their Lobster Pho! They serve you an entire whole lobster! Definitely have to taste this next time if I can stop ordering my Pork Belly (my favorite). They also offer Shrimp, Clams, & King Crab Legs at Market Price if that's what you're craving :)

They also have a Happy Hour! Monday-Friday 5-7pm & Sunday-Thursday from Midnight- 2 am! 
-Oysters (6,12,18) $1.25 each
-Wings (6,12,18) $0.50 each
-Garlic Fries $2.99
-Pork Belly Buns (2) $3.99
-Egg Rolls (4) $3.99
-Fish Tacos (2) $4.99
-Green Papaya Salad $4.99
-Vietnamese Carpaccio $9.99
-Beer/Wine Specials as well 

Definitely recommend this restaurant :)
Love the ambiance! On our recent visit, my husband ordered their infamous lobster pho and I must say, it was delish! But the price isn't as delicious lol. But totally worth the experience!

Of course we are back again to District One....every time we are in town. We were starving so ordered too much food! Once again the food was great!! The services was awesome! The lobster pho was delicious! Lots of flavor. My husband loved his rice, steak and eggs. The steak cooked just perfect. The grilled squid was not chewy and so fresh! Wish they had this restaurant in San Diego. Till next time...

Oh man this place is worth all the hype and good reviews I've seen and heard. Called in first before I came just in case here was a wait. I came in with my luggage and backpack and they were very accommodating to let me keep my belongings next to my table. I got the yellowtail fish tacos and the black pepper lobster noodles with the matcha thai tea. Everything was delicious! Fish tacos was fresh and all the ingredients complimented each other. The black pepper lobster noodle I originally thought it was going to be in a pho bowl like the whole lobster pho but with more flavor, so initially I was disappointed but the way it came it was still great and the matcha thai tea have been one of my favorite drinks as of late since I first discovered it at a Thai restaurant in Elk Grove, CA a must try when in Vegas

I was recommended here by many of my friends from the area. Nice place, with great decor. Service is very fast. I ordered the Lobster Pho which was $49 which looks really appealing, but the pho was just normal pho that I would of have tasted from home, but with a lobster. It was nothing special. My girlfriend bought the Bone Marrow pho which was really delicious. All the food is super filling. Would recommend if you are hung over in Vegas. Also, they have Hennessy on tap!

Made reservations for 8. We all ordered the pork belly buns, egg rolls beef carpaccio, and wings. The pork belly buns, egg rolls, and wings were good, but the carpaccio was amazing. It was like a magical plate of juicy goodness. Druglike since it seemed everyone's eyes kept involuntarily darting back to the plate. For the entrees, we ordered the oxtail fried rice, pork belly with coconut juicez Cornish hen with garlic noodles, and steak and eggs. The hen was a bit dry bit easily fixed with an ample squirt of sriracha. The oxtail fried rice was to die for. A bit of everything in each and every bite. Garlic noodles were great in taste and texture. The steak and eggs were surprisingly good. Reminiscent of a pepper steak from the Chinese restaurants. The showstopper was the pork belly. Melt in your mouth good. I can't wait for the weather to get colder so I can stop in for some pho.

The waitress was on top of things. Topped our drinks off constantly. Always attentive and quick to serve.

This place is "Pho-Nomenal!" The eclectic bowls of pho are photo worthy and simply out of this world delicious.  The broth in the pho is so flavorful, their beef shaken salad is delicious, and they make some great cocktails.

Saw the pictures on Instagram, so I decided to try this place out. We went on a weekday, so the ordering and delivery were spot on. The server did a great job of recommending the specials and what was popular on the menu. We ordered the oxtail loco, oxtail fried rice, fish tacos, and pork buns. The fish tacos were awesome, I liked the presentation but the taste is what got me. I ordered extra to go. The oxtail fried rice is a huge serving, and was good. Really good if you enjoy garlic. Wish I was a lobster lover, otherwise I would have ordered the lobster pho, there's always next time!

First meal in Vegas!  Meh.

Good Morning Vietnam - their rendition of a Bloody Mary.  This was Pinky's drink and he wasn't a fan, well I guess I wasn't too much of a fan either just because I felt like I was drinking super concentrated V8.  A good bartender will make a good Bloody Mary with a perfect balance of flavors, not too strong in alcohol, not overwhelmed in spices, and not too thick and tomatoey.  I have to say, that although I appreciated the shrimp inside the Bloody Mary, it did nothing to tone down the thick consistency of the actual drink.  While the truffle salt I guess gets A for effort to make this drink exciting, but meh.. could have done without it.  

Shigoku oysters - was excited for our oysters, but decided to just try 2 before ordering anymore since they said they served it with caviar and some ponzu type sauce.  Nice presentation, but what a waste of a good oyster.  Sorry, but the sauce that they flooded those little shells with totally killed off the natural flavor of the oyster.  I could only feel the texture of the oyster, but the taste was all sauce.  So happy we didn't order anymore.  

Scallop sashimi - they served the scallop meat cut into thin slices with the ponzu and caviar with the more heartier, crunchier parts (I think the organs?) in the center.  Like the oysters the delicate flavor of the scallop was overwhelmed by the ponzu, but the crunchy bits actually went well with the sauce.  Pinky appreciated the crunchy bits of scallop and ended up finishing the order.

Green papaya salad - I liked this dish, it wasn't overly sweet like I had thought it would be, but it actually would have been tastier with a little more sweetness.  The salad reminded me of Thai papaya salad minus the strong fermented fish sauce flavor and scent (which I love btw).  the salad was refreshing and light, but I could have used more potent and pungent flavors.  Only downside was that the dish was supposed to come with pork, but when we got it there was only shrimp.  Initially I thought that maybe I had just read the menu wrong, but then our waiter came up with another bowl of salad but with all pork in it to make up for the mistake.  It wasn't a big deal... but just kind of weird how they remedied the situation.  But oh well, it was a win for Pinky bc he packed the pork salad up and ate it as a late night snack later on.   

Lobster pho - price is marked as MP, we paid $40 for the bowl.  Noodles were cooked perfectly!  The lobster meat was sweet and the little brain/guts in the head were deliciously enjoyed by yours truly.  The broth itself was on the milder side... Honestly I had low expectations for this dish, but it actually surpassed them.  HOWEVER, I wouldn't order this dish again and $40 for it.  Maybe I'm just not a big enough fan of lobster to do it... but after my bandwagon-y instagram picture post of the dish, I'm over it.  

Service was awesome, and the menu items go well with the cool atmosphere of Vegas... Might even do well in LA where theres a bunch of hipsters, scene kids, bandwagonners, and unknowing mi trang.  But as for me, I'll stick to my mom and pop shop, bowls of dank pho broth.

good ambiance... food "looks" good but average in taste  
good hang out place though if you are not too picky about your food 
I would skip lobster next time

District One is a really fun, tasty place. It's unpretentious and crazy inexpensive if you've been conditioned to eating on the strip.

The chicken wings and belly buns are highlights. The oxtail fried rice was decent but it hardly blew me out of the water.

Protip - skip the lobster pho. It looks nice and is interesting, but isn't worth the cash.
30 mins and counting... I still don't have my food. The restaurant is half filled. What happens if it was a fully packed?

This is one of the best restaurants I've been to. The service was amazing! TK was our server and he's absolutely awesome. The food fantastic. Their pork belly is one of my favorites. They also have an awesome drink selection and really good whiskey. I will definitive be a regular here

We got lost and was hungry and found this one on Yelp! Thank goodness for the honest reviews because this place is bomb. Service was 5 stars and everything was delish... 

We Ordered:

Ice Coffee   - we made it ourselves so we got to control the sweetness.
Double Down - this was so filling and made my belly happy! 
Steak & Eggs - this was cooked perfectly and the fish sauce made dancing in my mouth. 

Love this place!

First time here and it was pretty good. I got the oxtail pho which I really really liked! I added meatballs to mine and I was really surprised that there was a charge and it was $3! I find that a little ridiculous but now you guys know. 

The pork buns (fried) were also good. And we also got the fish tacos, and those were delish too!

The Serrano wings and garlic fries thought, not that good... No flavor and pretty plain but we got it during happy hour so at least the price was good.

Overall it was good. I'd probably only go for the pho because the broth was good and flavorful. Decently priced, especially during happy hour (5pm-7pm).

I definitely love the vibe going on at District One. The quality of service their employees offer is superb! And the food, oh lawd I'm tellin' ya, it's to die for! Their chef is definitely doing some magic in the kitchen. District one is the type of place you can go to if you want to enjoy good wine and eat good food while enjoying the ambience without spending a ton of $$$. Give this place a try, you know you want to!

Recommended dishes:
Ox tail Fried Rice. Omg omg omg omg!
Vietnamese Beef carpaccio - drenched in truffle oil
Oysters! Always fresh, go during happy hour for $1 fresh fresh oysters
Big Bone Soup - Bone marrow lover? You will die once you see the marrow comes out.
Lobster Pho - A bit pricey but c'mon! It's a whole friggin lobster.
Garlic Fries - So flavorful!

Went with a large group for a birthday celebration.

Waitress and staff were attentive thorughout the night. The restaurant decor was pleasing and soothing, it was lamost like a place you would visit if you were near the beach or coast. The music ambience was modern and enjoyable.

The food menu had a few selections which was good, as too many options at times seems to make things complicated. We ordered the Edemame for appetizers and were not too thrilled with the sauce. The Belly Buns were delicious and so were the Beef Lemongrass Skewers (love that the lemongrass stick was encompassed by the beef in order to enhance the flavor). As for their Pho dishes, I wish they had a lean meat option, I had the vegetable Pho and was happy the veggies were not "frozen" but freshly cut.

Overall experience even with clitches of large parties being able to split checks, it was worth coming here. I recommend it.

I have only been here two times but I enjoyed my second time as much as my first time. It doesn't look like a typical Vietnamese restaurant but I enjoyed the interior mix. The music isn't too loud and the girl that served us both times is very nice! She knows what she's doing and she constantly checked up on us. That's some great customer service! The first time I came, I ordered the oxtail pho and it was so good. It was filling as well and I thought that this would become the place whenever I wanted oxtail pho. My family and I also ordered oxtail fries with shreds of oxtail meat in sauce that is poured on top of the fries. I don't eat fries at all and I was trying not to eat it but I have no regrets. If I was to eat fries, it would only be the oxtail fries because that was seriously the best thing I have ever eaten... In terms of French fries. We also ordered hot tea and they give you this big tea cup with tea bags. The hot tea served is green tea and they give you pots of hot water. I think that topped it all off because when you eat late at night to early morning, you just want good food served in attractive cups, bowls, or plates. This place is a must try and it is just wonderful!

Just to be clear,  I have been waiting weeks to try the notorious lobster pho ~ so after the four hour drive I couldn't wait to taste such a unique and different dish from my normal traditional pho. For presentation I would give it 4! :) however if I'm paying $50 for a bowl pho - I'm expecting every part of it to be the best ever. According to the server , the broth was cooked 5 hours with the lobster; but when I tasted the broth, I couldn't get a taste of lobster at all! The broth was not has tasteful as I expected and lacked some flavor. My other complaint would be the noodles weren't as fresh as I expected. For a $50 bowl every bite should be exquisite - and the best is exactly what I was expecting but did not get. Given , I know we were paying for the price of the lobster - everything else still should have been amazing. Lastly , the lobster was actually cooked very well but I just felt like the overall experience was not as I expected. It was not at all worth the price. 

Noted , if I were to come back I would most defiantly  get the pork bun baos again!!!! They were amazing & for an amazing price $4 on happy hour :) the pork bun was well cooked !

This place is always good! The atmosphere and waiters/waitresses are some of the best. Very professional and willing to accommodate. One of my regular go to spots. Must try: Hamachi tacos, pork belly in young coconut juice, & tomato rice!

We came here because of the Lobster Pho, but I can't get myself to pay $50 for a bowl of noodles.  Instead, we had the regular pho & Bird's Nest Noodles along with Oxtail Fries and Chicken Wings.  I liked the idea and flavor of Oxtail Fries, but the fries were disappointingly lukewarm.  Wings were enjoyable.    The pho portion was generous, and the meat (ribs or shrimps) were ample.  I ordered the Bird's Nest but switched with Hubby because it resembled a Chinese dish too much.  Hubby did finish the plate.  Service was OK.  I'd give it 3  1/2 stars.

Seriously, not much gets me more excited about coming to the sparkling lights of Las Vegas than money, booze and strippers. Ok I'm lying, I also enjoy the arcade games at Circus Circus and the Bellagio Fountains a great deal but recently District One Kitchen & Bar has resoundingly become one of the reasons I desire coming to Sin City more than I already do.

The Vietnamese inspired food here is simply just amazing and is only rivaled by the incredible service, ambiance and family-friendly vibe this cozy hangout offers up in droves. Oh if these walls could talk, it's the joint to meet up with friends to watch the game, share some drinks, have some laughs, nurse that hangover and have damn good eats. Inventive menu selections include live Maine lobster pho, Surf n Turf pho (lobster and tender slices of ribeye) and oxtail anything. The food presentation is also spot on, for those who love to post their meals on social media (you know who you are) a post from here will guarantee 100 likes and new followers. But seriously, there's really something for any type of mood you're in. I mean let's be honest pho can cure all maladies, I know I eat it to stay young and virile, but the stuff can probably cure Ebola too.

Well, if you're a fan of fun and good food then swing your way on down here and give it a whirl, don't take my word for it. With a full bar, a bodacious staff of waiters and waitresses who are ready to pour your next shot of Fernet or glass of Veuve Clicquot, it's a for sure good time that is certainly Vegas worthy. There's a reason they've recently been named Best New Restaurant of 2014 by Las Vegas Weekly. I'm already planning my next adventure to my home away from home and D1 is going to be on my agenda at least a couple times.

Good food with large portions, full bar with a lot of draft selections. There are plenty of TVs around the place so you should be able to see one or more from where ever you sit. The staff is friendly, helpful and attentive. This place has a very laid back, cool vibe. I will definitely be coming back.

Wow!!! Thank you Aaron for your wonderful service and food suggestion. Aaron was very informative when asked questions about the menu. (09/01/14)

I didn't even know Las Vegas had a China Town in the City of lights. This is a must, place to visit! Take a break from the strip -- sun, drunk people and gambling. 

My other half and I love to share our food. This is what we had:

-The wings- (Garlic Serrano Pepper) They were just cooked right and crispy. The sauce at the bottom of the tray was top notch! Very Juicy

-Belly Buns- (Pork Belly, Clintro & Peanut Sauce) The bun was so soft it just melted in my mouth, the peanut flavor was awesome. They didn't have so much fat on the meat! (A+ Plus) 

-The 3 pound Garlic Lobster with noodles-- WOW! WOW! This was amazing! At first we thought 3 pound was going to be a lot of food, but at the end we devoured it! The noodles were very fresh and tender. The lobster was cooked just right. The seasoning was great and finger-licking good! 

Dessert- O-mg-! The ice cream is to die for! They only have one flavor which is coconut -- served on a coconut shell. 

The wait time to get our food was expectational! It took them about 10-15 to bring out the main dish and about 3-5 for the appetizers. I can't wait to go back! :)

*Disclaimer - this review is biased only rated one item - the Ox Tail PHO!!! *

I've actually been to D One twice but all that is on my mind is their Ox Tail Pho!  Now for most stereotypical asians paying more than $10 for a bowl of Pho is insane unless you are at the TI on the strip but this bowl is worth every penny of its 11.95 price tag.

On work days when I'm having an ox tail soup craving and can't make it out to the California with an 11pm Ox Tail start time, I'm S-O-L but now I get to go to District One for the best of both worlds - Ox Tail and Pho.  Genius - yah, i know.

The soup is so rich from all the fat tender ox tail goodness falling off the bones as you gently prick it with your chopsticks. Im getting off thinking about it as we speak.  Anyhow go check it out.

Oh yah they do have other things like the Shaking Beef Salad, or Shaking Beef Steak and Eggs, Cornish Hen.  Everything here is pretty good but the first thing I'd order is their Ox Tail Pho!

Always pass by this place on my way to the house. Every time I drove by I mentally noted that I wanted to try it. Well it was about time I put that thought into action. I came with a group of four during happy hour and we were greeted and sat by our server. We knew this was going to be to try the drinks but we figured we grab some finger food while we drink. I ordered the pork belly buns, an order of the chicken wings and Eggrolls. The chicken wings didn't really have a lot of flavor but they were very crispy and had a jalapeños roasted on top of it. I wouldn't really say they're anything special. The pork belly bun and the eggrolls were a 10. Definitley great finger food. The service was a little slower but it was slammed and there was really like four people on the floor. The bar was packed because the drinks are soooo good ! We came on national margarita day and they were having a special on them. The Thai basil margarita was very refreshing. We also ordered the coconut mojito! MUST TRY COCONUT MOJITO! So good and they serve it in a fresh coconut! I also ordered the café sua da which is viatnemese drip coffee with hennnesy and I asked for the condensed creme on the side! It was a perfect after dinner drink! The drinks are worth returning ! Service was great and the soundtrack is FIRE

This place was awesome! I ordered food to go and it was some if the best pho I've had in a long time. The place was really inviting on the inside, I can't wait to go back and eat there. The service was was amazing the guy who rang me up also took the bags to my car! Defiantly exceeded my expectations. 

When I got home and put the pho soup together it was great. Will defiantly be back for more soon!

The food, atmosphere and service were good. I don't have anything negative to say about the place, but there is nothing special about the place either. The lobster pho was a fun and different concept, and they do serve a generous portion of lobster. Other than the lobster itself, the pho tasted like a beef broth pho. I expected it to taste more like lobster, or at least, seafood. The chicken pho is served with dark meat, not white. Not sure if white meat is optional. The steak and egg was good. The soft shell crab is good except the ponzu sauce that was served with the soft shell crab did not taste like the traditional ponzu sauce. Their papaya salad also didn't taste like the traditional papaya salad. The spring rolls were good. The worst item we ordered was the kimchi. They totally missed the flavor. All in all, if I want to eat Pho or any other Asian dish, I would go to authentic Asian places. This place was more Asian fusion.

Come for the overhyped pho but stay for the appetizers and other dishes.
 
This place is so heavily advertised that we had to make this a mandatory stop on our trip.

I was not impressed with the pho dishes at all. The Oxtail pho had decent flavor and the taste seemed to get more rich as I kept eating. The Lobster pho was bland and probably the biggest disappointment. I understand this is "exotic" pho but $14 and $MP, respectively, they weren't worth it. What was even more disappointing was paying so much for the pho and it didn't even include the basic meatballs, flank, tripe, tendon, etc. With these two bowls of Pho, you are very limited on meat. You're better off going to a normal Pho restaurant and paying less for more (food & broth quality).
 
Oxtail Fries were delicious. The gravy wasn't too salty nor was it too rich. It had the right amount of flavor and I would recommend it.
 
Grilled Squid was also a worthy dish. The squid had a hearty, meaty taste instead of being rubbery so you know it was grilled perfectly. The spicy aioli was a nice touch (as you know I love aioli).
 
King Crab with spicy aioli was my absolute favorite. The only thing I didn't like about  the dish was that it had me wanting more afterwards. The spicy aioli was a great compliment to the sweet chunk of king crab.
 
I would still come back here. There are many dishes that I consider unique, and I think it's definitely worth a few more visits. However, I wouldn't recommend the pho unless you're coming for the hype. And if you are, my opinion wouldn't matter anyways.

Awesome! Lobster Pho, oysters, Vietnamese chicken salad. Need I say more?  

Wonderful!

Amazing food and modern decor .  The lobster pho is so good and innovative, and we loved all the appetizers we ordered  .  If you saw it on the food network then you best head over and try this place out because you won't be disappointed . Chef Khai Vu is on top of his game .

Awesome Vietnamese joints are a dime a dozen in Vegas, so let me tell you why you should choose this one.

First, the whole place can only be described as stellar Vietnamese food meets hip, modern, clean Brooklyn-hipster decor meets Texas BBQ-sized portions. Allow me to elaborate:

- I have gone here three times in the last week, each time with a big crowd. This means I've sampled a lot of the menu. Must eat: eggrolls with lettuce wrap, thai basil, radish; pork buns pork buns pork buns; steak Pho--I almost never get pho anywhere because I find it boring, flavorless, and not-filling. This is not the case here. This is, hands down, the best pho I've ever had; fish tacos

- This place is huge and clean, with "chalkboard" walls, long tables, concrete floors, and plenty of room to spread out. It's not one of those drab, dark, maroon carpeted joints that Spring Mountain has plenty of. 

- The portions are enormous. Every plate is just overflowing with goodness.

On top of all of that, the service is great. Friendly, attentive but not overbearing, and speedy. This is clearly a family-owned and run establishment and it's likely that the people telling you about the specials and serving your food have a vested interest in making sure you have an excellent time, and it shows.

Terrible chicken pho!

Most of the chicken was a greyish color and the texture was terrible. They forgot to pack basil, sprouts, lime, or jalapeños, so it was boring and bland.  Will not be ordering from here again

Ever since coming back from Spain, my husband and I have been on the hunt for razor clams! We were able to find this restaurant in Vegas that actually serves razor clams, and decided to visit. :) It's Asian-fusion...and serves dishes ranging from pho, to bone marrow, to pork belly, etc.

We ordered the following:
(1) bone marrow soup - huge portion, primarily consists of 2 large bones, they were huge! once you suck out all the marrow, there's not much left other than the soup to drink. you should probably order some rice or noodle to go w/ this soup, since it doesn't come with. my husband ordered this and thought it was OK, i personally wouldn't order it again.
(2) oxtail pho - i didn't have this dish, but apparently this pho is suppose to be one of their specialties, especially if you like oxtail!
(3) bun bo hue - my sister in law had this dish and thought it was good; spicy though
(4) braised pork belly w/ rice and egg - i ordered this dish because i'm a fan of pork belly and it was yummy! flavors were great, broth was yum, and i gobbled up my dish (but had 1 pork belly left over which my husband helped to finish up).
(5) 4 orders of razor clams -- 2 orders of the grilled w/ scallions, 2 orders of the black bean sauce; YES MUST GET ! it's not on their regular menu, but only available on their "special menu, which they write on chalkboard" -- each order only comes with 2 razor clams, so that's a bummer. each order is $8.95 too, so very expensive!
I personally liked the black bean sauce once better, because it comes out sizzling on a platter. the grilled one is not as flavorful , and less salty, but some people like that version. 
(6) belly buns -- pork belly buns (each order comes with 3 buns); these were delicious, kinda wish we got more, but if you like pork belly buns, then order this! you won't regret it :)
(7) fish tacos -- i didn't eat this so i'm not sure how it tastes, but the folks who ate them said it was delicious. the taco itself was very tiny though, so don't expect a full size taco! they are petite.

Service was friendly and our food came out on a timely basis. We were happy with our feast, and wouldn't mind coming back just for the razor clams! :)

This place is an affordable modern mixed/fusion Asian restaurant in my opinion. I have never had a problem with this place when it has come to service. I generally see the same servers and theyre all friendly and pretty chill. 

Their options are different but I enjoy all of it here! My husband finds some things "exotic." For example, eating snails! 

This place is affordable in a way, but I have come to realize that the prices of their foods have increased in the last year or so.

Love the decor, very nice and spacious! Large bar area...Hennessy on tap...say what?!! Tried the fish tacos and on tail fries one day...super yummy! Next day, came back for dinner. Had the pork belly buns...deliciousness! Their coconut ice cream is also satisfies the sweet tooth! Almost forgot, the coconut is quite refreshing! Friendly service. Definitely will be back when I visit Vegas again!

We had came here because they were famous for the Lobster Pho. We had got here about after mid-night, and they were still serving the Lobter Pho. This place also has a full bar which they ask you when you arrive, if you want a table, booth or bar seating.

I personally did not get it but the I did taste and the broth is very flavorful. For $45 a bowl, I am not sure if it was worth it only because it  seemed very skimp on the noodles. The meat is already out of the shell for you so all you get is the lobster meat and a little bit of noodles.  Yes, it is a must try, but again...no unless you win big at a casino and can afford it and only like a little bit of noodles. 

I had the Bun Bo Hue, which I personally thought it lacked flavor. My bowl came out first. Traditionally you wait till everyones food is out before you can start eating. We must have waited another 15 minutes for the lobster pho to come so my bowl sat there luke warm, but the waitress was nice enough to bring me out a bowl of hot steaming broth that was packed full of flavor. Maybe what I got was not the best choice but the pictures and reviews from other looked really good.

Interesting concept and a hidden gem in Las Vegas Chinatown.

Food: We weren't particularly too hungry this day so we ordered the Garlic Serrano Wings and Steak and Eggs. I've been to a restaurant in the past where they served a dish similar to the steak and eggs so I was pretty excited about this dish. Although all around it was good, it wasn't noteworthy. The beef was a little bit on the tough side, but the flavor made up for that. As for the rice that came alongside it, it definitely lacked some flavor. The Garlic Serrano wings were also subpar. These little wings didnt much meat clinging to the bones and the flavor was lacking as well. The flavors sounded really good on paper, but to be honest I probably won't order this again. I really wanted to try their famous Lobster Pho, but that will have to be ordered during my next visit. 

Environment/ambiance: The restaurant itself is placed in the middle of what looks like an old school Asian plaza. The decor is new and different, almost screaming that it's modern next to its neighbors. On a sunny day you can't miss it---it shines in the sun. Indoors it looks like it used to be a Boiling Crab. They do a good job of representing their seafood theme. It's cozy, a little musty, and the only thing missing is nearby seawater. There's booths along the walls and a few tables for large groups in the middle. 

Service: We came early during the lunch hour so we were seated right away. We were also attended to right away by our server, but he didn't do much talking. It would've been helpful if he explained the menu more (although I already had in mind what I wanted to order so no explanation needed).

Tips: This is definitely a place to eat, drink, watch a game, and hang out with friends. It got pretty busy as it got later during the lunch rush. They have different menu items than other restaurants so give it a try!

A group of 8 of us came here for lunch based on all the great reviews on Yelp and Eater 38, and were not disappointed. Off the beaten path, but very cool ambiance and friendly service.

We got a bunch of small plates and dishes to share. The pho and wonton soup were both excellent; broth was really tasty. The oxtail fries were a favorite. Also enjoyed the chicken salad and spring rolls. The pork belly buns were just ok, and chicken wings were crispy, but a little dry (could use some sauce), and are really spicy. But overall, a wonderful meal.

Hand-crafted cocktails - favorite was the Vietnamese Donkey (a mule with lychee vodka); coconut mojito in fresh coconut was also very good, and lots of craft beers. Great pick!
Sooooooo good I got the short rib combo so yummy there meat is so good the ribs are even better the egg rice so good I didn't get to try there famous coconut mojito but I bet it will be just as good!

Umm... Okay so I guess I missed the bandwagon on this place because after leaving here tonight I'm a little confused as to what's the big hooplah about this place? Listen I'm all for given credit where it's due however this place just doesn't get my vote. My co workers love it and I have had their food and now tonight a chance for the happy hour! This review is strictly for the happy hour and nothing else. For starters lets talk about the joke of a menu they have for happy hour? You might as well not even offer happy hour with the half ass menu they are offering? Like cmon now it seriously only benefits people who like beer and cheap wines that will leave you with a headache? Oh and the little bit of food they have listed is a joke as well. I ordered those extremely fried chicken wings that were .50 cents a piece.. And yeah full of grease when you bite into them and extra freaking crispy, no thanks. The drinks are priced I guess we'll for beers but what about the folks that want a good cocktail on the happy hour menu! NONE of the regular cocktails are priced differently during this time frame and that sucks a lot being that most places at least list the well drinks. The service is cool but just put it like this they won't ever get another dime from me and I'm sure they are okay with it because seems from the other reviews this place is a hit! The entrees I've tried before in the past were "just okay" as well. The whole garlic noodle thing throws me all the way off. If the happy hour improved and they listed more relevant items I may or may not try them again but for now they are most definitely on my skip list!

We ate here one night for dinner and were lucky enough to make it for happy hour.  I think we ordered almost everything on the happy hour menu!  The food is very flavorful and I definitely overate but well worth it. I had the Mandarin Orange Crush for a cocktail and it was delicious.  A tad on the sweet side but I still enjoyed it.  The Oxtail Fried Rice was excellent and I was craving it the next day.  I look forward to returning here.

I wish there was a 3.5 star rating. 

The food is decent. Price is a bit high compared to other vietnamese pho places. But this place is more modern, so I guess the price jump is expected. 

Some of the wait staff were really friendly.

The coconut dessert seemed too pricey for what you get.

Pho flavor rating = 7.5/10
Rice and meat (i think it was com thit nuong) = 8.5/10

My friend had the ox tail pho and really liked it. But I didn't taste it, so I can't rate it.

BIG BONE SOUP. Hands down the best thing to get here (with a side of rice of course). I mean, who can say no to the succulent taste of bone morrow?! But ahhhh!!! It's so popular that sometimes, they're out of it (hence my one star deduction). Don't you fret though! They have a TON of other great dishes! If they're out of bone morrow (like tonight), then I order the oxtail pho with rice instead of noodles. If you're not feeling like soup, try the oxtail fried rice. So rich in flavor!!! Those are the top 3 we like to order, but tonight we decided to go with one of their specials: 18oz ribeye! A little on the pricy side but it was so juicy and seasoned to perfection! In all, you really can't go wrong with anything you order here. Service is great and food comes out pretty fast. Oh and if you're over 21, try the coconut mojito. It's amazing and comes inside a coconut! And if you're any age, try their coconut dessert. (Can't you tell I love coconuts lol). But really... You won't regret it!

Cool new find in the Vegas area, off-strip, at the recommendation of a friend. Not your traditional pho, you can order Lobster pho, oxtail pho, or big bone (bone marrow) pho. Naturally we had to try one of each! The lobster pho broth is very light, and you get a decent amount of lobster with your pho. My oxtail pho was delicious, complete with a nice rich broth. The big bone broth was a sight to see! They even give you a straw to suck out the marrow. 

We also ordered calamari, belly buns and oxtail fries to start. All fantastic!

I've been coming here EVERYTIME Im in vegas since I first ate here about 3 years ago!!!

The parking lot is huge. I've never had a problem finding a spot. If I don't have a rental then I take a lyft or uber, and get dropped off. Nothing stops me from eating here.

The service is really good. The staff consistently checks up on your table to make sure everything is okay, if you need anything, or any refills on your drinks. 

Things I've ordered:
Oysters- love, love, love
Serrano wings- crispy goodness
Ox tail fries- DELICIOUS everytime, perfect flavor combo
Belly buns- okay, I never ordered it again
Beef carpaccio- truffle anything n it's AMAZING
Lobster pho- okay, I did it for the gram (not worth price)
Big bone soup- I LOVE bone marrow, I get this EVERYTIME
Ox tail pho- okay, I like my Ox tail fall off the bone tender
Ox tail fried rice- really good, full of flavor

I want to say that I've ordered everything that I would like to eat from the menu, and now it's hard to choose what I want everytime I go. I try to go with more people, so I can order more and SHARE family style. Sharing is caring!!!

Looks like vegas is calling my name...

One of my faves. Have never had a bad dish or bad service. Be sure to always check out what's fresh and on the specials board as it changes daily and they always have some fun and interesting dishes on there. Great beer selection and some great cocktails. Absolutely try the oxtail pho. So good!!!

Excellent food,  great staff.  Staff was willing to work with first timers from out of town and explain menu items.  Food was served fresh and In a timely manner.  Loved the music,  trendy without being vulgar (so it's safe to bring the kids)

Had the steak and egg. Others had district one combo and pho tai nam. All was not very tasty. Overpriced for what you get. Service was ok. But the food was just so mediocre. Pho tasted sour and the steak and egg was nothing to write home about.

Came back here recently with a friend after a pool party and their food brought us back to life. We ordered the beef pho, spicy beef noodle soup (bun bo hue), and oxtail fried rice to share. Everything was really flavorful, but I thought the bbh was a bit too salty. I think the pho is better if you're looking for more a light broth because the bbh definitely has a kick. We also ordered their fresh coconut juice and felt everything was good. It's a bit expensive for Vietnamese food (our bill came out to nearly $50) and I feel like you can get a decent bowl of pho in that area for a bit less. However, I like the ambience, their unique menu, and customer service was really good so it makes it worth it.

So I have eaten here a couple of times with the family.  Once for dinner and once for lunch.  The food is good and I do appreciate the good service we got on both visits.  On the most recent visit the wife and I had Pho Oxtail, fish tacos and Steak and Egg Rice.  The wife so enjoyed their Pho last time she quickly selected the Pho Oxtail for her lunch.  I went with the Steak and Egg Rice and we went with the fish tacos for our appetizer.  
   The fish tacos were good but got to be honest not great.  The lacked the depth of flavor I expected and were kind of bland.  The Steak dish was slightly too salty which but it was a tasty dish.  It was sweet with a little sour taste and paired well with the rice and over easy egg.  I enjoyed the dish but wish the salt was used a little more sparingly.  
   The highlight of he meal was the Pho Oxtail.  They do some very good Pho and the Oxtail is one of the better ones. The broth was so so good.  It had such a good depth to it.  It was a beef broth with the nice accent of mint in the background.   The mint didn't overpower the dish but was there to add to the delicious flavor.  The meat was plentiful and very tender and good.  The wife was so happy with her choice and she prefers District One's Pho over several other places in town.  
   I do love their ambiance and have been in later in the evening when the crowd is there to have a mixed drink or two and enjoy some great food. It is a happening place and can get very busy in the evenings and on weekends.  The staff is excellent and took good care of us on both our visits.  Funny thing the daughter had been there with a friend just the day before.  She brought home some leftovers and they were so good that we wanted to have D1 for lunch.  I will gladly be back and look forward to another meal at D1.

Oyster specials were good and meaty for $2.50 each.

I came here to try the Live Lobster pho that everyone was raving about. Our server informed us before hand that it was not the season for lobster since they were less than a pound each. So they will be using frozen lobster for the pho. I had to re-evaluate if I still wanted to order this, so I asked them that will the broth be as sweet as if it was made with live lobster. Our server answered yes. So, I went on and ordered it.

IT WAS NOT WORTH IT! $49 for pho made with frozen lobster. It was tasteless and the noodles itself was soggy. I will not recommend ordering this. Also, my friend ordered the Lobster garlic noodles, which was SUPER salty. I will not be back.

One of my favorite restaurants! Known for their lobster and oxtail phos.... i usually go for the steak and eggs if I don't feel like eating pho that day. Their spring rolls are so good! Place is super cool and has a bar. Staff are super friendly and attentive!

HONESTLY didn't know what to expect... but finally got the chance to come in especially since we promised to come in after we met one of the managers while dining at our favorite sushi joint YUMMY GRILL & SUSHI while we were eating at the bar top...

The decor of this place is simple & in my opinion if what I call cute & chic. They have a chalk wall where they have handwritten specials & social media references. They have booths along the wall & tables in the center of the resteraunt with the bar closest to the kitchen. 

We were greeted right away & seated right away. Our hostess gave us a rundown of what they were all about & lucky for us we came in for HAPPY HOUR TIME which we thought ended at 6 but was informed that it ends at 7 YAY =]

Our server came right over & helped us out on what are the best items as well as showing us the portable chalkboard of their daily special! I did wish they had the prices written down though. Multiple servers checked up on us throughout our dinner & constant refills on our waters. 

WHISKEY BARREL BREW BEER 15.00- I personally do not like whiskey but the hubby loves it & I love beer but he doesnt... then this large bottle of AWSOME came along & it was a whole new world & connection for us ahhaha. It was suttle & smooth with a caramely richness with a bit of chocolate bitterness. YOU JUST GOTTA TRY IT!!

VIETNAMESE BEEF CARPACCIO 11.95(9.95 HH) - WOW amazing sauce that it is served with & thinly thinly sliced beef that is rare & o so TENDER!!

SERRANO WINGS 6.95(0.50 each HH) - so crispy & hot (temperature wise) the wings could have definately used a little more seasoning itself but when you eat it with the serranos  it has some more flavor.

GARLIC FRIES 2.95HH - crispy fries with fresh sautéed chopped garlic giving it a full blast of flavor

BIG BONE SOUP 14.95 - O My... FLINTSTONES sized bones as it is served whole bones with some meat at the bottom of the soup bowl with broth! So much marrow comes out of the bones when you poke it out with the knife provided. You also get the tendon!

STEAK & EGGS 13.95 - like the traditional cubed peppered steak that most Vietnamese resteraunt serve but i would say a little different & maybe the least favorite of the choices that I ate but still good. Just different from what I was expecting.

SEA SNAIL SOUP - not really for my taste buds... ahhah the broth was a little too fish saucy for me

1/2 DOZEN OYSTERS 9.95(1.25 each HH) - amazingly fresh with awsome cocktail sauce 

CRISPY EGG ROLLS 6.95(3.99 HH) - taro & pork with veggie filling served with lettuce and mint leaves

OXTAIL LOCO MOCO - a little liquidy compared to most Loco Mocos I have had but maybe that is there style... regardless the flavor is tasty goodness.

OXTAIL FRIES 9.95 - full of flavor & seriously think they use some of the pho broth to make the oxtail sauce that is drenched over the crispy thin fries.

PORK BELLY BUNS 7.95(3.99 HH) - the pork literally just melts in your mouth & the white bun so soft & chewy as it should be 

COCONUT ICE CREAM - not 100% sure if they make it but the ice cream itself also has some chunks in it & it also comes in a fresh coconut shell!

PANDAN CREME BRULEE - I THINK that's wat it was called but honestly the most addicting creme brulee... rich in flavor & vibrant in color with a perfect sugar shell

Overall this is a new favorite place for Vietnamese cravings that is a GIVEN! The broth for the pho soup base also reminds me of pho back in Cali which is always comforting with blasts of flavor!

omg, this place is amazing!!  it's off the strip, there's parking,no waiting, and the food is absolutely delicious!!!  we were in town to celebrate our friend's 30th birthday and before getting all dolled up, our friend recommended this place.  Fantastic choice! We have 7 girls and 1 guy.  We definitely ordered the whole entire kitchen.  Almost all the appetizers, small dishes, and then individual orders!  Love the fried calamari, love love LOVE the oxtail fried rice!!!  it was so good that I, personally, ordered another one!  The pork belly bun was good, but not the best.  Typical spring rolls and egg rolls.  We ordered oysters on a half shell, that was a big disappointment and we all love oysters.  It did not taste...good.  not bad, but definitely not good.  We didn't even finish it.  So we all ordered individual entrees aside from the 20 dishes we had already.  I ordered the Marrow bone soup dish...thing.  I love bone marrow and I just had to have it.  While I'm chomping on the oxtail fried rice, main entree is trickling in.  Wondering where's mine and all of a sudden my friend's eyes looked like a pug.  Just sticking out like it's reaching for something.  I turned around and I saw this monolithic prehistoric bone sticking out of a bowl.  "Marrow Bone Soup" they called out.  Whoa, it's my dish.  I think I had a T-rex bone marrow.  Two giant bone sticking out of my bowl.  I didn't even know how to tackle it, but hey, I love food and I'm not ashamed of it.  I ate it like a true rockstar, my hands and a straw.  Absolutely devine!  I was so happy and enjoying my "bone", hahahaha.  Friends took pictures of me left and right.  It was on point, to perfection.  I definitely enjoyed that dinner.  So if you're there, order the oxtail fried rice, fried calamari, and the marrow bone soup and you'll be just fine.  Man, now I was to go back just for it!
I had the Edamame Xo , it was yummy also tried the tamarind chicken wings and had pho. It was all very tasty and the staff was very friendly.

You would not expect this place to be a Vietnamese restaurant when you walk in. The restaurant vibe and decor was hip and trendy.. not a usual viet restaurant style. The decor was "American-ized". Haha and even more I didn't expect to eat really good viet food at a place like this. I thought it would be very "fusion" from the vibe and decor is the restaurant but it def exceeded my expectations. Came here as our last meal of my friends bach party before heading back to LA. All together we ordered different pho bowls and fried rice. I got their oxtail pho and wow... soup was so clean and not too oily, meat was high quality. It was really good. No really. Their fried rice was simple but very tasty and went perfect with the pho broth. Definitely will be back next time to try their lobster pho and other dishes. 

Service was really good too. All the servers were nice and didn't get our orders wrong, filled up our waters without us asking.

*you need to try their coconut ice cream. Omggggg so gooood. Don't forget to scrape the meat of the baby coconut once you're done with the ice cream.
Came in for a few beers. Got hungry and had the oxtail fries. Atmosphere was awesome, bar tender was knowledgable and friendly, and the fries were awesome.

I was so excited to try this place..there was so much hype and once I tried it, it wasn't all that great. I got the lobster pho and the lobster was over cooked, so chewy! I told the waitress about it and all she said was thank you for telling me. No discount or apology what so ever! Not worth the 40 dollars!  The bf had the ox tail rice and again, not that good, too salty and not what we expected. The customer service was okay, all waiters that were covering our table were not on top of our drinks or what we were ordering. We had to ask multiple times for our drinks, it seemed like they were too busy hosting a bigger group of people. Definitely not as good as it seemed.

I ordered the garlic noodles with steak and fried egg, oxtail fried rice and for the appetizer we had the oxtail fries. 

Personally I felt that everything tasted too salty to my liking. Not sure if they use any msg but possibly due to the saltiness of every plate except the fries I tasted. 

It was definitely a new experience to try something new. Nothing really caught my taste buds to really want to come again though.

Wow,  the best pho I've ever had.  We had the bone marrow soup.  The broth was clear and so flavorful.  And the staff are super friendly.  We were undecided between the chicken wings or spring rolls.  We settled on the wings but the bartender/waitress got us the spring rolls complementary.  Both were really good.  Will definitely come back again.

Excellent food and excellent service. I came in on a busy Friday with a group of 9. Initially they told us the wait was going to be 30 minutes but we were able to be seated within 15. The hostess was very accommodating and even gave us waters while we waited. We ordered a lot of food, I think maybe more than half the menu LOL everything was DELICIOUS! There wasn't one thing that I tried that I didn't like! The only downside was that they were out of the lobster pho so I ended up getting the hue spicy beef noodle soup which was still delicious. The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be sure to stop here again and let's hope they don't run out of the lobster pho again!
I was looking for a late night restaurant and was lucky enough to have read a thrillist article with District One on it.  Love the atmosphere,  the drinks and the food.  Great place!

Was excited to come here after reading all the other reviews. Ended up having to take off one star due to very slow service. Eating if you bowl of noodles should not take this long. Spent well over an hour in the restaurant when I should've taken half as long. I get the feeling that place is more about drinking and about food. If you are interested in getting dinner, I would go somewhere else. If you have lots of time and want to have a few drinks and eat some good food then come here.  Pho was good but took way too long to come. I honk they use MSG too. Fish tacos were quite good. 

Don't think I would come back since I can get pho elsewhere

Beef carpaccio is THE thing to come for.

 Lobster pho is eh, I think personal preference is beef and chicken pho. The lobster was fresh and soup had lobster flavor but didnt blow me out of the water. They also didn't offer the basic beansprouts and jalapeños toppings in the beginning. 

Serrano chicken wings is also eh. Some wings tasted really spicy and some were just mild spice, hit and miss depending on where they sat on the jalapeños, I guess. 

Parking is pretty crazy on a Saturday night since they share the lot with a lot of other businesses. 

TLDR- get beef carpaccio 8) worth the 4 stars for me!

Food and service were excellent! The lobster Pho was exceptional and the bone marrow soup was in a class of its own. Oxtail fries, and the oxtail fried rice were out of this world. Even my dogs were happy...
Such a good cocktail , food and service was very good. The restaurant is clean , staff were nice and we got a free ice cream:) , I recommend it , try the Vietnamese donkey cocktail!

This place is OK. 

I think that the food is decent. I heard about this restaurant from some friends and decided to check it out. I had the grilled squid and it was much chewier than I would have liked. 

The pork belly was pretty good but again, a little strange. Not really my cup of tea. 

I don't think I would eat here again,

Oh, man!! This place is so good. Totally worth the drive into the "Chinatown" of LV. I never knew   this part of town even existed! 

Anyway, a lot of folks say go for the lobster pho... But I would recommend the salted pepper lobster. It's not done exactly in the same style as most salted pepper stuff, but it's pretty close. The sauce is amazing perched a top a bed of garlic noodles. I think it was the owner that came over to us and said that's actually his favorite way of cooking up the lobsters. They don't have it all the time though so we did get pretty lucky. 

We also had the mekong noodles and the sirloin pho. The mekong noodles were really good... Loved the quail eggs in this. I do have to say that the pho was only ok - I would probably not order this again. 

Drinks... They have some great things on the menu. My fiancee and I got the Vietnamese coffee with Henny. Really tasty.

Group din, Sat night. Awesome venue with awesome selections! The cube steak fried rice was amazing! Friends got the big bone oxtail soup bowl, huge and tasty. Papaya salad was great. Wings were great. Prices are a little high, but it Vegas. Overall a great experience. Will now make Disctrict One a must stop each future Vegas trip!

District one is somewhat of a novelty restaurant. They get you to come in by offering things you would not normally see in a typical Vietnamese restaurant. Most notably is the lobster pho, where they put an entire cooked lobster in your noodles. While the idea is clever and unique, the price is a little steep for me. While I do love lobster and pho, I wouldn't pay $50 per bowl for it, especially when I can get a good bowl of pho for under $6 back home. Some of the more affordable dishes are the big bone soup, which has tons of delicious cartilage that just falls off the bone and juicy marrow. There's no noodles in it, just soup, but it's good nonetheless. Ox tail fried rice isn't something you see all the time, but they certainly make it good here. I wish some restaurants in Orange County would start picking this dish up. 

Service is wonderful, but you better get their early or be prepared to wait in a long line!
Great place to eat. Foods amazing. Service is amazing. Awesome food, service, and open late, what else do u want?  Kai's the man!

Pho nam (soup w noodles n beef) is really good for 9.99. Nice portion and good quality. Service friendly and not pretentious. Great selection of spirits. Good, reasonable ,and a very interesting menu.....Lobster Pho......wow! .food is the hit on this trip.. only area of improvement I could see was a better wine list and put drink prices at local prices not the strip. Atmosphere comfortable but nothing over the top to demand nightclub drink prices.  I would return if I was near there.
..

THIS PLACE MAKES ME SO HAPPY.

When you walk into a trendy-looking bar, the last thing you expect is the amazing smell of pho wafting through the air. It's so brilliant. 

I appreciate the decor, cleanliness, service, and of course, the food. Despite the ambience which would be appealing to a younger generation, my parents really enjoy coming here. I've held business meetings here as well. 

Their menu is absolutely solid, and I've been having fun working my way through the list. It's not just fusion for the sake of being fusion -- there are traditional items working in the freshest ingredients. And they make of the best pho in town (and the Mekong River Noodle Soup is also great, harking to the California Tung Kee noodle house combination bowl... I know some of you know EXACTLY what I'm talking about....).

And their creme brûlée and coconut ice cream is worth cramming into your full stomach.

not coming back..... my first time me and my boyfriend we had a GREAT experience and thats why we came back, but after today I don't think Im coming.

We came to the bar and always a great experience we order our food and app, our app came out but after that I had 2 more drinks and still waiting for our food to come out...... 

Still waiting for our food and people that show up after us they got there food and "we still waiting" 
My boyfriend order a steak that came with corn and fries, that corn came first and we wait, Steak came out 5min after so corn was cold by the time steak came out, well we still waiting for My FOOD to 5 7 min after my food came out by that time my boyfriends food was cold.
