No happy at all.... he eat his food cold because first they took FOR EVER, after that they star bringing the items one by one and everything got cold.... 

Yeah the bartender   and drinks was good but everything else was horrible Im sorry but IHATE eating my food cold and nobody came and talk to us to make our experience better so drinks  were good but I don't think im coming back.

A favorite when I'm in Vegas, District One never disappoints. Bottom line: show up with an appetite. The prices won't break the bank either. 

Oysters with ponzu sauce topped with chives and roe? On point.

Garlic noodles topped with braised oxtails? Amazing. 

Crab fried rice? Solid.

Phô? Good, but not the best. 

Overall, get over there if you can. Great late night food.

This was a very trendy Vietnamese fusion place. I loved the interior design and the atmosphere. I got the deep fried pork bun and the garlic noodles with chicken.  I also tasted the fish sauce wings. DONT LET THE SMELL FOOL YOU! The wings were the highlight of the meal. The deep fried buns were ok not really special, and the garlic noodles were too overpowering. Overall it was ok, but not the best

Came here today and had the "Surf and Turf" Pho. It was the lobster + ribeye slices. The broth was very good, a little on the sweeter side. The lobster had some sizable pieces including the claw and the ribeye was of higher quality. 

The only drawback to the "Surf and Turf" pho was that they do not give you as much noodle and it was fairly expensive. It came out to a whopping $33. I would say that you should either try the "Maine Lobster Pho" or "Surf and Turf Pho" at least once, but its probably something that I would only get once. 

They seemed to have a decent collection of whiskey here. I was surprised that they had the Yamazaki Japanese Whiskey which is a definite plus.

I have heard many good things about this place and I am glad I came! I am a fan now because all the raves are all so true!! The restaurant is a huge location and can seat large parties. This place is quite popular during happy hour, weekend, and watching sports! Parking can be a struggle but it's all good. The food is worth fighting for a parking space.  

This is a good place for Vietnamese fusion and are well known for serving lobster PHO!! Presentation makes me drool but I heard it's doesn't taste as good as it looks after finding out you are paying lobster the market place between  $35-45!! Lol... Don't get me wrong.. The pho they serve is better than most pho places in Vegas. Just be prepare for the bill.

Other popular dishes are the bone soup, oxtail fried rice, and the oxtail pho. The serving size is enough to feed 2 ppl. Soup is very rich and flavorful!! They are generous with the noodles too. The best part is that the meat is so tender that it easily falls off the bone. Yum!! 

I love the atmosphere here. Servers always check on you and they aim to please. I plan to come back here again!! I'm looking forward to another bowl of pho!!!

Great customer service. Our server was very friendly and helpful. We ordered their ox tail fried rice, and it was sooo good and not dry like most fried rice. Super moist, just how I like!!;) I would def come back here again when I'm in Vegas!!!
Excellent service. Delicious food.  Slow Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice...!!!  It's so flavorful, a must have!!!  ^_^
Super friendly and delicious food. They keep checking on you and they do their best to satisfy you.

So we go for Happy Hour, order 3 different things. First item comes out fish tacos not bad we finish this and wait for a couple of minutes then our next item comes out, chicken Wings which is good. Then we wait and wait and wait. Ask the server where our garlic fries are? He says it will be a minute. 
Wait 5 more minutes and catch another server ask for him to check on our order of fries and wait. We are deciding if we want to order more items. 30 minutes pass and hooray we finally get our fries. NO APOLOGY nothing just here is your order of fries. Kinda of irritated now especially as the fries are not even HOT! 

Bill comes and they charge us for 2 orders of garlic fries. After telling them again NO APOLOGY! Guess that equal NEVER COMING BACK!!!!! 

2 stars cause tacos & wings weren't bad
Awesome food and atmosphere! Love the pork belly buns and spicy garlic chicken wings! Lobster pho next..!!

Welcoming environment, clean and modern decor. Came in here for a quick lunch, ordered the Mekong(shrimp and pork) river pho. The broth tasted natural and flavorful and not over powering. I like the added garnishes(roasted garlic and ground pork meat). Not your typical pho joint(in a good way)

Delicious food and great service.  My favorite is the ox tail fried rice and the beef carpaccio.  I've had pretty much everything on the menu and there was not anything that I did not like.  Their drinks are great too.  Looking forward to coming back next time we're in Vegas. Also Congratulations on the new location!

YA'LL THE PHO HERE IS BOMB. 

I have been sleeping on District One and so happy I am awoken now. After dying in Vegas and not getting out of bed until 5PM my friends and I decided to revive our lives with some pho, the ultimate hangover cure... 

My friends were saying they went before and had to wait 45 minutes so I was a little hesitate to give this place a shot. However, when we went inside there was no wait. BLESS UP. 

The broth flavor is indescribable. But what really makes their bowls of pho so great is the meat to noodle ratio. They be stackin' & packin' their meats!!! So happy I did not let the wait time or the 110 degree whether from stopping me from coming here. This will definitely be a stable for whenever I am in Vegas. Until next time District One!

This review is for 3.5 stars.

District One is one of those places where it's hit or miss depending on the wait staff, time of day, and luck.  The restaurant itself is very hip when you walk in and doesn't give off that usual Asian sit-down vibe like the other restaurants in the area.  District One has a feeling of hanging out, and should be a go-to Happy Hour spot for some of the food.  Drinks aren't cheap though, so keep that in mind.

I had the meatball pho, pork buns, and chicken wings.  Meatball pho was just ok.  I know I should have gone for one of their flagship oxtail or bone marrow phos, but I messed up - shame on me.  The chicken wings had a nice kick but were all in all ordinary Asian wings.  The pork buns were amazing.  The bun, the meat, the filling, all top notch.  Come during Happy Hour for a great deal and get a few orders of them.

The complaints are long; if it wasn't for the solid food and the ultimate finale of our situation, I would have given 2 stars for sure.  First off, after being immediately seated in an almost empty restaurant at about 5pm, the waiter took 10 minutes just to take our order.  He brought over a different beer than what we asked for and then when we placed our order, it took 40 minutes to come out, all at the same time, not staggered as appetizers and mains should be.  Apparently the kitchen gave our order to another table which just blows my mind because no way somebody ordered our exact dishes.  But the worst part was that no waiter came by to check up on us during this 40 minutes without food, even with empty beer up to that point.  We ultimately just packed our appetizers in to-go boxes straight away and only ate the pho at the restaurant because we were in a hurry.  The waitress comped both appetizers, which is nice, but still doesn't make up for the previous 45 minute meal experience.

Loved my visit here! I was afraid the food would be too Americanized for my taste but I was so wrong. We had the ox tail pho and it was delish!! Flavorful and very beefy. My brother ordered the "big bone" on the side and it too was amazing! So much flavor and the marrow was so so so good!! For the amount and quality of pho, I was surprised by how cheap the prices were. This is a must try when in Vegas!!

A little pricey for pho, but the soup was very good! And the beef ribeye on top was an added bonus compared to basic thin slices beef you'd get from other places. They have a lobster pho that we wanted to taste, but at $40+ a bowl we decided to pass.

I've had my fair share of pho in Las Vegas and hands down D1 makes the best bowl in town! The broth isn't too oily (like most) and doesn't even need much sauce to amp the flavor. Their appetizers never let me down.. The Vietnamese beef carpaccio is absolutely delicious!!

The restaurant is kept clean and the design is way beyond than your average Vietnamese joint. Two thumbs up guys!

I've been to District One twice in 1 week - that's how good it is.  See Marcus or Khai.  They'll make sure you get exactly what you want.  I ordered the pho with shrimp the first time I went, which was very good.  The 2nd time, I asked Marcus how to get more veggies in my pho, so he had me order the veggie pho with a side of shrimp.  Perfect!  Clean, reasonably priced, great music & they'll be receiving their liquor license soon.  I can't wait to go back!

This is where the old Cravin Cajun used to be.  Plenty of seating.  Very unique menu, but primarily Vietnamese cuisine.  Had the oxtail fries and the bone marrow soup.

The bone marrow soup is picture worthy only because it is something you don't see everyday.  Two gigantic bones on a shallow bowl.  It was kind of difficult to eat because the bowl was so shallow, but the flavor was great.  Bone marrow tastes like butter to me.  The broth is beef/pho.  

The oxtail fries were okay.  I'm used to Bachi Burger's oxtail chilli cheese fries.  Here, it's just oxtail marinated in sauce minus the chilli.  Includes an over easy egg.  

I would say it is an experience to eat here, but overall I think it was just okay.

What an expensive Vietnamese pho restaurant. What they are advertising is their ox tails. Almost everything is ox tails. 
-parking: a big parking lot for this plaza. 
-service: we came in and the lady sat in the counter told me if I was ok to seat by the bar, we can go for it. I asked her there were not two seats together, I didn't want to have my brunch with different seats with my hubby. She said she could grab a chair which she never did, she didn't even remember she told me what she would do for us. Maybe she's over busy, but it didn't seem very busy that she could handle with the crowds. As soon as we settled ourselves, we had to wave to ask for service, that time was not much people ordered drinks either. 
-ox tail fried rice: it tasted like they pre made in the kitchen, as soon as we placed the order, they brought to us in 5 minutes. It's a heavy dish, ox tail meats was stuck together, not evenly. We definitely felt heavy after this plate. 
-ox tail soup that is what they are famous for. We have to wait about 30 minutes for them to bring it over, we didn't have any updates with our order. Nothing special for this bowl of soup. The ox tail was hard to chew on, the meat was still stick on the bone. The noodles was very hard, it's tasted like lack of time to cook. The soup base was a bit sour. Flavorless ! 
-price: the fried rice was $15.99, same as the soup. Very expensive ones. 
Good to try and also good to not going bav

Amazing spot for quick lunch and delicious drinks!! I'm seriously impressed with their drink menu, and I wasn't expecting the presentation to be so good too. I had a coconut mojito that came in a coconut, which they later cut up so I could enjoy with the juice.

Food wise, everything was delicious. Beef carpaccio is a must try - loved the combo of peanut, onion and salty. The chicken wings had the right amount of spice and were super juicy.

Pho wise, I had the pho tai nam with added meat balls. The balls were a fav and had a good amount of chew. Portion sizes were generous and there was so much meat! 

Bonus - this place is perfect if R&B is your jam. Their playlist was on point.

Every time I am in town I stop by.  Had there Lobster Pho which I have never seen before and it's amazing.  Oxtail fried rice is another great dish.  Bun no wei which is also good.  The service and food is great here.

Spacious restaurant! I've been wanting to go here every time I'm in Vegas because of all the lobster pho posts on IG, but it's off the strip and no one wants to go. However, this time around, we made it!! And I'm soooo happy I finally tried the lobster pho! Of course it's pricy: $50, but it was amazing!! I loved how the broth was beefy and not seafoody, the lobster was delicious! We also tried the carpaccio, which was okay. The egg roll was good, and they're regular beef pho was phonomenal! I believe their late night HH included Jameson shots for just $5/shot! What a steal!!! I'd definitely come back.

My friends really wanted to try their surf and turf pho - rib eye and lobster. They thought the flavor was good and liked the combo. I opted for the oxtail pho. My bowl was tasty as the flavors from the oxtail made it great.  I liked how the meat was cooked and easily comes off the bone. We also ordered the oxtail fries and the beef salad. The fries almost reminded me of poutine fries. They were a bit soggy as the juices/gravy soaked in them. The beef salad was good as the beef was very tender (I wished the pieces were a bit better).

Grabbed lunch here with my family.  My mom and I shared the Belly buns (4/5). The bun was soft and yummy and the pork belly was full of flavor.  The big bone soup (5/5) really has big bones and the soup is very, very tasty....BOMB! I loved it and ate it with a bit of rice.  I tried the hubby's steak and egg and wow! that dish is delicious. I want to go back and try other things.
Shaken beef salad was amazing. Shrimp skewers were delicious. The atmosphere is relaxed and comfortable. I am already planning our return meal.

"LIke"  yes I do. I love the food, ambience and service. They are sometimes busy but will attend to you and won't forget you. 

What we ordered here was oxtail soup, oxtail fried rice, oxtail fries, steak and eggs, Serrano wings, garlic noodles and belly buns. All the oxtail were delish. I love oxtail and they did it justice. The crispy wings had a little heat but it's one you should try. The garlic noodles was OK but I've had better. The pork buns was delish and really good. It had nice price of pork/fat pork which yeah gross I love the fat part of the pork bun.  

We didn't wait to long to be seated maybe cause dinner rush was over. We were seated in the big table. Had a good view of the bar/TV and say for us to get the waitress attention if needed. 

Parking ugh now that's another story. It's hate it. No street parking but I've parked across the street in the other plaza. Luckily I haven't gotten towed..

Wow ! So yummy ! I loved this food "Careaccio "
With Beef .....
& a lot food good design & good

Good food. Family fun time. Good service. Would recommend coming back. The ice cream is a must have. 
Update: Came here two more times during my trip in Vegas and once again I was not disappointed. Everything was excellent and the service was good. The coconut ice cream is always a must have.

Party of four, 3 pho, 1 clay pot.

Service 2 stars - good try but left us hanging at the end

Food 3 stars - it was so-so. We could have gotten the same quality with better service elsewhere

My biggest pet peeve was the wait time. It took 30 mins to be seated, 45 minutes after ordering to receive our food; we were done eating in 10-12 minutes. The restaurant was full when we got there and more than half empty when we were done. One of the worst services I've had in my life.

Superb! I am an asian food junkie and I had an amazing ox tail pho and I went back today for the Vietnamese Carpaccio.....

Get off the strip and head over District One!

I have finally found a Pho restaurant that I can call my favorite. Friendly staff, especially Renz, who was all smiles & friendly for us at 1am. This place looks awesome inside and what was pretty neat to me was on the way to the bathroom, there are about 4 sinks lined up in the hallway! 

I normally think Pho is Pho. It's all the same. But I think that with the nice atmosphere and the friendly staff, my food tasted so good. Especially the incredible crispy and delicious chicken wings! At other Pho places I normally order Pho Dat Biet but I never eat the tripe and when I am here, I always order Pho Tai Nam, which is perfect because it's a combination bowl basically, without the tripe. Meant to be!

Their Happiest Hours Monday-Friday are from 5pm-7pm and Sunday-Thursday 12am-2am.

At about 1am there was hardly anyone at the restaurant but when I came here to eat again it was packed at about 8pm! I have yet to figure out a good, reasonable time to go where you don't have to wait for seating, but I do believe this place is worth the wait!

We originally came for PHO, but ended up eating off the Happy Hour menu except for one of us who actually ordered PHO. 

This place has a really good Happy Hour Menu.  What we ordered:

Serrano Pepper Wings (6pc) .50 ea
Belly Buns (2) $3.99

Crispy Egg Rolls (4) $3.99

Green Papaya Salad $5.99

Garlic Fries $2.99

I was really happy with it, especially the Green Papaya Salad.  I couldn't stop telling my co-workers how much I enjoyed it.  It was great in taste.  Not to salty, nor to spicy.  

I didn't care too much for the belly buns.  They were just okay.  The garlic fries, wings and egg rolls were decent.  The wings had the right amount of heat.

Service was good.  Made reservations and when I got there it wasn't busy.  Waiter told me to pick a seat.  I was offered a drink when I sat down and the staff was attentive to when the rest of my party arrived.

I did wish they had calamari on the Happy Hour menu.

So with that being said, I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu.  Happy Eatings!
The food here is really good. Servers were nice. If you are ever in town, you got to try their lobster pho.
Hands down my new favorite spot to bring friends and family . The live  scallops n oysters were amazing !

I recently went to Las Vegas for a conference, and my girlfriend and I were craving pho before going out. So we took to Yelp and saw that this place was pretty well rated, and decided to give it a shot. After eating here, I'm sort of depressed. This was basically the best rare steak pho I've ever had, being on par with OB Noodle House in Ocean Beach, CA (which I think is the best). Pho is one of my favorite foods, and it really is a sad twist of fate that a bowl of pho this good is so far away from my hometown in Orange County. 

For starters, the broth was absolutely delicious. There was a hint of anise that was just enough to recognize, but it was downplayed by the clove, which was the star in my book. The broth had a nice complexity to it, but at the same time, it was that simple, wholesome broth that you expect from a good bowl of pho. 

The meat - wow. A good cut of ribeye that also happened to have a fair amount of marbling (I always get the meat on the side) for this type of food. It was perfect. The service was also very good, the staff were all nice. I definitely will be back here the next time I come to Vegas.
Love this place. Great drinks and amazing oxtail fried rice.  Very knowledgeable about different spirits.

This place has good food and good service. Although it is pricier than a typical pho in chinatown, it was worth it! 

The interior was very modern and somewhat americanized so I honestly had my doubt about authenticity at first. There was no wait for 3 people since we sat by the bar. Our bartender/ server was very friendly. She recommended me to get oxtail pho so I did.

To decorate on the service, my friend had a surprised feminine call of nature and the server rushed to get her some emergency feminine hygiene products very discreetly! ( Mind you, we were sitting at the bar next to a few guys!) 

The oxtail pho had very flavorful clear broth as it should be. The noodles weren't impressive; however, the meat was so tender it fell off apart from the bone itself. I was so in love with every spoonful.

My friend got lobster pho. She was so hyped about it since she saw the video online and that was merely the reason why we went in the first place. Sadly, it didn't live up to her expectations and it was just average.

We had a very good experience nonetheless!

The good: 
I've been here four times and I have to say that their appetizers are really good...like really really good. The oysters are to die for. Seriously. They are so sweet and taste so clean and refreshing.  The beef carpaccio is really unique and our table had to re-order it twice in one sitting because it was that good. The wings were also a hit. 

The mediocre:
All of the entrees I've tried were just okay.  I've had the Mekong river noodles, lobster pho, shaking beef, bone marrow soup, and short rib with rice and none of them were really that good.  The lobster pho did not taste better than any other pho (actually less flavorful).  For some reason everything was very bland compared to the appetizers. 

The bad:
The Porkchop with rice was extremely dry. Three people at our table ordered it and had to force it down. 

Overall, the appetizers overshadow the main courses, hands down. It's like they build you up for something really amazing and then kinda let you down. Regardless, I will keep coming back for the oysters.

Really enjoyed this place!  Hip comfortable place for some seafood and appetizers.  Sake and happy hour makes this place worthwhile.  We had the pork belly buns and they were warm and soft and delicious!

So disappointed  I drove from the southeast  part of Las Vegas  I got there and there was no bone marrow  soup.  Lesson learned so 2nd time I called told me in about 3 hours I got tired of the long time so I went somewhere else. 3rd time I called they said they had the soup so I drove there again. Took them almost 45 minutes to prepare  it. I am thinking this  would  be awesome. Someone asked me if I wanted something to drink so I ordered  iced coffee. When  he came back he said there was no cream so I said forget the coffee bring me my soup. Finally it came it was a big bone soup, I was imagining  all the bone marrow  that I was getting I was so excited, I put my knife  inside the bone no marrow.  The other bone had a little  so I was ok until someone  ask me how the food was I told her about the situation  and she totally agreed  with me, she went to the kitchen  to talk to the chef and the answer was  it depends on the cut of the bone. The name of the soup was big bone soup the description  said it has marrow on it. But there was a tiny tiny marrow in this humongous bone. I'm sorry but I'm not coming back.  By the way the service was good but I  drove there  twice for the bone  marrow soup. For me it didn't  happen.

My family and I had watched an episode of "Worth It," where they went around trying pho and we immediately bookmarked District One for any future Las Vegas trips. Today it happened, we wanted my husband to try the surf and turf pho for his Father's Day meal and we all ended up having a bite or two of it. The broth was delicious and complimentary to the vegetables and proteins. We also ordered the garlic noodles, spicy pork green beans and ox tail fries. Had we all not filled up on broth we wouldn't have had any left overs. Since it was Father's Day my husband was given a complimentary beer which was greatly appreciated. I enjoyed a coconut mojito that is served in a tender coconut with fresh mint in it. It was delicious and refreshing, I couldn't get enough of it. It felt never ending!! All in all we had an amazing meal and experience, if you're in the area give it a whirl.

3.5 stars for this visit, I will round up to 4.

My friend suggested we come here for dinner since he was in the mood for Asian food. District One is trendy Vietnamese fusion restaurant. I had trouble finding parking (Saturday night), so had to park across the street.

Service was good, and people checked on us regularly and refilled our waters. The menu wasn't huge, and I decided to pick one of their specialty dishes, lobster pho.

The pho comes with a whole lobster, and a decent amount of meat. While the dish was tasty overall, I was actually expecting the broth to be richer, considering that it was cooked with an entire lobster. 

The menu did say market price, and I knew lobster wouldn't be cheap, but the bowl of lobster pho ended up costing $49, and after tax and tip, I spent $61 on my meal. Not really worth it in my opinion. I could have bought an entire fresh lobster and made my own pho for under $30. 

Not super impressed by my first visit, but I'm sure other dishes are more reasonably priced, and there were many seemingly appealing dishes on the menu.

This review is for their 2018 Las Vegas Restaurant Week three-course lunch menu, which features items on their standard menu.

District One is that cool, hip and casual neighborhood restaurant that I wish I had in my own neighborhood. Its menu offers delectable dishes inspired by cuisine from various Asian countries.  

First course - Spring Rolls: Fresh and light and with a delicious crunch. The two rolls were packed with vermicelli, lettuce, shrimp, and pork, which was omitted for me upon my request. The peanut sauce perfectly complemented the appetizer and had balanced flavors of both sweet and salty. I feel like oftentimes I receive a peanut sauce that's just sweet. 

Second Course - Pho Tom: Despite the hotter than hell weather outside, I have no regrets about ordering this soup. This was full of shrimp and long vermicelli noodles that swam in a light and flavorful broth. 

Third Course - Pandan Creme Brulee: I love me some dessert after a meal, and this was it. Flavors were subtle and not overly sweet, which was just enough to satisfy my sweet tooth. 

Overall: I'm hoping this will become one of my favorite restaurants to dine at in town. I cannot wait to return.

Was craving pho & came here on a Friday night. The host seated us right away! (Group of 2) The ambiance was cool. It reminds me of boiling crab but with a bar! 

Review based on the pho. I guess I'm just used to golden deli in Cali but yeah the pho was a little off to me. Also, the spring rolls was a little different to me just cuhs the flavor was an acquired taste. The only way I can describe it is "sweet & minty." I like the little crunch tho. 

On the plus side, the service was great! I don't know if we had a specific server but there was a couple girls going around. Myra was super attentive! She kept making rounds for anything we needed. 

Overall, everyone was great. Pho alone was ok, but I might try to chicken rice next time. Everyone seems to be eating that when we came in!
The pho tai rib eye was very satisfying and not too overwhelmingly salty!  Very deliciousssssss! Thanks for having us district 1

Went here with a couple friends, and we enjoyed our dinner at District One!

I had the Oxtail Fried Rice and the Chicken Wings.  They also got the wings as well as the Steak and Eggs.  Everything taste great so far.  Can't wait to try out more of the menu.

The restaurant is big and they have a full bar.  They decor is nice and modern.  Service was great, as there was a moderate amount of people and didn't have any missed orders.   Hope I can make it to happy hour on the next visit.  Definitely want to try the Oxtail Loco Moco :-)
First time here. Staff were very good and the food had lots flavor. They have lots of tv's so we were able to watch the warriors game. Would definitely come back to this place again!

I came here for lunch with a bunch of friends. Since it's fusion Asian food, you can expect higher prices. There are some more interesting things like lobster pho and oxtail fried rice on the menu. 

I ordered the chicken pho which was nice I guess. Tasted basic with chunks of chicken. Pork belly seemed very tender.
Omg yessss!!! This place is sooooooo good like seriously I wold come back anytime! I had there stake and eggs and it was so good! And there ice cream is the besttt!!!

A friend suggested that we go to this place being the foodie that we are, me and my husband. The friend said their best seller is the big bone soup which is good for 3 people at the very least. So we went one night after 9pm. To our dismay, the receptionist told us there is 10 minute wait...it is ok. But it wqs already pushing to 20 when we were seated. Furthermore, she said a COUPLE OF MINUTES for the server is but waited 5 minutes. And to make the night worst...they were out of the big bone soup. You decide

This is a great restaurant with owners and most employees try their hardest to make sure this place is running great. I will continue to come back disregarding my previous visit. Thank you for the great food and service.

I like District One for its unique atmosphere. The food is great, the menu is extensive with plenty of options to choose from & the service is pleasant. The restaurant has an upgraded modern urban touch to it. Everything catches your eye! From the cocktails to the pho soups & other food items, to the decor. It's not your ordinary restaurant. It's Vietnamese food with a modern twist. Definitely recommend it for anybody who wants to try something new & different!

I was hungry for a nice salad & based upon the reviews of District ONE I thought I should check it out.  When I arrived they were quite busy during lunch but I was able to score a seat at the bar.  Service was efficient & the staff I engaged conversation with were super friendly & nice.  The full flavors from my green papaya salad with shrimp danced around my mouth long after I finished - it was delicious!! Thank you for making this such a wonderful dining experience for even a simple salad.  I will definitely be back to try new items next time!
Excellent service. Way beyond expectation. Happy hour specials was the favorite part. Ordered some pho, wings, oysters and the bomb ass porkbelly . Definitely returning for that famous lobster pho.

Gotta try the talked about town fusion pho place in Vegas! The famous big bone soup is to die for, the oxtail soup is amazing and the lobster soup is superb, people here is super friendly and the service is super fast and efficient! So come on and dig in! Don't leave Vegas without trying!
Good food, nice ambience, reasonable price, ample food serving, attentive server. Will come back if in the area.

My rating would be like a 3.7 so I rounded up.
Food is good. We ordered the Pho Oxtail, Vegetarian Spring Rolls, Belly Buns, Chicken Clay Pot, and the Fresh Coconut. Hubby said Oxtail Pho was good, but no wow factor. Belly buns were good, bread was really fluffy. Spring rolls were okay, but a little to minty for my personal taste (vermicelli), although the peanut sauce was amazing! Chicken clay pot was good but again, too strong with herb flavors. The coconut was great, I love coconuts so it was great, nice and cold.  Service was good, never felt forgotten and she was really nice. Atmosphere was very nice.

District One has been a late night eat for my friends & myself on occasions. They have some good oxtail fries, oysters, & oxtail soup in addition to a pretty decent alcohol selection. Everything else I have tried so far is okay. Their service isn't horrible. The only trend I've noticed is that they can get slow when it comes to refills, especially during late nights. One thing I see others are a fan of is their infamous lobster pho. Maybe next time?!

Being Vietnamese myself, this is honestly my new favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  It has a modern look, and nice modern menu to go along with it.

I went here with my wife, 1 year old, and mom.  The service for all of us was superb, even for my child.

We had the Pork Belly Buns, Ox Tail Pho, "Steak and Eggs", and the Slow Braised Pork.

The Ox Tail Pho here is amazing, definitely bang for your buck.  The meat on the tail is perfect, and the amount of noodles they give is the perfect amount.  All Vietnamese places in Vegas usually give a tiny amount.

The Pork Belly Buns were delicious.

The steak and eggs were perfectly made, the steaks were nicely marinated.

The Slow Braised Pork is nice and soft.  The sauce is perfect, and loved the way the egg was cooked. 

We will definitely be back!

This place is a gem here in Vegas. Best food and amazingly priced! My nail guy, Harry (who works and owns the amazing Exquisite Nails) recommended this place because his friend, Nelson owns the joint. Not only did Nelson take care of us but (again) the food and service was out of this world!

Amazing!!! Foood was so good, my husband and I did not know where to go for our typical date night so we decided for a new place. Great place tobcheck out. Atmosphere is mellow, food delicious,  pho was to die for especially on a chilly night. Check it out

Came here to try the famous whole lobster pho with some friends. We thought it was good, but agreed that it  wasn't enough to justify the $49 price tag, but with trying once! 

I ordered the Surf and Turf ($35), which is half a lobster and sliced ribeye. The ribeye was very tender and the flavor of the broth was authentic (according to this Viet ). Their matcha Thai iced tea was also very good. My fiancé ordered it, but I ended up really liking it and ended getting one to go too.

First time here, and my impression was it was okay. The hubby and I ordered the wings and fish tacos for appetizer, no real wow factor. Dinner I had the steak and eggs with garlic noodles. The steak was real tender but became a little salty after continuous eating. The garlic noodles were, meh. The hubby ordered the cornish hen which he enjoyed, it seemed to have a nice crisp to it and flavor was there. If I return I may try the pho since they have a selection of flavors. Their version of the moscow mule the Vietnamese something was good. Refreshing with the lime taste and lychee.

Nice place. Great service. Food was good. Only three stars because I was hoping for better tasting food. We had the short ribs with rice- needed more flavor. Oxtail pho was good. The grilled squid could've been better.

Already open for a year and I just stopped by for the first time about a month ago. Happy hour is the way to go if you're looking to keep spending to a minimum. A slight fishy taste didn't stop me from enjoying the tiny fish tacos. The wonton shell added some great crunch to the sashimi yellowtail. The fanny bay oysters provided a balance of sweetness to the salinity of the oysters and caviar on top, with a touch of heat that trailed at the end. The beef carpaccio was unfortunately drowning in sauce. Half the amount would have been plenty to make the beef, onions and peanuts shine. My favorite item was the pork belly buns. The deep fried buns were a nice contrast to the standard chewy bao buns. And, of course, pork belly never disappoints. No Vietnamese restaurant is complete without pho. Their pho tai rib eye is plenty big enough for two to share, with a wonderfully aromatic broth covering a large mound of noodles and beef.
The food was great with good service. It's has a hipster vibe with good modern music. We will be back soon. Good work District one Kitchen.

This place is one of our absolute favorite places to eat and drink. They always have delicious food and their service has been excellent 9 out of 10 times. None of the food we've ever ordered had failed us. It's either phenomenal or at least above average.

Food that we felt were extraordinary:
Pho'getti, Steak & Eggs (shaken beef and tomato rice, omg, I never knew it could be so good), their special raw oysters of the day, Garlic Noodles.

Food that my guests felt was extraordinary, but I didn't really feel that way:
Live Whole Maine Lobster Pho, Oxtail Fried Rice.

Food that we always order because it goes great with beer and because we trust the food and taste quality here:
Garlic Fries, Chicken Wings, Grilled Whole Squid, Fish Tacos.

Other food we tried that were delicious and beyond average, but not something I necessary go back for:
All their pho is really good, Fried Calamari.

Their prices are on the pricier side, but it is worth it once in a while.  My only complaint is that no matter how many times I ask, they just don't carry ranch.  I get it, you know.  Vietnamese restaurants don't normally carry ranch condiments, and they probably are a little anal about the way their food should taste and don't want people to ruin it with ranch.  And maybe that's what makes this place so stable and reliable in their food.  I always know what to expect.  But c'mon...  You have fries and chicken wings, why not ranch?  Sometimes all I want is bar food, and that's why I want that ranch.  Well, one time, I brought my own ranch and they were okay with it.  Lol!

When it comes down to it, we really come to this place because we love the atmosphere.  Yes, the amazing food keeps us coming back, but it's the service, the people, and the atmosphere that makes us feel comfortable and right at home.

Heard good rave about this place so I had to try it.  I might say it was a little disappointed.  The place is clean. Food presentation was great, food wise not impressed. Order  chicken wing-very bland, no flavor what so ever not even the chile. Fish tacos- could not taste the fish only avocado, made me wonder if there were any fish so I head to do a double take. Bun bo- good flavor just a little too salty for my taste.  Best thing that  actually  redeem itself was the oxtail fried rice, it was delicious. Overall will  give it another.

We started with the oysters.  Defiantly hit the spot.  We then moved on to the pork belly rolls which were delicious.  Definitely a must try and even though I am not a huge fab of crab legs they were good and already cracked which made to great and easy to eat.  Good selection of beer and the bone marrow was good along with some loco moco rice!   I wasn't to hungry so will have to come back for more . Defiantly a good place and the server were very attentive and asked of first time so they were good at making recommending stuff for this trip and for next one.   When in doubt who better than the people who work there.

Unfortunately this 400th review of mine is about my not so great food experience here.

Maybe because this establishment was rated so high and all the hype about the Lobster Pho...but anywho, here it is.

We ordered:
Lobster Pho (MP - today was $30): Sure there is a lobster presented in this bowl, but seriously, it's just the typical beef broth, and a broken down lobster where the meat is pretty tough to chew.  It probably would have been better if the broth itself is made of a seafood broth?  Pretty disappointed. 

Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice ($9): Few pieces of cubed pork belly, one egg (halved), served with a bowl of rice, and a bowl of pickled cabbage and carrots.  Earl enjoyed the pickled cabbage.  This was an ok dish.  Nothing that will warrant us to order it again.

House Special Oysters ($10): We ordered the smaller portion (consisted of 6 oysters).  They were topped with soy sauce, tobiko, slice of jalepeno and something else.  The oysters were small and not sweet.  

Sculpin ($8): Earl was pretty excited that they have Sculpin here.
Overall, food was mediocre at best, based on the items we ate.  Taste does not justify the cost.

The ambience, however, was great.  There was a bar, and many tvs to watch sports, news, and whatever else.

Earl said he would come back for happy hour.  I don't care for drinks so I will pass.

I met up with a friend of mine here today. Parking was full today. I had to park on the next strip parking area. 

The restaurant was packed and loud.

The place offers Vietnamese cuisine and incorporates Japanese, Thai, Chinese, and American influences onto a menu of seafood, appetizers, rice bowls, and noodle soup. 

We ordered The Big Bone Soup, OMG it was huge!! there were some bone marrow inside the bones. It was average, not really worth $17.99 but it satisfied my craving. 

Happy Hour is from Mon-Friday 5pm-7pm and Sunday from 12am-2am.

From the Happy hour menu, we had Fish Tacos, Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio which was surprisingly flavorful and Belly Buns.

The service was attentive. Overall, 3.5 stars on food but I rounded up to 4 stars for the great service.

The food here is pretty good. I wish the oxtail pho was more flavorful than what it was. It tasted like regular pho but they added the oxtail to it. It didn't taste like they made the broth of ox tail.

The ox tail fried rice was okay. The pieces of oxtail were delicious, but the rice itself was way too garlicky for my liking. It seriously over powered everything and you were left with the garlic residue in your mouth for the rest of the night. And don't even get my started on your burps. 

The service was good, but the night I came there was a 50th birthday, so I think there was more staff working that night. 

I really like the decor in the restaurant it's really cozy and cute. It kind of reminds me of boiling crab.

I definitely want to come back and try those baos! They looked so good!

I've always heard great things about this place and finally had a chance to check it out with family tonight. We came during happy hour and ordered some items off that menu--a few cocktails and $5 beers, as well as pork belly buns and egg rolls which were very good. My mom and I split the 18oz ribeye which was amazing! And the boys ordered pho. Staff was in the middle of shift change but a were promptly switched over to another server who accommodated all of our needs.
The atmosphere is really cool too. Decorated but not too cluttered. This place is family friendly too :) and background music is great :) :) I will be back!

Customer service is excellent. Keeping water refilled and also food was delivered piping hot and fresh. The highlights were the: Two bone marrow, Grilled Squid, Oysters, Oxtail Fried rice, Pork Belly buns. The other dishes were OK, including the lemon grass snail, beef carpaccio and Chinese clay pot. 

I'm not usually a big fan of fusion, but when it's done right - it's pretty cool and this restaurant hands down does it extremely well. I was pleasantly surprised.

The restaurant is bright, large, clean and has a fully stocked bar with a bunch of screens for watching sports. I will definitely be back if I return to Vegas.

Trendy Asian fusion restaurant off the Strip. 

Happy hour 5-7pm for food and drinks. 

Tasty food. I recommend the chicken wings, pork belly buns and grilled shrimp skewers. 

The green papaya salad didn't taste right.

My Girlfriend and I went to try it out because we knew the owner from his family's other restaurant. Everything was excellent from the second we walked in until we walked after finishing. Greeted right away by wait staff and owner then seated. Started with some Delicious Shrimp Papaya Salad as an appetizer, then for our meal 2 very generous size bowls of Pho with Ribeye that were also very good. Then as we finished the waitress asked if we would like some dessert and recommended the coconut icecream inside of a young coconut topped with roasted nuts, all I could say is WOW. District one also has a very nice bar and great happy hour. I had a great experience, we definitely will be back there again.

Friends and I got garlic noodles, house special oysters, oxtail fried rice, chicken wings, and steak and eggs (substitute rice for garlic noodles). Everything was okay, nothing really wow'd my taste buds. I would give this place another try and go with what the server recommends. I think I didn't order the right items to know if I like this place or not. 

The only thing I was disappointed in was my bottled beer. I was given a cold glass and the beer was still lukewarm.

District One isn't a traditional Vietnamese  restaurant but definitely a modern fusion focused on Vietnamese food. The flavors here are very refined and almost everything I've had here would at least be described as delicious. 

Service is thorough and attentive here. I've never had an issue throughout my half a dozen or so visits.

They have an impressive list of beers and whiskeys as well as other spirits, for an Asian restaurant. 

Some of my favorite items to grab here are the short rib rice, the pho and any of their happy hour specials.

I only knock off one star because the prices definitely are on the higher side here. The basic pho isn't different enough to justify a higher cost. Still one of the best places to go for Asian food late night.

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(89/365) "Cravin' Cajun Reincarnated"

A bunch of us stopped in as a plan B after we sadly found out that I-naba was closed for the evening. Restaurants these days have the wierdest names!?!? I kept calling this restaurant One Direction!? After finding out the correct name, it still reminded me of The Hunger Games, not a restaurant!?!?  Oh well....

We shared a few apps and started out with the Tamarind Wings and the Garlic Serrano Pepper Wings which were both puny in portion and very underwhelming.
We also shared the Beef Carpaccio which was delicious and the star of the appetizers.

For my entree, I ordered the District One Combo Plate with The Kalbi short ribs. I asked to substitute Vietnamese Red Rice with extra garlic. This plate was good, but not great. Nice taste and char on the short ribs, but unfortunately, the rice was red, but kinda bland and there was no extra garlic like I asked for. there also was pieces of Chinese sausage and a little pile of kimchi on the plate as well but seemed like it didn't really flow with the rest of the components. 

After getting a taste of Amelinda's Slow Braised Pork Belly in Coconut Water (SO FRICKIN' ONO!!!!!) That would be THE dish I would return for. If you have the chance, order this dish. Don't ask questions, JUST DO IT!!!  ALOHA!!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  3.5 

*Little more than A-Ok right now with wiggle room for improvement...

We wanted to be adventurous one night so we decided to try District One. Once we were there, I remembered that I had been there once when I first moved here, but I couldn't remember anything besides the interesting drink menu.

The decor inside is kind of a mix between a casual restaurant and a sports bar. They have a lot of interesting-sounding dishes, but unfortunately, a lot of them do not live up to their interesting descriptions.

The garlic chicken wings were probably the last thing we ordered that came out, and I was excited for them the whole time we waited. By the time they came, they were pretty disappointing. Very dry and no flavor on the outside. When I asked for any sort of sauce they thought could go with it, they brought me a chipotle mayonnaise, which was really unappetizing and does not go with chicken wings.

We got the short rib, which was alright, but extremely salty, to the point that I couldn't eat more than a few bites.

We also ordered a papaya salad, as my boyfriend love love loves those, and he said it was the worst he's had :/ After having a few papaya salads since then I would have to agree. It was just not made the same way they usually are - very little flavor and no crunch to the salad.

On a high note, the garlic noodles were very good as was the steak tartare, which I believe was titled a vietnamese take on the dish and I found it to be uniquely tasty.

The dessert was the best part of the meal. Coconut ice cream inside half a coconut - very delicious, crisp and not overwhelmingly sweet.

Pho, pho, pho... 
I'm big on soups or stews so anywhere that's serving some kind of variation of it will be on my hit list.
Broth 4/5 I've been to Dist 1 a few times and one time I'm thinking the salt slipped from the cooks hands but most of the time the broth is solid. Meat always taste fresh and tender though...
Appetizers ehhh... haven't been blown away by the calamri grilled nor fried. Chicken wings LOOKED better than they tasted.
Drinks... yes! I love their drink menu. The drinks here are the unsung heroes! I've tried the coconut mojito which comes in a fresh coconut, big deal to me...if you like fresh coconut get it! The good morning aVietnam was amazing as well. 
Last but not least, the staff is kind and interior is very spacious which I love, definitely recommend trying this spot.
Love the bar here! Easily one of the best off the strip, huge selection of whiskeys and cognacs.

In the Hunger Games series District One is supposed to be the holy land riches and beauty. Er... maybe a better comparison would be the first class flight or flying coach, you'll both be getting the same destinations, just certain amenities of first class makes the experience all the better. The cushier seat, the dim lighting, more leg space, and more flight attendant service. District One should probably take a cue from Jet Blue. 

The service here unfortunately gets worse and worse each visit. The first few visits started with longer wait times for food and progressively gotten to one of the worse service experiences I've had in a long time. No one was necessarily "rude" but the lack of sense or urgency really killed the experience. Maybe I should of seen it coming when it it took a day and a half to have our waiter take our order, which is usually not a big deal, you're busy I get it. 

We told the server our orders and less than 2 minutes after we tried to cancel the fish tacos (because even with the happy hour pricing the cost/value was in the negatives).  When we asked the response was "I just put in your order". I know, you came to our table right after you placed it, but you're telling me that you can't change the order now because somehow in the past 2 minutes the fish was being cut fresh from the Pacific Ocean and the taco shell was being made fresh (obviously this is an exaggeration because the fish tacos took over 20 minutes to get to our tables, which many would presume is ample time to tell the kitchen to cancel the item). 

What confuses me the most is that our orders were repeated to us by the server, yet 1 order of pho tai nam and an order of steak and eggs were missing? Maybe the kitchen is having a delay, no problem, but ten minutes later we followed up with it and the steak and eggs came out within minutes, perfect (except for the fact the rice should of been in a cereal box considering how crunchy it was) and then another 10 minutes later (a total of 40 mins waiting for our food) for a pho tai nam (came out minutes later as well). 

The check was another hassle of its own, and in short, the party of 4 split the check 2 ways (which we wrote in pen) and it was still messed up. It took two reprints to fix things. Water refills? Wishful thinking.

So Kevin T, you obviously had terrible service, why the 2 stars? Fortunately and unfortunately D1 has the best pho (noodles cooked inconsistently though) and food for the majority ranges from acceptable to great. Sometimes theres lots of love in the food and sometimes... none.

Things to order:

Pho (any except lobster)
Mekong River Noodle Soup
Beef Carpaccio 
Wings
Beef (from their fairly crafty craft beer list)

Things to pass:
Belly buns
Lobster pho (really? #onlyinvegas)
Expectations of great service
Fish tacos (I have dog treats bigger than these)

Will I come back? Maybe someday when the raging hole in my heart after getting burned so hard by the service heals.
I was very happy with my food choices until my poached egg was very under cooked. I will probably not go there again for breakfast, maybe try lunch or dinner. The services was good.

Probably my favorite pho place in Vegas. We always stop by before heading home to LA for that hangover cure. The restaurant is located in a big plaza, plenty of parking. There's usually no wait when I come but it does get pretty busy. 

Here are a few things I've tried:
- Shrimp and pork spring rolls, one of my favorites because I love the dipping sauce that comes with it. Only down side is that it only comes with 2 spring rolls cut into 4 pieces for $6. Pretty steep in my opinion, but I always order it anyways. 
- Pork belly buns: meh, they were okay. I've had better elsewhere. 
- Pho dac biet: my bf always orders this, he seems to like it. No complaints. 
- Ox tail pho: yum! My favorite because the meat literally falls off the bone! They give you a good amount of ox tail as well. The broth is super flavorful. I crave this and I wish we had a good ox tail pho place back in LA. 
- Mekong River noodle soup: was not a fan, stick to the pho

Food takes some time to come out, but service is always friendly. Will be back the next time I'm in town!

This place is a hungover person's dream come true - Delicious bowls of pho in a room with low lighting and chill music muahahaah.

OXTAIL PHO (5/5) - with a price tag of $15.99, it's definitely the most expensive bowl of pho i've ever had, but am I crazy to say it was WORTH IT? I was a lil reluctant because some reviews here claimed the oxtail meat wasn't tender but mine was FALL OFF THE BONE, easy-peasy-to-eat tender. Abundance of meat! Flavorful broth! No complaints here.

OXTAIL FRIED RICE (5/5) - $15.99 - sampled a bite of my friend's order and it was YUMMMMMY. Very soft chunks of oxtail meat hugged by perfectly fried rice. Hefty portion size! No complaints here either.

THE BIG BONE SOUP - $17.99 - this is THE thing to order if you want something for the 'gram. The bones are RIDICULOUSLY gigantic. Keep in mind it does not include pho noodles, so if you order that on the side, it's an additional $5. Had a taste of my friend's order and it was indeed tasty and would please any bone marrow fan, but it's a dish to avoid if you want something that'd require minimal effort to eat.

VIET-CHELADA (5/5) - $8 - mmmmm tried a sip and it was delicious. Basically it's a Michelada with Vietnamese beer. Whatever they used to rim the glass was nommynommy savory and worth lickin' yo lips for.

VIETNAMESE COFFEE - just as a heads-up, they serve traditional Vietnamese drip coffee. If youza noob, wait for all the water to drip from the filter, then stir the coffee with the condensed milk at the bottom until it's all dissolved, and then pour into your cup of ice. 

! BONUS POINTS !
- the music played during my visit was A1 (mura masa and odesza vibes).
- extremely extensive drinks menu, it's crazy. If I was a Vegas local, I'd see myself coming here often to hang out and slurp/munch the night away.
- water refills by our server were oooooooooon point. 
- surprised they didn't automatically charge gratuity for our party of 8! 18% was well deserved regardless.

OVERALL
 - hungover or not, I'd mosdef come back here the next time I'm in Vegas. Their menu has a wide variety of both traditional and modernized Viet food to tickle anyone's fancy!

District One is our dining location after our basketball tournament in las vegas. Plenty of space for the entire team to sit and dine on some delicious mixture of vietnamese, Hawaiian, and seafood dished.

They were extra helpful in procuring me a bag of ice for my head at the gym. Now thats servive.

Terrible service on a night where the restaurant was empty. Friend's food ended up coming out 30 mins after me and my bf's food was given. Grilled squid was good. Oxtail pho wasn't cooked to the point where the meat should fall off the bones. Friends ordered a pound of shrimp which looked less than a pound, and off par crispy birds nest noodles. We came here once before and enjoyed the food and ambiance, but after this experience we won't be back.

Social media hyped this place up too much, because District One was a total let down. We tried the oxtail pho and the oxtail fried rice, and we were very underwhelmed by both. $16 for a bowl of pho? I don't care if it contains unicorn meat; at that price, I could get TWO bowls of pho from a traditional Vietnamese place that tastes infinitely better. The oxtail fried rice (also $16) was too greasy and contained shreds of meat so small, I wouldn't be able to tell it was oxtail unless you told me.

Sadly, they were out of coconut shells for their coconut ice cream that day, which was odd considering we were there on a Monday afternoon. Disappointed by the food and general lack of empathy from the staff, we decided to save our money and get dessert elsewhere.

Did we arrive on an off day? Who knows, but I don't see myself coming back to find out anytime soon.

Nice restaurant . Started with some oysters which were really good. Also had the Vietnamese version of carpaccio or tataki . Was great also ! My friend and I each had pho and was very flavorful . Service was attentive and on point . It was my first time but I will
Definitely he back soon .

Nommmmmmmmm! Loved this place. It's outside of the Las Vegas Strip! My friend spotted 'lobster pho' on some website and wanted to go so we tried it out and it was delicious. Not only was all the food delicious, the customer service was excellent. I'm glad we discovered this place. 

We ordered:
* Coconut Juice - came in a real coconut (I originally thought it was going to be like those viet restaurants that come in a cup and some coconut pieces) but this came in a legit coconut and you can carve the inside for yummy coconut
* Matcha Thai Tea - I was tempted to get this, so I was asking the waitress questions about it and she offered to give us samples which was very nice of her. The taste of this was a little too sugary for me, very sweet combination. I passed on this. 
* Belly Buns - they ask if you want it steamed or fried, we got steamed! This was very tasty and had a big pieces of pork belly
* Bok Choy - we got two different kinds. One with garlic only and the other with spicy garlic. Both were really good. A tad oily, but the spicy one had a really nice spicy kick to it.
* Oxtail Fries - it reminds me of poutine fries - it had oxtail meat pieces with the gravy all on top of the fries and we had egg on top. This was sooo good and creamy.
* Oxtail Pho - If you love oxtail soup, you should try this. It's pretty self explanatory for the oxtail pho. The broth tasted like oxtail (not heavy/strong) - it was light and tasted delicious. 
* Lobster Pho - expensive, but worth to try it if you love lobster. This was my friends bowl so I only tried the broth ~ the broth had the lobster kick to it. It was soooo good. Good hangover soup for sure.

In the end, they were nice enough to give our bride a complimentary congrats coconut ice cream in the end (we were all dressed up in our bride squad tanks). THAT WAS SO GOOD. I love coconut, it had something else in it I believe, but it was just nice of them to give it to us. If you love coconut - get whatever ice cream dessert they got!

All I have to say is this is a MUST eat!  One of the best foods I have had in Vegas.    We ordered so much and it was all great,   Ox tail fried rice, oysters, snail, carpaccio, fish sauce wings, lemon grass beef and more.   I was surprised how great the bar was.

Came here for a weekend lunch around 2pm. Took a couple minutes to get seated but I liked the atmosphere and the two waiters that took care of us. Our crew started off with the Oxtail Fries (Oxtail gravy, fries, fried egg). It was a different kind of bomb since it was wet due to the gravy. I got the Oxtail Fried Rice which was cooked to perfection. My friend got the Hue Spicy Beef Noodle Soup. My other friend got the District One combo platter. I was super hungry since I just finished hiking at Red Rock so I felt the food was so good! Tried a bit of each meal and loved it. Food wise I'd give them a 5 star. My only complaint would be the men's restroom didn't have a holder for the toilet paper and was confused as to why there were 3 sinks outside the men's and females restroom hallway. Probably helps not to slow traffic when their busy so some people can just wash their hands instead of going into the restrooms. Other than that, not a bad spot indeed. You gotta end with the coconut ice cream!

For all my Vegas friends (and those visiting), this place is great. We went there last night to get my friend Tiffanie away from the strip and I found this little spot on some random website...it got good reviews on Yelp so we decided to give it a try. Three of us split the Belly Buns, Carpaccio, Oxtail Fried Rice, and the 8 Treasures (not on the menu, a special since new years eve...had fried shrimp, tofu, and some other amazing stuff). Everything was awesome...I recommend this exact order to any of you, if you have a 4th, the oxtail fries look ridiculously tasty. The drinks were a little pricey, but they are all custom made and unique...watching Tiffanie drink a mojito from a coconut was well worth it. The ambiance with the music was perfect and the wait staff was surprisingly not in your face every second asking if you liked it. I'm definitely taking the crew from work here...

Happy Hour : Mon. - Fri. 5pm - 7pm
Reverse Happy Hour Sunday Only : 12am - 2am

I think this place was way too hyped up in my opinion. The presentation on all the dishes made my mouth water and got me very excited to come and try this place, but the food was so so. I ordered the ox tail pho which had a lot of meat, but the broth was over powered by star anise flavor. The fish tacos very good but nothing special about it. The goi ga (chicken salad) had a fish sauce dressing which was very sweet.... Too sweet for my tasting. The big bone soup, their speciality.. The meat on the bone was soft and tender, but the marrow the god's butter was extremely cold which made it hard to eat. The broth was the same broth use for the pho so again too much star anise. The best thing was the coconut mojito which was tasty and refreshing. Overall I'm glad I was able to try this place out but I don't think I'll ever be coming back.

The oxtail fries are to die for. Although, I would personally add another fried egg to it. I also got the grilled whole squid, which was alright. Nothing to write home about. Definitely gonna try the lobster pho next time.

We were on our way home to LA and this place was on the way and we wanted something comforting before we left. They definitely have some big servings here and I underestimated it and over ordered as always (LOL). We got the oxtail fries (5/5 - great for sharing, probably enough for 3-4 if shared because there's 2 of us and we didn't finish it), spicy hue soup (5/5 - love the level of spiciness on this one and very meaty) and my bf got the lobster garlic noodles (5/5 - worth the $50 price because they serve it with the whole lobster and very well seasoned noodles). This place is great for family and friends because it's great for sharing!

Ordered the spring rolls (which are actually salad rolls), lemongrass beef, rib eye pho and oxtail pho to share. Spring rolls were fine. Lemongrass beef was good but the portion was small. Both phos were a bit disappointing. The noodles and meat were cooked fine but the broth was lacking in flavour. I don't see myself coming back the next time I'm in town.
Phenomenal food...I recommend the  yellow tail fish tacos, Serrano Chicken Wings and lobster fried rice. The service was awesome. A must go when you're in Las Vegas.

This is the coolest spot to hang out and grab a bite of new generation Asian.  District One pays homage to so many of the traditional Vietnamese / Southeasy Asian staples we had growing up, but puts such a great modern twist on each item.  The interior setup is awesome, conducive to discussion and sharing of food and stories.  I wouldn't hesitate to eat here again.  Definitely geared towards a younger and hipper audience with a wide selection of craft brews on tap.

HATE  Nothing.

DISLIKE  Service can be inconsistent depending on the server (some are inattentive while others are amazing). Parking is very limited when whole commercial center is busy.

LIKE  The bar. The modern decor. One of the owners is very friendly and almost always available. Menu doesn't just offer traditional Vietnamese offerings.

LOVE  Shaken beef salad. Lobster pho. Pork belly in coconut juice. Steak and eggs. Open late on the weekends. Location pretty close to home. Mekong River noodle soup.

I wish this place was closer to the strip. It is completely out of the way, a pain in the ass to get there, and yet I can't wait to get to vegas again in a few weeks to go again. The food here is awesome and one fo my favorite vietnamese places in the world. Get the lobster pho and thank me later!

The pork belly buns were fantastic as well as the egg rolls and wings. Im getting so hungry thinking about it again right now!
The squid was not edible and the oxtail fries were like prison slop. The beer and pho were great. Stick to that!

December 26, 2017

Thanks to my fiance's friend for showing us this place! Their bone soup is amazing. I wished for more everyday, but until we are back in Vegas, we will meet again. At 7 months pregnant, I wasn't able to satisfy my taste buds until then. We got their oxtail fried rice and man...yes! Service is amazing, but lines are long for this place. My son, 18months, loved the food too, he couldn't stop eating their rice! haha which is always a good thing for a mom...to see her son enjoy the food.

Food is on point was there for lunch. AAAaaamazing must try the lobster pho. Shrimp fried rice was Yummy. Staff is very chill and friendly.
Will be 
Back soon.

This is one of my favorite Pho place in town. The parking is always hard to find due to other outlets in the area but worth it. When i enter, im Always looking for Julie, she is great and always taking care of me and my family or friends. Must have appetizer is the the grilled squid, Julie knows to bring extra sauce cause my wife is always asking for more. For me, the Big Bone Marrow Pho is a must. The atmosphere and music is easy going to have a nice family dinner. Not your typical Pho restaurant where the pho comes out within 1 minute once ordered, but still in a timely manner. The only down fall is the dessert menu, they only have 2 options but I don't care for desserts. Just my honest opinion. Always coming back.

My favorite new Vietnamese joint in Vegas!!!!

Came here to have lunch on my birthday with fam bam. This place was recommended by a friend of mine but since it was cold and rainy out.. decided to have something warm for lunch.

Oxtail soup - Im a biggggg fan now. Ever since I had their oxtail soup.. I've actually started making it at home because of this. I love how there is soooo much flavor packed into the broth. Its $15 for a bowl and you get 3 big pieces of oxtail (which is a lot more then most places who serve oxtail). Very filling and worth coming back.

Shaken Beef Salad - my mother-in-law ordered this dish because she wanted something light. But the portion was pretty big for one person. Again.. the meat was packed with flavor and balances out with the salad. 

Coconut pork belly - my husband ordered this plate and I tried a piece of it. It came with CHUNKS of pork belly which is always a plus!!! Very sizeable portion & delicious.

Since it was my birthday the restaurant gave me a complimentary coconut ice cream served in a coconut. Light but sooo goooooddd. I especially liked that it was served in a coconut so you can shave a little bit of coconut into your ice cream. Not overly sweet but super creamy. Wish I could bring a gallon of this ice cream back home

I've eaten at District One about 4 times. Each time, it gets a little less impressive... 

We ordered the special- escargot.
It was tasty but the snails were awfully gritty.

The whole squid.
I prefer my squid to be tender, my friend likes the chewiness... District One's rendition was on the very chewy side. I could have gotten over that, but it was also brought out cold. Chewy cold squid is definitely not appetizing. I finished all the little burnt tenticles which the flavor was on point, but definitely a miss. 

Oxtail Pho.
Thank you for the delicious oxtail pho. This was just how we liked and hoped it would be! They have all the traditional pho toppings and tools on each table, including your own roll of paper towels.

Service was also a bit slow. We will probably continue eating at District One due to their late hours & convenience, but wish they would step their game up a bit.

I usually come here late at night for some grub.  The garlic serrano wings and garlic noodles are my usual order.  The lobster pho is excellent also, flavor as well as presentation.  I've taken numerous people here and we've ordered across the menu...everyone wants to come back and says why have you been holding out on me...definite Grub!

Where do I begin... just a bunch of girls hungover and hangry and our stomachs led us to District One. To our surprise this place was open on Labor Day... YES! It's meant to be. 

Traditional Asian dishes with a twist... here's what we had on our table (for 3 girls) Garlic Serrano Wings - oh my word. Crispy & garlicky and just the right amount of spice. This one is delicious. Coconut Pork Belly - comes with an egg, rice, and some pickled veggies. There was about 3 pork belly cubes per order, this one was good but reminded me of just your regular adobo. Garlic noodles (added shrimp) - YES! Chowed this down in less than 5 minutes. Oxtail Fried Rice - GET THIS! They don't skimp on the oxtail meat, so flavorful, and it's a huge serving, they top it off with an egg and everything is perfection. The Big Bone Soup - huge bones with bone marrow in a pho broth, so overwhelming in size, but so comforting and good. 

Customer service is on point. The workers are helpful and happy. I really like the vibe here. The restaurant is clean, the food is served at a timely manner. It's worth the wait definitely.

It is often a game for me to find a place to eat when I'm in town and since I'm here once a month I make it a point to eat at different restaurants, you know, to get the most out of my corporate credit card account (wink wink).  

Today is Vietnamese fusion food day.  This place has good reviews on Yelp and I love Vietnamese food so in I came.  I came in for lunch and felt like having a traditional Vietnamese salad, and lo and behold, they have the Goi Ga chicken salad (1 of my favs) and they also have the Imperial Stout oatmeal beer on tap, even better.  My afternoon was looking grander by the minute.  
The salad did not disappoint and the beer was perfect.  Lunch really hit the spot.  Service was good.  Overall, I left happy and full.

Best local destination hands down in Las Vegas. Great food, great atmosphere, great service, and the best great drinks! From the staple lobster pho to the dinosaur bone barrow soup dish this place has it all. Don't think this is your regular pho destination! This place has so many more to offer! Chef Khai's cooking and presentations are one of the most creative I've seen here in Las Vegas. Also great place to watch your favorite NBA, Football, baseball, or basketball games! Stop on in...You won't be disappointed!

First time here and service was amazing. Everyone check on us occasionally even the chef. Had beef Phö and was tasty. My friend had the steak and egg plate. Interesting twist. The steak was cut up in bite size pieces and dredged in a thick sauce was very tasty as well. We ended the meal with the best part of the experience... Vietnamese coffee!!!! It was amazing and truly the best tasting coffee I've had. I'll definitely be going back again

I liked everything here. Very modern ambiance  and service is good. The music was at perfect volume so we didn't have to shout to carry on conversation. Also you can have chinese, Vietnamese and Thai foods here. All the seafoods we ordered was very fresh and tasty.  This will be my favorite Asian foods hang out.

Very cool joint in a Chinese Shopping center not too far from Orleans, Gold Coast, or Palms. Went specifically for lobster pho and even at $49 did not disappoint. Impressive looking, tasty, significant amount of lobster. Service very friendly. Also ordered two small plates, crispy egg rolls and yellowtail  rolls. Egg rolls served with basil for a wrap. Decor was supposed to look like a se toon of Vietnam, reminded me of Wilmington Beach NC. Would definitely return-lot if fun. Ubered back to Orleans Casino for $10.

Went in today to check out the food and also from all the Yelp reviews because I'm from San Diego and didn't know where to eat. Food is not really my taste buds but they get a two thumb up for their oysters and service. The girls were great. They greeted they smiled they checked on us. Environment and atmosphere was good as well. Will be returning if I'm back in town for some more oysters.
I've had home made phó my whole life and no restaurant could get this food right until this place! One of the best places to eat phó in Vegas also has an American bar lounge atmosphere

Been wanting to check out this place for a couple of weeks and glad I did. The scene is hip for a pho place and they don't offer the norm that you would see on the menu. Music is good and decor is pretty modern. 

We tried the Oxtail Pho, Steak and Eggs, and Braised Pork Belly. I love oxtail with a passion so you really can't go wrong with me when oxtail is on the menu. It fell off the bones and they were gracious with the amount of meat they had in the pho. They put a little spin on the steak and eggs and added tomato rice which I also love (reminds me of the Asian cafe style food that you find in California if you know what I mean).  Steak was already cut up into small pieces and had an Asian flare to it.  The pork belly was pretty typical but also good. 

I definitely want to go back to try some other things on the menu. Also found out the owner is a friend of a friend so I definitely want them to do well. My only complaint was my tiny coconut hole. How do you scrape all that yummy goodness when you can barely fit the spoon in the hole. But I got her done :)

We had their pho. The taste was great but they soup was just not hot enough. It couldn't even cook our raw beef.we asked for another extra side bowl of extra hot
Soup and still the beef wouldn't cook we ended up throwing the beef away. Clean place but we most likely would not return as we don't eat raw beef. Good customer service.

The food and service here was honestly really good. The reasoning behind the three star rating is due to not honoring happy hour rates because of EDC weekend. I get it, business demands are high, however your website advertises happy hour with no restrictions on event weekends here in the city. I suggest placing thar disclaimer because there are other restaurants that will still honor happy hour rates regardless of busy weekends.

Pretty cool spot to eat. Environment is fun for friends & family meals. Service is nice. 

Ordered:
Spring Rolls - Yum!
Fried Calamari - ok. Thick batter and spicy aoli, no lemon is given :(
Garlic Noodles - Yum
Oxtail Fried Rice - Super Yum! Just wish it came with more egg. 
Coconut Pork Belly - Tasty, but there was nothing coconut about this. Just tasted like stewed pork belly. Pickled veggies were bland that came with. 
Double Down w/kalbi - Yum! Can't go wrong with this meal. 

I'm wondering if there's some secret menu because there wasn't Oxtail Loco Moco on the menu and neither was Viet Ice coffee. Seen in other people photos. We decided to ask about the coffee and they do serve it. We didn't see any "Specials" posted either.
Amazing food! Amazing service! Everything was quick and delicious. The atmosphere is trendy, unique, cool and comfortable. We will be back!! What a great spot.

The grilled squid is so yummy!
We stayed at the bar, Christian, our bartender was funny, helpful, and a good conversationalist!
yes! we'll remember! Sundays and Mondays! lol

overall great atmosphere!

definitely will come back for their happy hour!

Long weekend in Vegas and decided to go off the strip for dinner and so glad we did. Everything we ate, drank and the service were all top notch! We shared quite a few dishes including the lobster fried rice, oxtail pho, spring rolls, birds nest noodles all so delicious! The margarita was one of the best I've had. The coconut cocktail was delicious served in a fresh coconut and they served the extra juice on the side. Delicious! Service was friendly and fast but not too fast, knowledgeable and didn't oversell us. Highly recommend!

In town for the weekend, originally hoping to get Asian BBQ & Noodles in the same plaza, and didn't realize they were closed on Fridays. Luckily District One was right there!

What I ate:
- HH oysters: Honestly, not the best oysters in the world, but pretty decent for HH price. 
- HH Garlic Fries: skinny fries. For some reason these came out kind of late. I was hoping to have them with the oysters. After some time they got soggy. I would pass on these fries unless this is all you plan on getting
- Oxtail Fried Rice: My friend who had been to District One before highly recommended this, and I'm so glad we ordered it. The oxtail was super tender and delicious, a great addition classic fried rice. Over easy fried egg on top just pushed it to the next level of decadence. Please order this to share with the table! 
- Beef Pho: This was good. I'm not a huge fan of pho, so I can't really tell you much
- Wonton Noodle Soup: This was a good wonton noodle soup. Shrimp wontons were tasty. This would be great to warm up with if you're craving noodle soup

Pros:
- Not much of a wait on a Friday night. 
- Happy hour until 7pm! 
- Friendly staff
- That oxtail fried rice! seriously, so good

Cons:
- Very cold. I think we were sitting under a vent, but it was freezing cold. I get it, it's the desert, but it made my friends and I crave warm noodle soup, which is why I think we ended up ordering noodle soups
- Asian parking lot. You know how it goes - spots are tight, horrible Asian drivers, very very busy and full parking lot. 

Would I come again? While food was good, I think I'd rather try something new next time I'm in Vegas.

I have to say that place is great 
There food is #1 IN LAS VEGAS 
Will keep come over 
And will recommend them always

The food was very good but do expect to pay a bit extra. Service was nice and friendly.

We ordered a bunch of seafood and meat dishes to share, since they all know I'm a total 'carni-whore'. The king crab legs were very unique and flavored with chili powder. The grilled octopus was also flavored well and unique tasting. They also had a blackboard with a bunch of specials. 

Service was friendly, fast and efficient. Bathrooms are clean.

First time here with the hubby. Yelped this place first before trying it..did not disappoint at all! Had the papaya salad medium spicy, chicken wings, oxtail fried rice and the reason I just had to try this place was for the big bone marrow soup...OMG....delicious!  The broth itself was awesome!!! Ended meal with home made coconut ice cream served with peanut sprinkles in a coconut shell.....wow!!! Great meal....will be back again when back in Vegas! Need to also mention that the staff was A1 attentive and great! THANKS! Our compliments to the chefs for a great meal.
Great place to eat! The fresh spring rolls are amazing and they have amazing service.

My 2nd time here and brought family. 
Oxtail pho, Oxtail fries, coconut ice cream, bone marrow soup are all good. This visit, service was really slow compared to my 1st visit. I'd have to ask for every frking thing... veggies for the phos. A server brought out 2 veggie plates for 7 bowls of pho... & the last bowl of pho came out after 6 of us finished our foods.
