Rediculous! & my bone marrow order was given away to the next table and a server said they ran out.... okay... && no apologies! The server said "I guess we gave it to them, yup." Not my luck at restaurants lately. Felt disrespected.

Restaurants that have a WOW factor sure will be much more memorable than those without it....that's what I learned coming to District One.  

Their wow factor you ask?  Just order the "Bone Marrow Soup"  and you will be WOW'd! I mean, they give you the entire femur (cut in half of course) of the cow in a bowl!  Can't be more WOW'd than anything else! 

To describe their menu, I'd say a modernized vietnamese restaurant with lot's of different Pho's, side dishes and specials.  One thing that was pretty interesting was the Ox Tail Loco Moco with gravy made from Pho broth.  I was pretty impressed with the taste! Definitely get that again!  

I also go the Ribeye Pho, which I must say, probably the best mean in a bowl of pho I have ever had!  

There's lots of goodies to try on the menu, so be daring and try something new!  Although we did have one mishap, and that was with the razor clams.  I think they didn't soak the clams long enough so it still had the gritty sand particles in the meat itself.  

Definitely be back to try something new!

Came across various reviews on Yelp and Chris V. review actually convince me to give this place a try. So we decided to come last night around 11pm on 7.11.16 for late night dinning.

First of all the atmosphere reminded me of a Joe's Crab Shack just with Asian Influence with a open floor plan with a good size bar. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable with the items they offer. We end up getting an order of Spring Rolls, Shaken Beef Salad and Oxtail Fried Rice. All the dishes we had was great especially the Oxtail Fried Rice. Coming from Hawaii, Oxtail is a staple. This dish was seasoned well and cook to the way fried rice should be, not being too dry and bland. It was balanced and consistent especially with the easy over egg on top. 

A few things when going to District One:

-Not a traditional Vietnamese Restaurant but Asian American Fusion style in a modern setting with a Vietnamese twist.

-Menu is only a page long on a clip board but they have an extensive drink menu which was like a small booklet.

- Great place to hangout with a group of friends or family members with open floor plan and large size tables.

- Awesome place to grab a bite after a long day at work and late night dinning.

Will be back to try more of their delicious food and drinks.

Oxtail Pho!!!! It's so flavorful... I would eat it, on a 110° degree weather. Their Vietnamese Donkey was refreshing. Service is phenomenal,  they're always friendly and always checking on my party. 20% tip or more... that's how good service was. Hardly find friendly service in Asian restaurants. when I have family in town from the Bay Area or Hawaii, this is my go to place.

A lot of the food here has a good wow factor--the food itself was ok. Though the food wasn't generally our favorite, I can see how some people would enjoy this meal. Still it was generally a good experience especially since the service there was cordial and the setup of the place was pretty nice.

Finally got to check this place out and will definitely be back.  The ambiance is nice and a pleasant change from all the other Vietnamese places in town.  I had the rib eye pho and what the broth was lacking in flavor, the meat made up for.  This was by far the best quality of meat I've ever had in pho that I've had in a restaurant.  Not only was it excellent quality but they gave you a good amount unlike a lot of places that are stingy.  Also got the Matcha Thai green tea which was delicious and a nice alternative to most Thai tea's.  Will definitely be back with friends to try out some other things on the menu.

Amazing service here!! Came In and at first was overwhelmed by people asking to get me drinks but ended up loving the attention all the people that work here give . Servers were on point about all menu items. Never had an empty glass... EVER!! Good was good had the spicy beef noodle soup, wings for appetizer, but the yellowtail collar (hamachi Kama) oh man!!! I was obsessed! So good. I'd go back for just that!!

I came here back in 2015, just haven't had the chance to write a review. 
This is the first time I came here and Im glad I did. 

This is like a modern twist on asian cuisine. My boyfriend order the crispy bird nest noodles and I ordered the slow cooked pork belly w/ coconut juice. Both dishes were very tasty. I was surprised the bird nest stayed crispy not soggy when you put the wet ingredient on it. 
The pork belly had flavored but i think to overwhelming for me cause the juices tasted like fish sauce to me. 
Service was slow. Don't get me wrong it wasn't busy but I would expect to have someone be more attentive if it wasn't busy to check on the table to see how were doing or even give more water without out us waving someone down.Over all food was good, I would come back and try there lobster pho.

Their Pho Oxtail and Pho Tai RibEye - both good! The meat is really tender, although the pho oxtail is somewhat costly ($15.99). I've dined here the last 3 times I've visited Vegas and needless to say, the restaurant was fully occupied each time.

District One is a place I eat often.  I have always had excellent food. The room is open and inviting.  If you can get the suckling pig do not hesitate. I do not think it is on the menu but on special occasions  it can be ordered.  The only negative thing about the place is that the parking lot is always packed and parking can take a bit of patience.
This place is LEGIT!!!  Servers are sweet.  Britney and Jonnazel are the sweetest and attentative!!!  Their fusion stuff is awesome. Definitely a better variety compared to other places.

That ox tail fried rice is delicious, it's a bit on the sweeter side. The oxtail pho is ginormous and delicious as well! 
I finally got to try the lobster pho but the market price was 79$ for a bowl of lobster pho, for that price, I'm not sure if it was worth it. But definitely worth the experience and the pictures. 
Everything else on the menu is pretty good too. Besides the seafood, the price for this place is more than reasonable and the whole ambiance is hip and trendy. I also love all the TVs playing live sports.

I normally order the deep fried belly buns and oxtail pho and oxtail fried. It the best ever! They also have off the menu options like the fried red snapper it was delicious and my friend had the lobster fried rice everything was perfect! It hit the spot. Yummy in my tummy!

This restaurant was recommended by a friend I'm glad we stopped by. When you walk in there's a nice hip and modern feel. Plenty of tvs to watch the games plus amazing appetizers and cocktails. I tried the lobster pho and it was amazing. The broth was sweet from the brine and it didn't need any hoisin or Siracha sauce. 1.5lb worth of lobster and it's all shelled for you to enjoy.

I have been here a few times since it's close by to where I live. Place is great nice atmosphere, clean, booths are huge they have a lot of TV's. Had the garlic wings, tacos, steak and eggs, Cornish hen, rib eye pho, shaken beef salad, beef lemon grass (both styles), vegetarian egg rolls. All were awesome. Whenever I'm down to watch a game I will probably head there.

Yummy place....Vietnamese fusion...you should visit and taste the food...pricey but worth the taste of the food...you won't regret going there....service is good as well...very clean and friendly server...my first visit and very good service and tasty food...

Been here several times and it hasn't disappointed. Full bar, good decor. Great number of tapis sized good eats. Must try: The oxtail fries, pork belly buns, and chicken wings. Service has always been great. I've seen groups with kids: so it looks like they're friendly to families.

Had a chance to visit this place since many friends talk about their Pho Lobster. No kidding, a real 1 1/4 lbs.Maine lobster and the broth taste so original; cost  $45 for a bowl of Pho Lobster. But their house special Oysters are the talk of the town. Full bar and large TVs. This place is definitely better than Rio Seafood buffet.

My first attempt at District One Kitchen and Bar came after a somewhat drunken night when someone in our party became sick. So entirely that experience could not do the place justice. After the rave reviews I heard from this multi-Asian fused gem, I had to go back a few nights later to find out for myself. I'm sorry to say that I was totally disappointed. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant was very dark, even early in the evening. Dark enough that some patrons needed their phone flashlights to see the menu. The overall feel is very hip, with age ranges between the late teens to early 30's, with decent but loud music playing in the background. There are a good number of raised booths surrounding the middle table areas. Parking can be difficult outside with a smaller sized lot and a good number of restaurants side by side. Table service is very slow, with the water always running empty.

Now to the food. The heavily raved oxtail fried rice was nothing spectacular. Rather, I caught myself grabbing whatever water was left and fried rice from another plate to combat how oily it was. I really wanted it to be good, but the flavor was uneventful. Our party had a couple variations of Pho, one more disappointing than the next. The rib eye steak was decent, but it cannot explain why the lobster pho was an absolute failure. The $40 pho was bland, with the lobster meat being tough and overcooked. Although it was visually pleasing, it was not good value at all. The best dish was their rice combo platter with short rib, pork chops, and Chinese sausage. Portions notwithstanding, a pretty solid dish overall with a good mix of robust spices and flavors. Do yourself a favor, keep the fried rice and skip the garlic noodles. We did not order anything from the bar.

This unfulfilling experience will keep me from venturing into District One Kitchen and Bar again.

Authentic Vietnamese dishes. Taste is perfection. If you love lobster & pho make sure order the Lobster Pho ! 

Great & clean atmosphere. When in Vegas end your  weekend with this restaurant. You won't regret it .

I have been here twice now and and it's because this place had a lot of buzz over the summer. Even though I am really curious as to how the oxtail pho is I have yet to try it. Since this is an Asian fusion place, both of the times I brought visitors here from out of town and the food did not disappoint. For the most part they execute their dishes pretty well. Often times Asian fusion restaurants tend to over due it as in "trying to hard," but that is not the case here because their fusion is just a slight twist on the original dishes. The first time I was not too hungry and I ate the tacos which were phenomenal. The light crispness of the wonton and then the freshness of the yellow tail make it a match made in heaven. Although delicious they are super small and kind of pricey for what you pay for. However, I guess the fresh fish constitutes it. On both of my visits we ordered the tacos and they did not disappoint any members of my party. The second time I had the combo platter with the beef short ribs and I do love me some short ribs. I am usually not a fan of Chinese sausage, but surprisingly I ate what was served on my plate because the flavor wasn't too overwhelming like it usually is. I must say I originally ordered the pork chop but then it was served with short ribs. Our server who took my order even saw the short ribs on my plate and immediately told his co-server that it's supposed to be pork chop. I was hungry and did not want to wait so I didn't mind the short ribs at all. My 2 other friends who were with me also ordered the combo platter but with both meats. I tried the pork chop from their plate and thought it was good. This place is pretty popular considering both times I've come here I've bumped into people I know. My friend ordered a coconut martini and it was served in a coconut, pretty awesome I must say. That's probably Asian fusion at it's finest. I've also been told by 2 friends that the coconut ice cream is to die for. So I must try that the next time I'm here. In regards to service, service is pretty good. On my first visit our server was Adrienne and she was pretty spectacular. The other members of our party could not decide to order so she basically gave a description of everything on the menu. She even gave my friend suggestions on what to order based off of what he craving. She was really patient and pleasant during our entire dining experience. This place has definitely become a stable in town and it certainly is one now in my book.

My parents were in town and I really wanted to take them to Raku. But, unfortunately, their earliest reservation was 10:30 pm, so District One became plan B. Serendipitously, we were just in time to catch the tail end of happy hour. The happy hour menu features some great appetizers at 30-40% off. We started off with the fish tacos, beef carpaccio, belly buns, spring rolls, a half dozen fresh oysters, and the garlic fries to start. Of those, I really enjoyed the fish tacos and beef carpaccio. The fish tacos featured yellowtail sashimi and a lot of acid (serrano pepper, cherry tomato) wrapped in a crispy taco shell. It was an interesting take on a not so taco Tuesday fish taco. The Vietnamese beef carpaccio was the most flavorful dish of the bunch. The thinly-sliced beef was just ever-so-slightly seared and mixed with lime juice, peanuts, and onions for the most flavorful carpaccio I've had. The belly buns were their featured braised pork belly. The pork belly was very tender and the buns were perfect (I've had a lot of shitty buns), but I didn't get too much flavor. The spring rolls and garlic fries were standard fillers. The fresh oysters were huge (not the typical small, sweet ones you find) and worth a try. 

As for the entrees, we were quite full from the happy hour appetizers, so we decided to split two dishes. We had to get the popular oxtail fried rice. This dish is as amazing as everyone says. The fried rice is nicely seasoned and the ox tail meat is flavored well although some portions are more fibrous than expected. No fried rice is complete without a sunny side up egg to top it off. The other dish we tried was the crispy bird nest noodle. I liked most of the food up until this point, but this noodle dish was just plain awful. It was so salty and the combination of stir-fried beef, fish balls, and shrimp made no sense. The flavors of sweet, savory, and mostly just salt made it unpalatable. The noodles were also completely fried instead of having the outside crispy and the inside soft as it traditionally is. This disaster dish aside, I liked the overall menu and atmosphere. Happy hour beers are $3-4 so check out happy hour 5:00 to 7:00 pm or reverse happy hour 12:00 to 3:00 am.

Came here on a Thursday night, 7/9/15. Place wasn't crowded which was a plus for us because we were starving. We had the oxtail pho 9/10, prime rib pho 9/10, meekrong soup 9/10, and steak & egg dish +9/10. Enjoyed the slow drip Thai ice coffee. My parents loved their food with no complaints and they can be picky. Overall great service and yummy food.  Will try the lobster pho next time we are in Vegas. Wish we had a District One here in East San Gabriel Valley (So. Cal).

Hostess was nice, server wasn't great at all. She was really awkward and monotone. Food was very good! I had garlic noodles and added shaken beef which the server said "I'll ask the chef if we can do that" even though they could add chicken or shrimp. Food and atmosphere were great, service was not
Ate the King Crab with Aioli and a dozen oysters. Highly recommend it!
Great Pho. Everything else was mediocre. Came in group of 6 and no one was overly satisfied. The service was great and the atmosphere was busy. Would come back strictly for happy hour and pho.

Had such a great experience at District One. We were lucky to get the best server, her name was Tootie, District One she needs a raise for her fantastic customer service! We initially went there for the Lobster Pho but with Tootie's recommendation we tried the ox tail pho and it was full of flavor. We also had raw oysters, snails, ox tail fried rice. Everything was delish! Maybe next time we can really try the lobster pho.

Service was great, and the inside has a trendy atmosphere.

I had the veggie pho and had no complaints. Generous portion of root and leafy vegetables. However, if you're a vegeterian, you might not like the fact that it uses beef broth. We also ordered garlic noodles, and although they were pretty plain, they weren't very oily. I actually enjoyed them more than the pho. Haven't tried anything else there yet but my carnivorous fried loved their pho tai nam.
This is one of my favorite places to eat!!! Everything here is amazing service to food
Ordered the lobster pho. It was not worth it for $50. Hells nah. It was like a kids meal size pho with a lobster. Don't fall for the lobster hype. Their oxtail is good tho.
Everything is amazing, but the spring roll, snail and surf and turf were out of this world!!

Jason,

Thank you for the AMAZING service! Food is impeccable! From Oxtail Fries to Big Bone Soup, & from the Pho Tai Rib Eye to DoubleDown Rice Combo.....simply delish!  

Need breaks from the LV Strip and buffets, District One is a "MUST Do" & a can't miss!!!!!

We'll try Big Bone through TSA next time =\

My new favorite place for pho! 
The place is clean, service was great, good ambiance, and of course great food!
The decorations are really nice too~
They have a bar with plenty selection of craft cocktails and beer.

I am so in love with this place! The food is wonderful and the service exceptional. Must try the Lobster Pho, Oxtail fried rice, but you MUST try the oysters as they're too die for! My favorite drink is the Vietnamese Donkey which is their version of a Moscow mule. The bar is fantastic as they have a great assortment of whiskeys and sakes. We go often.

This place is soOo overrated! No seriously. Food comes out at different times...service is horrible, like literally horrible. I mean I seen the servers tends to other people's needs but I guess we weren't important enough even when we came with a large group. So after we all are done eating...the bone marrow noodle soup came out. It's my sister in laws order however we shared our food with her because her food did not came out yet and she was starving. Terrible, terrible, terrible. Overall the food was okay to great. Tasted better Pho and braised pork.

Service is a huge component of the food and beverage industry. If you have 80% empty tables and three groups of people standing by the host stand with no host in sight, there is a problem right there. Having multiple groups of people waiting near the entrance for over 15 min just for an empty restaurant is incredibly disrespectful and rude. After making eye contact with multiple waitresses no one seemed to care to come over and give us an idea of the preposterous situation. It is only after I personally call a waiter to come over will they then come and acknowledge our ridiculous wait. I then asked, do we wait for a host or do we just seat ourselves, and the waiter replies, let me call someone over. This tedious process of waiting to get seated at an empty restaurant shows incompetence and a lack of quality in the staff. Our group then left the restaurant because we understood that our business was not welcome there.

Extremely great food!! You can eat from 11 am or after server , Michael -( Peter Pam ) , Jason, cookie gave us awesome service friendly sweet  , nice . I want they keep good foods and service I'll be your loyal customer! For long time. I highly Recomemde this place amazing food not only fancy good price and taste are amazing ! After I found in yelp I came back everyday ! Great great food!!!!! Yelper thank you for recommended me it was all truth!!!

Such a cool place. You can sit at the bar and have amazing food or have the full restaurant experience and sit at their tables. I drive by the place all the time and never knew it was here. This is the theme for Vegas restaurants. In no other city would I eat in a strip mall except Vegas. That's where all the hidden jewels are! I ordered the pork belly buns and they are delicious! Pork belly seems to be hard for people to get right but they did. I also got the shaken beef salad. I really only got these two things because my favorite yelper Phil said they were good and he hasn't lead me wrong yet. Lol.

A friend wanted to try here because of the social media buzz. There's nothing really wrong with it, but I think this place is mostly hype. 

Free parking lot for the plaza. We didn't have any trouble but we were there right when they opened for lunch.

Service was decent. They were friendly and checked up on us. They forgot 2 requests, but fixed it right away when we asked again. 

For the food, my group ordered family style. I got to try some of their pork belly buns (fried and steamed), garlic noodles, and surf and turf pho, and I decided not to touch the other dishes. 

We got 2 versions of the pork belly buns, but the star of the dishes was seriously lacking. It was mostly gelatinous fat instead of a nice balance. The surf and turf pho definitely had big pieces of lobster in it. It didn't make me feel like I was getting ripped off by the cost. I wasn't feeling the broth though. The basic garlic noodles were actually pretty good, probably my favorite of what I tried. 

I wouldn't choose to come back based on what else Vegas has to offer, but I can see the draw for the Instagram crowd.

I heard it gets super busy on a weekend night but lunch on Friday after Thanksgiving was not crowded at all. We were seated quickly, even with our huge party of 15.

I heard that this is one of the best pho places from multiple Vietnamese folks. I personally can't tell the difference, but they offer a variety of pho, and everything was delicious. The oxtail fried rice is a must as is the mikong pho. The ingredients are fresh and broth tasted clean, which are always pluses for me! We like to eat our pho with sliced onions as a side dish covered in chili sauce, and they came out with sliced red onions which was yummy and not usual at pho joints in LA.

We didn't get the infamous lobster pho (market price was $45 when we went which is quite steep for pho...) but I heard it's overrated and not worth the big bucks. They also had a Instagram special where if you post a photo on Instagram, they take $5 off the plate. Even that incentive was not enough for us to take part.

I'd recommend stopping by for a lunch meal, but I don't think it's worth any sort of wait. It's a fun atmosphere though!

We did have a slight issue with one of our dishes--lets just say we found an unwanted item floating in it. The server was really nice and apologetic about it and took it off our bill rather than sending out a new dish, which was perfect for us.

Went for happy hour which is from 5-7pm. Tasty food at reasonable prices at this time. I got the fried pork buns, the egg rolls and papaya salad. I couldn't finish all of it. The portions were surprisingly filling for a happy hour menu. The papaya salad was refreshing, but spicy. The egg rolls were savory, they came in 4s. But the best part of the meal in my opinion were the pork buns. Filling and fatty, but soooo good. The place also has a pretty big bar. Next I need to try their lobster pho. That's on the bucket list.

The lobster pho is delicious! I was expecting it to be overhyped and similar tasting to regular pho, but it actually was unique. The lobster was cooked perfect and paired well with their broth. I really enjoyed it and would come back for it again, even if it's pricey ($50).

We also ordered the sea snails with a Tom Yum soup base. It was extremely delicious! I would definitely recommend this dish. 

I want to give this establishment 5 stars but there was a lot of miscommunication involved that forces me to give it 4 stars. We had to come here three times in the span of 2 days in order to finally be able to try the lobster pho before heading back to LA. The first night we came here on a Saturday night at 9 pm and the restaurant was pretty empty. Even though there seemed to be a lot of seating, the hostess was really slow at seating guests. Finally, it was our turn to be seated and we overhead that they had run out of lobster for the day, so the lobster pho was unavailable. The hostess suggested we call back tomorrow morning to see if they would have a shipment the next day. So we took her advice and called to question if they would another shipment. When we called at 11 am on a Sunday, the  person on the phone assured us that they had lobster. So we made the drive off the strip expecting to try the lobster pho, and the waiter tells us the shipment didn't come yet. It was really inconvenient that the person on the phone gave us false information and had us drive all the way to the restaurant. Finally, towards the end of our day, we decided to call and ask again. They assured us they really had a shipment of lobster. Because it was delicious and worth the wait, I got over the fact that we had to make three attempts. I have the impression that they must run out of things quite often because I wanted to order a fresh coconut drink and they explained that they ran out of that too.

Despite  the misinformation, I would come back here for the sea snails and lobster pho.

We had a friend who wanted to go here so bad because of the lobster pho he saw on instagram. He never got around to it, but we did.

The lobster pho was $39.99 but so worth it. It was huge with a super fresh-tasting lobster. And the broth is to die for! My only complaint is the amount of MSG. I felt so heavy and tired after. But while I was eating it, it was amazing. I wish we could have brought the leftovers home, but we were going to be traveling by plane.

We also ordered the oxtail loco moco, even though we couldn't find it on their menu. It was awesome. Super flavorful and cooked to perfection. The rice was not dry or too moist, and the egg was perfect and the yolk burst perfectly when you poked it with a form. My BF ate the whole thing.

We're coming back next time we're in Vegas.

First time here came from Denver ! Super
Delicious !! Finally a place that have snails and it was delicious !!! Ox tail soup was BOMB!!

Very good hip Pho spot near China Town. I've had the oxtail, rib eye, shrimp, and veggie Pho. 
Each are excellent in their own right, I prefer the oxtail, they put a ton of meat in plus offer fixins and extra broth on request. Haven't tried the Lobster Pho yet, but this place goes far beyond the gimmick of a $50 bowl of soup. The menu has a variety of tasty options you wouldn't expect to see in a reg Pho shop, like calamari and oxtail fries (both excellent!). The late hours and bar options make this a late night grub necessity. Comfy booths and informed waitstaff round out an altogether solid  experience. Only docked a star for extreme lack of parking, and menu items are around 15% overpriced across the board.  I generally split an app with my Wife and we each get a Pho, after tip total averages $50.
Off the hook...rare beef to the bone finger licking good!! :))  Enjoy all these foods we've tried too. Checkout our yummy eats! ;)

I was in Chinatown to get my tickets for the Las Vegas Fringe festival at the Las Vegas Little Theatre.  Instead of cooking when I got home, I decided to hit somewhere in Chinatown and eat there.

I saw the District One sign and made my decision then.  The restaurant had a fair number of people so I sat at the bar.  For one person, that often is a good option.  I looked over the menu for some time and opted to eat healthier than normal.  I ordered the Shaken beef salad with house dressing.  It was a nicelyu done mix of greens with tender, warm beef slices, and topped with the house dressing,  The flavor was a little spicy which was good.

After finishing my salad, one of the servers asked me about dessert.  He named two things and when he said coconut, he had me.  I got the coconut ice cream which is a half fresh coconut with ice cream inside and nuts on top.  As you eat the ice cream, you scoop out the coconut meat and it's a very good combination to get ice cream, fresh coconut, and nuts in one scoop.

Service was very good.  My iced tea was refilled a couple of times and I didn't need to ask.  A very pleasant stop!

Basing this review on the service. We sat for almost 10 minutes with no one approaching us. A table was sat next to us, then a guy comes by and asks for our order. The server to the table next to us, brought this chalkboard with specials on it, which I never saw, they also got their order in within minutes of sitting. Food was good, but I work in the industry. This was awful.
This is restaurant is one of my favorite place to eat at in Las Vegas. Their pho is always on point. The bone marrow soup is a must if you have a hangover. Everything on the menu are good.

Lobster pho had no or very little flavor of lobster. I got the surf and turf pho with half a lobster , more like 1 claw and pure shells for garnish and 5 slices of rib eye. Not worth it, Service was alright. Other things on the menu looked good.

I went to this place 3 times already! 
The food is amazing. 
The oysters are a bomb!!!
Must try the Bloody Mary!!
The Bloody Mary is the best one I ever had. 
If you take the soup for to go they will get you 2 to go cups and split the soup and the spaghetti so it won't go bad. 
Amazing place. Must try it.

My friend took me here and told me it was the best Vietnamese restaurant. 

This really made me question his thoughts and his sanity, definitely subpar at best

We went here on Sunday for lunch and everything was excellent.  We got a table right away since the place wasn't busy.  The bun bo hue was good, but they didn't put too many noodles.  Not spicy at all.  My friend ordered com bo luc lac with an egg and he said it was good.  We also ordered coconut ice cream for dessert and it was delicious.  Overall, this place is clean, the services are excellent, and the prices are not bad.

World's best fish tacos. Full Bar, quality seafood selection, and a great atmosphere!
This is a well thought out business that cares about quality!
A must try when you are in Vegas!!! Very cool fusion Vietnamese food and Wow, delicious! I'm a local so I know my food spots

This review is for a Saturday night dinner service and not for their happy hour service.

I guess I am definitely in the minority here, but I thought the best thing about my visit was serendipitously meeting Eric and Lisa R and having them join us for dinner. Beyond that this place had mediocre food and terrible service. From the moment I walked through the door, it was nothing but waiting.

Waiting for a host/-ess or anyone to acknowledge us or tell us to put our name down, etc. After being seated and ordering, it was waiting for my ice tea which came after everyone else's drinks were served and only after prompting the waitress. Then waiting for everyone's entree. I ordered the bun bo hue and green papaya salad, which came out in that order.

The green papaya salad had large, steamed 20/25 shrimp, instead of the dehydrated small bay shrimp (which add additional saltiness to the dish). It was okay. The bun bo hue had a good, robust beef flavor and was not too spicy, but it was missing the pig hock and the pig's blood. When I asked if they forgot, the waitress replied they were out. Gee, you couldn't tell us that before we ordered?! You can't send someone across the street to 168 Market to  buy some? To add insult to injury, while waiting our waitress to refill my ice tea, I see a waiter carrying a pitcher of ice tea by, look at my empty glass, walk to his table to fill a glass of ice tea, and then walk away to set the pitcher down. Really dude?! I know we were not your table but I guess you would've died on the spot if you had filled, or even inquired about, another customer's ice tea.

At the end of the meal, after all the waiting, I could not leave this place fast enough.

Been here before and service was great. Food even better. HOWEVER, this time around the lady at the counter skipped us on the list of waiting parties. She didn't even call our parties name, instead she crossed it out without our knowledge. We tried to ask her about it and she was rude. She completely ignored us until I had to yell at her. She then changed her attitude, acknowledged her mistake, and sat us. 


Aside from that, service at the table was great.

Our server was nice and gave us samples of the beers to see which one was good. I went with the sculpin IPA. 

We had the pork belly bao, the bone marrow soup, and the garlic noodles with steak and eggs. I wish the garlic noodles were more garlicky. The food overall was great. 

I'd recommend anyone to come here.
Beef carpacio.... awesome. . Lobster pho...WOW.... Why only 3 stars.... The service ... horrible. ..sorry to say.... But I would definitely return to see what else that kitchen can produce

If you're coming for the bone marrow pho, come earlier rather than later. Had one person in my party disappointed to find out they ran out at 2:30pm. Then he finds out his second good choice of deep fried crab was no longer on the menu, so caution!

We had a party of 10. We thought appetizers took a few minutes too long to come out. The oysters on the specials of the day menu were 3.50 each and they were very small. I thought they were good, but I would rather not have the caviar texture on it. The thinly sliced meat with oil was interesting. It was good, but food at room temperature doesn't really appeal to me. Most of the family got the oxtail soup since the bone marrow pho was sold out. They thought it was good, the noodles are thicker than we are used to. 

The most negative part of our experience was that our food came out at very different times. Half of the party who ordered rice dishes ended up finishing eating as the soups made their way out. We came here to eat together not watch each other eat. That's a little mean, but it really did suck. 

Other than that, the food that we did get to order was decent. Buy personally, I'm not a fan of Asian fusion. I like my Asian food as is. (: (for example, their papaya salad is not how I like my Thai papaya salad :(.....) 

But I would still give it another chance to try their bone marrow pho and lobster pho! 

Enjoy (;
The food is incredibly fresh and delicious, the atmosphere is fantastic, and the staff is all very friendly and accommodating. This is a must-go destination of Vegas.

I don't love it, but I like it. I'm not a fan of Vietnamese food but this place is not your typical Vietnamese restaurant. It's in a busy plaza of Chinatown and parking can be a struggle. 

ATMOSPHERE
District One has this urban feel to it. Place is spacious and loud, with three sections. The sports bar, main floor and booth. 

SERVICE
Courteous, friendly service. My server suggested some of her favorite dishes and was attentive the entire time. 

FOOD
Not too much of a selection. Menu consist of appetizer, rice, noodle soup and seafood. My friendly server told me that anything with oxtail is popular, and suggested me Oxtail Loco Moco which is not on the menu. Along with that, she also suggested Rice Combo Platter (choice of short ribs or pork chop but you can get both for $4 extra) and Oxtail Fried Rice. 

Oxtail loco moco was good! Not like the Hawaiian loco moco that I imagined it to be with the buttery gravery. Gravy itself had a vietnamese twist with pieces of cilantro. There were plenty of oxtail inside which was super tender. All of this deliciousness with sunny side up egg....perfection. 

CONCLUSION
Obviously one item is not enough to give this place the accurate rating but I will be back to try more and adjust my rating/review.

We go out at least three times a week, this place by far has the best and most attentive servers. They were very knowledgeable and so very friendly. Food was creatively executed with perfectly paired flavors.

Food is ok , 4 stars for the lemon they use for PHO was so old the lemon was brown and yellow, the coke was flat but they changed to the new one so it better . Staff was nice , very clean looking place .

The food was really good! Everything was seasoned just right, nothing was under seasoned or over seasoned. Me and my wife ordered the 5 spice Cornish hen which we shared and a pandan creme brûlée for dessert. The Cornish hen was served with tomatoe fried rice which was plenty for two people and the creme brûlée was on point, because the sugar shattered when tapped with A spoon which means it was done properly. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it took FOREVER just to get our check, and it wasn't even busy. Overall service was pretty good and food was really good. I'll definitely be back

I give it a 3 1/2 stars.

Maybe we just ordered wrong?  I was super hyped about District One and I even braved the cramped parking lot with our SUV just to try this place out.  But we came away just a bit underwhelmed.  No pop!  No wow!  Just a long, drawn out poot.

District One was hoppin', no joke there.  Sports on the TV, alcohol flowin' freely, and lots of heads on tables.  Very busy but luckily no wait when we visited.  The place is nice - modern, vibey, nice leather booths.  Shiny & new!  But the food...eh...was a bit lackluster.

I love me some Vietnamese food, and I love me some fusion.  But while that may be good and appreciated, I gotta sway back to the classics.  What good is fusion if you don't have the classic down?  Does one not learn how to walk first before trying a 360 kick flip?  Do you just approach Heidi Klum and MInka Kelly without mastering the art of taking the 'grenade'?  I think not.

Perhaps we should have ordered differently at District One, because what we had just didn't impress.  The menu looks delicious, rice dishes, soups, noodles, lots of Asian-inspired cuisine.  But that day I really wanted pho, and the wifey really wanted wings.  

We started off with the Tamarind Wings.  Wow.  For $6, I'm sorry to say, I felt a bit ripped off.  These were 6 of the tiniest @$$ wings I've ever seen!  At $1 a piece damn were they small.  I mean, these wings were literally half the size of those you see at a place like Wing Stop.  Nearly no meat!  I guess I wouldn't have complained if they were some bomb-diggety wings...but...they were bland.  Oh, just bland.  There was a bit of sweetness to them but that was it.  One note.  No mixing of flavors, no sour, no heat, no crunch, no nothing.  I don't think they were properly seasoned as well because I didn't get much of a salty flavor either.  So plain.  This app definitely left the wifey and I hungry and hoping the main dish would fit the bill.

We both stayed basic and got the Pho Bo Vien, the beef pho.  It came to the table steaming hot, nice.  But again....what's with the portion?  The bowl was smaller than what we were used to at other Vietnamese places around town.  And for $8 each, we were a bit surprised.  At other decent places around town, for the same price I can get the special pho with more goodies, and in a bigger bowl.  We got our little plate of veggies as well for sharing.  This included some basil, bean sprouts, and fresh chilies.  The pho was pretty good, District One has some great broth.  Not overly salty, lots of complex flavor, good on the palette.  But boy did I crave for more noodles and more beef to sop this broth up.  

The service for us was excellent.  Server was very attentive, wasn't hesitant to let us know if we had any questions on the menu to just ask.    Water was kept filled.

Overall it was an OK first visit to District One.  The wifey and I left hungry and were eating again less than two hours later.  I think place does warrant another visit, but maybe next time we'll go with the more popular dishes they serve.  I do fancy some Big Bone Soup or some Oxtail Pho!

Was my first time here while in Vegas and I was absolutely blown away.. Everything was delicious.. Wish i would have ordered more.. Can't wait to visit again next time we're in town!!! Definitely a must have!

Came here after a long day and was seated almost immediately even though a crowd. Once seated we were served drinks and left the menu to look through. 

I ordered the oxtail pho and came to realization it was also happy hour so I ordered the porkbelly buns (fried)... needless to say it was amazing. I've always had steamed buns but having it fried was no comparison to the unhealthier version.

The food arrived all together, I immediately tried the oxtail pho and it was so tender and soft to the bite. And also had the very crispy spring rolls which wasn't too hot on the inside so I was able to power through the appetizer.

In the end, I was very satisfied with my decision to eat here and will definitely bring friends and family here because the ambience is great and not too loud even though there's a sports bar. 5 stars all the way

I've wanted to like District One, but that may be the reason why I was disappointed with their food. A modern Vietnamese restaurant that has the city talking and even some of the country talking with their introduction to whole lobster pho a few years back.

I didn't dig the interior. It reminds me of Boiling Crab with the log looking tables and wall fixtures. The emphasis on sports and drinking with all of the TV's make it an option to watch sporting events.

The thing about District One is that their pho broth wasn't good. We tried two bowls of pho, oxtail fries, and egg rolls. I had this thought in my head that they really had this modern Vietnamese restaurant that improved on a classic and elevated it, but the pho was so bland. With Vietnamese pho I am a purist. I add my veggies and that's it: no fish sauce no hot sauce, nothing. I had to hook my broth up so much to make it decent. The oxtail fries were good with lots of oxtail meat, but not as good as Bachi's. The egg rolls were so small and the filling very dry and at $9 for 4 pieces was a hard no from me.

I have to give them props on their staff. They have a lot of staff and they are very attentive-you're not only helped by one person.

At the end of the day I would not go back to District One for pho. If I want a good bowl of pho I would definitely try somewhere else. I recommend stepping the broth game up otherwise nothing is enticing.

Hype is real. In a plaza in Chinatown. Service is friendly and portions are decent. 

Got the Lobster Pho to share with 7 girls ($50). Nice to have a bite each to try. Very flavorful and lobster was cooked perfectly.

The beef carpaccio is really good. Has a little smokey flavor to it.

The egg rolls and spring rolls are ok. Nothing special.

Now for the bone marrow pho. It's massive and a ton of work. Ask for gloves to dig out all that marrow and make sure you order a side of noodles because it doesn't come with it. DELICIOUS!

Very good.  we had calamari that might be the best I've ever had. We had ox tail fried rice and lobster pho. Both were very good. the lobster pho came with a whole. It was $50 though we should've asked market price before we ordered.

I've been eating at District One regularly since I moved to Vegas. There's something about D1 that keeps drawing me back. Other than the food, I'm not sure if it's the spacious layout of the restaurant or if it's the trendy casual vibe I feel as soon as I enter. But either way, they found a regular customer in me!

They're mostly known for the Pho but the rest of the menu is amazing! If you're willing to splurge a little extra, your server will bring a Specials Chalkboard to your table with some options for you but otherwise, you'll probably be very satisfied with their menu!

 TO SHARE:

Spring Rolls- Personally was never a fan of spring rolls until I tried the ones here. The rolls taste so fresh that I sometimes tell myself that I'm eating healthy whenever I order these. I also like to ask for no mint just because it tastes too strong but otherwise, I can eat them all day. 

Oxtail Fries- VERY generous with the oxtail meat and the fries. That's all you need to know!

ENTRÉE:

Rice Combo Platter- You get rice, an egg cooked to your preferred taste, sliced Taiwanese sausages, and you get the option of either pork chop or short rib. I HIGHLY recommend asking for both and paying extra! They're BOTH so good that no one should have to choose between one or the other. With a hungry stomach, you'll be able to finish the plate and feel quite full/happy. But if you're not that hungry, I would suggest asking for both meats and sharing it with someone else or taking the rest! It'll be more than enough. 

Never had an issue with service. They know what they're doing!

Can't wait to go back soon!

Is there a better place to eat at midnight? Vegan pho on the menu with a drink when I have a craving after a concert on my way home. I cannot think of a better place for me to go. District one is the bomb!

This place was amazing! I've seen some pictures of the food here from friends and decided to take my boyfriend to a late lunch today.Well we scored and came in during happy hour! $1 oysters and .50 cent serano chili wings! Obviously we couldn't pass that up, I also had the fresh scallop sashimi which is only on their specials menu, well worth the $17. For my main dish I had the steak and egg! All delicious and very reasonably priced. Definitely going to be back for some late night happy hour in which they are open till 3am. Everyone who worked here was very friendly and it was a great atmosphere! Awesome job District One :))

Lobster phooooo! This place is so cool, and their highlight product is a delicious precut lobster in a tasty pho not to be missed. Dont stop there, try their pork belly buns or vietnamese carpaccio to die for! Highly recommended!

Oh hell yeah....  off the hook with Surf & Turf Pho....  wow, the cocktails are awesome, the menu is really impressive.  Laid back staff who can actually tell you the specials from memory  ( nice ! ), and alert....  they nail the kalbi ( short ribs ) on the spot. Perfectly done.
Love love love their House Special Oysters! Will go to District One just to order those! Good vibe, friendly service, nice take on Asian flavors.

Ehhh...more misses than hits when I came.  With all the pics from previous Yelpers, I had higher hopes.  Honestly, there are probably better fusion Southeast Asian places in LV.  Hopefully you have a better experience!

***edit -- service wasn't up to par.  We had to flag down and make requests a couple times for items we needed for our food.  Also, we made reservations for 8:30 and when we got there, we had to wait around 20 minutes before we were seated.

This is my go to place for quality pho. I also love the oxtail fried rice! I wish it came in a small size as well, because i would love to get pho and a small side of fried rice. 
The reason this place only gets four stars is because whenever I order the oxtail fried rice, they put soooo much onions. Im not an onion hater, but its like they barley even cut the onions (see photos). So I would recommend anyone to just order light onions. 
Also almost everytime the egg comes overcooked. It tastes good however the egg comes, but why ask how I want my egg (over easy) when it almost always comes with a completely cooked yolk.

Felt that I needed to give an honest personal opinion. First time there the food was good. This time we decided to try the $50 lobster pho and garlic noodle. I couldn't understand the rave on this. Personally felt it was salty, noodle over cooked, lobster was mushy, soup did not have lobster flavor. Really not worth the money or taste. Garlic noodle was dry and didn't had much garlic taste, this could be the worst garlic noodle I've had. Skipping our third dish, not worth mentioning. However, their service was friendly and attentive which is great. Didn't want to rate 3 stars but felt everyone should know lobster pho is waste of your money.

I love eating here! 
The oxtail fries are amazing, the place looks great, every time I've come here the service was quick. Overall great food & staff. Jason was very helpful! He sets a very good example on how staff should be.  Five stars! :)

BRING A HOODIE. Sounds weird? This place was freezing. Probably an ingenious plan to get you in the mood for pho in the middle of summer. 

Came in to try this trendy joint. Again, the first thing you are hit with is the freezing cold. Did I mention to bring a hoodie? Yeah, bring a hoodie.

To warm myself up in the mean time, grabbed a drink. I always a major plus when a restaurant has decent beer. The Sculpin IPA is a very big plus.

The servers were prompt, showed us the specials for the day. There IS lobster pho, but we didn't HAVE lobster money this night so we opted for Oxtail Fried Rice, Pho Oxtail, and the Pho Tai Rib Eye.

The Oxtail Fried Rice ($12.95) is really overpriced. Everyone of their rice dishes seem like that. It was a good portion of rice, but I've had better fried rice (Japaniero) for cheaper. The chunks of oxtail in the rice was tender and delicious. Nothing else really exciting about the fried rice though. Lacking a flavor other than oxtail. So hope you got oxtail in every bite.

The Pho Oxtail is huge, you get the huge bone in there with plenty of oxtail for cheaper than the rice ($11.95). My Pho Rib Eye also had delicious slices of meat. I did think it was a little skimp on meat with a little too much broth. I don't know if it was just me. What I did have though, was delicious. I overdid the sriracha and jalapeno. 

I ended up with bastard broth. The broth was so spicy that my head sweat and I was crying. I finished it all. Why? It was delicious.

The atmosphere and the different specials assures me that I'll be back. I will have to get lobster pho eventually and try out their different appetizers. 

Did I mention to bring a hoodie?

My best friend and I loved their shrimp the first time we tried them. We had to come back for more! This is our go to place when we have a seafood craving late at night. Their service is good. The servers are nice and friendly. I get a good vibe from this place, which adds on to the pros. Presentation of the food is cute. Simple but nice.

We will most definately be back!! 

Tonight was our 1st time dining @ District One. First off, the staff was polite and attentive, so they get an A on service! Now let's get to the food, oh man the food.. We had the wings to start, and that's some sweet and spicy yumminess right there. We would of gotten a 2nd order, but had to leave room for some of that good good, the pho! Now the broth was aromatic and flavorful.  Next time we're definitely going to try the lobster pho and pork belly buns! And the visit after that we'll try the snails. Lol I love lemon grass snails, yum yum in my tum!

First heard of this place from a video from Facebook. They were promoting their lobster pho. I'm not a huge fan of pho but everything else on their menu looked good. So my friends and I came to visit while we were in Vegas. I ordered the oxtail fried rice and it was really good! It was a pretty big portion so I took the rest home. My friends and I shared the oysters that were $3.50 each and they were really good! They were better than the bluepoint ones that we got a dozen of but still pretty good. I tried a little bit of what my friends got as well and we were all pleased with what we got. I would def come visit this place again when we visit Vegas!

Friendly staff and really good service.  We ordered the soft shell crab, pork belly bun, oxtail fries, beef carpaccio and garlic noodles.  Everything was really good. I also ordered the Leche martini,  which was awesome.  I think my favorite was the oxtail fries. The oxtail was a huge compliment to the  fries. Not to mention the gravy and the egg.

After tonight, I'm not sure what the most interesting restaurant in this plaza is.

Mountain View Plaza on Jones between Spring Mountain and Desert Inn is home to other great restaurants such as Asian BBQ & Noodles and Chada Thai and Wine. I finally made a long overdue visit to District One to hang out with old friends. Per their web site, their name is inspired by the old "epicenter for entertainment and dining" in yestercentury Saigon, but their cuisine is a fusion of Vietnamese with other Asian cuisines and American flavors. Still, I was definitely able to spot the Vietnamese influence in a lot of dishes.

"Happiest Hours" are Mon-Fri 5-7pm and Sun-Thu 12am-2am, and we hit the sweet spot of the normal happy hour, so a lot of our dinner consisted of sharing those items:

Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio ($9.99 Happiest Hours / $11.99 regular): beef, citrus soy, sesame & truffle oil, crispy white onion, crushed peanut. The beef pieces are considerably thicker than your average carpaccio, but they weren't too difficult to chew. Fortunately, the truffle oil was used judiciously, so I enjoyed the overall combination of varied flavors and textures.

Belly Buns (2 pc, $3.99 HH / $7.99 reg): braised pork belly, pickled carrot and daikon, cilantro, crushed peanut. Not sold on the supposed presence of cilantro, but the pork belly is prepared a la "xá xíu" (aka char siu, aka BBQ pork). In combination with the slaw, it really evokes the flavor profile of banh mi. Execution was inconsistent in that the meat in the encore order lacked fat and consequently seemed drier, but the first order was bursting with juices, and the happy hour price is stellar.

Cajun Garlic Fries ($2.99 HH, not on reg menu?): french fries, fresh crushed garlic, cajun seasoning. The garlic was far more prominent than the cajun spices, which is fine with me. These seasonings were uneven over the plate, but they were really addictive, and it was feasible to cobble together enough from the spillage. Ketchup can cover for that issue too. Also, it's a very nice portion compared to enhanced french fries at other restaurants.

(An interesting food hack that one friend used was to dip fries in the leftover beef carpaccio sauce. I've got to try that next time.)

House Special Oysters ($19.99 for 12): ponzu, caviar. We got this instead of the fresh oyster, which is $1.25 per oyster HH. For the small increase in average-per-oyster price, the ponzu and caviar put an interesting spin on what could have been mundane lemon and cocktail sauce oysters. A small quibble is that the oysters were a bit on the small side, but that's easily solvable with a second order...

Crispy Egg Rolls (4 pc, $4.99 HH, $6.99 reg): pork, mushroom, taro. The overall flavor was really good, especially with the dipping sauce. However, I'm sure most people will agree that there is far too much taro compared to the other parts of the filling. I barely had a problem on this occasion, but my ideal is a more meat-focused egg roll. I would avoid it as a silent protest of sorts, but you should try it once if you haven't.

Fish Tacos (2 pc, $4.99 HH / $9.99 reg): sashimi yellowtail, avocado, cilantro, cherry tomato, serrano pepper in a crispy shell. One of my favorite bites of the night. This does not remind me of anything in Vietnamese cuisine. It's more like the seafood tostadas offered by Soho Japanese Restaurant, This rendition has a medley of flavors, especially when you squeeze the lime wedge into the taco. I enjoyed the reorder of this dish, so I have to rank it above the Belly Buns.

Serrano Pepper Wings ($0.50 each HH, $7.99 reg for ? pc): deep fried wings, supposedly in serrano pepper sauce... wait, what sauce? Yeah, I'm going to ignore that odd description. These are moist, properly seasoned wings - a welcome relief after the relative disaster at Chow in downtown Las Vegas. The crust and flavors remind me of my dad's delicious recipe. Be prepared for the mild inconvenience of having to scoop up the serrano pepper slices and the green onion pieces to flavor variety.

Oxtail Fried Rice ($12.99): shredded oxtail meat, red onion, soy sauce, fried egg (sunny side up). This dish is fairly tame on its own, but it sings glorious harmonies in your mouth when you add a bit of Sriracha sauce. The sweetness, acidity, and heat in the ever-increasingly popular condiment perfectly complement the flavors of the fried rice. It's puzzling that the flavors aren't already in the fried rice recipe, but I don't care after how delicious it was. The only issue is that the oxtail didn't stand out for me. It could have been subbed out for any other reasonable protein.

I truly enjoyed District One. I was impressed with most of what I tried and the happy hour pricing, and nothing was overly disappointing. Come here for HH and bring friends. Perhaps you can enjoy Monday Night Football on the myriad of TV screens as we did. I can't speak for the rest of the menu just yet, but I'm excited to return to explore it.
Great food and great service. Each time I go there, my must items are beef carpaccio, ox tail soup, and fish tacos. You cannot go wrong with any of these items. The service are excellent.

Hipster Vietnamese fusion...

I like, I don't like it, then I like it again. This is pretty much the feelings I had when visiting District one. If a place projects itself as hipster, does that mean really they are no longer hipster? I got some googling to do.

After a cool yelp night at the Mirage, we decided a late night snack was required and after seeing some nice reviews of District One and throwing it up on my bookmarked places we decided to venture here.

Thursday night, the car park is packed, I have no idea why, maybe something was going on in another business that I didn't see or hear, so make sure you be patient. 

Walking into a near empty restaurant we were seated in a nice booth with a nice window view of some cool cars and neon lights. The layout is actually quite nice, with a nice long bar at the rear of house and nice big Tv's. The centre has 4 tabled chairs with a few booths closer to front of house. This place is a hipster bar, it doesn't seem like a restaurant in china or Asian town.

We were greeted by an extremely nice sever who went through a bit of the menu and made a few recommendations. All prices were very very reasonable, and dishes were quite large.

After looking at a few reviews on yelp we went with the Pork Belly Buns. And I'd like to pass on they were great!! As a main I grabbed the 5 Spice Hen. Little disappointed in this dish, very very dry and a little bland. I tried the Oxtail Soup which was a little difficult to eat but I will say to give it a try!

I like District One, I'm a little unsure how successful it has been, but I do believe the location might hurt them a little. This market would serve better on the strip or in a Green Valley or even in the heart of Summerlin with less Asian restaurant competition.

Overall
Price: $$
Drink: 3-5
Food: 3-5
Service: 4-5
Come back: Maybe

This place was delicious. We ordered king crab legs (D1 special), steamed clams with lemongrass basil sauce, scallops, fried rice, soft shell crab, short ribs, escargo and yellowtail tacos. All were amazing and not salty like most Asian restaurants. Cute place good staff!

I eat here 1-2x a week and I live In NW Las Vegas. 

Beef Carpaccio is sooo savory and is def first thing you try if you come here aside from the spiced hen. 

Staff and Owners are super accommodating and you can tell they love to host.

Pork belly buns, fried squid, oxtail pho, Serrano wings (double fried). Pork belly buns you have a choice of steamed or fried. Why choose? Get one of each and you wont regret it. Everything was delicious. Must try in Vegas. Bonus-it's away from the strip!! 

My glass was cracked and I noticed it after I devoured my drink. But other than that great experience.

Great place to experience while in Las Vegas. My wife and I had the privilege of trying this place due to family introducing. Awesome food and great service. 

My wife had the Big Bone Soup since she just loves the bone marrow. It was fun to watch her devour into it. I believe her when she says it was an awesome entree. Be ready to get messy but well worth it. 

I had the Oxtail Fried Rice which was very different but at the same time pretty damn good. The taste profile was spot on. Not too salty and not too bland.

I had been anxious to try this restaurant and am happy to report everything was outstanding. We shared the scallop special of the day, beef carpaccio,  fried rice, soup and coconut ice cream. 
The food was fresh, everything was balanced and tasty. 
I can't wait to go back again!
Really good fried rice. Try the oxtail fried rice. The pork belly buns are absolutely delicious. The coconut ice cream and fries with eggs is a must.
Updating my review to 5 stars because of the Ox Tail Fried Rice. I've eaten this at least once every time I'm in town. And man, it never disappoints.

2 1/2 stars. Came in on a Sunday evening and the place was so busy they were overwhelmed with crowds from the EDC - Electronic Daisy Carnival. I'm not sure if management was unprepared but the service and quality was totally absent this second time dinning here.

I ordered the Mekong River Noodle soup, pork belly with coconut juice appetizer and Garlic noodles with shaken beef & egg. I asked for the Noodle soup to be served first and balance of entrees to follow. Unfortunately the waitress brought  Won ton noodle soup which was incorrect,  after telling a different waiter who apologized BC they were busy and redelivered the wonton noodle soup to the table next store. When my correct soup arrived the noodles were flavorful and tasty and consisted of shrimp, quail eggs, sliced pork, chives and yummy broth.  The pork belly arrived secondly and it was tasty over the steam rice. Lastly the garlic noodles were totally a miss - horribly greasy and overpriced at $13.95! The waiter apologized for the poor service and offered me complimentary coconut ice cream dessert which took some time to receive since he never advised the waitress who only showed up once after bringing the wrong soup so she had to confirm the complimentary ice cream with the mangager!

I don't know if I'll return here again or if they're busy....I would avoid this place. I Hope they get their service together and hope this was a fluke incident.
Excellent food! If you like spicy this is your spot! The dessert were amazing...love the pandan creme brûlée.

Hubby found this place on Yelp. We usually go to the Cal for his oxtail soup, The Midnight Special... But he wanted to try something new , as the Cal hasn't met his expectations lately...

Came here at midnight. They do have midnight specials, such as the pork belly buns and sashimi fish tacos. The oxtail pho was not one of the specials , but it's reasonably priced especially for the amount of sleep you get, can easily feed two people...

I think he's found a new place to come for his oxtail soup...

Since it was 109 degrees that day, I chose the oxtail fried rice. So good!! Didn't have a chance to try any desserts this time. But I will for sure the next time we're in town!

I went here for happy hour last week and ended up getting chicken wings, fish tacos, pork belly buns, taro egg rolls, and french fries.  There was not anything notable about any of these appetizers.  The chicken wings and the egg rolls were good, but really nothing memorable.  The chicken wings would definitely benefit from an extra dipping sauce - like the fish sauce that came with the egg rolls.  The egg rolls had taro in them, which is why I wanted to come here.  The meat to taro ratio was off, as shown by the slightly mushy texture of the filling.  The pork belly buns come as either steamed or deep fried - I got the steamed.  The buns were not as soft as I hoped and the filling was very skimpy.  French fries were fine, but again, nothing memorable - McDonald's makes better fries.  The fish tacos were good, but tasted kinda odd - a little too fishy?  I think it's a ceviche like filling, but I'm not sure.

Although nothing was bad, I don't think I would come back here.  There are too many other restaurants in the area to try before I give this place another try.

I love that management reached out to me about my experience. It shows dedication to their business and customers. Definitely worth another star. And after a few more visits, I hope to give them the full five.

Pulling in its easy to find on jones. Friends have been recommending it so i though i would give it a try. Entering the place seemed clean with booths around the edge and a bar with like 5 tvs directly to the back. Alot of Japanese whiskey and scotches on display and a good selection of draught beer. Bartender was attentive and it was happy hour. I ordered pretty much everything he recommended from the pork belly to the oxtail fried rice. Food was served in a very timely matter and was good!  Great place will definitely come back.

They really care about presentation here! Great atmosphere, friendly service, authentic foods, & delicious desserts. I Will be coming back for more. 

Must-haves: "Lobster Pho!!!!" cross that off your bucket list because you need to eat this before you die. Yolo...definitely a Yolo

My Dad, husband and myself all ate here Wednesday evening.  I wish I remembered out servers name as she was very nice.  She pointed out to us that it was happy hour for a bit longer and so we ordered the wings, pork belly buns and egg rolls.  The egg rolls were standard, the wings I expected to be saucy but it was more like fried chicken, and I did enjoy the pork belly bun even though I must warn you it was very fatty and one is more then enough if you don't usually eat foods that rich!  Also, I could only stand to eat one wing because it was so greasy.  I reeeally wished the wings were saucy and not greasy.  I also had the pho which was very good.  The food runners forgot our tables limes, basil and sprouts so we were almost finished when we asked our server if they served limes and she went and got them.  My Dad ordered the bone marrow with noodles and I think he was very happy.  He said not to get them if you are ever on a date because it is so messy!  The server gave him a few wet naps, plastic gloves and I think a bib to help with the mess, but it was still messy.  I think my Dad enjoyed it even though it looked like he was Fred Flintstone eating a Brontosaur.  The server wrapped one of the bones up for my dog and my dog also loved it!  I liked eating here.  It wasn't the best ever but I'm sure I can find more on the menu I would like better.  I saw other people here with coconuts with straws in them and I wanted one but was too full by then!

Came to Las Vegas for a 3 day weekend trip. District One was one of the place that I needed to try.  They were on the food channel network. We order Oxtail Fries, this was ok and kinda different. I did not like the Sea Snails. However, my friend loved it. As for, there famous Pho Lobster. It's a big portion, enough for 2 people. The pho lobster was $44.99. It's taste good. This was unique. Instead of having meat in your pho, you have lobster. This was my first time trying Pho Lobster. Would I order this again, probably not.

the only added value of my review may be a caveat:

 The lobster pho is the normal beef base. That pic is amazing, but i suggest spending your lobster money on more of their other worthy plates. 

everything we ordered was great. I will be back for the oxtail pho. my hands were sticky after gnawing on the bone.

This place is amazing! First time trying we got take out and ate at home and everything was great... Second time went and ate there and was even more impressed.  Really fast service and the atmosphere is pretty cool in there.  Got the whole grilled squid... The sauce it comes with is bomb... Super spicy.  Tried the shrimp when we went there, I've had boiling crab and hot n juicy before and I feel like the spices for district one are way better! Also tried the pork bao puns which are sooooo good.  Definitely a cool little spot Id recommend.  They have a good mixture of food for different options

Man. I barely write 2 star reviews man... but this past week has been cutting it.

Everyone's been telling me about District One and how great their food is, especially the Lobster Pho. Apparently, it was on Buzzfeed, but Buzzfeed hypes up spots so easily and it's really not that great.

My friends from OC and LA said good things and I was like okay, let's give it a try.

First off, I am not a fan of fusion food. 
It takes off the authentic taste of the origin. I am not against the idea, but I am just not into it.

I looked at the Lobster Pho and it just seems extra and not tasty, so I didn't bother. I've tried it before, and I was just not happy with it.

Today, luckily we went with 8 people so I was able to try various options.
Oxtail Pho - Soup was bland, had no flavor.
Eggrolls - I don't know why my basket had so much Basil and Mint. (Yes, I know how to eat Eggrolls correctly) I practically am Vietnamese.
Oxtail Fried Rice - This was the only dish which had flavor. But wow, there was so much oil .... was it the Chinese Sausag??
Steak and Eggs - It's basically the Shaken Beef plate. Rice was bland, the beef was sauteéd with vegetable... but it wasn't mind blowing or anything.
Double down - Garlic noodle... I didn't taste any of the garlic in there. The meat was all whatever.

Overall, there was just no flavor. Presentation is important but what's the point if the food doesn't pull through?

I've been here twice! Love this place! Wish it was on the strip instead. My friends and I make a trip to Las Vegas about 2-3 times a year, we obviously stay on the strip and don't rent cars so we have to uber here. I'm docking one star for the slow service, it's been slow each time. But the food makes up for it for sure! 

My faves:
-Shaking beef with tomato rice (really flavorful)
-Garlic noodle (so simple but so good, love all the garlic-ness)
-Oxtail fried rice (order mine without onions)

Recently had their pho for the first time, tried the broth before seasoning it with your typical sriracha and housin sauce, it was yummy!

Going to have to say. . . Their lobster pho price is a bit steep. I know it says "Market Price", we definitely didn't ask how much it would be (assuming it would be like $28-$35) but when we got the bill, we were taken back and couldn't stop laughing. $49 for a bowl of lobster pho! Yes, the lobster was huge but I do think that's over priced. Maybe it's because lobster doesn't cost that much in WA (even the big ones), lolol. That was our first L (lose/loss) of the new year, hahaha. First and last time we order lobster pho, but will definitely order the ribeye pho and perhaps try the oxtail pho next time!

This place has always been good to me.  Nice and clean, seating is ample and comfortable, staff has always been very attentive. Tvs are in view from pretty much any table, booth, or seat at the bar. 

Almost without fail, I'll order a fresh coconut to drink with my meal, because yes. Once you're done, ask them to cut it in half to get to all the glorious meat! Make sure you get the grilled whole squid! The seasoning on it is perfect and the shichimi (I think?) mayo matches so well. Anything with oxtail is a hit for me here, including oxtail loco moco and oxtail fries. Bone marrow soup is delicious, with some gigantic bones. Ask for extra broth if you end up running out. 

Love hanging out here with friends, and will continue coming back for sure.

Love this place! Food is amazing. Reminiscent of traditional Vietnamese cuisine, but with an added of a little something. Just enough level of customer service where you can find someone if you need something, but private enough for a good date night. Tonight my fiancé and I we're eating and he accidentally drop the nutcracker (for the crab legs) and immediately the owner (who I assume was the owner) came running to our table paper towel at hand to help clean up the phone. Pretty awesome of you ask me! A must try!!

Really love the difference in scenery for a Vietnamese establishment. Really nice elevated booths makes it feel really americanized right away when you walking. You get that aroma of pho all up in your face. Got the beef carpaccio, and the roti rice dish. Darkmeat was awesome, white meat is dry as usual at all Vietnamese places. Service attentive very friendly, lastly I really enjoy the phrases all over the wall.
The portion size was great and the service was really friendly.

Great food ("Vietnamese/Asian Fusion" is technically correct, but doesn't really adequately describe it), friendly service, in a shopping center full of great restaurants.  I had Vietnamese beef carpaccio, a coconut mojito served in a coconut, a cucumber gimlet, a great bowl of oxtail Pho, and 2 hours of relaxation, for less than a mediocre room service or cafe meal on the Strip.

I'd definitely recommend this place (open until 2am), especially for for drinks and lively groups.
I honestly thought food here was The top notch but was not really impressed although place looks clean and atmosphere is nice.Staff were friendly and service was not bad.

Went for lunch in the middle of the week.  It was just a bit crowded but I didn't have to wait long for a table.  The decor/vibe was a nice surprise and though it looks smaller from the outside, there are plenty of tables and a decent sized bar. They could turn the music down a bit so people could hear each other better though.

The issue was with some of the waitstaff and time for meals to come. Twice they poured water in my club soda and completely forgot to bring the drinks ordered by the others at the table. They brought my food (which was very good) and the other person w/us waited almost 15 minutes for his meal.  The staff seemed absent-minded and scattered.

Nonetheless, the place has a good atmosphere and I may have just been there on an "off day".  I'll go back and see if I have a better experience.

Was thinking this was a high- class joint catered to the richer...but have to say not bad at all! Loved the food, the feel, and the service! Our party had the oxtail pho, the bone marrow soup, pho meatball, green papa salad, chef's special steak with fries & corn, and garlic noodles....all were tasty! The only warning I must give though is that the papa salad is NOT like your typical one you know and love. This one is light in flavor and has basil plus meats (shrimp, beef, & pork). Hence, very different. Pho broth was great although there was a lack of sauces and seasoning that you could add yourself...only sriracha and his on available. Service was by far the best I've had. Most Asian places lack service A LOT, but this place was top notch on service! I would highly recommend this place.
We come for the oyster at their happy hours time. No where on the menu saying certain oyster s not for the happy hours price but they told us that we can only order one type with happy hours price
Delicious food. Big portions when it comes to Pho. Fast service. Will be back for more!

I can see myself coming here quite often!

Pretty cool menu and pretty cool vibe to this place. It has been on my list for a while and it did not disappoint. I ordered the Oxtail Pho and the Oxtail Fried Rice. I feel like the fried rice was a little expensive, value-wise but still quite tasty. The Oxtail Pho is where it is at though. I really can't wait to come here and try some of the Lobster Pho. I stare longingly at the pictures people have posted of that Pho. 

Good selection of beers. Only downside was that it was absolutely freezing in there. Not such a terrible complaint when you live in Las Vegas.

A friend of mine who is a Vegas resident recommended this place to me.  So good he comes multiple times a week. And he did not steer me wrong.  

Oxtail pho ($11.95): gigantic portion... 3 girls each ordered one and we could have shared one. Plenty of oxtail and meat fell right off the bone. Broth was good and noodles had a food bite. Overall wonderful.

Lobster pho (market price ~$29.95): for the price, it actually wasn't that bad. Definitely something to share. I would say it's something you order once, but probably won't order again. Good, but not great. 

Oxtail fried rice ($9.95): my favorite menu item. Plentiful chunks of oxtail mixed on well with buttery rice topped with an egg. 

Oxtail fries (can't remember price, it was a special of the day): my least favorite item. Mediocre and lacked the sparkle I found in the others dishes
Their oxtail pho, oxtail fried rice, bone marrow soup, and coconut ice cream are awesome! We'll come back for sure.

So far one of the best customer service I have had in a while. Everyone is pretty friendly and helpful, they make sure you are comfortable. The food is pretty good different compared to other places. Highly recommended especially if you like seafood.    Everything you eat will be flavorful its like a party in your mouth. 
The place is big so it is good for big parties. Some of my favorites are the 
Oyster 
Pork belly bun 
Steak and eggs 
Oxtail pho 
Slow braised pork belly in coconut juice
Coconut mojito ( verry good!) must try 
Best of all the big bone soup this a must as well 

The price is also decent considering how good the food is. Typically don't write reviews  unless the service is really bad or if I had a really good experience. With all that said Kudos to the staff for such wonderful customer service please do keep it up because for sure my friends and I will be a regular. :) 
I love that they are open till 4 am on the weekends.

Great place to grab lunch or dinner ! Parking is hectic in this plaza ! Service is decent. Took a star off because no one came back to refill my drink ! I had to ask numerous of times and it wasn't that busy ... Overall will come back for the food !! Love the pork belly and beef carpaccio yuummmm
Incredible food to say the least. This is my first time here and what makes it a home run for me is the atmosphere. It's a different type of Vietnamese restaurants.
Overall great place to eat. Good Pho, Great creme brulee and Service! Oxtail with Large oxtails. Good size Calamari portion. And Padang Creme Brulee (different but good) and friendly service.

we got there for happy hour which is from 5-7 pm monday-friday. The pork belly bao buns were on happy hour and it was delicious. It comes two pieces to an order but the pork belly melted in the mouth and the seasoning on it was not too salty. We tried the grill squid and it cooked perfectly the best part of it was the legs because it had the charred taste. The service was good and they kept refilling our water which was a plus. Also tried the spicy beef noodle and it was surprising that it had a kick to it. the oxtail pho was yummy and both the broth was good in balance. Overall the food and service was great will come back again.

The pho soup was delicious! Just wish that my oxtails had a little more meat on them cuz they were so tender it fell off the bone and probably got lost in their pot or something. For the pricey bowl of pho, I think the noodles could have been more plentiful. A few more strands couldn't hurt, noodles are cheap. My daughter had the garlic noodles and they were yummy. Definitely have to get here again cuz the other dishes looked really good. too.
