A little better than average but for $39.99 ... Ummm not ... I rather go to Boston for twin lobster ! Much cheaper ... Much bigger ...and the broth was ok ... Nothing special in the broth to make it tastier than any other Vietnamese pho place ... The oxtail fried rice was extremely tasty ... It had that wok fragrant flavor which is usually only obtained by an experienced season chef! I'll order that again ... I wish I had a bigger stomach so that I can try some of the specials

I've tried this place twice now hoping to find something I really like and tbh I don't find it to be anything special food wise. I tried several items on their menu from the pho to the steak and eggs and the spring rolls but none of them really stood out. 

In summary, experience is as cool and modern as they say, but the food is quite bland. The Vietnamese coffee is a must try, and it's not a good place for a date being that the music can get super loud and intense.

This place is awesome! If I could give it more stars I would. Everything I had was so delicious. I highly recommend the Vietnamese Donkey cocktail. It's a Moscow Mule made with Lychee Vodka and it's amazing. The service was great and just an all around great atmosphere!

Didn't order the Lobster Pho $49 (1.5 lb Lobster) due to the mediocre reviews and hefty price tag.

Do get: grilled shrimp ($4/shrimp). Baby bok choi ($8).

Been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally made it here. I loved everything that was ordered. I tried the oxtail fried rice, oxtail soup, and the pork belly appetizers. They are like mini sandwiches or sliders. You get three in an order. Loved it and will be back again!

Awesome food and services. Oxtail Soup and Big-Bone Soup are very good, but my favorites were the Oxtail Fried Rice and the Coconut Icecream. Mixed drinks are also on-point. Overall, I highly recommend this joint!!! Will be back...

The food tasted as good as it looks on the menu. We had oxtail pho, fresh oyster, garlic noodles with crabs, pork belly buns, and oxtail loco moco special. Everything was on point. Must try the pho and pork belly buns! Service was excellent and the atmosphere was great. A nice break from Vegas strip food.

I enjoyed the Pho! That's mainly what's offered on the menu... We had the vegetable spring rolls and the size was great, wasn't a fan of the minty taste in them though... Service was great. Only other recommendation aside from the minty minty spring roll was to have more menu options... Not really much to choose from...

Not a 4 star place, slightly underwhelming. The bone marrow soup looked incredible presentation-wise but was extremely difficult to eat and didn't have much flavor to it. The pork belly was rich and tender but wasn't mind blowing. The lobster pho will hit you with sticker shock at ~$45 a bowl and isn't worth the price past the novelty.

They have great Ox tail pho however! The pho broth is likely the best in Vegas and the ingredients are fresh. I'd come back for the Ox tail pho alone.

This place is loud and rowdy. Prepare yourself for the horde of drunk Asians.

This place makes their pho the right and good way. I love it. I got the oxtail pho soup. I wanted to try the surf and turf pho but I didn't feel like paying $35+ for a bowl of pho. Next time I will come back and try it. The price here is pretty expensive. The food is great but if you dine here make sure you are ok spending a bit more than other pho places. My oxtail pho was $15.99. The flavor of the broth was excellent and I slurped most of the broth down. Loved the meat on the oxtail. The noodles amount they give you was just right as well. They didn't give way too much noodles like other places. Our server kinda took his time and didn't greet us right away and he didn't really come back to check on us so I would probably want a friendlier and better server next time. Otherwise the food here is very good, just a bit on the expensive side.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon, and had to wait about an hour for a party of 6. I am told the wait is usually much less than this, but there typically is always a wait on the weekends. It was 110F outside, and the staff provided cups and pitchers of ice water for everyone waiting, which I thought was a very nice gesture. 

For food we had the pho, oxtail fries, which were delicious! Good for sharing. We also had the fish sauce glazed wings to share as well. It was very heavy on the fish sauce, which is great if you like it, terrible if not. The batter is very crunchy, really enjoyed these. The pho was also very good, generous portions of meat (ribeye). Overall, the food was very good, service was friendly. Prices are on the high side for pho, and for off strip, but they've definitely got the demand to maintain it, so why not? Overall, this place was good, but it didn't blow my socks off. I would probably come here again if someone suggested it, and I didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes. Otherwise, I think Vegas has plenty of other great food options for the price.

I was looking forward to trying the food here. But nothing stood out.  Chicken wings: over battered and salty. 5 spice chicken: nothing amazing. Oxtail fried rice: different, tasty but not spectacular. Close to $70 for food and 15% tip for lunch. Somewhat outrageous. I'll go for sushi or a good buffet instead.
Superbly made dishes with an ever expanding menu... I've been there with my family and work colleagues on numerous occasions and they've never disappointed..

My friend brought me here during happy hour. The atmosphere was Nice and clean. Food and drink was worth for what you paid for. However, I ordered a patron shot not knowing it was $10! I was not given a bar menu. I just thought it was be $5-8. Oh well

Lobster pho!!!! Incredible!!! And the oysters!!! Amazing!!! Already looking forward to my next Vegas trip to have these dishes again. So glad I found this place. Leave the strip guys and try this place you'll love it too.

District one has a great atmosphere and even greater food. The only downside to this place is the parking. It took me almost 20 minutes to find a parking space due to the limited amount of spaces shared between District One and about ten other restaurants. 

The bar has an impressive menu of specialty mixed drinks, beer, and wine. Once our table was ready we ordered the oxtail fries, lemongradd beef, fried calamari, pho, and more. The oxtail was so tender and flavorful that it almost melted in my mouth. 

However, I wish the fries were fried slightly longer so that they would be a little more crispy to hold up to all of the oxtail gravy. The beef pho was great, the broth was flavorful and not too salty and there was a good ratio of meat and noodles. Delicious food but next time I come I will make sure to ask for extra crispy fries.

Simply awesome. Their lobster pho is amazing. I usually add a side order of oxtail to it to make it a heavenly experience. They were also able to make a fish broth versio for my peacatarian fiancée. While slightly on thr pricey side, you get a lot for the money, especially when it comes to the lobster pho (lots of lobster).
It was our first time going there. Everything was so delicious  would love to go back again! If you love asian food this is the spot to go.

Really good late nite happy hour spot with several options. I tried the fish tacos and the pork belly buns you get two of each. The tacos were all right but the pork belly was very tender and fell apart with good flavor. I also got oysters which were good size.

In town to celebrate family birthdays, Yelped for an Asian fusion place and District One came in at #1 and it sure was a hit from A to Z!!! If you love soup, their big bone (bulalo) soup and oxtail pho are sure winners! Unlike other places, broth was on point with fresh garnishing items. Equally savory was their garlic fried snapper, steamed bok choy, oxtail loco moco and oxtail fried rice. For dessert, buko ice cream served on fresh coconut was awesome! What completed the great experience was the service #1!!!

I was surprised when I got there that there wasn't that many people because the food was great. I ordered the combo plate with the pork chop and a side of beef. Because I have a very strict diet the restaurant was very accommodating to switching a few things out and replacing it with stuff I was able to eat. The pork chop itself was very juicy. The side of beef was good but I thought it was a little too salty. 

The best dish I would recommend would be the beef carpaccio. It was perfectly marinated with the right amount of lime and basil. 

If you have dogs I highly recommend the oxtail soup. The soup itself was surprisingly not salty like how I've had in other restaurants. The oxtail was a bit hard to eat but the marination of it was amazing. The meat would just fall off the bone. 

FYI. The parking in that center is horrible!

The surf and turf pho is really good. As is the birds nest noodles.

The wings have really good flavor but they appeared to have some sort of batter on them which I don't prefer.

The garlic noodles are really good. Maybe a little oily but I added some of the fresh herbs that came with the crispy egg rolls and that was great. I was asked if I wanted to add anything to these. I added shrimp, I should have put vegetable too but they were really flavorful and chewy in the right way.

Fun place.  Great food.  Great ambiance. Sit in the bar and look for Aaron. He mixes the best drinks in town.  The oysters are  good especially the happy hour price. I ate a dozen and a half.  Highly recommend this place for a great foodie and drinkie place.

Very good selections of food.  Their hamachi tacos are one of my favorite dishes there.  The Phos are great as well. Not the cheapest place to have pho but their qualities are good enough for the price.

It's a real no-brainer that this will be the best Asian restaurant in town for many years to come. Cleanliness check, service check, decor check, food + drink check. You have everything and anything that your Asian craving desire. On top of that, you have the selection from the old Cravin Cajun menu! Crawfish and shrimp bags! 

I think that the Chicken Roti dish here should be their signature dish. I've been looking for years to find the equivalent of http://www.yelp.com/biz/bale-valley-restaurant-canoga-park
and finally DOKB delivered. The game hen, so juicy, so crispy, so salty-sweet. It's the ultimate indulgence. Surprisingly it does not come with fish sauce dipping, so don't forget to ask for it. It's a must! It would be like eating egg rolls without the dipping sauce (which by the way this place makes a mean egg roll!!). 

I can take my whole family here and every single person in the crowd would be pleased. I love the simple yet expansive menu selection. I appreciate not having to choose from 10 difference combination of Vietnamese rice dish when there's really only one. 

I'm already craving my next meal here.....

I love this place.  Ate there the other day.  The services was beyond my expectation.  Everyone who works there was so pleasant.  The food was delicious, probably the best PHO I had.  You have to try their garlic fries!  Enough said and try it yourself!

Always. And I mean always THE place to go for some of the best Vietnamese comfort food in town. 
And the drinks are amazing also.

BUN BO HUE!!  If you're looking for the best place for BBH, I highly recommend trying District One. 

District One is more upscale than your normal Vietnamese restaurants.  Love the ambiance and how spacious it is!  The booths are huge! Big enough to fit 3-4 people on each end.  They also have plenty of tables to accommodate bigger parties.  This has always been a favorite when planning big party dinners.  

I've tried a number of appetizers here, but I've stayed true to ordering one entree off the menu, and that's Bun Bo Hue.  On the menu, it's listed as, "Hue Spicy Beef Noodle," and it comes with beef shank, pork loin, and hue pork roll.  It's soo good!  It's unique in the way that it doesn't come off as oily and you don't have to sift through the spices to get to the broth.  Add some lime, cabbage, herbs, and you're good to go!  I rarely ever finish a bowl of pho, but time and time again, i see the bottom of the bowl whenever I'm here.  

They also have good appetizers as well!  I enjoy getting the chicken wings, oysters, and spring rolls.

They offer Vietnamese beer and fresh coconut juice!  They also have different specials each night.  The last time I was there, they offered shigoku oysters for $3.50 each.  And also, Happy Hour is from 5-7pm and 12p-2am!  It's a great place to come for late night eats and being able to enjoy everyone's company!

Asian Fusion is putting it mildly at this fabulous Vietnamese out of the way restaurant. 
Each food ordered had an unusual flavor of its own like no other. The grilled crab legs was so delicious that we ordered it again. The Oxtail Soup (Pho)with beef bones was full of rich flavor served with bean sprouts and Thai Basil toppings. Egg Rolls and Belly Buns which was braised Pork belly were excellent as well. Happy Hour is a great time to visit because that way you can sample more items.
The wait staff was beyond exceptional. We will definitely be back when visiting again!

Visit was 6/19/2016 

Came in and was able to get seated right away for a group of 4. 

Ordered dozen oysters, Lobster pho- of course (do it for the IG), oxtail fried rice, Belly Bun, Garlic Noodles. 

Dozen oysters were pretty yummy and fresh! 
Lobster Pho is Market Price! Ours came out to 50 dollars. Broth was on point, lobster is already opened for you, and was pretty meaty but I would not come back to order it again. Like I said, its for the gram. ANYWAYS. oxtail fried rice was super flavorful but not too salty, garlic noodles were perfect. Would recommend. 

Lastly, that belly bun, a bit too dry, and simply tasted like soy sauce to me. I have had better. But other than that, it was all really great!

Had a wonderful round of beers and appetizers. Came here with a friend from work to have a few beers and a bite to eat. We ordered a few appetizers to get a feel for the menu. I have to say everything we tried was delicious and executed very well. We ordered the wings, steam pork bun, spring rolls, carpaccio and the oxtail fries.....i really enjoyed it all. This area of town is really doing some exciting things gastronamically. I highly recommend this place and i will definitely return.

The food is awesome. I had the prime rib pho. It was excellent. The wings were ver good and the oysters fresh and tasty. Great service and atmosphere. It was packed but food and drinks came promptly. Highly recommended.

This place is very clean and the food is so good! I ordered the pork bun sliders, garlic fried rice with goat meat, and a couple of coconut mojitos!! The waiter was very nice and always asked if we needed anything.  I would definitely come back. This place also has a huge bar!!

District One was not our first choice for dinner, but was a pretty decent back-up option! We actually wanted to eat at Asian BBQ & Noodles next door, but didn't realize that the BBQ place was closed on Fridays - so we "settled" for District One. And it was a pretty solid find! 

HAPPY HOUR menu is from 5pm - 7pm and includes quite a nice selection of food & drinks that are TOTES worth it.

[Snacks to share]
1. Belly Buns (steamed) were good but nothing too amazing. 
2. The fish tacos were a refreshingly crunchy bite-sized way to satiate our appetite for a bit. 
3. The Green Papaya Salad was generous in raw shrimp, but was pretty one-dimensional in salty flavor.
4. Beef Carpaccio was super doused in truffle oil, so if that's your thing - you gotttaaaa get it. Just be ready for the fact that it's super bloody! 

[Entrees] 
1. At 6pm on a Friday, they were COMPLETELY sold out of their famous Big Bone Soup, which we were SUPER disappointed by. They said they were sold out since lunch and if we wanted to try it, they had no idea when it would be ready (since it takes hours and hours to make). Our sad faces weren't enough to convince the waitress to try to find some big bones they may have accidentally lying around. Bummer!!
2. Oxtail Fried Rice was probably the winner of the night! Large heaping mound of fried rice was warm, satisfying, and generously served with tender oxtail. It was very simply flavored, but super well done. It WAS a little on the oily side, but it did gave the rice a delicious smoothness. Plus it's served with an egg on top, cooked to whatever style you like! 
3. Garlic Noodles were a close runner-up for the fave of the night. It's simple noodles, cooked in super garlicky oil so you may not see the garlic chunks, but it's there in EVERY SINGLE DELICIOUS BITE! The noodles were firm and had a chewy texture that I would liken to spaghetti that's just perfectly al dente. YUM! 

[Dessert]
The Coconut Ice Cream was a disappointment. The surprise is that it's not coconut-flavored ice cream, it's VANILLA ice cream served in a half-cut coconut, so you get just a wee bit of coconut meat with every bite. It was very dissatisfying and such a misnomer. We totally regret getting this. 

[Overall]
It was a variety-filled meal where you'll definitely find something for everyone. Service was A+ and food came out really quickly! Would recommend if you're feeling munchy and want to get plates to share. Plus there's a HUGE selection of alcoholic drinks to pair with all the feastin'!

It was ok. Had the brontosaurus bone soup aka Bone soup on the meno. Literally two big bones, no meat on them by the way just for looks, and two pieces of oxtail. It was tasty but for 17.99 not really worth it. Food overall good but it's high prices Vietnamese food. House Moscow Mule was good tho, nice touch of lychee.

What a cute Vietnamese Asian fusion spot, with a full stock bar. I mean really, who wouldn't want their pho with a glass of Dom Perignon lol.

Service was superb, after seated our hostess let us know that our waiter would be around soon. After having some time to look over the menu, our waiter arrived and told us about the daily specials and asked if we had any questions about the menu. Very attentive and informative. 

I wanted to try a bit of everything so I ordered: The Five spice hen over tomato rice and pickled, Vietnamese beef carpaccio, Oxtail Pho, Pork belly buns, and the Oxtail Fries. Five spice hen over tomato rice: first off, I'm a sucker for five spice. Then hen was juicy on the inside with a fried crispy other skin. Vietnamese beef carpaccio was different but full of flavor. It was a little heavy on the sauce for my taste on carpaccio but hey its fusion. Perk belly buns, were delicious and juicy. Full of flavor with a soft steamed bun. Oxtail pho, had to try this. Oxtail, in pho? crazy! but they nailed it. I will honestly say, cleanest pho in town. What I mean by clean is, you don't get that heavy feeling of salt ans msg. Just a really good broth with chunks of soft oxtail finger picking goodness. If you have room spring for the oxtail fries. Its topped with a fried egg and oxtail infused gravy. So good.

We ordered the rib eye pho, couple orders of spring roll, papaya salad, garlic noodle and fried calamari. Everything tasted regular compared to similar places in Orange County. So much for the hype on this place. But the real reason for the review is the awful calamari. Expecting a hefty calamari order, we instead got a plateful of sliced fried jalapeño mixed with fried tiny bits of supposed calamari. You'll be fooled by the small round pieces. Careful when you bite. So disappointing.

Wanting a quick bite and decided to try something new. Never been here before and was wow'd the first time walking in. Never expect this contemporary décor when enjoying Asian/ Vietnamese food.  The wood all around the restaurant, multi leveled, and the beautiful 10-12 seat bar was warm and welcoming,  the aroma around the restaurant made us hungry, I was very excited to see what they had to offer.

After still talking about the décor, the server arrived promptly with menus and the specials of the day.  I was excited to try the entire menu, but settled on Pho Tai Nam. Yes, it's about 98 degrees that day and I decide I wanted hot soup, don't judge!! My friend ordered the Belly Buns. Although, I did not get a chance to try her dish, she couldn't stop talking about how good it was.  My soup was awesome, what was great about the dish was the after part.  After having Pho, at some places, I become growingly thirsty, not so much with District One's pho.  It was full of flavor, right about of onions, and did not have whatever component that makes you thirsty. Kuddos!!

I am excited to see this place make it big, very different concept. The food was definitely fusion, I mean where can you get fish tacos and chicken wings at any other Vietnamese restaurants.   I love the marrying of different flavors, cultures, and ingredients;  the unpretentiousness, that is what food is all about. 
Sure, this visit was brief, but I will definitely be back to try it out again and again.  Next time, I'll bring more reinforcements and will venture into the King Crab, Oysters, and the Down and Dirty options! Can't wait! Great job, great first impression!!

Long overdue review!

I personally think District One is underrated. I've been several times in the past few years - and my experiences have all been quite delightful! 

Food: 
Pretty good, however, the main reason why they get 4 stars and not 5. It's not over the top impressive but there are some tasty dishes I've enjoyed! 

- Shaken Beef Salad:
Greens topped with Extremely tender pieces of flavorful marinated meat and dressing 

- Grilled Whole Squid 
A dish I never get sick of, sliced grilled squid that comes with a spicy (siracha mayo?) aioli for dipping 

- Hue Spicy Beef Noodle Soup 
Great heat, decent flavor, not a lot of noodles but comes with a variety of different meats 

I've also tried various specials of the day including fresh oysters, king crab legs, whole boiled sea snails (in the shell) - all were tasty and unique

Service:
Very friendly bartenders and servers! Servers are knowledgeable about the menu and provide the specials of the day, which always vary 

Ambiance: 
Hip and visually appealing. Lots of seating available: bar, tables, and booths. I love the large comfortable booths! 

Overall District One is a fun spot to grab food and drinks, great for all occasions. If you haven't checked it out I would definitely recommend it!

What attracted me to District One and avoided District 9's drama altogether with Katniss? Lobster pho... duh.

Did we end up actually ordering this $60 sucker? Nope, but we did end up feasting on some pretty good New-American/bougie Vietnamese at this trendy restaurant off the Strip. It's a sports bar vs. Asian restaurant that is sure to satisfy your hunger needs.

My friends and I came during our recent Vegas trip since everyone was raving about how great the food is even if it's a bit pricier than other spots. My large group of eight ended up ordering a bunch of appetizers and mains for ourselves that were quite delicious.

Warning: their portion sizes here are fairly generous and you can really get full off an appetizer and maybe half a main!

We started off with their oxtail fries ($12) which came in a huge bowl with plenty of oxtail meat and a fried egg on top. You have to mix and mash all the ingredients in the bowl together to get the best effect. We ended up taking some home because there was no way we were finishing that bowl. We also got some wings to share and they were decent hot wings. Crispy and tender, and definitely curbed our cravings.

As for me, I went for the big boy bowl and got the "Big Bone Soup," ($18) which was essentially a large chunk of meaty bones with bone marrow. They do not play when it comes to the name- for the bowl is simply big. You cut off slices of flank from the bone and dig out the delicious bone marrow hidden inside. Simply amazing and incredibly filling.

The waitress convinced me to get a side bowl of pho noodles for $5 which you honestly don't need given how much food is in the soup.

District One was able to satisfy all of us and we left with big tummies ready to take on the rest of the day. If you want some good Asian with bomb portions, definitely check this spot out. As my friend would say though if you're considering just the pho: "get something you wouldn't find anywhere else, and would you really pay thaaat much for a bowl of pho?"

The choice is yours.

I visited Vegas for the weekend and I might have to come back every weekend because the Oxtail fries blew me away omg. Also, the customer service was impeccable - which is the most important quality to any business in my opinion.
Great food and decent service.  Lobster pho is delicious.  Variety of dishes in menu looks good.

My buddy and I ordered and ate the same food except I also had 6 oysters. Within 15 minutes I was vomiting explosively in the bathroom. Then 10 minutes later I was vomiting again. After that I got better and by an hour or so after that I was back to normal. It was the oysters they were bad and I got them up in enough time to not have any lingering effects. I notified my waitress and she denied it. I have filed with the Nevada Health Department to let them know the issue. The waitress and cook were way too dismissive of what happened.

Definitely worth the cab ride off the strip for some Vietnamese food.

- Oxtail pho is on point. Good broth that doesn't taste like it's loaded with MSG. Very generous portion of oxtail. 
- Oxtail fried rice is also good. Loved the crispy texture. 
- Fish sauce wings were OK. A little too fishy for my taste.

Service isn't like your typical Vietnamese restaurant which means no service at all. The staff is very friendly and attentive. They have a bunch of TVs if you don't want to miss a game as well.
Great service, so many things on the menu I would like to try. Definitely will return on my next visit to Vegas.

Not your typical Vietnamese "pho" restaurant. This was a great place to relax, have a drink, watch a football game and eat good food. Parking was tricky as the lot was full when went for dinner around 7:00. Also, we opted for sitting at the bar since there was a wait for a table. The portions were on the larger side so a good deal for your $$.

You never really see Vietnamese Asian fusion places, but with the 2nd generation of Vietnamese Americans growing up, you'll probably see more.

This place does a nice job of making classic Vietnamese dishes current. They've created a place that caters to the yuppy community in a cool and sleek place with also a gastropub vibe. 

I wouldn't come here though for the pho straight up though. Like the pho was good, but I feel like this place is more palatable to introduce pho to Americans than it is as your go-to pho spot if you're a pho connosseiour like cough cough...I didn't spell connesousiour right and my spell check won't help because it's so off. 

But this place is cousin's with one of the regular Pho spots so that makes it authentic right? And did you know restaurants can be related? 

We got oxtail pho which was good. The oxtail was tender like it should be. The soup was good.

We also had the pork belly, which my sister really liked. And a steak salad which was good but awkward because the steak was flavorful and sauced and it seemed like it was just plopped onto some lettuce. I think they could refine that a bit more. Maybe less greasy for the steak?

I got the pork chop and short ribs plate with chinese sausage. That was my favorite obvi cause I ordered it. But sometimes at Viet places the pork chop is dry. This was not the case. For four bucks extra you can get pork chop and ribs and because i'm a baller (BALLA!) i got both. Well my parents paid that's why I got both. But the short ribs were great just like Koreans make. The chinese sausage was good. 

So in my opinion I think come here for the other dishes besides the Pho. 

A lot of people talk about this place and it has a "buzz" going on. Whatever that means. But my other friend from LA was there and took her co-workers from CES there. So it MUST be good. Nah but it is.

Holy my Moly. This is another restaurant that gets me hard.

District One is a hidden gem. I typically visit this establishment at least once for all my trips to vegas. In fact, its the first place that I stop by when I drive to Vegas from Cali. Food/Eating taking priority over Partying/Drinking...what is going on?? Yah its that guud! Its known as the "new Go-To spot" for all people of Las Vegas. I love PHO. I REALLY DO LOVE PHO. Simple, light, and delicious. What originally caught my attention about this restaurant was that they had OXTAIL pho and BONE MARROW pho. WHAT?? Yes...an oxtail where the meat falls right off the bone like butter and a delicious bone marrow with TONS and TONS of tendon. The sight of the bone marrow and oxtail makes all foodies say the 3 magic letters: O, M, G.  The protein and meats were absolutely delicious. The noodles were perfect and weren't too soggy and the basil and leaves were fresh to perfection.

(Fun Fact: Tendon is high in protein and low in fat)

Anywho...

When Im intoxicated beyond belief, or when I have any sort of alcohol in my system, the number 1 thing I crave is Soup and Noodles, in particular: PHO. And when Im hungover as hell the next morning, my number 1 cure is PHO. Being drunk in Las Vegas is fun, but being drunk w/o any delicious food to be consumed sucks. I wish there was a 24/7 buffet. Tacos El Gordos isn't as great as the original location in SD. Steak and Eggs for some cheap price just doesn't cut it. Earl of Sandwich gets boring. And who wants to pay for overpriced room service?? 

PHO is my answer! Another cool thing about this place is that its open till 3 AM. And another cool thing about this location is that they serve lots and lots of craft Beers. I had a Soba Ale created by Chef Morimoto...this is an ABSOLUTE MUST TRY!

If your drunk, or if your looking for a place with great Vietnamese food, come out to District One. This place has a 4.5 star rating for a reason! This is a must-visit for all foodies, especially those people (*cough asians) who love to take pictures of their own food. This Bone Marrow is a must-see-in-person type of deal! This place gets me hard, and I love everything about this restaurant, everything from the customer service, to meeting the managers, to the decor, and the plating.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! 

UNTIL THEN!! ^-^

This place is a little over hyped. There Pho or any noodle soups in general are not good. It tastes like water. They only thing I seemed to like was their oxtail fries and oxtail fried rice. Those dishes seemed to be the only things that had flavor to them.

Jair was our bartender/server and I cant rave enough about him! He made it such a memorable and fun experience. I throughly enjoyed the Double Down with the short ribs! It was such a big plate so it was perfect to take the rest home for dinner!

Do not leave without getting the coconut ice cream. My girlfriends and I devoured it. Will definitely come back here whenever I'm in town!

My new go-to spot!! Coming here after a hard day at work always hits the spot. Though it's located in a very busy area, it's worth It!! Next door is q karaoke, cafe moda, and all the other fun stuff.  I usually come here at midnight or so when it's not too busy.  The servers are very quick and attentive, also very friendly! The food also comes out quick and always tastes bomb. I usually come here just for the garlic fries because they're that good.  

Happy hour is the best time to come.  They have $4 shots (I always order Jameson with sweet tea), $3 garlic fries, tacos, etc.  I always order the oxtail pho and garlic fries.  I also tried the papaya salad, oxtail fried rice, wings, coconut ice cream, matcha drink, and garlic noodles.  They all taste amazing.  Besides the garlic fries being my favorite, I also recommend the coconut ice cream.  So good!!!!!! It's also in a coconut which makes I.t even better.  During happy hour we only spend $40-$60 with alcohol.  Nothing satisfies me more than garlic fries and Jameson.  

This joint is really great for late night grub after karaoke, work, whatever it is.  Recommend!!

Oysters were amazing!!!!
We had 6 regular and 6 house special. Both were great flavor and freshness. House specials were my favorite though. I can't remember all the yummy stuff they put on top of the house special ones, but it was delicious!
The Oxtail Fried Rice was also really really good! I will absolutely be ordering this again on my next visit.
Last, but definitely not least was the 5 Spice Roasted Cornish Hen. Flavor is fabulous! I substituted the garlic noodles ($3.00 charge) for the tomato rice that this dish usually comes with because we had the Oxtail Fried Rice........ and personally, I am so glad I did....... the garlic noodles were perfect texture and super garlicky!!!! (that probably is not proper grammar, or spelling, but oh  well, you get it right?) Tons of garlic flavor!!!!
I will definitely be back to try the Pho..... that Lobster Pho looks like fun!

You would think the waitress would let you know the sub par dish you order off the specials is $49 since no price is shown on her dry erase board. You would think! Over priced China town pho & more. There's 6 better spots within a square mile of this place.

Went there during edc week and it's packedddd!! The line was insane but it's worthy to wait. the oxtail pho & oxtail fried rice are sooooo good....  the best I ve ever had. It saved my hungover/ rave day. And people there are so friendly and nice too. Love this place
Probably one of the top 3 pho places in Las Vegas . Personally being my fave. And the oxtail fried is hands down the best fried rice ever.

This restaurant had amazing food, but we came with a very large group (about 16) and it was difficult for the service to keep up, which is why I cannot give them a 5. 

They had some good prices for happy hour, which we caught an hour of. From the happy hour menu, the wings were good, the fries hot and tasty, the belly buns were very good, the mango salad was very big and refreshing, the eggrolls were my favorite, the carpaccio was an excellent delicious surprise, and the beer was good. 

I also got the short ribs smothered fries with an egg on top and they were also very good. It was from their special menu described by the waiter. The portion was huge, but went fast at the table. 

Even the cooks struggled, because the first thing I ordered was the garlic fries and they were the last thing to come out. 

The waiter really struggled with the bill, but it was finally all worked out in the end. I also explained how disheartening it was to watch three staff standing around talking while our waiter was overwhelmed and we waited so long for refills and service. All the waiter could do was apologize. 

Either way, I would definitely come back again. Maybe with a smaller group this time.

Been here three times now and with each visit it gets better! Lobster pho, beef carpaccio,  and oysters are must haves. Service is great and the owner has come by the table to check on things each time we've been. You'll be happy you stopped in.

We finally had an opportunity to try this spot out. Everything was amazing and the service is great! Our drinks were constantly topped and the waitress constantly came back to check on our table. The food also came our really fast, one dosh after another! Most importantly, everything was amazing! We ordered :

Pho with rib eye meat- The broth was really good and a good amount of meat

Grilled razor clams- topped with green onion and roasted peanuts (very good)

Beef Carpaccio- meat was very tender, and the sauce was perfectly seasoned (very good)

Raw Oysters- topped with their house special ponzu ( very good)

Green mango salad mixed with squid,
Onions, mint, and a light vinaigrette- this dish was light, but it didn't stand out as I thought. Perhaps the squid can be grilled instead of blanched? I would try another type of salad next time

Fish tacos- This was my least favorite appetizer. I was thinking of a more similar concept to sushi roku or nobu yellowtail tacos.

Overall, it was a great experience. We have marked our spot for future returns to Vegas!

I don't even know where to start because we ordered so much... My favorites were the belly buns and the steak and eggs. Had to order a second round of those. The spring rolls and beef carpaccio were pretty solid and close runner ups. To be honest though, i enjoyed everything. We also ordered eggrolls, the double down of korean short ribs and chinese sausage, oxtail fries, and pho. Everything was demolished.

Service was excellent, restaurant is clean, and ingredients seem fresh and of high quality.

The food is amazing here!  The kiddos love the garlic fries and calamari. 
This is our to go place.  My husband is very picky with food and services, this place delivers the best of both.
--Great Music--
 S.Y.

I recently came here with my boo and his family after our original plan had failed. We've been wanting to try this place for awhile so it actually worked out perfectly. We came on a Friday around 6 pm with 6 people and were able to easily get a table. Throughout our entire meal the servers were super helpful and friendly.

To start the meal we took advantage of their happy hour specials and went with some house oysters, belly buns, and crispy egg rolls. We also had to add in some drinks of course too so we shared the asahi pitcher of beer and a sake flight. Hands down my favorite part of the entire meal was the house oysters. They were super fresh and came topped with a ponzu sauce and jalapeño. I honestly could have eaten just a dozen of these by myself. As for the belly buns and egg rolls they were just alright to me. I felt they could have been a bit more flavorful, but overall still good. Next for entrees I went with the garlic noodles and fish tacos. The noodles were good, but a little bit bland. I added some hot sauce to give it a little extra kick. The fish tacos though, amazing! They're a bit on the smaller side, but the perfect size with a side of noodles.

I'm so glad we came here and I can't wait to get back and go ham on some house oysters!

The appetizers were delicious, but that's about it. The traditional dishes are subpar and overpriced. My girlfriend and her family are Vietnamese and they were severely disappointed. The appetizers alone cannot bring me back here. 

However, the staff was nice and helpful and the decor was great.

This place was awesome. We came in around 1am and everyone was nice. Brittany was our server. She was super funny and cute. she did more than a good job catering to my friends and I will def come back whenever I'm in Vegas.

Must be the food we ordered but I do not know how there are so many 5 star rating. I ordered the wings  and the ribeye pho. Wings was just ok, the pho broth was PLAIN. Also they don't have tendon!! Menu is a little overpriced in my opinion. If you wan some good pho go best to look for another spot

I heard about this place mentioned a couple of times by not only my husband but a few of my foodie friends.  They told me that they had Oxtail Pho.  Man was I craving some Oxtail Pho during lent, I gave up noodles for Lent.  

So, I finally had the chance to go and eat here with a few other peeps.  You know how it goes when there are more mouths to feed, more chances to try more food on the menu! Yesssssss.  We were greeted by a few of the staff and they began by telling us all the awesome things they had on special that night.  In nice resturant lingo like "Chef has prepared...." Hey District One, nice touch on selling your menu.

District one is the old Cravin Cajun.  They fixed up the restaurant really nice.  Plenty of room if you have a big party.  Ono (delicious) to the grinds.

We had oysters, squid, chicken wings, papaya salad, quail...and that is just to name a few.  Of course, I still managed to get Oxtail Pho.  I still like another Pho place because their Pho broth is bomb, but the price they charge here would actually bring me back because of that.  It wasn't bad pho broth.  They actually gave HUGE oxtails.  By the way, if you still want your crawfish/crab/shrimp boil fix, you can still get it from District One.  Think I will have to try that they next time.   And the pork belly seems to be a hit so I better try that too.  

My hubs liked it because they had a lot of his favorite Asian Whiskeys.  See Jesse N :)

Well they made me a fan. As you can tell from my review I will be back.  I hope the hype stays good since I've seen this place change up a few times.  The variety they offer is awesome because everyone at the table should get different Asian fixes here...Yup, I said that.  Lil' asian me.

We had a great dinner with our entire family.. It was a casual dinner with great food. They blended traditional Vietnamese cuisine and updated the menu to meet young foodies to come and eat... we will definitely be dining again.

Asian Fusion in Vegas?!! Now I can get my fix when I am on vacay, YES! 

Food:  During my visit here, my friend and I shared the oxtail fries, half a dozen house special oysters and we both got our own order of the Pho tai rib eye. Call us piggies, we have NO SHAME! 

Oxtail Fries: COMFORT FOOD ALERT
The oxtail fries definitely hit the spot, it kind of reminded me of Chinese beef stew but they substituted the cubed potatoes for french fries. YOU MUST FINISH IT WHEN DINING IN. Since we got a little carried away with ordering, we had to to-go most of it and let's just say it did not look pretty. The sauce became clumpy when it cooled, so i just ate the oxtail and threw away the rest. 

House special oyster: 
The oysters were super yummy and fresh. I do not remember the actual name and description the waitress gave us but GET THIS! All I remember about this dish is it had a tangy sauce and fish eggs on top. Hopefully this helps :/ !

Pho tai rib eye: 
I love PHO and this place knows how to make it right. The soup tasted really good and tasted of little to no MSG. The noodles  were also cooked perfectly. My only complaint about this dish was that the texture of the beef slices were inconsistent. Some were extremely tender, while others were really tough so I was so pretty sad about that. 

Service: Our waitress was really attentive and helpful. It was our first time here and she went through the menu/ specials with us and also came by to refill our waters a couple times.   

Final Verdict: I will definitely be back for the oysters/ oxtail fries and not to mention their pork belly buns! Let's see if this place tops the LA version at Dip's Grill.. we will have to just wait and see !

I like this spot, it's solid. The combo plate with short ribs and Chinese sausage are just enough food, pork buns are delicious and the chicken wings are really tasty. They also have a decent late night happy hour, the only issue I have with the place is the parking lot! It's in a plaza with a bunch of other asian business....which means lots of asian people. In cars. Trying to park.......so, just be careful in the parking lot, and if you make it to district one won't be let down!
Not only is the oxtail fried rice heaven in your mouth, the staff from the hostess to the servers are kind and great conversationalists.  Great food and service without stuffiness you may expect.

I have nothing to say about this restaurant 
Amazing food and service just awesome 
Specially careaccio is so yummy

5 stars for the superb service. I had District one Lobster pho n beef bone! I had to try it but the lobster was a bit disappointing because it didn't taste fresh. The beef bone broth was very yummy but it's more for pictures really. Overall, I wouldn't come back for these two items, but I would for the superb service. Perhaps trying a different dish next time

District one is trendy and different, both in their decor and menu offerings. I tried the Big Bone Soup which is a soup with bone marrow and it's super filling! My friends tried the oxtail pho and we all agreed it's a healthier tasting pho, it was good but didn't make you feel bloated and sick. The oxtail fries are a must try; it's like poutine with pieces of shredded beef. The baos are also good so give them a try too!

Nice, casual place. Great for dates or with a group of friends. Average noise level but could get loud if there are big groups. Customer service was great! We ordered oxtail fries, oxtail pho, and the district 1 combo plate. Everything was delicious! I have nothing bad to say about any one of those options. Definitely a must try! Will be coming back here for sure.
garlic fries for 4.99 is a rip off, pork belly is good but a bit too sweet, pho is amazing, pork chop rice is good but steam rice is too hard
Great service, great food! Everything I've tried here is really good. My boyfriend and I especially love the garlic noodles! Never disappoints!
the food is pretty good, the Bone marrow pho is a must try, the portion is HUGE! I would definitely share. the fried chicken wing it was ok, but the grilled calamari was pretty good.

We went to District one on a tip from a friend and good food and everything was fresh servers are nice place was very nice little pricey but worth it and we plan to come back here when were in Las Vegas yeah

Pho Tom, wings, chicken clay pot and garlic green beans are amazing! We have been here about 10 times. I would like to recommend a change in veggies for Veggie Pho: Snow peas, baby corn and keep bok choy. Current veggies of broccoli, carrots and zucchini end up still being raw even after 5 min in broth.

Great restaurant with Pho and many cool small bites. I got the oxtail pho which I thought was really good. Broth flavor was good but not the best I have had but good enough. What I really liked about the pho was the Oxtail as you don't get that anywhere else. 

Also got oyster which was fresh and good as expected. 

Did also try the pork belly bun which were amazing. Something new that I hadn't tried before but was really good and flavorful. Also helped that it was part of the happy hour menu too.

I ordered their Double-Down item off the menu, specifically with the short ribs and Chinese sausage combo with my eggs scrambled, and I was soooooooooooooo satisfied with the dish.  10/10 delicious and good proportions!  Note: I'm a very petite, 5'3" Asian girl at 82 lbs so maybe that's why it seemed like a lot of food to me, but still, everything was yum.  I finished everything but the rice.  It really hit the spot for someone who had just hopped out of a 5hr car ride.  Atmosphere was going for a trendy, Asian hangout prime of Instagram photos despite being a bit dark.  My dad had their tea and said it was good.  Also, they brew/drain your Vietnamese coffee right in front of you the traditional way so they gained brownie points there too.  Staff was very friendly.  Just noticed that even though it was an Asian eatery, they had posted a white, blonde chick to greet everyone while the actual Asian staff was standing way in the back.  That didn't sit right with my parents since they came to this Vietnamese restaurant expecting to be greeted by fellow Vietnamese people.

Came for a party of 2 around 11pm on a Friday night. We were seated right away. I'm surprised they weren't busy, I expected it to be since the lot was pretty full... but I think it's always hard to find parking in this center, especially on weekend nights. People park everywhere and anywhere they can find space lol. 

But anyway, we both ended up ordering the steak and eggs + oxtail fries. My steak and eggs ended up having heaps of onions rather than meat, but I suppose it was a good amount to get me full. They give you a lot of rice as well. The sauce they use seems like it's missing a little something, but I give this place props for trying. 

The oxtail fries.... I've definitely had better, but my boyfriend seemed to like them since they "weren't as sweet as others." Bachi Burger oxtail fries over District One oxtail fries any. day.

Service: Ok. Always had a full cup of water. That's always good. They check up on you often. 

Pricing: Can't remember exact prices or totals, but it was around $46 something for two steak and eggs and the fries.

Just a side note: We didn't come for drinks, just for food, but overheard that they don't do happy hour on Fridays and Saturdays. Just a heads up.
Order the Mi Wanton, the coconut pork belly, spring rolls. All of it was delicious! The staff is super friendly and helpful. The music and decor was lit.

Pros: the food is pretty amazing! I had their famous lobster pho and it was really good! They do all the work for you in terms of getting all the good parts of the lobster out. The pho is quite light and not overly oily for a nice clean broth. The atmosphere is very edgy and hipster with their wood decor and hanging light bulbs. The manager also came to greet and chat with us so definitely a plus for good service!

Cons: the food at be a bit on the pricier end (the lobster pho expect to pay $40)... But of course it's because you get a whole lobster. The quantity is on the smaller side but you still get full.

Overall: definitely highly recommended for this Asian fusion restaurant with their delicious food, quality service, and hip ambience!
Food is amazing we got oxtail fried rice pork belly bum and bone marrow!! So yummy for my tummy everything tasted so wonderful  definitely coming back again to try the lobster pho next time hehe

The lobster pho here is my go to every time I come to Vegas. The oxtail fried rice was also bangin. This place have yet to disappoint me out of the four times I've visited. Get the lobster pho don't sleep on it, after all we are in Vegas to ball out.
We came here for the bone marrow soup and it did not disappoint! Loved the atmosphere and service there!

Service and food was overated! 
It took too long to get the main courses after two entrees!  
We were the first table at 1:30 pm.
All other guests came after us got their foods while we were still waiting for our main dishes! 
We were given excuses that main courses would be served after entree was done! 
But after our reminder it still took us another 15 minutes to get the main courses!
(Obviously our orders had been forgotten?
This is not a five star dining restaurant! 
With kids together, we expected all orders came up all together! 
Kind of disappointing!

Legit Oxtail Pho for Vegas and the salt and pepper wings is super bomb! Great vibe for drinks and a good break from your typical Vietnamese spots on Spring Mountain (and the strip) if you want an hour of normalcy.

Came here on a Saturday for dinner.. there was a wait for a table so we decided to sit at the bar for a drink until the table was ready.
Ended up ordering food at the bar and giving away our table because Emily was so cool!!
Seriously, my favorite bartender. EVER.
Attentive but not annoying.
Handled everything (being the only bartender there) very well.. timely and efficiently.

Drinks: Moscow Mule and Vietnamese Donkey
BOTH SO GOOD.

Food: Lobster Pho.. 5 stars. Delicious
Ox Tail Fried Rice: 5 stars. Really good, and actually had good chunks of meat and a yummy over easy egg on top. 
Fried calamari: big portion (we had leftovers) really good kinda spicy dipping sauce! 

Overall, 5 million stars

I rarely ever leave the strip when I'm in Vegas. Most of the time, I will eat at the Bacchanal Buffet or Bellagio Buffet because I have a family of picky eaters and we need a large selection of food to accommodate everyone. On my recent visit to Vegas, I was fortunate to accompany some friends to District One for lunch. I live in Orange County and we are surrounded by Asian Fusion food so I had my reservations about District One... However, when we entered the restaurant and met Vi, the Hostess, I immediately knew that I would have an awesome experience. She was passionate about her menu and specialty drinks and she went through the house specials with enthusiasm and confidence.

We found ourselves ordering the Vietnamese Donkey, Mandarin Splash and Vietnamese coffee for drinks. For appetizers and entrees, we had in no particular order, (1) Japanese oysters with house ponzu sauce, (2) jumbo fried shrimp, (3) seasoned squid, (4) fried snapper with papaya salad, (5) oxtail fried rice, (6) garlic noodles with sliced rib eye, (7) coconut ice cream with roasted peanuts on a coconut shell and (8) coconut creme brulee.  OMG, we ate all of this for lunch cause the menu was so enticing!!!

The food was absolutely delicious and I look forward to coming back the next time I'm in Vegas. There were so many more items that I want to taste so I will be back soon!

Did I really just paid $50 for a bowl of pho!?!? 

If you're from the OC, that's definitely not your typical 50% off beef/chicken pho for $5.

Lobster pho MP - good and worth the experience! The portions are huge and the lobster overflows the bowl. I'd probably won't get it again but you should try at least once. Good to share between two people

Pork buns $8 - very juicy and tender

Decided to check this place out with some friends and I'm so glad we did.  The service was Great! But the food was even better.  We all shared: big bone soup, oxtail pho, coconut pork belly, oysters, spicy edamame, ribeye eye and lobster pho.  My favorite was the coconut pork belly with a soft boiled egg.  The big bone soup with with bone marrow broth is my 2nd.  The presentation was definitely a mouth opener.  And the fact that they gave us gloves if we wanted to grab the bone and chomp down like cave woman was hilarious. Luckily, the waiter did all the hard work for us and even took out the meat in the bone. The fresh coconut mojito is a must try! They also cracked it open so we can enjoy the coconut meat! Yummmm.. I'm definitely coming back!

My friends and I were in vegas last weekend for a friends birthday and or plan was to stop by here before heading back to San Diego. We heard a lot of about this place and their lobster pho. This is probably the first time I ever heard of lobster pho which caught my attention. 

We got here Sunday at 11AM and got seated right away. My friend got the lobster pho which was $40 (market price) and the rest of us got the rib eye pho, steak and eggs and spring rolls. We literally came here to see the lobster pho for ourselves and to take pictures of course! Haha my rib eye pho was $9 and the steak and eggs was $15. Although, I wouldn't spend $40 on pho even if it was for lobster but the presentation might and taste was amazing. So maybe next time I'm in town I'll order that! The broth they have for the pho is tasty and didn't taste like there was a bunch of msg in it. 

The employees here were nice and constant on refueling drinks and checking up on us. The food came out quickly and didn't take too long. The amount of food that was given for the price we paid was fair. I'll be back in vegas in 2 in a half weeks. Maybe you'll catch me here again if I'm in the area!

Went there after seeing videos online.  Service was top notch. Waitress and owner gave grade A service which I haven't seen in awhile. :)

Lobster pho was good but not great.  Lobster fried rice was better in my opinion.  
Papaya salad has a nice blend of Korean and Viet flavors.

Snails were good as well.  Didn't care too much for the beef gravy fries though.  Think it's good if you're drinking.

Would definitely come back again.

Lately I've been feeling more like a Las Vegas resident with all the temporary work assignments out here. Naturally, like any kamaaina being away from home, my gills started drying from being in the desert and I missed our melting pot of amazing food.

This day was no different. I was fiending for some amazing, Chinatown-like pho tai. Surely, most places on the 9th island would disappoint. I searched Yelp for hours, meticulously going through review after review, photo after photo and eyeing up each restaurants website. I felt like a crazed person. But I NEEDED some good pho...I needed something familiar and reminiscent of home.

Finally came across District One which was about 15 minutes from my workplace, great reviews, pics looked promising... Skeptical, I ordered take away from them anyway. Got the pho tai and egg rolls.

Food was ready when I got there, the server helping me was friendly and trying to sell me on the happy hour but not in a pushy, salesman type of way. Got back to work, spread all this vietnamese goodness across an entire lunch table, and to my surprise...they packaged the meat separately and uncooked! HALLELUJAH!!!! I like my meat still kicking because that's where all the flavor is so I really enjoy dipping the beef in for 5-7 seconds, taking it out and eating it. There's nothing I hate more than precooked, overcooked, flavorless meat. Added my sprouts, peppers, lime, basil, hot sauce, hoisin sauce, noodles. Then started rolling my egg rolls in the lettuce, filling it with the shredded carrots & daikon, mint etc. This take out experience was HEAVEN!! The beast was tamed.

Needless to say, my colleagues and I come here quite a bit now and there's a take out menu posted in the office.

YAAAASSS!!!! I never thought it could be done, but District One has somehow managed to pull off what I call "Fancy pho."  That's right - delicious, flavorful, high quality spring rolls, pho, and other Vietnamese dishes in an upscale restaurant...wait for it...WITHOUT being obnoxious or super over-priced or TOO high end.  

The prices are great for what you get - and the soup is VERY good.  Their spring rolls are my fave in the city (sorry Pho Kim Long).  Oh - and there's a full bar?! WHAT?!  What is this world coming to?  

You MUST come check out District One.  Definitely get the egg rolls - I was HIGHLY impressed!
So delicious. Amazing service and you see the owner walking around helping out his staff. The spring rolls were so good. The lobster pho was great and I'd come back on my next visit here.

BS 

"I told you to separate our checks!!!"

I mean seriously this rating is not about just the food but the customer service.  Ok first the location - super busy area.  Parking is limited at night.  The inside is hipster authorized and designed.  It's rustic and country modern.  I love  that your waiter is quick at taking orders.  But I specified and said it TWICE to make sure we have a separate check because I didn't feel like paying for 10 people (which I ended up doing!).  Plus TIP was automatically included at 18%!!! Are you serious? Even in NYC they don't do that.  At least 15% and give me the option to pay you more.  Ok Sorry D 1 but you are about to get the BIG D from me.   So I ordered the pork rib meal - $13.99 I believe and the fried spicy calamari.  A beer and wine.  And my total ended up $180 and change.  I mean seriously? Anyway, so the calamari came! Wow that's a lot of breading for a chewy octopus.  I wish I had the jaw power of a hyena or a pitbull to eat it.  It was gnarly to chew on it.  The dip was nice and yummy.  It was spicy that it made me smile.  The  short ribs was super hard and overcooked.  The sausage that came with it was the cheap shriveled hot dog. The egg tasted like it was microwaved.  This place get's a lot of high praises but I was not happy at all.  The waiter even took 20 minutes to come with my beer.  I love the guy but COME ON! I want to get lit but instead I got burnt.  Anyway, I was charged $20 for my wife's wine.  I get that price but at least bring it in a nice cleaner glass.  Anyway, overall this place is super hyped.  I might  love it if I was just eating the chicken wings.  Maybe I'll come back during happy hour.  Overall, it was an ok experience.  It's not impressive at all.  Maybe I can be impressed next time I visit Vegas.  

* Boomsauce scale.
BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended.
BS = it's just O.K. (experience)
BS+ = Yo! I like this place.
BS++= That's Whoa! This place good.
BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

The pho is wonderful. We've tried the Big Bone soup and the oxtail pho. They are both the best I've ever had!
Their fish tacos are amazing if you are a sushi lover! Warning, they are addictive!
From hand crafted, unusual cocktails, to great draft selections, this place doesn't disappoint!

My Dad's Birthday today family decided to go for District One Kitchen and Bar this is always good place to eat Asian fusion food we had  Pho Tai Rib Eye,  couple of Oxtail fried rice,Pho GA it's chicken, Double Down Ribs and Pork Chop,Belly Buns, Crispy Bird's Nest Noodles. This is what I call dinner awesome.

Yum Yum! Love the food! 
Papaya salad = refreshing 
Pho = authentic 
Fish hard shell tacos ( appetizers) = could have been better for the price. There were barely any fish. 
Bone soup = super ! Love the bone marrow :)

We started off with an order of beef and lemongrass wrapped betel leaves that were not what I expected based on the menu description, but still were very good.  We also shared an order of 5 spice Cornish hen that was just legs and thighs that I upgraded to include garlic noodles. In addition we had an order of garlic vegetables to ward off aliens.

Went here craving pho and it was amazing. We got the prime rib and the shrimp noodles and both were beyond amazing and satisfying. 
The atmosphere is really nice and the prices are extremely reasonable. I'll definitely be back with my family many times over.
Mediocre food, service was great. Unfortunately I don't come for the service, but for the food.

They are located in a plaza on the Southeast corner of Jones and Desert Inn near Icy Juicy (situated in Cravin' Cajun's old spot). The layout hasn't changed, however, it has new flair to suit District One. I really like all the decals on the back wall!

I came with a few Yelpers (The Q's, David V., and Paolo) and it was a new experience for most of us. We shared both of their chicken wings selections; Tamarind Wings ($6.95) and Garlic Serrano Pepper Wings ($6.95). The wings were fried without a batter and tossed/dressed in light sauces of their respective flavors. Both selections were bland, lacking a pinch of salt, however, the Garlic Serrano had great flavor potential. Without a batter, the wings lacked any type of crunch or bite. Additionally, the orders came with pickled vegetables (carrots and daikon) that were good! We also tried the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio ($10.95), served with lime juice, white onion, and peanuts. The sauce (soy sauce and oil base) was very tasty and it made the beef taste amazing.

Everyone ordered their own dishes, like Fish Tacos ($8.95), Tomato Rice (side order; $1.50), and the District One Rice Combo Platter ($11.95). The fish tacos were made with hamachi sashimi, avocado, cilantro, and cherry tomato in fried wonton "shells" and came in a set of three. It was okay, but nothing special. The tomato rice also lacked flavor and warranted a shrug. For the Combo Platter, you can choose between chargrilled short ribs or pork chop and it comes with kimchee, pickled vegetables, lap xuong (Chinese sausage), and a fried egg. The chargrilled short ribs were good and had a nice "char" flavor (no marinade).

I ordered the Slow Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice ($8.95), served with a soft boiled egg, and Jasmine rice. This was really delicious! The meat was soft and tender and the sauce created from the coconut juice and pork belly was fragrant. I threw my whole bowl of rice into the stone pot to utilize every drop of the succulent sauce. Even if there weren't any other successful dishes, I would come back just for pork belly coconut juice! Everyone else seemed to really enjoy it as well.

Service was really nice! We didn't realize that we had stayed almost an hour after their closing time, however, they were really cool about it. I like the menu because of its focus on Vietnamese fusion and obviously, that makes it unique. I don't eat Pho, but the MP Lobster Pho is definitely enticing! Not sure how much the price fluctuates, but it was approximately $27 last week. Anyway, I'm willing to give the other dishes a try and if anything, I'll always have the pork belly as a back-up plan!
I love this place , gotta have my good morning Vietnam Bloody Mary when I'm in town. The best I've ever had. Food is delish, it's so flavorful. The staff are friendly. Highly recommended

This was a great venue, very modern, clean and spacious. There was plenty of table seating and booth seating for any size group. Lots of very helpful and good looking staff to help serve. Everything was done quickly and efficiently. They got us seated and answered all questions about the menu pretty quickly.

We tried the spicy noodles, pork belly bun, and steak rolls. All were good dishes, nothing that blew our minds out, but flavors were well developed. The spicy noodles could have used more meat and more spice. It definitely was a good take on a very traditional vietnamese dish. The fried pork belly buns was a cool take on the traditional bun. I mean... "anything fried makes it better' right?! I liked that extra crunch to contrast the tender pork belly. Finally the steak roll was subpar for me. I had one and it was plenty to see that it was just a filler, not so much a homerun dish.

Will definitely be back next time to try more dishes. There is plenty of parking, and the bathroom was very clean and modern. All around great experience. Happy eating!

Good fusion of vietnamese and modern. Really catered to the young adults. It's always busy so plan to come early to get on the waiting list. 

They have a big parking lot in the strip area. During our wait I just tried some matcha  ice cream from the shop in the same strip.

Definitely worth it to drive off the strip to eat good food for good prices compared to being lazy eating on the strip or in your hotel. 

Nice casual trendy place, good service. Worth the cab drive !

Came in for happy hour. Only had some appetizers ranging between $3-$6 which included mini fish tacos, pork belly buns, and egg rolls (all were fairly tasty). Also had the cherry sake bomb which was indeed, bomb! $8 for happy hour pricing was a little steep but no complaints since the service was beyond stellar! Adrianne, our server, knew the menu from top to bottom and she owned the seafood talk! This girl knows how to sell the snappers and lobsters! It's a shame we only came in for drinks and apps but will definitely come back to check out the rest.
Spring roll, short rib and belly buns are delish! First time here today. We will definitely be back when we're in town.

we had a fantastic anniversary dinner here on jan 1st and I will say the pho was delicious I had mine with flank steak and brisket My hubby had the oxtail fried rice with an egg ( his 1st sunny side egg) the service was fantastic and the people were soon happy to give us there option on what was good and the lady with the purple hair was sweet

Oh district one why do you have to be so good but be pricey for the amount you get. I absolutely love their oxtail fried rice, but I'm not sure if it's just me but they keep raising their prices every time I come here. Their wings and the oxtail pho is really yummy as well, but I feel I could go somewhere else in China town for the same stuff for a couple bucks less. I come here as often as I can, but you don't really get the biggest bang for your buck. Get their oxtail fried rice, nuff said.

Spot on service and extremely friendly staff. Very good quality food. The beef steak and eggs are yummy! Fast seating for lunch. All the staff were polite and smiles. We are very pleased with the food here. Clean and well kept. Casual atmosphere. Definitely returning next time for more. Thank you District One!

Took my kids there and they loved the food. Don't remember our servers name but the runner took care of us (Richard). Food came out fast which was great. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone.
Best oysters for taste and display. Lobster ph little overrated for me however atmosphere, cleanliness, service was top notch

Cool looking space with that "industrial-hipster" look of exposed beams, metal, wood and a bar with wood pallets as a base.  Food was pretty tasty with the grilled squid being a must!  If the coconut ice cream is available then get it because it's a sweet, palate-cleansing mix of Filipino/Vietnamese type dessert.

Delicious, fun, good service. A Trifecta! Came here with my coworkers for a birthday, and had a great experience. Fun and casual place with modern music and smiling staff. Clean and well designed interior with comfortable chairs.  Ordered appetizers and food, and nothing disappointed. The Oxtail fries are to die for, and Belly Buns were awesome. Fresh tasty Spring Rolls have a crunchy flair from a little fried wonton inside. The service was top notch. The server was very helpful in accommodating my diabetes, so I was able to order my Shrimp Pho with 1/2 the noodles and adding fresh vegetables. It was delicious and enough for 3 meals! To round out the birthday, we finished with the most awesome coconut and fruit ice cream sprinkled with peanuts. Wish I knew what it was! I was only going to have one bite, but confess it was so good I snuck a few more. This will be a new favorite dining spot!

This is a cool Asian Fusion sports bar that actually serves draft beer, cocktails and wine. We came last night to hopefully get some pork belly baos and watch UFC Fight Night. 
We ordered Belly Buns, Papaya Salad, and Serrano Chicken Wings. They have a decent menu with Vietnamese, Chinese and Thai choices. I am being generous with my 4 stars as 1 star each for service, atmosphere, menu selection and concept. The food was not the greatest though. I did not like the Belly Buns as they lacked flavor and the Belly was dry and small. I've had belly bao with a thick tender caramelized pork belly with pickled garnish and these were not good at all. The papaya salad lacked sweetness which would have balanced the sour and salty taste. The wings were crispy and big but they didnt give all flats. The drummette piece tasted dry and horrible. Usually in Asian joints they give you all flats when you order fried wings so that was disappointing. I did see the table next to is ordered a Black Pepper Dungeness Crab that looked pretty good. Maybe some of their other choices might be better than what we ordered. This is a cool place to watch the game and we will give it another try next time. The food is just so-so on our first visit here.

If you got money to blow (maybe because you won money from gambling), do yourself a favor and get the lobster pho to celebrate.

If you don't got money to blow (maybe because you lost money from gambling), do yourself a favor and get the lobster to cheer yourself up.

Oxtail fried rice is amazing here
 I would come back just for this. The pork buns we ordered was deep fried which was interesting but the flavor was just okay but my boyfriend says " if you get to the cilantro part of the bun then it's good". The lobster pho was good. Some of the yelpers complained that's it bland and not flavorful. Its not bland. The broth compliments the lobster very well. It might not be as flavor packed as beef but that's because it's too different broths and it should be that way. The lobster pho was expensive. About $50. Overall, I would come back.

Got the lobster pho and chicken salad. For the price of lobster pho ($49.99), I expected more flavor and noodles. The chicken salad was really good. Service was good, food was served pretty fast. I made a reservation and called back to confirm weeks later and was told we can't make reservation for party of two. The staff who made the reservation should've told me the first time I called to reserve.

Went here for early dinner with a girl friend because we heard good things about this place. We ordered the wings, chicken with noodles and pho. Food was good and we did enjoy the Pho but we can't say the same for the service. It was pretty bad and the Pho took around 50 minutes to come out even after a follow up with the waitress. We asked for the Pho for a second time after another long wait and the waitress was surprised that it still wasn't there. The wait staff should at least take the initiative to check if the orders are complete. It wasn't even that busy at that time so we couldn't understand why it took so long for our orders to come out. Wish the wait staff were more friendly too.

It isn't regularly on the menu but the sea bass sashimi style with their papaya salad was the best.  Shrimp skewers ok fish tacos good. Read all the reviews about the ox tail pho. It was good but I guess it was the hype. The highlight was the real coconut juice wow. And the coconut ice cream was good too.
The quality is good and I want to try it again

First time trying this place after seeing it in Instagram. Did not disappoint!! Everyone in our group gave their thumbs up on what they ordered!!! Delicious dishes- oxtail loco moco with extra oxtail meat, oxtail fried rice, beef salad, steak plate!!!!! You basically can't go wrong!!! 

As for the serve, we had the best waitress EVER!!! Ask for JL, super friendly and honest! She has a great personality and she definitely uses it when providing serve!  Our family will be making this a must stop each Vegas trip and we will spread the word about District One!!!

It's no secret that I love pho. All my friends know this so they suggested that I come check out District One. It is how Vegas does pho. I wanted to be surprised so I didn't even look on Yelp before coming to check them out. When I arrived, my friends already had a table and started on drinks. Guess we were drinking first before eating lol. Boy did we drink! Customer service was excellent the entire night. The staff was very friendly. 

I quickly glanced at the menu while drinking and knew I wanted their The Original Whole Maine Lobster Pho. It was 1.5 lbs of Maine Lobster over pho so it was massive. Gotta be Vegas. It was Market Price so it'll change from time to time on price. The broth was delicious and sweet. Great lobster flavor. There was just the perfect amount of noodles in the bowl. I saw the table next to us order the The Big Bone Soup and it looked insane. It'll be my order next time I'm in Vegas. Maybe both so I can have Surf and Turf.

Of all the reviews we read, the bad ones about service turned to be accurate. We didnt get to order, so i'm not sure if the food is good. We sat down. After a while we had to call someones attention. He said he only serve drinks but he will call our server. We got water... I could see three servers around but another 8 minutes passed and we left. Total of 15 minutes, 5 tables occupied 6-7 servers/ drink servers around. Am I wrong here?

Food and service are impressive. Had the savory big bone soup with noodles, pork belly buns, and coconut ice cream. All were delicious full of satisfying flavors. I always make a point to come here when I'm in town. I highly recommend.

Been here a few times. It's not the typical Vietnamese food, it has it's own twist to it and I love it! The decor is more American/Asian inspired put together. 

I first fell in love with their garlic noodles, chicken wings with fish sauce, grilled squid and so on and so forth. And you have to have their coconut ice cream. 

One thing though, when they get busy or late at night, parking here it's hard to find.

I don't know you guyssss!!! Maybe I ordered badly, or maybe D1 was having an off night but this place just didn't do it for me, sadly.

I started with the stuffed jalapeno appetizer, which was just, well, kind of boring. Ground seasoned chicken on top of a cut-in-half grilled jalapeno with marinara sauce on top, super basic ya'll.

Next I had the oxtail fried rice and omg that stuff needs to come with a warning label, ox tail tastes like dirt. It's gamey AF and I like gamey, I'm down for lamb any of the week and I order birria tacos now and again, but ox tail is another level. It's also got that sinewy fat situation going on that just makes me gag. I know some folks love it, those who order the tendon at pho places for example, would love ox tail, but not I. 

The shining star of the meal was the garlic noodles, they were perfect, dry and packed with flavor! I could eat 10 plates of it. I also really enjoyed my creamy green tea, so there were some hits amongst the misses and for that we go 3 stars.

I am absolutely in lust with this place! I would give it 5-stars but they were all out of the first item I ordered and my second choice Item took 15 mins longer to come out than the rest of the tables order... Although, I really enjoyed my food and service was awesome!! I felt the food prices were on par with the food quality. I decided to skip a cocktail because the prices seemed to be a little high for off the-strip. 

I plan on going back soon because I enjoyed it so much!

Ambiance was much better than the actual food here. Service was good-attentive & quick. I really wanted to like this place, but overall, wasn't impressed! 

1.) Chicken pho was not made w chicken broth! I order chicken pho specifically for that reason. Instead, they use beef broth. I know this isn't a 'strictly pho' joint, so they probably use the same broth for all of their phos. 

2.) Oxtail fried rice was too mushy & wet for my liking. I like my fried rice drier in texture & this seemed almost porridge like..something was missing in flavor too. There was a good amount of oxtail meat though!

3.) Whole grilled squid-probably the best out of the 3 dishes we (bf & I) tried. The spicy aioli was okay, but I would have preferred this dish w ponzu. 

There are probably dishes here that are good/better, but I don't think I will be running back here anytime soon to find out. 

P.S. I have used Yelp for yrs but never wrote my own reviews..decided to start tonight...proud to say this is my first review on here-woot :)

The food here is really good. Everything we had was delicious. The even have a pretty good bar with an awesome whiskey selection. One of the popular dishes was the grilled squid which was really good. I usually don't like squid that much, but a lot of the yelp review pix had it, so we had to try it. Definitely will be back again soon.

I have mixed feelings about this place. I like the decor, vibe and the service is friendly. Their menu looked very interesting which was what drew us in but i guess some of the food is seasonal or they change their menu often cuz some of what we saw on yelp was not available at this time . Some of the dishes were a hit or miss. First the good - Oxtail fried rice, crispy red snapper were excellent and a must order.  The bad - the papya salad tasted like it was marinated with soy sauce instead of fish sauce, the chicken wings w/ garlic was a lil bland, the grilled whole squid i guess was okay but needed a lil more flavor or more of a char from grilling but did look very appetizing.  The varieties of pho were cool and was enough to satisfy my hunger.

Loved everything about this place! It's on the pricey side but that's what you pay for friendly attentive service, hip atmosphere, and fusion food. It's a Vietnamese fusion. There were 2 of us so we sat at the bar, which is a full bar but we ordered their specialty drinks along with 5 food items.

Vietnamese donkey: 5/5 basically a lychee Moscow mule. Very light
