Fresh coconut mojito: 5/5 it comes in a real coconut and tastes very refreshing. They also give you coconut juice on the side to drink as well

Pork belly buns: 4/5 good appetizer, nothing amazing. They used Vietnamese radish and carrots which was different but it didn't blow me away. 

Oxtail fries: 5/5 I loved it! Definitely recommend this as an appetizer or even a side dish. The meat was very tender and had a pulled pork consistency. It comes with a sunny side up egg too so if you don't want it to get too soggy just put the fries to the side and break the egg on the other side and dip it in 

Garlic noodles: 4/5 pricey for what it is. It was on the dry side and the garlic flavor wasn't completely there but the garnishes added a fresh flavor to it 

Shaken beef: 5/5 super tender and they used the more traditional Vietnamese butter rice I believe. This entree also came with eggs and you get to choose how it's cooked

Short rib combo plate: 4/5 short ribs were marinated very well and tasty, but portion on that was small. I only got 1 small slab of kalbi and the Chinese sausages were hard so I only had a bite of that and I was done. I liked that they also included an egg in the meal so I had it sunny side up so the yolk dropped over my rice when I punctured it.. Yummmm I love runny yolk 

Overall, I would defiantly recommend this place and come back to try other items on their menu

I wanted to give this place a five because i really liked the food but i felt the staff especially the manager was lacking. My bf and i started with the razor calms at $14.95. They were meaty but flavor was only ok. We also got the fish tacos which were pretty good. It came with three wantons skins fried and shaped like taco shells and filled with yellow tail and added veg. My bf got the oxtail pho. I thought the broth was very flavorful and i enjoyed it alot. The oxtail was fall off the bone tender. I had the district one rice combo. That included a large heap of white rice with a fried egg on top, pretty spicy kim chee, pickled veg, a small and thin but very tender and full of tasty goodness pork chop. The seasoning on it was to die for. Lastly it was suppose to have chinese sausage. My food came out and i noticed the sausage i was really looking forward wasnt on my plate. I told the waiter that explained yo mr thats what i ordered. I told him that what i read on the menu was different so he went to check then to the kitchen then back to me. He apologized and said the kitchen ran out of the sausage which i have never heard of a kitchen running out of a regular item on a menu that is in fact offered twice on the menu, even worse 168 supermarket is across the street and houses about 20 varities of chinese sausage. I was quite disappointed and shocked that the kitchen didnt inform my waiter and i guess i wasnt suppose to notice. To appease me they brought out free coconut ice cream that too was yummy. Upon heading to the bathroom i saw food come out with the sausage. I asked a waiter and they said i saw it correctly. I called the manager over who was comfortably dressed in running pants and nikes and explained what happened. She told me they did run out if the sausage and sent someone to the store after i was served and she felt the ice cream was a nice enough gift. I told her it was but i wanted the sausage now that was suppose to be in my meal to begin with she said the she thought the ice cream would have taken care of that which i replied that i would pay for "her kind gift" if its a issue but i wanted my sausage. I hate to say im coming back cause clearly customer service is lacking but i really enjoyed the food. I should have known the manager was a joke when i saw her behind the bar getting her hair played with.

Came by for dinner the other night and it appeared to be a tourist trap off the strip. The interior was more like a sports bar. 

The 1.5 lb Lobster Pho that Yelpers raved about is $49.99...

Ordered the oxtail Pho which consisted of 4 huge pieces of oxtail. Oxtail could have been a tad more tender. They were quite flavorful, however. There were only two bites of noodles despite the huge bowl. The broth was also mediocre...

Also got the spicy pork string beans which were also mediocre. Some of the beans were past due and the beans were quite flash fried enough. Flavor was quite strong.

Service was friendly by the staff.

$33/head after tax and gratuity...

I was looking forward in trying District One because of the hype! However, it didnt live up to my expectations. 

We were there on a weekday night, and they were not that busy. We were seated right away but it took a while for our party to order because it was our first time. We ended up ordering pork belly sliders as appetizer, ox tail pho, beef pho, spicy noodle and like a bbq combo with rice. The broth of our soup was average. It did not have a depth of flavor. The bbq was good, but it was not something special.

First time trying here. We ordered some of the items on the happy hour menu. Some of the food came out pretty fast but the service is a bit slow. Maybe because they are busy but I feel like they hardly check on us if we need anything once the food is out. Overall, my favorite item on the menu is the beef carpaccio. Its pretty good. The atmosphere is a little bit loud. More of like hanging out place with friends instead of family type of a seatings. The parking area are spacious and the presentation on the food looks good.
Hip and modern... Love this place oxtail soup was delicious and they always have a lot of specials that's not on the menu

It's awesome! Great food great drink selection. 
They take time their time to be helpful. 
Way better than when cravin was here.

Really like the soup here after a night out.  The oxtail fried rice is great. And if you are feeling fancy et the lobster pho. Khai designed a great menu and you won't disappointed. There is also a full bar for hanging out and watching games.

Came here for the big bone soup. It definitely had the wow factor but the bone lacked any meat. It had a lot of ligaments and the soup was good but otherwise, it was A-OK. Their ox tail fried rice was really good. Pho was ok.
Came here with some friends who live in vegas. They had some unique dishes. We got lobster fried rice and oxtail fried rice. Oxtail fried rice was bomb. Prices are pretty reasonable.

District One is a hidden gem. The chef is great.  He loves to play with his ingredients.  You can tell by his dishes.  I came here a year ago with my mother.  It was great and still is.  I came here a few weeks ago with my husband.  
 
I was able to try a few different dishes this time around.  Oxtail Fries is a must!  Pork Belly Buns was tasty, the balance in flavors is great.  Pho was good and fresh ingredients. 

Can't wait to come by to try their other small dishes!

Have you been to mom & pop Vietnamese family restaurants in the States where all the menus are nearly identical that never change? This District One (D1) joint is the opposite of that routine.

They are all over the news & is one of the top Las Vegas restaurants.  In Sài Gòn (Viet Nam),  District 1 is where all the actions are, and features some of the best cuisines of the country.  This D1 restaurant represents well what Sài Gòn has to offer; really brought us close to home!

They feature some of the most authentic Vietnamese dishes with a twist in style or presentation.  They are comfort foods that you come in not necessarily because you are hungry, but because you crave some of the dishes that mom & grandma haven't cooked in awhile.

This joint is owned & operated by my friend, Chef Khai Vu.  I tell ya what, I am really glad that I loved everything that I ate there, so now I can wholeheartedly endorse this restaurant & truthfully feel great about backing it! By the way, neither Chef Khai Vu nor his wife ask me to write any of this.  In fact, they have no idea I am writing this review.

Also, D1 frequently hosts watch party for live sports event, so follow them on Facebook for event announcements & special offers.  There's a lil something for everyone at D1; I guarantee it!

We went to District One last night based on the recommendation of a few friends, and they were right on! The food was excellent and service was great! I wish I could remember our waitress's name because she was awesome and funny!  Our party of 10 had pork belly buns, oxtail loco Moco, oxtail fried rice, shaken beef salad, and steak & eggs. My family also surprised me with the coconut ice cream as a birthday treat. EVERYTHING was delicious. We'll definitely be back when we're in town!

District One is a great addition to the plethora of Asian restaurants in Las Vegas. 

The dishes are always fresh and the attention to detail is not what you expect in a restaurant the Chinatown district.

First off let me say that the service is great. Our hostess and waiter were very friendly and attentive. We ordered a dozen of the oysters which were delicious. Their cocktail sauce was fantastic. 

The bf got the oxtail pho which he really enjoyed. I ordered the pho ga which actually wasn't very good. The chicken had an odd texture and didn't taste fresh. The broth and noodles however were very good. With tip the bill was around $53.

Pretty cool spot. Cool to place to come get drinks. Had the oxtail and veggies. Was a little lacking in flavor. Maybe a pinch of seasoning for the veggies. Sea salt even. Tomato rice was not bad. The beef shanken salad was pretty solid. Liked it. Would get it again. Good soy vinaigrette and good sauce on the beef. I'll try it again. Hopefully gets better.

The food here is epic. This was hands down the best meal I had while I was in Vegas! It's definitely going to be a must-do whenever I come back.

The lobster pho was phenomenal and totally worth the price. The pork belly buns were perfect and the summer rolls were delicious but pretty standard. But my absolute favorite for the price and taste was the oxtail fried rice - sooo good!

Love the atmosphere and vibe of this place! A great place to have drinks and dinner with friends!

Delicious! Tried Pho for the first time! Loved the rib eye and flank steak pho. I didn't care for the spring rolls but the pho made up for it. The fresh coconut mojito was also great but lacking a good amount of rum so I would recommend the Vietnamese donkey.

I wish I could give it a 5 stars. I really like the place.
The bird nest chow mein is really good.

Lobster Pho, well the flavor is good, but it's not freshly cook the time I ordered.
The lobster is pre cooked :-(  yikes 

The lobster head's meat is mushy,
the lobster body temperature is not hot,
totally two different lobsters , oh no is not freshly made to order and the waitress confirmed it.
is it worth $50.00 ...hun

I hope one day the restaurant will consider ... " fresh = cook to order"
t's has a hipster vibe with good modern music. The food was great with good service. The fish tacos were great, but pretty small. They have a full bar and great wine selection.

I heard about this place from a coworker of mine that claimed it had the best and most authentic Vietnamese food in the Las Vegas area. I knew I had to try it after hearing him talk so highly of it. Without looking at any of the pictures, I came here on a whim.

Immediately seeing the doors, I could already tell this was going to be far from authentic. It has the American western spin and style on the decor, the the atmosphere, and the food itself. There was not a speck of Vietnamese on the menu. Everything was in English. I'm not saying that this is a bad thing. I was just expecting full blown Vietnam when he told me authentic.

My gf and I ordered the oxtail fries, pho Bo vien, and I got the steak and eggs.

The oxtail fries came out at the same time as my steak and eggs, leaving no gap between appetizer and entrée.

The oxtail fries were a 1/10 for me. The attempt to blend fries with a soupy oxtail gravy broth results in a soggy mess of flavors that do not complement each other. It actually became worse as I ate more and more. Initially I thought it would garner a 3/10 but as I said the flavors were fighting each other in my mouth, and maybe even my stomach.

My entrée was the steak and eggs but should be called steak and egg. The shaky beef was delicious and pretty amazing. The rice itself was bland in my opinion but it might have been part of the experience to emphasize the shaky beef flavoring.

My girlfriend got the pho meatballs and told me they were between a four and a six. So I'll say five.

All in all this meal was mediocre for way too much. And I still have the aftertaste of the oxtail fries in my mouth hours later.

So we are in Vegas, tired of the buffets and the high end dinners, so we stopped by this place after seeing a video on Buzzfeed. 

We ordered the lobster pho (for us, it was $49) and oxtail fried rice. 

To be honest, both of the dishes were pretty salty, the fried rice being a little more bearable, so we politely complained and they remade our lobster pho and to apologize for the inconvenience, they gave us a creme brulee dessert. 

The oxtail fried rice was BOMB (despite it being salty) I would 100 percent recommend this dish. 
As for lobster pho..  if you like lobster and pho, it might be a good choice for you, but honestly,  it wasn't that special.  

O, and the creme brulee is so worth it.  Get it!!
Fyi, happy hour from 5~7. Look at my pics for the happy hour menu.

I'm giving these folks 5 stars not due to the food (it's good, but IMHO only 4 stars), or the service (again, good, but IMHO only 4 stars), but because of their honesty.  I ate there on Saturday.  Sunday morning I discovered that my credit card wasn't in my wallet.  I called District One and they had found it (I was a tard and had left it at my table).  I was able to get over there rather quickly and they had it ready for me (it turns out I'm not the only idiot who's left cards there - one guy from Texas even left his drivers license).  I checked with my card company and no other charges after my meal's were on the card. The folks at District One were awesome and I thank them for their honesty.  There are too many places in this town where a situation like this would have ended much differently.

A trendy higher-priced Vietnamese spot close to Chinatown? Okay, I can dig that. I first heard of District One when another Yelp friend posted some delicious looking food on her FB. I had some friends in town who LOVE new Asian spots, so I took them here.

Our server was really friendly and seemed knowledgeable of the menu. It was a bit strange that they read the specials literally off of the specials board, so that if you want to see it again you have to get up and go look at the board by the entrance. We ordered apps, but they came out with the regular food - this seems to be consistent with all Vietnamese restaurants, no such thing as coursing. However edamame never showed up so we had to ask for it. She must have forgotten to ring it in, but it was our very LEAST favorite thing so maybe she was trying to do us a favor.

Onto the food!

Edamame - it's covered in this very fishy sauce. I love fish sauce but I couldn't eat more than a couple of these. Server said you can order them naked, so next time for sure. 2/5

District One combo platter - this is short ribs and a sweet sausage with rice and over easy egg on top. The short ribs were lean, which was good. 3.5/5

Oxtail friend rice - This was my favorite. We ordered with scrambled eggs though since someone in our party doesn't like runny yoke. Next time though, I would try with the over easy egg. 5/5

Lobster special - This was served cut into sections but rearranged as a whole. The flavor was awesome, but you get about 4 bites of lobster. I guess if you like the stuff in the head, might be worth it, but none of us touched that. Ugh. 3/5

Mango salad - This seriously tasted exactly like Thai or Lao papaya salad. It was good. 4/5

Pork belly buns - These were delicious! Really awesome flavor, and I loved the crunchiness of the peanuts. 5/5 

Vietnamese Donkey cocktail - this is their version of Moscow Mule, but they incorporate lychee. It's simply BRILLIANT. I could've drank 10 of these if one didn't already leave me with a slight buzz in my head. 5/5

This is a fun spot to bring friends, but keep in mind it's a bit pricey. The ambiance is great though and I'd love to go back soon.  A lot of things on the menu that I still want to try.

randomly saw someone ig this place and since I was going to Vegas anyways, might as well try it!

good thing we came here during happy hour! I love cheaper food :) 

- ox tail pho - the ox tail was pretty tender. pho was ok
- serrano pepper wings - 50 cents during hh.  I thought these were okayy. not bad but kind of plain. the pepper wasn't too spicy so that was cool
- oysters - $1 each during happy hour.  I think they were pretty good. fresh so that's good
- yellowtail tacos - I like these!  I love the crunchy hard shell.  the fish was in this green sauce which I think went really well with it.

This is a must-go when you are in Vegas. I love Vietnamese comfort food. My friends took me here and I am glad that they did. I have been here over 10x's already. The food here is amazing. I can tell that District 1 really cares about their customers and the quality of their food. I tried a taste of almost the whole menu already from my friends. Every dish is on point. The food here does not even compare to the Vietnamese food in San Jose. I will definitely take my girlfriend to D1 on our next trip to Vegas.

I've been here twice now in the span of three months (to a city I don't live in) and it's just so good, I'm going to make it a goal to come every time I'm in Vegas. 

This place is great. Open for THANKSGIVING. Yes, thank you, my fellow hardworking Vietnamese people! I was shocked when they were, but since I had no plans and no family around, here was my opportunity to have a feast on my own. 

The dishes I've had:
Got the Japanese oysters to start and they were of course very good (not my first rodeo). 
Cornish hen rice dish
Bun bo hue (I think it was named spicy soup on the menu) 
Bird's nest
Lobster fried rice
Bo luc lac salad 
Some veggie dish 

Everything is great. The Cornish hen is so crispy and juicy. It's not that dry, but it does lack flavor. I basically used all of my fish sauce that it came with. But the rice is great too - it's not super easy making that rice right. 

Spicy soup is great, but don't expect it to taste like traditional bun bo hue. 

Bird's nest - fun, crispy noodles with stir fried veggies. Good, but I'd never get again. 

Lobster rice: yummmm but it's pricey. I've had better, but this one is solid, though on a bit on the oily side. 

The menu is smaller than general viet places but it's good. I don't think a lot can go wrong. 

Service is ok - not rude like usual Asian places, but not on the ball either. A full bar is offered, so you can drink away and it's a GREAT place to watch sports. They have a ton of tha everywhere with the latest games, so you can watch the cowboys whip butt. (But more likely be whipped...) Get out of the strip and make it to district one where you'll be able to find a table, get a drink, and enjoy some pretty good eats!

Useful Tip: Walk-In Sign In Ask Questions Later

After waiting fifteen minutes a hostess inquired if I signed in!  Of course I didn't which resulted in an additional 10 minutes wait. 

Food:
Baby Bok Choi $8.99
-The wok fried bok choi with garlic was a nice size portion and I scarfed down the entire bowl. If your into greens you will not be disappointed.
YellowTail Tacos $10.99
-SMALL PLATE The yellow tail sashimi tacos are small but full of flavor and extremely delicious. I highly recommend ordering your own portion you will not want to share!
Garlic Noodle $7.99 + $3 Shrimp
-The garlic noddle was a bit on the oily side but tolerable. The additional shrimp were nicely sized. Another great dish if your about that noods life!
Shrub Beverage $5
-This vinegar based drink was terrible after waiting nearly 20 minutes for it. 
Creme Brûlée $7.99 COMP 
- This green tea dessert was nice and light. Our server voluntarily compd our dessert due to the slow service without us mentioning anything and I appreciated the goodwill gesture.

I love asian food and I'll definitely return to this hip little spot with a reservation.

Bill $42+ Tip

My Mom and I came here 1 for late night Happy Hour appetizers and some yummy food .

Corey was our server and we had the joy of also having help from Brian when we were getting out left overs he was super friendly and awesome! Which helped bring the rating to a steady 5 ..


 Lets be real the food alone is really delicious as long as you order the right choice for you . This is Vietnamese fusion which means they have a lot of the flavor but more Americanized vibe when it comes to how it's run and the food is a fused sooo I was able to eat and get good service plus feel like the quality of the food and dishes Just Had more upscale vibe ... but it also still kept to its roots and was Vietnamese to me .. 

I guess they are famous for two things which get talked about in other reviews but we didn't try those so I will just breakdown the stuff I got ..

Shrimp pho-11.99 I think which many feel is a lot for pho but compared to a lot of our pho places I've been to this price isn't bad for the size and for the fact that I have a server with a smile lol

Oysters - I got 6 they were decent 

Wings on happy hour - they were dry but I think my server felt I didn't want any sauceso that is why I didn't get ones like in the picture but they were tasty flavor 

Shaken beef salad - so so good like melt in your mouth meat and good dressing 

I can't wait to come back and try more stuff especially dessert but over all this is a nice spot to get booze and food 

We got the Gin drink to try that I can't remember it's name but it was tasty too

I been here couples of times when I was in Vegas with friends. When I got here I didn't think this place was a Vietnamese place since it looked more Americanize. There was no line or waiting when we got here and was seated right away, When I looked at menu there was so many choices to pick. I noticed that people were ordering the ox tail pho or lobster pho. I ordered Bun Bo hue since it my favorite noodle. I also ordered Vietnamese coffee since I was tired from the long drive to Vegas. The coffee was good that it help me stay wide awake the whole day lol. While the girls all ordered their District famous ox tail pho,  I had to be the "Unique" out of the group lol.  The portions of the bun bo hue and pho was big. It was very good. I got to taste of some of pho since my friend shared with me. I was impress with their pho so next time I will order the Ox tail Pho or maybe the lobster pho. The servers were very attentive and checked on us often . They refills our water often. I will definitely will be back when I'm in the Chinatown Vegas.

I had to get the lobster pho. Last time a friend and I came here, they ran out so I made sure to call in ahead of time to make sure they had some. It was market price which came out to $49.99. It was good, lobster was an ok size.  They body came out deshelled and declawed.  The only shelled part were the head and tail. The broth was AMAZING! I wanted to take the bowl and sip right out of it (couldn't tell if there was MSG or not). Overall it was good but I probably wouldn't order it again. It was one of those dishes that I wanted to try once.

We also go the Oxtail fried rice and beef carpaccio with truffle oil. The oxtail fried rice was as good as the last time! Oxtail was tender and plentiful. The carpaccio was different than I expected - the beef was also slightly cooked which made it a littl3 chewier than I would have liked. I only had a few slices and left the rest for my husband to finish.
We had the amazing big bone soup, eggrolls, oxtail fried rice, garlic noodles, and the nam pho. Every dish was very tasty, well prepared, and looked appetizing. Service was great! Highly recommended!

Honestly the rant and rave of this place, what is the big deal? The atmosphere was hipster, modern and the food had decent flavor, the loco moco oxtail was horrible where is the right portion of meat, gravy and rice ? The manager didn't seem appeased with my comment quiet snobbish but workers i give them credit for trying to accommodate us so im ok with one star! So will i be back, no thanks  manager can maybe wipe her hanabaddah for once...

I came here on the recommendation of a friend and was absolutely blown away with my experience:
First and foremost, district one is a Vietnamese-based restaurant with a wonderful variety of traditional dishes but it's also a nice bar with a hip decor suitable for a first date or watching a game with friends. 
I tried the four dishes:
Vietnamese carpaccio which was melt-in-your-mouth tender and delicious
Cabbage and shredded chicken salad - this is one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes and this one was the best I've ever eaten. It was clearly made to order with the mint still being crispy and nothing feeling soggy or stagnant. I'm hungry even thinking about it and I ate it a week ago. 
Clay pot - this was a hearty and savory comfort food which was delicious but not as light as the other two
Sautéed water spinach with tofu - perfectly cooked, not overly oily, the perfect amount of garlic and delicious. 

I would highly recommend this place for locals as a restaurant or as a bar which happens to have fantastic food. I would also recommend it to Las Vegas visitors who want a temporary escape from the strip and it's blinding lights. I think Vegas should have uber by my next visit and I'll make it a point to return to district 1.
Fan of Asian Fusion and that reflects on my rating. Pho's amazing and the place is hipstery. Open on a midnight is what's the best you could ask for.

We accidentally came here during happy hour, we had the oysters which tasted good but was a bit too warm and needed to be more chilled, the fish tacos were very good, the oxtail fried rice ordered spicy is to die for (omfg), and the bone marrow soup was awesome too!!!

My diet cokes were filled up fast and we had great service!!

Three words.

Phenomenal Ox Tails!! 

I and my friends were stopping by Vegas after a short visit to the seven magic mountains. I and my buddies were looking for a place to grab a bite and stumbled across of District one.

This venue looks pretty modern and urban on the inside. The layout and designs of the walls felt identical to how the boiling point franchise in southern California look like. There's a bar with a menu full of many different assorted alcoholic drinks and a lot of seating areas for customers.

When we looked at the menu, we noticed that there are assorted dishes that consist of Oxtail. It's not common for a restaurant to serve Ox tail dishes, so we figured that we would try some. We ordered the Ox tail pho, Ox tail fried rice, and Ox tail fries. These dishes were amazing!
Each bite into the oxtail was extremely delicious and juicy. The meat of the Oxtail was perfectly balanced between chewy and tender in all three dishes. Although if i were to pick a favorite out of the three, Oxtail pho was by far the best. I want to say that it's better than the restaurants in the bay area that serve Oxtail.


Would definitely recommend for anyone who likes to explore food dishes to try this place if they are in the area!

This place is a great find. Service is excellent, the prices are great and the food is delicious! Bone marrow pho with rice is the bomb. The bone marrow is massive and the broth is so good. Best place to go the next day for a hangover.

During one Vegas trip with friends, we decided to drop by in the morning when they opened. If you have a big party (like we did of 8 people), it's best to show up early to be able to get some of the bigger tables. 

Everyone got a few different things so we decided to share a few different things. My friend and I shared the oxtail fries - kind of like poutine fries - really good. 

I ended up ordering the pho because well I may have drank a little too much the night before and needed some hydration. It was pretty good - nothing to write home about, but nothing bad either. 

I wanted to get the lobster pho, but that was a bit too rich for my blood. 

Protip: get some things and share with friends

District One is an upscale sports bar styled Vietnamese fusion restaurant, nestled in Chinatown amongst a number of other Asian restaurants in a strip mall. I was definitely not expecting a modern atmosphere, and was happy not to have to wait in line at around 11:45am for lunch before my flight out. Highly recommend making the trek from the strip for some good Vietnamese eats here!

* Ox Tail Fried Rice - 5 stars: The oxtail fried rice was chock full of delicious ox tail, a little oily as expected but so tasty. I liked that it was not overly fatty 
* Pork Belly Buns - 5 stars: Recently went to a food event, Cochon 5050 in Napa which featured  restaurants serving all types of pork. This dish could stand head to head against those dishes. So tender, so flavorful, meaty, delicious! Next time, would order the buns unfried.
* Ox tail pho - 4 stars: Decent pho, have had better noodles. Broth was quite good and there was a lot of tender nonfatty oxtail meat - came with 2 large pieces. I think next time I will opt for the lobster pho.

The service was awesome, the food was great - can't wait to come back and try the rest of their menu! Come early, the restaurant was full with a line at 1230pm on a Saturday!

Wow wow wow this place is so good. They have delicious raw oysters on a half shell, mouth watering oxtail fried rice, oxtail pho, fried noddles, and garlic bok choy. We didn't order too much but I know other people rave about their other dishes. I will definitely be returning next time I'm in Vegas!!!

Its hard to find a hip place with great food, all at a good price. District One hits all the notes and orchestrates the symphony with courteous, attentive service. 
I came here, got the calamari, ox tail fried rice, ox tail soup and of course the Big Bone Soup. @___@  i would say i was far from disappointed, hence i had to come back for the famous Ox Tail Fries. This place will always be a destination for all my upcoming Vegas Trips.

Unique fusion dishes were OK. The fried chicken that's supposed to be stellar was just fried chicken, needed sauce or something. Service was really slow. If they want to accommodate more patrons, they should pay attention to when the customers are trying to flag down the wait staff for 30 minutes to get more water, receive the bill, etc.. And one of our dishes never came out; we had to ask about it when we were done eating everything else. Not sure if I would come back.

I have been to this restaurant several times and really enjoy it.  The food is really good.  The only negative is the parking because of all the restaurants that have opened up in this mall in the last 2 years.

My favorite menu items at District One:

Fresh coconut juice, vegetarian spring rolls, fabulous chicken wings. Pho veggie (very tasty) with lots of vegetables.

The food is balanced and flavorful!  Alan is attentive to my needs, and anticipates my wants. He suggests the most wonderful dishes that I am craving, but cannot pronounce or have any idea what they are. The coffee is fresh, and the chips are warm. The salsa is consistently beyond perfect! Dear God, it's good. I have Mexican relatives who make delicious salsa, however, theirs puts my relatives to shame. Shhhhhh. ;) One more thing, a picky person I know well, told me his boss eats there 3 times a week. For this reason, I had to see what the fuss was all about. Thank you to everyone!  Oh, I am craving it again.  Wow!

Ordered the Specialty House Oysters which were pretty darn good. Liked the citrus mixed with jalapeño (and I added a little Tabasco to each to give it an ever more vinegar-y kick). It was a refreshing starter. The Pork Belly Steamed buns were  tasty too. Then I ordered the Pork Belly bowl, which was even better! Best Pork Belly bowl hands down. Served with a soft boiled egg in the broth, and just enough fat to melt in your mouth. Yum!

My boyfriend ordered the Spicy Beef ramen, which he wasn't too impressed with and said it was way too spicy (and he likes spicy stuff). However this isn't Monta, so he should've known better.

Overall, I thought the food was great!

Really love this place. It's concept is nice and it has a really cool, modern look to it. I've only come for the pho so I can only speak on that. The veggie one is still beef based so beware. Other then that, the veggies are cool to perfection and the noodles are well done. The beef pho is amazing and the meat is thin and nicely cooked as well. The only reason I knocked it off a star is that, although the staff is nice and helpful, they come by your table too often and I have a hard time enjoying my food. Other than that, it's a great place and I still come to it.

Its my first time here and like its a good place .. The fresh spring roll has a crunchy thing so kinda taste weird coz I never had that. But the rest of the good we ordered was good, the server was nice and stuff.

Pho is the best recovery food when you're all partied out from what vegas has to offer. From what I can tell, I would not exactly call them authentic. I tried the oxtail pho which was huge and offered so much meat that I couldn't finish it. 

One of my friends got the bone marrow pho and it was amazing. There was loads of meat and the MARROW was so delicious and rich. Definitely recommend these two. I sampled the surf and turf pho and I don't think its that amazing for the price tag ($35). 

They also have an amazing coconut drink that IS TO DIE FOR. Please try it if you have the chance (even though they don't say it, you can ask to have it spiked).

If you love asian food or seafood this is the place to go! 

The Decor is sleek, the ambience is welcoming, the service is seriously one of the best, and the food is exquisite! 

I am big on service and District One definitely has one of the best service I've had at a restaurant. The servers are extremely knowledgable and always attentive. Drinks are always refilled without even having to ask. When you need someone to help you out they are always there to tend to your needs! 

There is definitely no cutting corners on flavor in all the dishes. Every dish I've tried has been extremely impeccable! If you are into buying seafood by the pound this place is for you! 

I recommend the Shrimp with house special sauce. The shrimp are always cooked perfectly and the size of them are crazy! Only the best! 
I also would recommend the Vietnamese egg rolls. Best in town! 

This place seriously is a must go no questions asked!!

I love their innovative dishes. Must try the big bone soup. I tried several dishes: papaya salad, oxtail french fries, big bone soup, grilled squid, and bun bo hue. I also had the Hennessy cafe su da.

Oxtail french fries look appealing but not a practical dish in my opinion, the fries were way too soggy and the oxtail marmalade just doesn't mix as it is much greasier at taste than when you have loaded fries (melted cheese and bacon). If the fries were very crispy, I'd enjoy the dish.

Papaya salad was decent but the big bone soup took the show for me. I enjoyed it as it had a lot of taste. The broth did need a lot of lime (but that is my own preference). What a presentation! Although they should consider machine sawing it to smaller piece so you can actually chew at it. 

The bun bo hue was enjoyable. But the grilled squid wasn't too great for me. I enjoy Cafe Moda's squid better, it is not chewy and was too dry.

They did forget about my Hennessy cafe su da but I ended up reminding them and they comped it. Honestly I'd rather this place 3-3.5 stars but I'll give it 4 for the customer service.

Place has awesome decor and is definitely a place to try. But I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon. At the price and actual product served, I think this place is for a different kind of crowd. Don't get me wrong, it's not a bad place at all!

We came here for a birthday dinner with twenty people, mostly from Portland, Oregon. And we loved it! We had a prix-fixe menu with oysters on the half shell, pork belly buns, cured beef dish, fried rice, squid, fried fish, and a few other dishes I am forgetting. The only complaint I have was that the squid was too spicy for my liking and was over-grilled. Otherwise everything else was delicious! Seriously, this place tastes ten times better than how it actually looks. It looks like any normal pho place but tastes better than any Vietnamese restaurant that I've ever had. Their cuisine is definitely modern and trendy and everything is packed with flavor.

Then the drinks! I had a moscow mule with a lychee and this was very good. There was also a coconut mojito that was served in an actual coconut and this was also delicious. 

For dessert, we had the creme brulee which was pandan flavored, I believe (like the green Asian fruit cakes, if you're familiar with those). And I did not think I would like it since I'm loyal to the classic creme brulee but this was once again, delicious! Packed full of flavor.

I will be CRAVING this place while I'm in Oregon and now I have a new, more trendy Asian restaurant that I can take my parents to - they're very traditional and mostly like only Asian food.

Must-try!!!

I love District one! The bartender Adrian is amazing, she recommended the Stir Fried Pepper Lobster with Garlic Noodles and it was incredible! 3 pounds of heaven! Thank you Adrian! You made my birthday so special and those coconut mojitos blow my mind!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would! We didn't have to wait at all, we got seated within arriving. The hostess was really nice all the way down to our server. The restaurant is very nice and has a great ambience! They have several tv's and all are not on the same channel which is a goo thing. They have a full bar and great selection of whiskey, American to Japanese... Hibiki!!!!  The food is amazing! We ordered Oxtail Soup  oxtail carpaccio, oxtail fried rice, and chicken wings in fish sauce (smells is very pungent and robust but don't be deceived it's really good). Can't wait to go back and make this a regular spot to go to!

I've been wanting to try this place for a while, and I came here with a group of friends. We ordered the oxtail pho, lobster pho, oxtail fried rice, and pork belly buns. The pork belly was so juicy and the bun was perfectly soft! I also loved the oxtail fried rice, and the portion was so large that I took half of it to go. The service was quick and the food was bomb! I can't wait to come back during happy hour!!

Went on a Tuesday night with a group of 8.  I liked the space.  It was open and reminded me of a couple of hipsterish places in New Orleans I frequented (e.g., Cochon Butcher).  

- The service was solid and very helpful with those that have dietary restrictions
- The wings were crispy and tangy and the jalepeno/chili sauce accompaniment was very nice.  Nicely balanced tang and spiciness
- The spring rolls were above average.  The mint was a little stronger and the shrimp were larger.  Nice mix
- The beef fried rice was delicious.  The beef was shredded rather than cubed and had a nice meaty and rich flavor.  Mixing it with the egg and some sriracha and I was in heaven
Food is pretty good! The price is $$. Good for family dinner and happy hour! Lobster pho is not bad. If the price is $30 will be better!

Wow this place is amazing. They have a lot of Vietnamese dishes, I ordered their take on the bun bo hue, which is spicy beef noodle soup with like pork. Traditional bun bo hue has pork knuckle, pork blood and beef shank, but they skip the two former and keep the latter. The broth wasn't too spicy, but you can ask for this chilli paste, which elevates the spice level by a lot if you'd like. I tried out some of my friend's oxtail fried rice, and that was delicious, ox tail meat, and an egg served however you like. I will definitely order that the next time I am in town. 

The restaurant itself is pretty big, plenty of parking in the plaza they are in. Tons of TVs set up so you can catch the game and what not. They also have other delicious looking items, like king crab, soft shell crab, oysters, spring rolls, oxtail fries...etc

This is our first time coming here, it was pretty good. We were able to get reservations for 7 people, I highly recommend doing so for a big group. The lobster pho was $50 so we opted not to try it.

-Bone marrow soup is huge, but does not come with noodles. Be ready to use your hands to pick off meat from the bones. You can order a side of noodles.

-Oxtail fried rice was really good. 9/10
-Pho with oxtail and pho with ribeye was good, the broth tasted clean

-Appetizer wings was lacking flavor, would not recommend 

-Beef chopped salad was decent, huge pieces of lettuce

Pho-king delicious! Definitely a bit pricy since I am used to spending around $10 for regular beef pho, so spending $50 can be hard to digest, but considering you are getting a full lobster, which was very fresh, I think this was worth trying! Broth was nice and doesn't feel greasy or filled with MSG that you would get from other pho soups. 

We also tried the pork belly buns, which come with 3 buns. They give you the option to have the buns fried or regular and since we typically have had the regular ones we decided to try something different and get 2 fried and 1 regular. The fried ones were ok, but if I had to go back I would definitely stick to the regular versions. Overall it was pretty good.

The chicken pho was great! Huge portion. Unfortunately not very vegetarian friendly. My friend had a hard time finding anything on the menu he would eat. They did prepare vegetarian spring rolls and garlic noodles which he enjoyed very much. Unfortunately no vegetarian broth for the pho which was disappointing. Cool atmosphere and great bar!
Damn, I mean Damn! Dat big bone soup is something else! The chicken wings are crispy Good! Come and check this place out, just look at da pics!

Came for dinner with the fiance. I've been meaning to try this place as we can always use some variety into our late night eats rotation.

The waitress brought over a chalkboard menu with specials and explained each one. We decided to get the oxtail fried rice off this menu. I thought this was pretty yummy fried rice as the rice was flavored well and there was plenty of chunks of oxtail in the rice. It had one egg on top, but it definitely needed more as after mixing it up into the rice, it sort've disappeared so perhaps consider getting a extra egg if you're a egg slut like me.

We also got the fried cornish hen with tomato rice. I rarely ever see cornish hen on menus, which is unfortunate as it's a more juicy,personal sized chicken. The fry on the bird was good, light crisp and it had a pleasant seasoning on it where I detected a hint of cinnamon that was lovely. If you love natural style fried chicken (no heavy kfc style breading) then this might be your jam. I was into this, it reminds me of Maxs Filipino style chicken that I grew up eating. 

Our server was pretty good about checking in on us. I like that this place is clean, modern  and has a young atmosphere with upbeat dance music. It's refreshingly different from the minimal utilitarian nature of most Asian establishments. The food is good so the fun vibe is just icing. I will be back soon to try the pho!

Loved this place!   Much nicer than my usual Pho place.  Great atmosphere.  But they dont have an alcohol license at all!  At least they didn't when i went :(  but other than that everything was great, with super friendly staff and decent prices.  Loved the lobster pho, and the fried calamari was excellent with a little twist... comes with pieces of fried jalapeño and garlic mixed in. Super yum!.  On that note, i was not a fan of the oxtail chili fries.  Bachi burger has them beat by a mile on these

From phó to tacos to cajun style seafood theres something for everyones taste when you can't decide where to eat.
Had a great experience eating at this place. It has  really cool design about it. Real urban-ish. Our waiter was good too! Because it was our first time, he was showing us the popular dishes that other people ordered. But since we already ordered ours we didnt want to over do it. 
Next time we come here I'm defiantly going to try some of there other stuff!

I'm a fan, but there are definitely things that they could improve on, service wise. 

Ambiance: 4 - It's small, cute, and clean inside. There's definitely a lot of space during happy hour when I came in, which is always a good thing! 

Service: 3 - They were good and attentive, but they are definitely prone to lots of mistakes. The servers should know what orders to put in first or the cooks should know which orders to crank out first. For example, we got our oxtail fries absolutely last at the end of our meal, which was odd. And I understand pho is easy to make, but you have to be smart about which orders you're putting out together. Other than this, service was pretty great! 

Food: 3/4 - I would say that some food was a hit or miss. It's definitely a good idea to arrive during their happy hours. I thought the oxtail fries and serrano wings were so-so. Though, I did hear that their pho was good and I had that crispy bird's nest noodle dish, which was also pretty tasty. Probably my favorite thing of the night was the oysters and how much they cost during happy hour--a dollar an oyster! They were super fresh and a good size. Plus, they didn't have that "just picked it from the ocean" taste, which was really nice! I think I'll definitely come back for happy hours ;)
Food was on Point!! yummy! a Must place to check out.. The only thing was that I had to look at the menu and look at yelp for the pics!! ;)

Spot on!! Than you TK.

Greeted as we entered, and seated after 10 minutes of walking into the establishment. It has the seafood/crab shack feeling, with wood top tables with an urban feel. 

After being seated, TK gave us the rundown of what the specials of the day was. Quite a few interesting choices, but eventually went with the Dungen. Very friendly staff, well except for one young female who collected our food to pack to go. She seemed irritated, mad, frustrated. Whatever it was, lucky it came at the end of the meal, cause we were quite happy with the food. Where's the smile at girl!? 

What ordered:
Ox tail fries
Spring rolls
Whole Dungeness special with garlic noodles.
Pho Oxtail
Pho Tai Nam
Pho Tom

Record time food service. From live to stirfried, the dungeness came out in a fairly quick and reasonable time limit. Everyone's food came all together and presented very well. Too bad they didn't have the bone maroc soup, but that just gives us a reason why we should be back. 

There is a full bar for those who want to have a drink with their meal. The atmosphere is casual and inviting. The parking gets crowded because of competing businesses, but not scarce. 

Definitely will come back. Hopefully by then, their busser/server will have a smile then. Otherwise check out TK and the rest of the staff at District One.

The grilled salmon was perfectly seared and skin was nice and crisp. I like salmon, but can be critical on the smell and taste. This was well seasoned and prepared w/the nice contrast of flavors from the topping and further accented w/the pesto on the bottom of the seared potato mash. This place is smart too, because the bowls of soup come in one good size, to make things quick and simple. The lobster ribeye was an even better portion reasonable for the type of food you get. This is a place I can appreciate because of the young fusion aspect that our Era or generation now have grown to expect. I would recommend this place if your into Asian and American variety or looking for a place to hang out w/a group for some fun. Oh yeah, service from the maitre d to the waiter was excellent all around.

My boyfriend and I came here for lunch today and we were definitely impressed. We ordered the steamed pork belly buns as an appetizer which were delicious. We didn't know you can also order it fried so we will be sure to try that next time. My boyfriend ordered the oxtail pho and I ordered the oxtail fried rice. I definitely have to say that this place did live up to its great reviews regarding the food. The service was a bit slow at times (having to wait for our waiter to place our order for food and drinks) but we didn't mind. He made up for it by coming a few times to refill our drinks and check in on us from time to time. Overall, the food was great. We will definitely be coming back to try their other dishes.

OMG - I'm not eating rice right now so I ordered the Rice Rice Combination plate with veggies instead of rice. See photo. My friend ordered the Lobster Fried Rice and Garlic Vegetables.  Doesn't get any better than this.  Good wine, too!

Wow a great place to come for tummy treats.  The main reason to come is the ox tail fries are the best ever, ox tail in a great gravy with fries and an egg. Omg sooo yummy. Would even take it home and add a big bowl of rice to suck up all that sauce. Oysters are spot on delish and the other plates were fulfilling.  3 adults 2 kids about one bill. Not bad considering we had beer and shots too. 

Bottom line I'll be back.

I don't like pho.   Wife loves it but not me.  Someone once said to me that is smells like feet and rotten cheese and I never shook it.

There are two exceptions.  Holla atcha boy Trinh Tran.  On special occasions, he would make a Maine sized lobster pot of pho that would make a vegan swoon.  Alas, he's back in Chicago.

The second is District One.   This is what pho should taste AND smell like.

District One caters to a young, cool crowd of Asian hotties, is clean, and has an attentive staff.  Their prices are very reasonable.  I like this place and highly recommend.  Thank you for restoring my faith in pho!

Had a late dinner here a coupla weeks ago:
- Nice place with an eclectic menu, including even fish(?) tacos.
- Rene(?), my waitress, forgot to take my order or was busy, but she was really apologetic and made up for it.
- I enjoyed the oxtail pho.  Will definitely try this place again.

Got dragged by the girlfriend and friends to District One and dont know what to expect. I kept hearing the bone marrow pho popping up in the conversation along the way. We got seated pretty quick once we arrived. Tried to order the bone marrow pho and coconut mojito and they ran out. EDC weekend and folks just killed the entire batch. Still i respect a restaurant that only serve what they can handle. We got the oxtail pho and double down instead. The pho is very clean and lighter than i expected even with all the ingredients. Overall the meal is very good. The service was attentive and they told us there will be more bone marrow pho on Tuesday! If you have time and a car in Vegas definitely visit this place off the strip.

"I'm the only white dude in the whole place" whispers Midwest Poker bud.

"Huh, I didn't notice" I say looking around at my two Asian poker buds and a restaurant filled with Asians watching March Madness.

"You guys order for me so I don't stand out" he continues.

"Whatever" I say, my voice brightening as my fellow buds break into huge grins. 

District One has come into its own.  The menu has been refined.  The list of cocktails greatly improved.  Outstanding selection of Japanese whiskey and other brown libations.  Inviting with all the elements to back up a great experience.

To start, sea snails in a beautifully infused chili, basil, lemongrass broth is outstanding.  Chewy as they should be, the broth has the distinct smell of the sea (like boiling stones collected from the ocean) with good herbaceous overtones greatly enhances the flavor.

The Vietnamese beef carpaccio is different in a good way.  Thin slices of beef are arranged on a plate, lightly torched before being drowned with sesame, citrus, and soy.  Basil, mint, a bit of truffle oil all enhance the minearality of the beef.  Crushed peanuts and thin slics of onion add texture.  A squeeze of fresh lime makes the flavors explode.

The grilled whole squid so simple and so good.  Plump, not very tender but not dried.  Light charred bitterness and aggressive seasoning.  It doesn't need the accompanying spicy aioli (taste like siracha and mayo)

For larger dishes, the fried whole fish.  Deep fried, finished in a sweet tangy sauce supported by raw onions, fresh cilantro, and green pickled papaya.  Good eats.  Some places are overcooked and slightly tough, it adds to the rustic nature of the dish.

The lobster pho (whole 1.5lb Maine lobster) remains excellent; the broth becoming incredibly rich and flavorful if you mix in the tamale of the lobster.  Eat this quick else the tail rapidly overcooks and becomes tough.  

Finally, the "Big Bone Soup" remains very good.  Loads of marrow and great extraction make for an unctious soup that delivers on flavor.

Very good, attentive service with just the right amount of casual familiarity.

Excellent libation list and well made craft cocktails that perfectly match their flavors.

Solid, solid, solid and worthy as one of the best "modern" Vietnamese eateries in the city.

We saw this place open up and bookmarked it immediately. I'm always excited when a new Asian Cuisine place opens up in town!

We came here on Friday night to try out this new lovely place. It wasn't busy and we were immediately seated. 
The waitress was very attentive and took our orders quickly. 

We ordered - 

Fish Tacos
Very good. I wish they made a larger size so you can have it as an entree. Who wants little bitty tacos?!?
Shaken Beef Salad
Very good. It was a good mix of sweet and spicy, very flavorful!
Garlic Serrano Wings -
Not very spicy in our opinion, but still very good. It had a very good flavor and the wings were cooked perfectly. They were SUPER garlicy though. So much you can taste that shit the next day.
The short rib combo plate -
The ribs were very good, it's the only thing on the plate that has flavor besides the bowlful of garlic kimchi which I stayed away from. 

Overall, the food, was very good. They have a good alcohol selection and they have TV's up everywhere playing sports as well. It's very clean and "hip" inside.
Definitely will try out again and try out some more food!

This is one of my regular spots to go to. Love the Oxtail Pho plus their broth is delicious and rich.

They always have seating and have good hours. Their happy hour menu isn't too bad either.

Coming to Vegas on a business trip and my partner brought us to this unique restaurant. The servers were very attentive, the food was delicious, the price is very reasonable.
I will be back.

After wasting my lunch break, I'm appalled to see the type of ratings they've managed to receive. It really does give me an indication of what money can buy because quality certainly wasn't on their priority list when opening a restaurant. I felt like pho-bomination they served me today was cooked in a toilet bowl after the violent passing of spring rolls and slim jim.

Mind you, I have eaten a fair share of Pho places throughout the WORLD, including in Vietnam. I'd be ashamed to serve this lukewarm soaked garbage with chunks of shoe leather to my own enemies. 

Will i go back? I would rather fallete a vagabond with a mild case of gonorrhea then put myself through another wasted meal at District One.
The ambiance, the presentation, the service and of course food was THE BEST. Each entree was unique and definitely coming back!

I've been to District One twice, on my weekend getaways to Vegas. Let me tell you, what a great spot to have our last meal on Sunday's before heading out to Cali. 

Restaurant was clean and very modern, great vibe, and servers were very well accommodating throughout our whole stay. They kept checking up on us making sure we enjoyed our food and not in the ridiculously nagging way, either! Our first time there, we sat at the bar and the Bartender was one of the owners/managers? She was very friendly and gave us the rundown on what their specialities were and a little background on the restaurant as well!

Food:
Both time, for those Sunday Vegas Hangover Cures, I've gotten the oxtail pho. Omgggg, to die for, honestly. Also, their broth is a bit different from other Pho restaurants I've been too, but not in the bad way! 
They are also known for their lobster pho, which I have yet to try, but I am sure trying it the next time I go. I've also tried their Vietnamese Coffee, and that definitely lived up to expectations. For those that know the Sunday traffic on the 5 going towards California, definitely order the Viet Coffee, if you had a long weekend!

All in all, I'm always really excited when we get to stop by District One!

We are obsessed with this place! Everything we've had here was delicious. From oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice, to their belly buns! This our number 1 go to place for pho! Kids love it too.  Amazing food! Great service.

The garlic fries were good; chicken wings---just ok; our meals werent bad for short ribs.  The chinese sausage { that accompanied the ribs} was way over dried. It was like eating beef jerky.  They gave us complimentary shrimp cocktails ; that was delicious.

The Oxtail Pho was wonderful!

At a reasonable price, the Oxtail Pho ($11.95) is LOADED with Oxtail bones in an oily, flavorful pho broth.  VERY GOOD!  

Portion size was very fair as well!  And the meat was much more tender than most....this would be my favorite rendition to date!

I really wanted to try the Lobster Pho for around $27 (market price), but I am VERY happy I was able to try their Oxtail here!  Just gives me a reason to come back again :)

Service was quick and efficient, and the restaurant itself looked clean and inviting.

I will be back!

The first time visit here , I tried the pork belly buns and it was just alright. Nothing special.

Second visit here I had the Thai Style & lemon grass Sea Snails on their Special Menu and it did not disappoint. It was so good !! Reminded me of the snail cuisines I had when I was in Vietnam ! 

The jalapeño chicken wings reminds me of calamari - pretty good

Excellent food makes you forgive minor gripes like having to explain repeatedly Restaurant Week-to a clueless waitress who disappeared for most of our meal. But that's minor compared to the overall excellence of our meal. 

We had the Restaurant Week Menu this visit and it was delicious. We had the spring rolls and lemongrass beef wrapped in betel leaves both with addictive dipping sauces.

Entrees were fantastic. The ox tail fries and shrimp pho were wonderful, replete with complex and unique flavors. The dessert was just as excellent. Their in-house coconut ice cream rests in a cradle of tender coconut in the shell.

Love this place!   My boyfriend's meal arrived WAAAAAY before mine which is the only reason I refuse to give this place 5 stars.  However the bartender was awesome, the food was great, and the atmosphere is really cool.   We'll be back !
Best fried rice I have ever had! Oxtail fried rice. Really great! The pork belly buns were really good too!

Very hip vietnamese restaurant that is different from other typical pho joints that you see in Vegas. Great vibe and service is excellent! We were not abandoned by the waitress after we put the order in. They keep coming back asking if everything was ok, clearing up the empty plates and bowl and refilling hot water for my tea. We ordered pho, combo pork chop rice, egg rolls, grilled squid, surf clams and ox tail fried rice. Food quality is definitely better than other pho restaurants around here. I love the idea of having the sinks outside of the restroom in the hall way for the guests' convenience. The only problem why I knocked down a star is because it took quite a bit of time for food to come out. Other than that everything is great. Will definitely come back next time we are here in Vegas again!

Delicious!! My daughter and I came here and we eat Pho quite a bit... the entire time she said " mmm this is yummy". This was my first time having lobster Pho and District One has set a very high bar! They did not skimp on the lobster at all and the broth was very flavorful! 

The Restaurant was clean and modern. The bar looked delectable and I will partake on girls night out! The staff were friendly and attentive. I will be returning!

We were dropped off in Chinatown in search of a place for dinner w friends we walked into 3 place before saw this place. We went in and we're instantly in love w atmosphere and then we saw the menu...yum! There were five of us and everyone loved their choices. I had shrimp fried rice w garlic noodles, it was amazing. They also had a really cool drink menu, ones we had never had. WE WILL BE BACK!!!!!

Yay! I'm a fan of this hipster spot! There's lots of space for seating and the tables weren;t sticky. I like the dark decor and all the lighting accents. Our server was sufficient, not bad not amazing. Now, the food was delicious. I ordered chicken as a appetizer and man I devoured those things. I ordered shrimp pho and the broth wasn't salty. It tasted smooth and the noodles were soft when they came out, which I liked because I didn't need to stare at her while waiting for the noodles to soften. Did not want to awkwardly stare at her while she eats, haha. Now, the atmosphere felt relaxed like a bar although comforting like eating at your own dining set in your home. Overall I enjoyed my experience here and my meal was inexpensive. Next time I'm ordering the lobster pho to see what all this fuss is about!

Pros: lots of seating space, appealing decor, clean, bathroom, delicious food, great presentation, lots of parking spaces

Cons: Customer service was below adequate

Overall: Coming back shortly! Maybe I'll order something new and enjoy the good music again! I like this spot for sure!!!

Yum, this is my favorite pho place in Vegas, actually even in SoCal...as far as flavor goes. The oxail pho is what me and my hubby got. The broth is so so flavorful. The little specks of fat floating around from the oxtail /drooool. So you might be wondering why I gave it  2 stars instead of the 4 or 5 for places I typically love. Service was bad, my hubs had to get up multiple times to ask for things we needed AND the oxtail wasn't as tender as it should've been. The oxtail meat did not fall off the bone, so in the end a lot of the meat was left on the bone. $16 for a bowl of pho, so it felt pretty wasted since most meat got left behind. I tried to gnaw the meat off, but it just wasn't tender enough to slip off easily. So my husband had to go ask for knife and fork so I could cut some of the meat off. 

The servers never came by to check on us or to see if we needed anything. If so, they would've known that our garnish plates never came out. We sat around trying to remove meat from bone in our soup bowls for 5 minutes and still no garnish plates. I wasn't sure if maybe this pho is so haute that they don't let you add anything to it because it will ruin the flavor somehow. I started to look around and saw plates of sprouts, basil, and lime though on other tables. That's when my husband got up to ask for garnish plates. Also, they don't refill water. Middle of the meal, I had drank a good portion and needed MOAR! Again, my husband had to get up to ask for a water refill. The other time he got up was to ask for the knife to cut meat, because they simply did not come around to ask us if we needed anything. 

Again, amazing flavor in the broth but the meat texture and service could use a lot of improvement. At the price level they're selling, they should really step up their service game. The flavor here is definitely next level, and if you can overlook the price, service, and oxtail texture, you're good to go! I think I will come back though to give them another chance. Plus, it was the Monday after EDC that we went, maybe the servers attended EDC and were dragging ass from it.
If you're a fan of lobster and pho. This is the place to be. Order the lobster pho! If not their pho ribeye was on point as well. On top of fast service.

Presentation and plating 3 stars plus location and restaurant made it to four stars. Food? Aiggghht! Too greasy and too much fish sauce. Don't get me wrong, I'm Asian and I can appreciate grease and fish sauce, but not heart attack grease tho' . But all in all food is good if your up to what we call " comfort food".
The Pho Tam and Vietnamese coffee was just superb!!! I highly recommend when in Vegas to check out District One Kitchen. The food and service was great!!!
Food was delicious and definitely unique! Staff was very nice in explaining things on the menu and everything was just great! I'll be back!
Come here for lunch . We have oxtails fried rice, spicy bun bo hue. Very good. Great atmosphere.awesome service
I love the pho here . The flavor of the broth is just right. Go to this spot if ur craving pho while visiting vegas
My first time here. We ordered the lobster pho. The lobster really big but I felt nothing special. The papaya salad was okay. May not come back.

Loved the environment of the restaurant. I was a little bummed because there wasn't a vegetarian option for the pho soup. 

Corey was awesome! He was very patient with me and went out of his way to make sure my order was just right. He also made sure the sauces I'd be having had no meat & let me know and accommodated sauces that I could use as replacement. Great customer service, left very satisfied.
I liked the setup and people are friendly. I wish they would have more seafood on stock but thats the price you pay for fresh ingredients.

This place is bomb! The appetizers are perfect portions. The food is well seasoned and tastes amazing. I got the beef carpaccio and papaya salad, both were so good.

My friend got the rice combo rice platter. The short ribs were to die for!!! 
The place is clean the staff is attentive and the menu is small, but offers everything u need. I'll definitely be coming back.
This place is phenomenal. The food is spot on and the atmosphere is really cool. Also, excellent service. Highly recommended if you're looking for good Vietnamese food in Vegas.

I'm not a fan. I stopped in based on Yelp reviews -- around 3:15 pm as I was in the neighborhood and needed a snack. I knew from other reviews it was happy hour and there were food specials. I was given the regular menu -- no big deal, maybe they changed happy hour. I ordered the serrano wings (6 for $7.95) and a side of steam rice ($1.50). The waiter then showed me the specials on a chalkboard -- none of which I was interested in but then I asked what the difference was between the wings on his specials board and the wings that I ordered. He said nothing -- but his price quote was more expensive than the menu he gave me. He really seemed confused and said the price must have dropped. Interesting. Anyway, he then said, what time is it? I said like 3:20, he said oh it's happy hour, there is a happy hour menu. He left, provided it to me, and the wings were $.50 each ($3 for 6), so, then I also decided to order the fried spring rolls ($3.95), and steamed rice. My bill with tip was $11 so, cheap but the food wasn't very good, the wings tasted a bit like chicken liver -- not sure what was happening there. The spring rolls were the highlight but I did not like their sweet chili sauce and asked if they had hot mustard -- they do not. The rice was not quality. It was not sticky, but very separated like American (uncle ben's) rice.

The clincher was -- while I was finishing up. The owner or manager maybe, drove up (Toyota beige truck), parked in the only handicap spot in front (no handicap sign or designation on plate), and walked in the restaurant/pulled up at bar and was still there 20 minutes later when I left. It is totally is rude and annoying when perfectly able body people take the handicap spots (I'm in tuned because my mom is disabled and I drive her around a lot and its annoying that spots are taken by those with no disability and just lazy-asses).
Really good. Loved the atmosphere. Went for lunch. We had the crispy bird noodle nest, oxtail fried rice & fish tacos. Loved the first two the tacos ok. Will definitely be back!
Really nice concept of decorating the restaurant! Clean and cool! Those staff are nice! Food is perfect

I love this place! !  I used to live on this side of town and never knew that this place existed...what a shame for me.  This place has the best Pho in town.  The portions the flavors of the dish here are big and well worth every penny.   Also, the establishment is fun and full of life.  The staff here is very attentive and friendly.   This is a great place to try out.

We walked in for date night around 9:30pm on a Sunday night. We were greeted by one of the waiters and seated immediately, they were at about half capacity. 

The waiter was very friendly and prompt. 
We ordered some Garlic Edamame and a Pho Oxtail. 

The food arrived in a timely manner. The oxtail was so good - literally falling off the bone. It gave the pho a great flavor. 

My only complaint is having to ask for everything we needed.. Anticipate your guests' needs. It's soup to share, I'll need an extra bowl, a spoon, a straw for my beverage.. little things, wasn't a deal breaker...but I feel like those are necessities when eating a meal, period. 

Overall we had a great experience and can't wait to come back!
I can't get enough of this place! Everything we ordered was amazing! Renee D was also exceptional! Sea snail appetizer, braised pork belly, oxtail pho, and the house special oysters! Broke da mouth!

I've never been here and agreed to give it a try after all these years since we had family in town. We came in late with a party of ten, half being kids and the rest adults. This place has outdone themselves with exceptional service since they tended to our table as often as any table should. It's difficult to have good dining experiences with big parties, since servers can possibly get overwhelmed. A few of us were there more for the company and weren't hungry, including me, but everything I tried that night was flavorful. Calamari is my son's favorite and the calamari here is a bit on the spicy side, but still so good. The pork belly was wow, phenomenal. The oxtail pho is something I MUST order, not just try, on my next visit. 

I love the setup of this restaurant...spacious, cool, and did I mention they have a bar? Yes. Something about this place gives a good ambiance.

Came to District One while visiting because a friend recommended the place. We ordered the oxtail fried rice (which was by far the best dish), fried chicken, papaya salad, five spiced cornish hen with garlic noodles, and pork buns. 

Everything was delicious except for the fact that the papaya salad was a way too sour for our taste and the breast of the five spiced cornish hen was a bit dry. We brought this up to our waiter not to expect our money back, but just to give them a little constructive criticism. To our surprise, not only did they take off the papaya salad off our bill, they gave us two free desserts, creme brule and coconut ice cream, which were both amazing. 

Great food and even better customer service. I will come back the next time I'm in town!
They have the best oxtail loco moco, oyster and pork belly here. Wouldnt recommend the slow pork braised here.
Terrific food, awesome waitor. What more can you ask for? go for the bone marrow soup and happy hour oysters.

Beef in betel leaves. Oxtail Pho. Pork belly in coconut juice. These are some of our favorite items here. 

Owned by the son of the owner of Pho So 1, we knew that we were in for some delicious Vietnamese food. Our high expectations were met the moment we tried the food here. With a small menu, they focused on high quality and innovative Vietnamese dishes. The restaurant itself has a clean, modern and hip look. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes!

Items Selected:

District One Kitchen & Bar
Tamarind Chicken Wings
Green Papaya Salad - Shrimp, Pork, Mint, Crushed Roasted Peanut
Fish Tacos - Yellowtail, Avocado, Cilantro, Cherry Tomato
Oxtail Pho
The Big Bone Soup - Bone and Marrow Soup
Slow Braised Pork Belly in Young Coconut Juice - Boiled Egg, Steamed Jasmine Rice
1lb Shrimp D1 Goodness, Medium Heat

Occupying the former home of Cravin' Cajun and serving up modern Vietnamese cuisine in a room one part hipster-industrial and one part sports bar it was with a group of five that I sat down at District One Kitchen & Bar just minutes after noon and focusing our order on variety the results proved 'variable' at best.  Clearly untrained and understaffed to handle a restaurant nearly 3/4 full by 12:30 it was with a trio of appetizers that our meal began and with beverage refills scarce as servers ran in circles perhaps it was fortuitous that none of the first round proved remotely spicy, the hamachi tacos bright and crisp at $3 each while dull, limp wings and the vinegar tinged salad proved entirely forgettable...and not particularly 'Vietnamese' at all.  Moving next to larger scale items, a duo of pho dishes would prove respectable if not particularly well presented; the supple oxtail imbuing long rice noodles with a meaty sapor while an enormous proximal femur laced its broth with fat to balance ample scallions, though heat remained mute even in the presence of sliced jalapenos.  Moving finally to the items that showed the kitchen's promise, suffice it to say that tender pork belly first braised then rendered soft in coconut milk proved by far the most complex option of the afternoon despite its unexpected sweetness and although a seemingly odd choice, the throwback 'get down n' dirty' shrimp finally delivered in the spice department, a pound of the snappy shell-ons again leaving my water-glass empty while wondering why we hadn't just gone to Crab Corner or Hot n' Juicy instead.

We tried to get in a popular Korean place and found that they had a huge line of people waiting outside. We found this place after being dropped off with Uber and were pleasantly surprised how great the food and service was.

The Pho broth had full flavor and was amazing, so was the ox tail fried rice. First time having that. The pork belly buns were fantastic! Couldn't get over how well things were prepared and how awesome the service was.

Can't wait to go back when in town.

The rib eye beef noodle was good and bad.  The beef was awesome, thin and well cooked.  Meat balls were also great!  But the problem comes in the noodles.  They were too soggy and they fell apart into short piece so I had to eat it with a spoon!!!  Broth was great, even better than some from San Jose!!!  If they improve on the noodle then it's perfect!

Customer service was great, waiters were very aware of what we need and when we need their attention, but I didn't appreciate the female manager having a training session while the restaurant was opened for business!  That seemed a bit unprofessional tho the rest of the staff were very polite.  The lady in charge was just loud and sounded obnoxious.  Kind of annoying while trying to enjoy a great bowl of beef noodles.  

Pork belly bun is a must have, with steam buns!!!

Pork Belly Buns
Fish Taco
Wok Clams and Basil

Friday late night (ten-something)... I expected a bigger crowd. And I especially expected a bigger crowd with the type of service we received. Two servers walked by and neither returned to fill my empty water glass.

I found the food un-inspiring. I literally said to myself, "Why did I get clams and basil here when it's so much better at a traditional Chinese restaurant?" I thought the the proportion of fat to meat in the pork belly buns was overwhelming. The fish tacos, I don't even remember them enough for an accurate description. 

It's unlikely we will return here. It's just too mediocre.
Oyster too weak and small. Chicken wings and Lemons dried, not fresh. Cocktails are so so. Salad is ok. Over all not satisfied. Service not bad. Need to upgrade your food.

I took my family out for dinner and wanted to try something new. This was an important dinner so it had to be somewhere good. The glowing reviews brought us here. We had to wait for a few minutes for a table which was bearable thanks to all their flat screen TV's with the OKC game on.

Pork Belly Buns:
Braised pork belly with sauce, peanuts and cilantro. This was tasty and fatty. 4/5

Soft Shell Crab:
Big pieces of deep-fried soft shell crab with a dipping sauce. 4/5

Lobster Pho:
Here's a dish you won't see at most Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas. The broth was quite tasty. They serve the whole lobster with head, claws and tail - the body and claws have been de-shelled so all you have to do is eat and enjoy. Market price for when I went was $32. 4.5/5

Mi Sate:
A big bowl of egg noodles and beef in peanut sauce. It tastes like Filipino kare-kare but much watery and with noodles. 3.5/5

District One Rice Combo Platter:
Short ribs (or you can get pork chop), kimchi, fried egg, Chinese sausage, and rice. A big plate that will not leave you hungry. The short ribs were flavorful and grilled. 4/5

The place seems like a good place to hang out at. The bar looks promising and I was watching the bartender interact with people at the bar during commercials - the people at the bar seemed pleased. They do serve alcohol, Vietnamese coffee, soda, etc. Our server, Tien was alright. He forgot to check on our drinks though. A different server gave us our check and asked if we wanted refills - too late! Tien came back to offer is refills - again, too late! Service could definitely be improved.

District One is amazing! I've been twice and about 2 months between visits. I was greeted with a "Welcome back!" He said the whole restaurant remembered me because of all silliness my friends and I were having and the jokes I was making. My friends and I were calling it PhOlympics and Phoci. We're full of punny! This unusually cool weather in late May and crazy allergies, Pho is what the doctor ordered.

On this visit we ordered Spring Rolls, the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio, and a bowl of the Beef & Flank Pho. I also ordered a Vietnamese Iced Coffee (which is a poor decision on a Wednesday night at 7 PM, I was so jacked) because when in Rome...

First out was the Beef Carpaccio, which was a little too salty for my taste, but it was tasty nonetheless. A huge portion and I had a lot of fun eating it with chopsticks. It was peanut, garlicky, citrusy goodness, just tone down the salt!

Next up was the Spring Rolls. These were nothing special and were straight to the point. Tasted fresh and the peanut-fish sauce was delicious and fresh.

Next up was the Beef & Flank Pho which was delicious. The broth is perfection, top it with some sprouts, jalapeños, a squeeze of lime, and sprig of mint. I also add a bit of Sriracha because I like the hot, hot, heat! Seriously, savor the rich complexity of the broth. 

At this point we were stuffed and happily fed. We were thanked for dining there and happily on our way.
