District One has a lot of seating, booths and long tables. There's a bar and TVs everywhere. Service is prompt and friendly. Food is fresh and tasty. They also have a bunch of fresh seafood that's delivered daily as well as a Lobster Pho that will happen at the next PhOlympics. 

Solid Asian Fusion. Definitely a fan!

Oh wow my last review was 3 years ago on District one, its time to have a update review.

This place never disappointed me, when i have friends in town i always bring them to this place coz i know they will love the oxtail fried rice!  

But i will say the papaya salad tasted different now, I do love the older version better.  Or maybe its time to add some new dishes to the menu.... maybe??

Located in the same shopping center on Jones Blvd as "China Mama" and "Chada Thai," this Vietnamese-inspired, pan-Asian restaurant has a very different look and feel than most of the nearby Asian spots. From the huge drink selection, to the flat screen TVs playing sports, to the modern, urban, and industrial decor, it's clear the owners designed this space to be a cool destination to hang out, socialize, drink, and dine. District One Kitchen & Bar is also open until 3am and offers some decent happy hour specials from 3pm-6pm and midnight to 3am.

I recently tried this place with four friends on Friday night at 9pm upon the recommendation of an acquaintance. Besides the limited parking in a crowded parking lot, our only complaint was that our five entrees arrived at four different times -- each of them 3-4 minutes apart. The staff made up for it by being extremely attentive with our drinks, however -- three of us had 3-4 refills each -- and a female manager was very gracious and friendly as we exited the restaurant. The food we ordered was also just as good as advertised. 

The five of us shared the garlic serrano pepper wings, pork belly buns, Vietnamese beef carpaccio, and fish tacos for our appetizers. The beef carpaccio was definitely our favorite and the fish tacos our least favorite (mainly because of the small portion and $8.95 price tag).

I ordered the Crispy Bird Nest Noodles for my entree and the dish was so tasty I didn't offer a bite to anyone in my group. Two of my friends ordered the Steak & Eggs and raved about the flavor of the steak but complained the eggs weren't cooked to their specification. We were collectively happy with our experience overall, however, and we each agreed we would be back in the future.
Everything was amazing.  Service, food, drinks.  Ok tail rice to die for.  The onions are chopped too big, but it's ok.  Soup, Carpaccio, and everything else was amazing.  Thank you

I'm pleasantly surprised by the pho here. I'm from L.A. with a considerably larger Asian community and food-fare and I wasn't expecting much when I came here.

After a night of heavy partying ("getting lit" or "turnt" as the cool kids like to say these days), I always find pho to be one of the best hangover cures/comfort foods to have the next morning. And this place definitely hits the spot. I ordered the pho tai nam, my standard go-to, and collectively shared an order of their "big bone soup" with the rest of my group. The pho tai nam did not disappoint at all. It was very delicious and satisfying. The big bone soup is also a surprise to me. Very tasty large beef bones cooked in their own broth, with delicious tendon hanging off the bone and bone marrow inside. I think they would go great with some of the other more carb-loaded dishes.

Our server was decent, but she seemed pretty busy and didn't check on us as often as we like. They also have a wicked bar selection of amazing Japanese whiskies; too bad I wasn't in the mood to have any alcohol at that point of visit. Maybe next time!

Would highly recommend this place to visit for your pho cravings in Vegas!

Pro-tip: Definitely order the big bone soup.

I've been to this restaurant on more than one occasion and the staff are always amazing. They take time out to explain to you all the specials and address any other additional questions that you have. Whether you're there in the middle of the night or right before closing. The menu is very versatile as well and gives you many different options to choose from, which I like.  Definitely a place everyone should try out!

Awesome food and service !

I'm from NYC and this is the best viet fusion I ever had.

So I've been here maybe four times? Once was for lunch and the other three times was for dinner. One of the dinners, it was during happy hour so we got to try some of the happy hour items. 

District One has a very modern feel to it. They have a bar at the back, booths in the front, and tables in the middle. Their menu consists of Asian fusion with a few traditional Vietnamese dishes, such as pho and bun bue hue. 

On my most recent visit, I got to try a few things on the happy hour menu. The Serrano pepper wings were pretty good. It was deep fried nice and crispy on the outside yet very juicy on the inside. The flavor of the Serrano pepper doesn't necessarily soak through as much because the peppers were way spicier than the wings, but I suppose that's expected for something that's deep fried. We also got a dozen of their happy hour oysters, which at the time were blue points. I can't say they do their oysters very well because it was dry. There was no brine to accompany it; therefore, you HAVE to squeeze lemon on it AND use cocktail sauce. I typically just eat it with lemon but that was not a choice here. I probably wouldn't get oysters here again. My friends LOVE their Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio but I don't mirror their feelings for the dish. They doused the beef in so much oil that I feel like that's the only thing I can taste! My friends also got their Cajun garlic fries, which had really good flavor. The only problem was that one batch had more garlic flavor than the second batch so the inconsistency surely shines through. 

For their pho, I have tried their oxtail pho and rib eye pho. I must say, District One is possibly my favorite place for pho. It is not the cheapest pho in town but it's got the best flavor to their broth. I didn't care for the oxtail though -- it was just three oxtail bones in there. I'd rather have the oxtail a different way but it was good nonetheless. I've also tried their Mekong River Style Noodle Soup, which was only so-so for me. They put a ton of stuff in there and perhaps some people like that. It's just not my thing though. They filled it with bean sprouts and a ton of meat. I prefer to control the bean sprouts on my own like I do with pho ;P Their garlic noodles, however, were very delicious. It's got good flavor and it's simple. 

Their oxtail fried rice is so popular. It's one of the dishes that you have got to try and, well, I didn't care for it. That was the first thing I tried when I first went to District One and I gotta say, I can't even remember it. I love clay pot rice so I had to try theirs. It's slightly different from the Chinese version because they mixed in the soy sauce for you already into the rice and frankly, they put too much. The dish was a tad too salty for me. I liked how they would put whole cloves of garlic in there though :) 

Their grilled squid is pretty good though. It was very soft and not chewy at all! I'm not a huge fan of squid but I would definitely order it again when I go. 

The service was decent. I wouldn't say that it was amazing service but it wasn't absolute garbage either. 

Overall, I would justify District One with a 3 star rating. Don't get me wrong -- it's not a BAD rating. It's good. But out of allllll the stuff I've tried, only like three dishes stuck out for me: pho, garlic noodles, and grilled squid. I would definitely come back for those three dishes haha!

I had this bookmarked for a while and now I can happily say I can cross it off my list. 
I dragged my friends along and we had a meal of epic proportions. 
Oxtail fries were soso, it tasted good but were real soggy. 
Serrano wings were damn good. Who doesnt like crispy wings with a touch of heat that slightly lingers on your palate. 
I had the big bone soup and a bowl of pho on the side. The broths tastes real flavorful. It was a lil effort to get all the meat off the bones but it was so worth it. I ate every tendon and meat strand there was then all the marrow inside them bones. 
My friends got the lobster pho which looked so freaking delicious, ( unfortunately I'm allergic to shellfish) I have learned to live vicariously through others so I was reading his face after each bite and it was of shear delight. 
My cousin got the steak and eggs, which he loved. The rice was tomato rice and the "steak" was their shaken beef.  He liked his dish  very much aswell 

We had a great time, the food, the servers and we came at a great time as there was a lot of tables open.

The service is amazing. A waitress helped us and made us feel super comfortable. She was super sweet and it was also her birthday. 

We ordered the lobster pho-- it was okay. It's one that you want to cross off your bucket list. However, it is expensive.

All right earlier tonight after driving around we ended up at District One in Las Vegas on Jones just off of Spring Mountain. We decided to give this place another try after a few months. To start we ordered the garlic fries which has fresh crushed garlic and Cajun seasoning. We  ordered the fries well-done extra crispy and they came out soggy I wasn't a fan.  We  ordered the fish tacos which was yellowtail sashimi, Avocado, cilantro, and cherry tomatoes. The tacos were delicious we were  very happy they had a unique wonton taco shell which really made the dish no complaints. Next we ordered the belly buns which was braised pork belly, Cilantro, and peanuts with a typical bun. I was very disappointed with them they need a lot of work, they are average at best. Next we tried the Oxtail  Fried Rice which had Shredded Oxtail meat, red onion, soy sauce and a fried egg. Another disappointment they said it was one of their more popular dishes but failed to deliver amongst our table. Lastly we tried the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio which consists of beef carpaccio, citrus soy, sesame oil, truffle oil, white onions, basil and peanuts. This was very good, nothing that I would completely rave  about but very good. No complaints I would order it and the tacos again for sure.
Pros: Good food, cool atmosphere, good crowd and they're open late.
Cons: although some of the dishes are good the rest of menu definitely needs some work. They really could be doing better. The staff seemed a little distracted with each other talking and on their phones at times and not really paying attention to a lot of the tables my friends and I had to wait a few times for water and drinks. After ordering appetizers our waiter disappeared for at least 15 minutes before he came back to take our entrée order. Lastly no wifi this is always a bother considering it's 2017 and every business should offer it to their patrons.
We are leaving disappointed for a second time which is very frustrating.
This place has so much potential and they keep dropping the ball. If they step their game up and improve the menu and food quality we would go all the time. As of now they have two strikes against them and I don't want there to be a third. We will give them another chance in a month or so and we will see. As of now they get a C maybe even a C-

I just can't get enougho!

You would think...pho in a bar? Hmmm...Better scrutinize the broth, it may be blahhh, right? WRONG! So wrong! They know how to do it right, right here at District One! So good! We were pleasantly impressed! We've been here, I would say, more than a couple dozen times in the past 2 years now? It is the perfect place for our Vietnamese comfort food!

My mom, who is Vietnamese, would make the family a dish she basically called "PORK & EGG!" Well, we didn't believe our eyes when we saw it on their menu, Thit Heo Kho. They put their spin on it, but we still fell in love with it. If that's not your thing, something like their amazing Garlic Noodles will do the trick for ya! You could ask them to stir fry it with anything really, veggies, chicken, you name it! Perfection!

I cannot say enough praise for their menu! They have so much that we love! And one thing that we love about District One is that it brings Hawaii to us! Yay! Oxtail Loco Moco! No description needed. Winnahz! Next on the oxtail bandwagon, Oxtail Fried Rice, Oxtail Fries, and of course, their Oxtail Pho! So go on and get yours! Must try! ALL! And while you're at it, and speaking of pho again...LOBSTER PHO! Whatttttthaaaapho??? This dish is an absolute memorable dish! A chef has done his job when a patron says his dish is "memorable!" That's their lobster pho! Last, but certainly not least, we had their Big Bone Soup! Massive! Inexplicably, massive! We were at odds trying to figure out how to dig into this dish! Thankfully, our "looks like from Hawaii, but not from Hawaii" server offered to carve it up table-side for us. The marrow. The soup. TO DIE FOR!

Oh, and yes, we mustn't forget the bar. Their cocktails (coconut mojito served in a coconut...mmm!) and beer selections are awesome! And there are TVs everywhere you sit so that you can never miss a game!

THANK YOU, KHAI & DISTRICT ONE! Your place rocks! And it's "traditional Vietnamese mother - approved!"

Sriracha Bloody Mary to start off the weekend was a great idea...!!!! you dont taste too much of the sriracha but there is a kick to the drink..one of the better viet-american fusion places i've been to..i was pretty bummed out that they ran out of the bone marrow soup..

our table shared some razor clams that were really good...I got the short rib rice which was basically like chopped up kalbi and rice and egg...you can tell that they tried to keep things authentic w/ a bit of fusion flair so i give them credit for that.

+ its a full bar.

Came here for happy hour with my girls. Waited for almost an hour for our food. We thought they were busy, so we waited patiently, but when we saw the table next to ours came in way after us already received their food, we asked our waiter and ended up they never put our order into the system. 

Instead of letting us cancelling the order, they just went ahead and put in the order and told us the food was already in the making. 
So we had to take it to go. 

They were trying to make it up for us by giving us one of the dishes for free, guess what, instead of the happy hour price, they charged us full price, because by the time they put in the order into the system( an hour later) it was already 7:06pm(happy hour 4-7)
So we ended up paying more.... 

I'm glad it happened to me thought, because I'm a hospitality business owner, can't imagine if I recommend my guests to come here and experience the same shitty treatment. 

Food was okay, and by okay, I mean average American Asian style, very greasy.

Went to try the lobster pho and oxtail pho. Both were a complete disappointment. Broth is super plain and bland. I world NOT recommend going there for the pho especially for the price. Not worth it.... Small hole in the wall joints are better!

Pleasantly surprised! It was my first time venturing off the strip for some Asian food, and boy do I wish I did this earlier! I heard great things about District One from my roommate who recommended their pho and carpaccio. I didn't know about carpaccio at a non-Italian restaurant, so we passed on that, but we got a side of egg rolls and shared a ox bone soup with a side of extra noodles. A pho + side of noodles is plenty enough food for two! My only disappointment was that I expected the soup broth to be milkier since it was "ox bone" soup (I'm familiar with this type of soup being boiled for hoursssss), but it just felt like regular pho soup with boiled ox bone meat put into the soup. The meat wasn't melting off the bone like I expected it to, but still a great serving of pho nonetheless. Will definitely come back when visiting Vegas along with all the other great eats in Chinatown!

I'm from SJ, California and I have had my fair share of Vietnamese food. This place puts a twist on the original style of Viet food, but I can say that they done it well. It's modernized for the American and young crowd, but you can still taste the original cooking style within the sauce and broth. It might be on the pricey side but it was definitely worth the experience.

I had the Steak and Eggs which is basically Bò lúc lc and I gotta say it was great. The steak was tender, juicy and had that similar taste of A1 sauce while the fried rice complimented the beef really well. It balanced out the rich taste of the sauce. The portion size was comparable to the price.

If you're in Vegas and don't mind taking a 10 minute ride off the strip, I would recommend coming here.

For a place that charges $50 for lobster pho, they have the worst services ever. I decided to give them a try due to all the hype but I was so disappointed. The broth was okay, there wasn't a lot of noodles. Our waiter only took our order and didn't check on us at all. I didn't receive my bean sprouts or herbs until my friends received their pho. They ordered regular pho and theirs took about forty minutes to
come out. We asked for several condiments during our meal and didn't receive it until asked for it again. Same thing happen with our check, we had to ask for it three times. If you're charging $50 for pho, please have better customer service.

Great Chilled atmosphere with a nice Happy Hour Menu Mon-Friday 5pm-7pm and Sunday's 12am-2am. I highly recommend the  small plate items included in this review. They also offer a Green Papaya Salad, which was simply amazing, love the inclusion of pork. Juliet the waitperson was very nice and made everything a pleasure.

This spot is located in Vegas' very own China Town (yes- Vegas also has a China Town). The place has a modern, industrial feel but smells like your Vietnamese grandma's kitchen. We sat at a booth, but there are tables and a bar to sit at during the wee hours of the night. We showed up here after dinner for some cocktails, yet we ended up eating a second dinner. Cocktails are awesome here-i got the juniper and spice, which has thai basil, gin and chili peppers. Fresh spring rolls came out and they are my favorite- there was something different about them though. They are fresh on the outside with the rice paper wrapped fresh raw veggies and herbs, dunked in peanut sauce, but they also feature a crispy center of fried wonton crunchiness. King crab is served broken into easy chunks with spicy aioli on top- so good. Min Ahi tuna sashimi tacos were also ordered and shared- now these were good! I cannot wait to come back for pho and rice and the crispy bird nest- sounds amazing. Definitely arrive hungry!

This place is unbelievable amazing! Very friendly staff with good customer service. The food was excellent. The oxtail fried rice, fresh oysters, garlic wings, steak & egg over rice, and the Vietnamese beef carpaccio were scrumptious!
I got a fresh coconut drink, garlic noddles and coconut ice which was really good. All the workers were really nice. I will definitely come back!!

I cant get enough of the belly buns!! Steamed or fried!! Also the Pho, any kind, is amazing! Also tried the Mi Wonton soup and the flavor is fantastic!! If your looking for something light, the beef carpaccio is the best!! Everything we've ever tried has been really good. I would recommend this to anyone and we will be back!
Flavor of the pho broth is by far the best I've ever had. Waitresses are really nice too.

After seeing this place all over social media, I finally got to try it out myself with a couple of my friends on a Thursday night. 

Omg where do I start.... the food was so delicious. My personal favorite was the oxtail fried rice & oxtail fries. It was so tasty and yummy. Every bite was delicious. I was so full from dinner I didn't get to try any deserts :(

I really like the vibe in here. It's a great place for a first date, family dinner or just to come and have a drink at the bar. 

The prices are very reasonable and customer services was great.  

Tips: 
*Parking is tough on the weekends because this shopping center is full of great stores. 
*Pretty chilly in here so bring a light sweater.

I eat everything because everything is good. 
Make belly go yum yum,
in tum tum,
Because I am not a bum.

Its modern asian fusion with a american bar appeal. Its like walking into yardhouse but with a modern asian menu.  Staff is friendly and place isnt dirty or dungy looking. Its bright and lots of tvs and comfortable seating. Did i mention all the paper towels u will ever need? They have oxtail pho, oxtail fries, and havent ordered anything i didnt like. Plus they have a good drink and beer menu that goes well with food and well thought out. A big plus is their desserts..not the mango, strawberry mochi ice cream deal
Got there just in time for happy hour and ordered the oysters which was served with lemon and a spicy cocktail sauce. Had the oxtail fried rice as well that was amazing!! Definitely will be back!

Family recommended this place. They where excited about the oxtail pho and kept telling us we should try it! So husband, brother in law and wife popped in for lunch and it was not a disappointment. 

We ordered the oxtail fries, lemon grass beef, fried whole fish, the big bone soup, spicy hue noodle soup, pho oxtail, and garlic noodles. It was a table full and it all looked and was very delicious.

The oxtail fries came out crispy, smothered in shredded oxtail 'gravy' and of coarse the fried egg, the fries stayed crispy for the most part and the meat/gravy was well saturated with pieces of meat, soft and tender. 

Lemon grass beef came out as little bundles of meat wrapped  with betel leaves. This dish was just blah, cannot say much about it. 

The fried whole fish was a beautiful dish, the fish was rather large and had a good deal of meat, two at the table really enjoyed picking the bones clean, even feasting on the fish eyes. 

The spicy hue noodle soup had just enough spice to make my lips numb but wasn't too overwhelming. And the big bone soup had the biggest pieces. 

The garlic noodles where also a big hit for the entire table. All in all the food was great, service was excellent. Good place for a great meal especially with a large group!

Always wanted to try it because people say it's good so we went to check to see if the hype was real. If Yelp allowed .5 star reviews this would be 3.5/5. All the things we ordered were off the menu specials minus The Big Bone Soup but this is what we ordered:

Lobster Fried Rice - Huge chunks of lobster with claws and shell as decorative display. Flavor was ok and not the best fried rice or lobster I had especially for the price but the the presentation was done well.

The Big Bone Soup - Shit looks like something a caveman would eat. Not the most flavorful and some may find this shit intimidating with this pre-historic looking ass dish. We kept the bones for the lil homies back home. 

Loco Moco - Yah we ordered this, so fuckin what hahaha. It was okay and not the best loco moco we have had. We honestly wasn't expecting much. 

Overall this place is really cool and the vibe is chill. The one issue I have is the smell of this place. I don't know if it's because of the cooking but the smell fuckin hits you like Ranch 99. We will probably come back and actually try the items that they are known for.
The oxtail pho and the oxtail fries are my favorite here. Their service was also probably one of the best I've received at any restaurant like this. Would go back every time I am in Vegas :)

Well what can I say. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I come here a lot. It just has everything in one place. It's far enough from the sometimes overwhelming buzz of the strip, but has a full bar in case you still want to catch a buzz of your own. They have friendly servers, dope atmosphere and cool decor but what really does it is the food. Man I can eat here every day. 

They have traditional vietnamese dishes, like pho and BBH. All pretty good, and being that I come from living in LA and OC the land of vietnamese food I can say it's comparable to some of the better spots out there. As far as Vegas goes it's one of my favorite spots for pho. The quality of the meat in particular when you order it raw is better than most out here. And the oxtail pho, man. Oxtail everything is good and they have good oxtail. But what really kills the game is their specials. Where else can you get lobster pho? Nowhere. At least not till they brought it. They always have fresh seafood specials like oysters, crab, and crawfish. I've eaten basically everything. I could keep going on and on but better to let you try it for yourself. Here's a few recommendations tho. 
Lobster garlic noodle. Their version of it is so bomb. 
Black pepper lobster. I'm a fan of black pepper already but with lobster?????
Beef carpaccio. My go to appetizer. 
Oxtail fries. Because damn. Oxtail. And fries, but if you don't feel like french fries then try my all time favorite dish here...
OXTAIL LOCO MOCO. 
Add an extra egg, just because you got it like that.  I get that every time and then I get another main dish too because I'm fat. But happy.

To start with.  The spring Rolls are pre made.  That's why I'm giving them 3 stars.  They should be made to order.  The menu is very good and all the dishes are fresh, hot and taste good.  Presentation is good, service was above average.  The Happy Hour oysters are a great deal.

Had the best lobster pho ever! This place is pretty amazing. It's a bit off the strip but totally worth it. I love that this was so unique. The ox tail broth was also very good. It is not ur typical pho ladies and gentleman. You will really like this place!

I hate being the outlier but I don't get why this place has 4 stars. 

The pho broth was bland, the fried rice and rice clay pot were sodium packed (had to eat them with a side bowl of white rice to balance out the sodium so we don't shrivel up like raisins at the end). The saving grace was the escargot appetizer.

Maybe they are known for their "Nhau" items that you eat with beer with fun company.

Asian Fusion with Vietnamese pho!! They serve very good pho with full bar!  Very lively atmosphere.  We went there on a Friday night.  It's a happening place.  They have many screens around the restaurant I'm sure we can request to watch any sport if we choose to.  Besides good pho there were many items that we shall try next visit.  We did order oxtail pho, mixed fried rice, raw oysters and other items with a glass of wine.  Pandan crème brûlée for dessert. Loved everything about this place.  Check out their hand sink too.  You don't need to go inside the restroom to wash your hands .
Food and service was awesome.   I had the salmon with potato hash which was one of the specials for the day.  Best salmon dish I ever had. The aioli sauce was delicious.

The first time (and second) my husband and I ate here, the food was amazing and we couldn't stop thinking about it. We honestly kept joking around that we would drive out to vegas just to eat here. But the last few times we've come in, it feels like the quality has gone down. I'll start off by saying that out of the last 3 times we came in (once in June, July and August) they were always out of the bone marrow soup. The beef carpaccio (which was our FAVORITE dish...I had dreams about this dish), was just ok. It didn't seem to have the same amount of flavor it had the first two times we came. The pork belly buns always came out with dry pork and one of the days we had lunch, my husband ordered a fresh coconut and was given one that had absolutely NO coconut meat inside! He waved down a server and asked them if they reused the shells, and she said absolutely not and promptly gave him a new coconut....and lo and behold, this one actually had coconut meat. Maybe it was just a coincidence...but he hasn't ordered coconut juice here since.

Been here many times before and haven't been here in awhile...and man did they raise the menu prices and lower the service quality. The many previous times I've been here I was happy with both the food and service. But now at my most recent visit I was disappointed. The wait for our server to acknowledge us was longer than our wait for food. I had to let the hostess know we were ready to order and no one even came by to get our drink order. Got the big bone soup and it was $18 compared to the $10 it was before, same serving size and taste. Also got the oxtail fried rice for $15!!!! Nothing special worth $15. Too little meat, too many raw onions, and found a whole bulb of garlic in it. Most likely will not be coming back.

Oxtail pho!! And chicken wings! Sooooooo delicious!! I couldn't stop eating! I even took a oxtail fried rice to go! 

Will be back for sure!

This place has easily won as my favorite restaurant in Vegas!! Ambiance is great, servers are great, and the food is AMAZING. I got the lobster pho, which had an entire lobster in it and the broth was unique but in a great way. It was $45 dollars, but totally worth it to try once.. though I'm not sure I would get it again, just because of the price. My boyfriend got the oxtail fried rice, which was very reasonably priced and also amazing. I will come back here every time I'm in Vegas, I need to try ALL of the other dishes on the menu and all the drinks look delish!

The fried calamari turned me down by over half of the plate were jalapeno and that cost me $10.99

service was not so good.

I heard good things about this place! 

I loved how this place looked. It was def. my first time seeing an Americanized Vietnamese restaurant! They did a great job with the decor and our server helped us with all of our questions about the menu. They had crazy food mixtures I've never heard before such as lobster pho, oxtail fries, etc. 

My best friend and I ordered the pork belly, house special oysters and the oxtail fries! All was delicious!!!

Delicious pork belly bun: fatty, juicy, and steamed bun with delicious sweet peanuts. Perfect execution of this Taiwanese snack. 

The spring rolls were also surprisingly fresh. They put mint leaves in there, but it wasn't overbearing. Just gave it a nice refreshing kick. Also they fried a piece of egg roll or wonton skin and rolled it up in the spring roll, so it also gave it a nice crunch. Loved this! 

The fish tacos were a miss. Yellowtail sashimi with guacamole, tomatoes. I generally like the taste of sashimi and don't need it doled up with a lot of flavors. But even the flavors they added just covered up whatever flavor the fish had, and the whole thing was just lacking in flavor. Maybe put more like lime in it, or sweet pickled onions. 

Pho was good - flavorful broth, good amoun of beef, and noodles cooked well. 

Viet iced coffee - delicious!!! 

The service was friendly, and prompt. I loved the decor of the restaurant too - kind of like a hip bar, where you can watch sports (lots of tvs), and beer and alcoholic beverages. 

My only complaint is that I wish they included more Asian drinks like boba, or viet desserts with the coconut milk and grass jelly.

We love this place! Happy hour twice a day and it's open late night! We always sit at the bar because we love the bartenders! Marcus and Tomas are awesome! Ask Tomas for his famous lemongrass Siracha shot (sounds weird but they're soooo good). Oysters are $1 each during happy hour too.. Great beer selection and amazing service!

Oxtail pho by itself gets 5 stars!  This is way better than the one at the California and they give you large pieces of oxtail with fall off the bone meat.  The broth is insanely good, especially on the cold winter days in Vegas.  We also tried the big bone marrow soup...that definitely has the wow factor for size, but if you are looking for a healthy portion of meat to noodle to soup ratio...go with the oxtail pho.  Trust me, you will not be disappointed!

There's been a few moments in life where I thought "wow that was life changing"

One of them was when I got stuck in the currents and couldn't swim out while scuba diving 30m deep in the ocean. 

Two was the free falling moment from skydiving over the island of Oahu. 

Three was discovering the loster phõ and oxtail fried rice from district One in Vegas. 

One of my favourite to go to food is phõ so naturally it's in the basket. I also like seafood so when I saw a whole lobster in my bowl of phõ it was a happy moment for me. 

The presentation was amazing but moving past that the flavor of the broth was superb . It was rich, aromatic and the noodle was perfectly cooked to my liking. 

Oxtail was something I'm familiar with however not cooked in the fried rice format. I thought it would be bland and just like regular fried rice. I was utterly wrong. The dish was perfect. The rice wasn't too dry or moist, the portion of oxtail was very generous. 

This spot is a must if you like Vietnamese cuisine or fusion cuisine. It's also a good hangover food spot seeing how it's open til 2am. Saving you from those sad chip bags from 7/11. Pretty considerate if you ask me .

I've been wanting to try this place for ages but never got around to it since there are so many great food options in Vegas. Finally came on 6/16/17 and ordered as much as I could since I came with a couple friends. 

Let me first start off by saying that the Oxtail Pho actually tasted pretty good at first..... until later that night... 

I got FOOD POISONING FROM HERE AND IT WAS ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. IT LASTED FOR NEARLY 4 DAYS!!!!!!!!!!!!

District One was the only thing I ate that day, and honestly, I didn't know what happened to me. But starting at 8:00pm on Friday, 6/16, I started to feel very, very sluggish. I was playing in a poker tournament and I just could not keep my head up in the game. I was very light-headed and had to put my head down many times. Little did I know that it was the beginning to a disaster. I busted from the tournament that I no longer cared for and went straight to my room.

The next day, I start getting cold chills, body aches, high fever, and many trips to the bathroom that was just complete diarrhea every time, and it was awful. I lost my appetite, I was weak, and I didn't know what was going on. It wasn't until I texted my friend who came with me to District One, that he was experiencing the SAME THING. Fortunately for him, his only lasted 2 days. Said he took Pepto Bismol and sat on the toilet for 2 hours. I, took everything imaginably possible because I was getting desperate. I took Pepto, charcoal pills, ibuprofen, tylenol, many over priced juices, gatorade, drinking plenty of water, and NOTHING was working. My friend probably spent nearly $100 on all the items he had to get for me.

3rd day, Sunday 6/18, I felt like I was dying. Thankfully my friend stayed with me in the hotel at the Venetian on Saturday night to make sure I was okay, but this day was the WORST. My friend went to go have lunch with his other friend while I stayed in the room all day. Of course I woke up early at 8am to take my ritual diarrhea (this was about my 10th trip to the bathroom in the past 3 days) The minutes seemed to last forever, and when I looked at my watch to notice it was only 11am after what felt like hours on end, I didn't know what to do. My body aches and body chills were getting WORSE. My fever in my head just kept getting higher and higher, to the point where I thought my head was going to explode. My bed was soaked because of the cold sweat I had all night. I was too weak to open up the cap for the Tylenol that I bought, so I was stuck. I told my friend to cut his lunch early to take me to the ER. We had to call numerous places since there was such limited availability on a Sunday but we finally found a spot 20 mins away. We went there and thankfully my gf is a doctor and I told her my symptoms and asked her if it was a good idea, since I was about to walk in. I didn't feel like spending an additional $1200+ for the emergency room fee so she just told me to just go through it and not check in to the ER. I was also feeling a little better getting to move around and go outside so that helped as well. 

4th Day, Monday 6/19, I start to feel much better and my poop starts solidifying (sorry for all the gruesome details but it was really that bad). I finally had my first real meal at dinner and by Tuesday, 6/20, I was better. 

District One, you wasted 4 days of my Vegas trip because of your Oxtail Pho. 4 of us ordered Oxtail Pho, and the first two bowls you gave out to my other two friends were fine. The next batch of bowls that came out that came to my friend and me was the really bad batch. We both got food poisoning but thankfully his only lasted 1.5-2 days while mine lasted nearly 4 days. You also made me spend ridiculous amounts of money on over-the-counter items and supplies and I couldn't even focus in the poker tournament that I spent $1500 to enter that I was looking forward to the most the entire year. Thank you for ruining part of my Vegas Trip. This was probably my most expensive lunch I've ever had.

Also, I felt really, really bad for the other people who had the bad batch of Oxtail Pho that day. It was the first day of EDC weekend and I can't imagine what they were going through in the middle of the dessert after getting food poisoning as well. They probably thought it was the heat and the music or drugs getting to them, when really, it was the lunch they ate earlier that day.

The server is very friendly, but the food is very bad...the crawfish that we ordered was small and spoiled, which was obviously not fresh...even the corn tasted funny...we also ordered pho and Mekong noodle. The broth was tasteless, and bland. Plus the noodle was soggy and broken...the decoration are great, but the food is very bad...we will not come back to this restaurant!

Went here last night for birthday dinner with friends & it was amazing! Super great & friendly service, nice atmosphere & delicious food. We ordered a variety of appetizers & pho soups & it was all delicious. Nicely flavored & seasoned dishes & plates. Will return all the time & bring more friends to check it out!
Love the unique menu! Ordered the lobster pho, oxtail pho and big bone pho. Go for happy hour!

They told me I couldn't order to go via phone because it's a busy week. The employee suggested I come in, order, and wait for the food to come out. How is having another body filling a packed restaurant better for them than just taking my order over the phone? Not a good way to retain customers.

The first time I was here, I ordered the belly buns, house special oysters, and of course, their famous oxtail fried rice. Everything was spot-on amayyyzing, and the fried rice was definitely one of the best I have ever had. The service was especially great as we the waiters were always ready to come whenever we group needed more water, wanted more food in the menu, or needed the bill. Very professional.

However the second time, not so much. We came during the night this time, so I do admit that it was fairly busy. When we were seated it took quite a while for a waiter to come and receive our order, and after that, it took 22 minutes before we were served our water (yes I counted). We were already dying of hunger, and then they could not quench us of our thirst!! I believe that every restaurant should not make this costly mistake of forgetting to serve the customer water. I had to remind the staff that they forgot it.

On the bright side, the oxtail fried rice was still awesome as ever, but for the blunder made earlier, I am only giving this place 4 stars.

Must try the razor clam with sauté green onion & peanut
Must try the oxtails pho with extra side of meat balls or raw beef in hot broth.
i took a star back because the lemongrass clam was so salty and over cooked!!!
Service was very attentive and friendly, i had told many friends to come here for the Razor clams. Don't bring your kids here though, the crowd is kinda punk ist with attitude, can be intimidating, but good food, i will over looked that

I had the fried pork belly buns and was a little disapointed. I felt like it was missing a little flavor to it. Can't quite put my finger on it. 
On the bright side, the environment is nice. Hipsterish decor. The rest of the food was good, not great but good. They have a pretty large menu, I'm willing to come back and try this place out again next time I am back in town.

Ordered their oxtail fried rice... It was FULL of oil and msg for 16 bux... FYI... Ur not suppose to see spoonful of oil with REAL fried rice in Asian countries... Literally felt my blood vessels are clotted after this... Waste of money!!!

Consider me a big fan!  

I was perusing potential spots for dinner last night and then I saw My T's picture of the 5 spice game hen and it..waS...ON.  They bake the game hen and THEN deep fry it!  Why don't more spots bake and then fry things?  It tasted even better than it looked.  The side of tomato rice was really good too.  I almost never rave about eating bird but I will be having this again.   

Another favorite was their shaken beef salad.  I was shaken up after my first freakin bite!  The beef was so juicy and so tender and only $12!  The hot grilled beef mixed with the cool lettuce, onion, tomato and spices made for one of the best salads I've had in recent memory. 

The Mekong River noodle soup was just ok.  It looked great and was filled with lots of fixings like fish balls, pork tenderloin, quail eggs, veggies and shrimp but the pork based broth fell short for me.  I saw a lot of customers going for the bone marrow soup and holy shit what a spectacle that was.  HUGE bones!  Me would feel like caveman and raise bone like champion (grunt!).  Check out the pics of it.  

But man oh man so much other stuff I want to try like the slow braised pork belly entree, crispy bird nest noodle and more shaken beef!  They're located in the old Cravin Cajun spot so it's great for groups.  I hope they get their liquor license soon.

How the hell is this place only four stars?  This is proof that some reviewer/humans have absolutely zero neuro capacity to make a sound judgement.  I have liquid dreams about this place.  I drive up from San Diego, 300+ miles to experience authentic Vietnamese on steroids.  District One, thank you for bringing true happiness into my life.
Food is good and quality of ingredients are great. Service is not good. Basically removed two stars because of the poor service

Where do I even begin? First off, I went in to order something to-go ... thought to my self why don't I get a drink while I look over the menu ? I was greeted so kindly! When I got to the bar I was greeted once again so amazingly kind by Jair the bartender. He made me hands down the best Old Fashioned cocktail.  He also helped me choose a few items off the menu, and everything was definitely super delicious! Highly recommend the tacos  can't wait to go back!

My son is vegetarian and this place had great pho. Wasn't thrilled about the egg rolls but that's just me, too meaty.  Everything else was excellent, including the service.  Our waiter was helpful and full of positive energy.

It was my boyfriend and I's first time here and we will definitely be coming back for more! Great atmosphere and fast service. We were given our food within 10 minutes of ordering! We heard about the popular oxtail fried rice and the rib eye pho which were both spectacular so I highly recommend you to try one of those. We also got the coconut ice cream for dessert and it was such a cute display! Delicious coconut ice cream sprinkled with roasted peanuts and inside a coconut shell, yum!!! It wasn't too sweet either, it was more of a refreshing taste after all the food we had haha

Definitely will be coming back to try the lobster pho that everyone is raving about :)

One of the places on my list that I wanted to try. Glad was able to do so. Place wasn't packed at around 11am. The host and servers were nice. The food was great. We got half a dozen house special oysters, belly bun, yellowtail tacos and lobster pho. Oysters were yum. Need to go back during happy hour. The belly buns were also good the pork was very tender. The yellowtail Tacos tastes better with lime and sriracha so better add some. The lobster pho was heaven. The broth was great and the lobster was succulent. If I lived in the area I'd probably visit often.

Sometimes fate has a way of getting you where you need to be.  After aimlessly driving in the rain to find out my destination was closed, I found myself checking nearby restaurants on, you guessed it, the Yelp app when District One popped up.  Long bookmarked but not previously sampled I pulled a u turn and made a very good food decision.  

First off, I have never felt so welcome in a restaurant.  First the hostess greated me and proceeded to ask how I was doing before explaining the concept of Asian Fusion.  She escorted me to the bar where I had a personal flat screen and she told me to ask if I wanted to change channels.  The bartender Adrian (sp?) was also amazing.  She took time taking my order, was way more knowledgeable about the menu than most bartenders need to be and was happy to explain the options.  She recommended the oxtail fried rice and the fish taco appetizer.  She even discouraged me from ordering additional food items as the rice was a large portion instead of letting me waste my money. I was also impressed that she asked about food allergies.

The fish tacos arrived three small wonton tacos with what can only be described as a light and crisp cerviche.  The flavor was amazing and it was the perfect appetizer as it was not too filling but really pleased the taste buds.

The oxtail fried rice came with a fried egg on top.  At Adrian's recommendation I got mine runny which really helped the flavor spread through the rice.  The rice itself had a large portion of oxtail mixed in and a great mix of flavors.  

I wanted to lick my plate clean when finished the flavors were so good.  However, she was right and I was full, so glad I didn't order any other dishes.

I highly recommend this place.  For those of us who budget, the rice was $12.99, and the entire meal, with a beer came to $30.00.

Our party tried three appetizers and three entrees. We started with the Vietnamese Eggrolls, Fish Tacos, and Pork Belly Buns. These were all great tasting and beautifully prepared. The eggrolls were made with taro which gave it a unique taste. The fish tacos were our favorite. Although on the pricier side (approx. $10 for three baby tacos), the fish was fresh and tasted awesome with all its taco components. Pork belly was tender. Highly recommend.

Entrees were Mi Sate, Oxtail Pho, and Steak & Eggs.

Mi Sate was OK. We all agreed it was our least favorite dish. Very super thick, peanut flavored sauce-like broth with skinny egg noodles. There is a small spicy kick, but I couldn't get over the peanut butter thickness. Maybe it just had a bad night?

The real hero of the night was the Oxtail Pho. Leave it to District One to bring this one all the way home. Very aromatic, tender (and plentiful servings of) oxtail, a truly original tasting broth. Steak & Eggs was a good decision too. Steak was tender and expertly cooked, tomato rice was flavorful, overall good decision for anyone. 

Impeccable guest service. We were diligently waited on by an attentive team and the food came out in a timely manner.

Overall good food, good ambiance. I will return with friends. Next time I'd really like to try their crawfish, lobster pho, 5 spice roasted hen, clay pot pork belly, and ca phe sua da! Awesome first impression! See you again, District one!

So here I am, at the soft opening of this new restaurant in town called District One. I'm here with 6 friends, so I didn't actually order ALL this food. 

Decor: Love this Asian fusion restaurant. The decor is so cute. Especialy love the wallpaper and the "let's nhau" quote (vietnamese for let's party/drink) in the corner of the room. There's also a huge bar that greets you and FOURTEEN flat screen tv's all over the place. It's totally set up for some good eating, drinking, and sport gatherings.

The CAFE SUA DA (Vietnamese iced coffee) was perfect. I am a coffee lover, and I'm extra critical. But they nailed the coffee here. Strong and sweet.

Appetizers: the GARLIC AND SERRANO PEPPER WINGS are good. Comes out hot, crispy, and moist on the inside. The serrano pepper definitely gives it a kick. And the side of pickled radish adds a nice touch too. The SHAKEN BEEF SALAD comes out on a huge bed of lettuce and tomatoes. The beef is sweet, salty, and savory at the same time. The beef could be more tender, but flavor wise, it was exellent. We also asked for a side of lemon, salt and pepper to dip the meat which really enhanced everything.

Entree: the STEAK AND EGG is where some of the asian fusion comes out. It's not the traditional t-bone steak you might expect. It's actually more like the shaken beef appetizer.  But the flavor is more sweet. This beef actually is more tender though. And the fried egg, which was over easy, was actually over easy!! *clap clap. The SLOW BRAISED PORK BELLY IN YOUNG COCONUT JUICE was a little on the smaller side for an entree. Also, the flavor was not as intense as I would have anticipated. It needed more bang, more salt. The OX TAIL PHO came with two big pieces of tender ox tail. It was so tasty and actually fell off the bone. Curiously, the pho tasted like Pho So 1. Which is also a restaurant in chinatown that does very well for itself.

Overall, this place has the potential to be great. I can imagine coming here to watch the game and grabbing a few drinks after work. The staff is young and friendly. And occasionally, the chef comes out to see how everyone is doing. That's so cool. It definitely feels like a family friendly environment. The waiters and waitresses come around and they always ask if everything is okay, and ready for refills. 

Decor/Ambience: *****
Food: ****1/2 
Service: *****
Drinks/Bar: TBD
Overall: *****

Had some really good food at this asian fusion (heavy on the Vietnamese) gastropub of sorts on Jones Blvd.   Some Vegas locals took me here for a late lunch and I was pleasantly surprised how good the food was. I had heard good things about District One so it was great to finally go there the last time I was in town.

We started off with the oxtail fries ($11.99) which we topped with an over easy egg. The fries were crunchy, the oxtail was tender and delicious in its own gravy. I really liked this dish and recommend that you get it. It was really good. Next we had the beef carpaccio ($12.99). It was excellent. My favorite version of beef carpaccio so far. It was perfectly thin ribeye with sesame and citrus flavors. It was just so very good. Ordering this next time for sure. Next were the pork belly buns (3 for $7.99). They were good with the peanut sauce and the braised pork belly was soft and tender. I could have done without the cilantro but that was just standard on the order. Good dish. We also had the oxtail fried rice ($12.99). SO GOOD. So flavorful... You have to order it. Shredded oxtail with all kinds of delicious seasoning with another over easy egg as a topping. Only thing I would change on this dish is add more oxtail for sure. The pics I took doesnt show too much oxtail in it and it could have used some more. Lastly we had the beef and lemongrass wrapped in betel leaves ($7.99). This was my least favorite of all the dishes we had. The lemongrass flavor was too strong IMO. The beef was tender and there were other seasoning flavors I couldnt make out. I would pass on that next time. 

Service was very good. Jeff was excellent. Very personable guy and we appreciated his attentiveness to our party. Kudos to him... Cant wait to eat at District One the next time I'm in town. Heard that whole fried fish dish is the one!

Parking in a shared big lot. Some are 30 min spaces only.

I was sad to learn that Cravin' Cajun had shut down and vowed to boycott District One right off the bat, like a pouty child actin a fool in my high chair.  Yet, after checking out the reviews and pictures on Yelp, I couldn't resist but to see what all the hubbub was about.  

The dining set up is generally the same with minor accented tweaks here and there.  I was lured to this place initially because it didn't look like they took their "V" grade, turned it upside down and drew a line threw it for a fictitious "A" grade, unlike other Louisiana style seafood dumps.  Problem is, "the mob is fickled," and sad to say people sometimes are quick to jump on the bandwagon.  But enough about the old joint, it is obvious the new owners wanted to create their own niche.

Nevertheless, the hip doctor undoubtedly paid a visit to this place and modernized it with an industrial/urbanish twist with the decor, ambiance and music genre playlist.  Even much of the old staff is still here, although, I bird told me that the new owners include those from Pho Kim Long amongst other unknown benefactors.

I was hungry and was recommended to try the Mi Sate, as it looked quite filling considering that it is primarily peanut butter based.  It was sort of like Mi Quang, Kare Kare and sate stew had menage, producing a love child of savory goodness.  I added the grape leaf wrapped beef appetizers to switch things up as well.

I gotta say, the dishes are unique, bold and a nice eccentric version on Vietnamese cuisine that is practically absent through the entire city and I only hope for their success.  

Best of all, Vy, who looks to be one of the head honcho-ess (?), gave word that they will be offering Nikka, Hibiki and Yamazaki Japanese whiskey along with other unique refreshments.  It is now a must that I come back with like minds.

I have never seen this place slow at all !! Why?? Because it is that good!! So be prepared for long wait times. 

Located somewhat centrally towards the west side of town, this place has a limited amount of parking.. only because there are a lot of other great establishments around the area.

Right away walking into this place... it's loud! This place is a bar/restaurant after all.. With many people eating and drinking and music playing.. this place is not your quiet spot to dine... 

Booth style seating that can fit from 4 people to 8 comfortably.. and many tables in the center. 

I came here for the Lobster Pho.. and this Lobster Pho was not something to mess with.. Market Price.. i paid around $60 for mine... i think it could've been a little cheaper given the size of the lobster. Nonetheless it was really great. Service was great and no complains about the atmosphere and vibe of the place. 

Other than that, i can see myself coming back and trying other things on the menu!

Enjoy!

My experience at district one was fantastic. 

First, the food is delicious. Not your typical pho spot. Has a few creative dishes. You must try the fish tacos and oxtail fries. 

Second, decor and ambiance has a feel good feeling. The music and employees makes it a really fun atmosphere. 

Third, most people wouldn't notice but they have one of the most impressive drink lists I've seen especially coming from a pho spot. I mean every single single malt Japanese whiskey you can think of and if you're lucky enough to meet "momma" she might have a shot of fernette with you to cure your hangover. 

I can't wait to come back to this place.

I was visiting from San Diego and my friend from Vegas recommended this spot. It has a very modern/hip ambiance, which pairs well with the booming Vegas lifestyle. 

My favorite appetizer was the beef carpaccio. I never thought I would enjoy rare beef because I'm a well-done (don't hate me) type of person, but this dish melts in your mouth leaving you wanting to for more. 

Pho Tai Bo Vien is my go-to order at any pho restaurant. Paying a total of ~$12 for a bowl compared to $6 from SD is just not what I'm used to. It was $3 extra for tai (rare steak). But granted they do give you a TON of meat. The rare steak is cut thicker than most traditional pho places that clumps into balls when left in the soup broth for too long. I'd recommend getting the steak on the side. 

Staff was pretty nice! They were quick with filling our waters and picking up the finished plates.

I made reservations through Yelp and luckily I was able to reserve for 10 people right away last minute. They were close to being on time too. Parking can be tricky and we were there on a Saturday night around 8pm. We ordered a lot. We ordered the snails, oxtail fries, their infamous lobster pho, oxtail pho, oysters and this thin slice meat appetizer. OMG!!!! Everything was so good. Each dish didn't need anything extra to my opinion. It wasn't oily, greasy and didn't make you feel heavy even after all that food. I couldn't stop eating! We saw the bone marrow pho and that can feed at least 3-4 people! It was huge!!!! I'm so coming back here! Customer service was great. It was my cousins bday and and they brought out a coconut ice cream dessert and that was really good too! Highly recommended to anyone coming to Vegas. So worth the wait! See you soon District One!!!!!

This is the only place I know where you can get lobster pho. And it is delicious and large. It's worth the $30

The oxtail loco moco- my husband wanted me to put that it was superb.  

Customer service was a 5 star. 

my 2 daughters shared a pho. They ate it all in about 5 min. So our lovely waitress asked if we would like to order extra noodles. We said yes. It only came out to an additional 1.50!! So that was awesome

Yes this place is worthy of Yelp's five star; I only visited it three times during my last vegas vacay which was also three days long.

On my first visit, my party came in to specifically try their pandan creme brûlée which we did not end up getting because it was too early in the morning for dessert and we got full off of all the other items we ordered.  We ordered the spring rolls, fish tacos, belly buns, chicken wings, and oxtail pho.  We originally had our eyes on the lobster pho, however, being that it was forth of July weekend they were out at the moment. 

The spring rolls and chicken wings were very traditional to the Vietnamese root.  However, the fish tacos and belly buns definitely have the Asian fusion flare to it.  The fish tacos came in three and was made with yellowtail (my all time favorite fish).  It was tasty and nice to look at.  The belly buns are a bit greasy, but then again it is made with pork belly.  It had a nice peanut butter taste and the buns were really good.  As for the oxtail pho, we were all surprised that it smelt and tasted great.  Sorry, but not sorry, Vegas is not known for their pho.  This one, however, had all the right flavors.

On our second visit, we went big and ordered a round of lobster pho.  It was pricey, but so very worth it.  I never had lobster pho before and now I never want to go without it.  Seriously, the food here is phenomenal.  Also, staff are super friendly and attentive.  Decor of the place is very modern, but the best part is their sinks.  I know it is crazy, however, they have sinks outside the restrooms.  It makes it so convenient when you want to wash your hands, but don't want to touch dirty bathroom doors!!

I am definitely a regular here. I get the oxtail fried rice and or the oxtail fries and they are always on point! little pricey but the quality Is worth it. I call it in and pick it up and they are quick as well.

Very limited menu, and strickly Vietnamese, but their Pho was wonderful, and service was also great.  Also very nice atmosphere.  Nicer than most Chinatown restaurants.  A bit more modern and trendy, with TV's everywhere.

We met up with some local friends here for a later dinner when we hit town.  It wasn't so busy when we walked in so we were easily able to get a table for 6.

I really hoped to like this place but I felt the food was hit or miss.  The service was average with a few instances where we were unable to find someone to help us.

But really, the food was sort of a disappointment given the price tags.  So here's the rundown:
- Snails:  The price on these were "MP".  I believe they were $14 that day.  We got a small bowl of anemic snails (6) in a lemongrass broth.  The broth was good.  The snails were not my cup o'tea.
- Black Pepper Lobster:  MP...Good flavor, waaayyyy too salty and oversauced.  The noodles underneath also became too salty. Lobster must have also been dieting.
- Shrimp Skewers: Also MP...they were just regular big shrimp. Unfortunately, these came a skosh overcooked.
- Oxtail fried rice:  Probably my favorite dish that evening, especially since they left in all the tender fat and gristle from the oxtail itself.
- Oxtail fries:  Nicely done fries, topping was also great.
- Garlic Chicken Wings:  You got the garlic but it was sorely unsalted.
- Cornish Hen - Bird itself was moist and well-seasoned; accompanying rice was meh
- Calamari - Forgettable except for the spicy sauce that came with it.
- Rib Eye Pho - Average

Cocktails were pretty tasty but nothing revolutionary or out of this world.

All in all, a decent meal but a little on the pricey side for what you get.
The happy hour specials are great . the pho is divine  But would love to see different items on the menu . Change it up a lil .

This is my 2nd time at District One and this time I brought the whole family. Get here early if you want to snag some of the more popular dishes, they had already run out of the big bone Pho and matcha green tea by 7PM.

Appetizers:
Oxtail Fries 7/10 (good but wouldn't order again)
Grilled Octopus 10/10 (aoli on point)

Drinks:
Young Coconut 10/10
Shrubs (tastes like kombucha) 10/10 but an acquired taste

Entree:
Oxtail Pho 10/10
Chicken Pho 10/10
Steak and Eggs (basically Bo Luc Lac for the Vietnamese food lovers) 10/10

The Pho broth was clean. I wasn't gulping down water from MSG like at other places. Oxtail meat was tender, falling off the bone and easy to eat. My favorite meal was the Steak and Eggs. Meat was just the right amount of crispy on the outside yet tender on the inside. The steak was marinated so well and the rice.. the rice was cooked perfectly with the right amount of flavor. Will be making this my go to Pho restaurant every time I'm in Vegas!

Came here for happy hour...stayed for the happy memories. First of all, this place has happy hour on Fridays and it ends at 7pm. This place is an Asian fusion with familiar names with a modern twist. I can't review their dinner menu since I only ate off the happy hour. Prices are fair for happy hour and service is amazing. I pretty much ordered everything on the happy hour menu and loved most of it. The chicken wings were delicious and crispy. I didn't care for the fish tacos but all my friends loved it. Oysters are fresh and decently sized. Only dish I didn't like was the beef carpaccio. Me and my friends felt it was TOO raw. I enjoyed this restaurant and I'm excited to try their dinner menu.

Amazing food! Had the chance to eat here while in town and loved every bite! The pork belly buns were amazing and the oysters were so fresh! I also tried the carpaccio, spring rolls, pho, and coconut ice cream. Honestly, the food was so delicious that if I lived nearby I'd make eating here a weekly ritual. Great thanks to the owners and staff of the establishment.

For a place that got tons of reviews and a for a Vietnamese restaurant, you would think that they would have excellent pho: a staple Vietnamese dish, especially the interesting sounding oxtail pho and and lobster pho. Unfortunately, the pho is very blan and overpriced. It was more so salty than anything, as if the salt was trying to compensate for the lack of flavor. 

The oxtail in the pho was tough and difficult to eat: oxtail meat is supposed to fall of the bone!

The standout items here isn't  what you expect it to be. The garlic noodles was delicious. If you are a fan of garlic, you would LOVE as it packs a nice garlic punch. The oxtail fries was also good: the oxtail in the fries was a decent portion and was tender and marinated in a flavorful sauce.  The oxtail fried rice, was was also good, but a little on the greasy side and not really special: it did have some bits of oxtail but other than that, not overly special.

So really, other than the appetizers, the dishes here are average,at least for its price point. You can probably get real lobster separately or solid pho elsewhere in Vegas and save yourself a few bucks.
This place is good for HH.. The oyster for $1 a piece and the .50c wings are bomb.com and they have excellent customer service!!!

We've been to this place a few times in the past, always heartily satisfied with our favorite Vietnamese dishes, but were still amazed with how they've expanded their menu  that's probably drawing this large late, Sunday night crowd. Lobster with black pepper beckons!  As always service was great.
Great drinks with creative presentation, nice vibe, and very attentive servers. Food was ok.

We came here on a recent trip to Vegas thanks to good Yelp reviews. It was worth it, we couldn't have enough of the oxtail fried rice. Food was exceptional. Desserts were also tasty. Everything is great about this place. Hipster atmosphere, great food, great service and reasonable prices.

We ordered the oxtail fries and it was heaven in my mouth! The gravy, tender oxtail and fried egg just topped it off. We also ordered the coconut pork belly. It was good but not "oh my god" good. I gave them a 4 because I didn't get to try my garlic noodles which I'm a sucker for so I was a little disappointed. Other than that, I definitely recommend this place! If you have a big group, make sure to call ahead.

The food was amazing but on my second visit, the service was EMBARRASSING. We had to eat our appetizers on our napkins because they never brought us plates or utensils. We waited forever to even be greeted after we sat down. Ill be back but maybe around a time when they are less busy. They seem to be understaffed and lacking bartenders with drink knowledge.
Vietnamese/Asian fusion. Varieties of Viet food and other Asian mixed.  Good food,  decent price

My friend and I came here around 8pm on a Thursday night. It wasn't too busy so we were seated right away. I ordered the pho tam nam and my friend ordered the oxtail pho. We both had generous portions of meat and just the right amount of noodles. The broth was very flavorful that I hardly had to doctor it up. It came with all the traditional sides. Will definitely be back again.

Uhhh i was really hungry when i went here so i thought i would end up giving this a lot of stars but i didn't like it. We had a ton of different things like some items from happy hour. The belly buns were okay. The fish tacos were alright. I liked the egg rolls bc i didnt like anything else. I didnt care for the steak and eggs nor the oxtail fried rice. I tried like 5 different things and they were all eh. I liked the atmosphere and decor tho! I gave a third star bc they let us order happy hour 2 min before it was over. And their pandan creme brulee was actually bomb!

i could not ask for a better place to come n eat  the sirvce is amazing the family friendly place i would tell u this the have the best pho in all of vegas n i love to eat pho come n try it an they have happy hour 3-7 happy hour an the have 805 beer on tap enjoy ever one
The fish tacos are tiny. The atmosphere is good and the service is good. Nothing else to say in this review.

This place is a must visit while in Vegas if you enjoy asian dishes. Think your traditional southeast Asian dishes with a twist. My favorite would have to be the oxtail fries. The fries are covered in an oxtail gravy and an egg perfectly cooked sunny side up. Cut into the yoke and let it run down all over the gravy and fries! It is a unique dish that any fry lover won't be able to stop eating. 

This place does offer a lobster pho bowl. The bowl is large and is sold at Market Price. That day it was a $35 bowl. The broth is pretty good. I'm not sure I would pay $35 again for a 2nd bowl. Hey, you're there for the first time, might as well right?

A definite must is the pandan creme brûlée. Like most Asian desserts, it is just slightly sweet and not overpowering your sweet tooth. This hit the spot. Do not skip this. 

This place was pretty busy even at 2pm on a Friday afternoon. I believe I waited about 15-20 minutes for a table for 3 people. Worth the mini wait!
Come here for the PHO. Everything g else was pretty good but the lobster phi is delicious. Service was amazing too

I've been coming here for years every time I go to Vegas. It's one of those "I gotta eat before I go back home kind of joint." This is the local/tourist trendy spot that has that good good. With all that being said...
The decor upon entering is nicely done in rustic and metal undertones. The fonts and quotes on the wall gives it a urban/chic feel. 
Now to the food. The menu is pretty creative with all of my favorite classics with a twist. Asian fusion at its finest. Such as the Ox tail Pho or Lobster pho or fried rice. I usually order the Ox tail Pho. The broth is rich and savory with a hint of sweetness kissed by my hoisin and Sriracha. 
The pork buns with is pork belly on an Asian bun never disappoints. You can get it regular or deep fried! If you're from the South like me, deep fried is a no-brainer!
They also have razor clams when it's in season! It is  paradise in your mouth! 
I can go on and on about the food...but what they do they do well. Their menu showcases everything you want in an Asian Fusion dish. A bit of influences everywhere. 
The service is attentive. The staff even recognizing me although I am not a local. It makes you feel like this place is home! 
Whenever you're in Vegas, or if you're craving some mind blowing food... stop by. You will not be disappointed. But this is strictly just my opinion. But what do I know?

I had the aptly named big bone soup. Again, aptly named--it comes with some seriously big bones with some seriously tasty meat, tendon, and marrow on those bones. The broth underneath is a solid pho base. At $19 it is reasonably priced and a dish uncommon among restaurants of the cuisine in Vegas. Definitely worth trying.

Staff was really knowledgeable of the menu and nice beyond words! We ordered pho all around ans a few appetizers.  If you're ever here, you must try thr beef stew fries.  I could probably eat that everyday and not get sick of it.  The pho really delicious and the broth had lots of flavor.  I managed to finish the whole bowl.   The ambiance of the restaursnt was really nice also.  They also have tvs for those of you into sports.  The next time I'm in vegas, I will most definately stop by again.

Apparently, the menu changes because everything i wanted to order was no longer in the menu (razor clam, shrimp like hot n juicy). That's okay, bc it gives me a chance to try the daily special.

Tai snapper $20/lb: it was the fried snapper with papaya salad. The fish was flash fried and the flesh was sweet and juicy atop with house special sauce (similar to sweet and sour sauce). 

Oxtail pho: Good job! It came with 2 generous oxtail which was well seasoned and tasty. It's amazing that the broth was not oily. The pho was hearty. 

Fish taco: it was a bit fishy this time. It was better last time...

Coconut ice cream: 3 large scoops of coconut ice cream(infused with jelly and coconut flesh) display in a coconut. OMG, i looove this ice cream that i ate all 3 scoops. Seriously, cut it down to 2 scoops to make it more manageable to eat!

Redbean chocolate mouse: it's more of a dark chocolate mousse and it was really good. i didnt taste much of the red bean.

This place is a solid 4.5 stars.  I round up for family owned places and down for chains...so they get 5!  The deduction of .5 stars would be for the lack of parking (which I know they can't help) and for a little pet peeve of mine, not listing the market prices.  If you are going to have things on the menu that are at market price, list the prices on the chalk board or have the servers mention them without having to be asked.  

Now to the good stuff.  The oxtail pho was very good.  Large pieces of oxtail that were falling off the bone.  Also, the spicy beef soup was the kind of soup one would love to have on a cold winter night.  We wanted to try the big bone soup, but it was sold out.  The pork belly buns were good, but not great.

Oh my god! This place is so delicious! I heard of this place on Facebook and since I was going to be in town, I had to try this place out. Its such a great vibe and the customer service was amazing.

Customer service: even though we came before it opened, our server Jason C. greet us and served us. Jason was a great server. He was very friendly and a cool guy to talk to. 

Food: Where do I even begin. The bone marrow soup was off the chain! Not only that I also got the lobster pho and it was amazing. The broth was so Delicious!

Eating here felt like my moms home cooking. Every pho spot I go to, does not compare to my moms home cooking but district one has exceeded my expectations.

I would highly recommend this place! I'm definitely coming back when I'm back in town.

We came here to watch the stupid Trojans lose to BC.  Seriously, BC?  What the hell guys, where was that defense?  BC, really????  Aaaaaarrrggghhhhhhhh!!!!!!  Not sure what's worse, that or UNLV losing to Northern Illinois... Pathetic and Pathetic-er.  Okay, done venting.

So it is great to find a cool ASIAN bar where you can actually watch games!  And they come with great food, which is double great!  $20 pitcher of Heineken is a bit steep, but it does fill up about 6 tall glasses and it comes in those pitchers with built in ice cooler.  Miller Lites are $15 for the pitcher, if you're looking for better bargains.  The food is more Vietnamese fusion than diverse Asian, but no matter, it's still good stuff.  We had a few dishes:  Ox Tail Pho, Garlic Serrano Pepper Wings, Beef Lemongrass skewers, and Calamari.  The pho was fantastic, calamari was great, and wings and skewers were good but not great.  The meatiness of the ox tail and the light & crispy batter on the calamari stood out.  There are other interesting dishes we want to try out, which will have to wait for the next time.

The real winner that is a great accompaniment to the good food is the atmosphere.  Wait staff was great for the most part, and like a typical Asian restaurant they don't have "designated" sections for each server so you can flag anybody down for what you need.  They're very good about coming around and waiting on your table, and many of them were even social with the customers in a pleasant and non-intrusive way.  Big ups for the wait staff.  There are TVs all around every section of the place, so wherever you sit you will have multiple views of the action.  Wish the TVs were a bit bigger though, although they were close enough that it wasn't a bother.

Great atmosphere, great wait staff (including the super cutie that appeared to be the hostess/manager?), and great food all make for a great "bar" that deserves at least 4.5 stars.  Oh, the tab came to $150 before tips for the 4 of us, but I suppose when you order 4 $20 pitchers... but the price is a bit steeper than your typical Vietnamese.

Table-for-1 Factor:  I'm not seeing this place as a great atmosphere for sitting alone (might be awkward), but there is a bar with good 8-10 bar stools if you have the inkling.

My husband talks about coming to District One every time we are in Vegas but we never make it out since it is a little further from the strip. It is well worth the drive during rush hour!  The food is fantastic as you can see from all of the pictures posted. We ordered the oxtail fries, five spice Cornish hen, coconut pork belly and garlic noodles. We had to take some food to go but our suite has a kitchenette so it worked out perfectly. The only problem here is the parking. We arrived at 6:00 pm and was seated right away but it took 15 minutes just to get a parking spot. We will definitely return, though!

I've been here a couple of times. 3 Stars for food and 4 Stars for atmosphere.  Being Vietnamese, I have a certain standard for our food. I also appreciate fusion food. I love what District One is trying to do by modernizing Vietnamese cuisine and appealing to a certain demographic. This place is cool, hip and a joint I would want to hang out at with my friends. However, I am less impressed with the food. Pho is very lacking in flavor, portions of appetizers are really small and prices are higher end compared to other Viet restaurants. I was most dissapointed by the hamachi tacos. 3 of the tiniest tacos the size of a pinky finger and literally a teaspoon of fish in each for over $10. I also ordered the oxtail fries. It had an interesting flavor with Viet spices that were very pronounced. It was ok but the 6+ chunks of gelatinous fat really grossed us out. These pieces were about 2×2" of pure fat! I think they were trying to pay homage to the oxtail fries at Bachi but really fell short. Wings are always good and the steak and egg platter was as well. There was a nice selection of seafood on their specials board including razor clams, octupus and oysters. I'll try more menu items next time and adjust stars accordingly.

Came here once a couple months ago and had dinner and dessert.

I love exploring restaurants in Chinatown LV. I've heard so many good things about this place and was lucky enough to stop in while visiting the city for work.

Everything is good here... there's something for everyone. I had the beef carpaccio, chicken wings, noodles, fish tacos, and two desserts.

I love the late night hours and the chill vibes here. Great for big groups.

I would love to come back here again to try more things off the menu. If you're in LV or visiting the city... I highly recommend.

Thanks Chef Khai!

I'm a fan.

- Miss Yelp 2017

BEST VIETNAMESE/ASIAN FUSION FOOD IN TOWN!! 

So GOOD I didn't even have the chance to take pictures of my food!! Seriously delicious & amazing service!!

Came here for a Saturday night dinner with my brother. Good Yelp reviews, and they take reservations. The food was great. We ordered oysters on the half shell and side of baby bok Choy.  I had the oxtail pho, meat was tender, soup was light (not salty or thick). Hubby had the surf and turf pho (generous lobster tail and rib eye meat). My sis-in-law ordered the spicy noodles, she loved it but too spicy for me. My brother ordered the Cornish hen and rice. The 5 star rating is because the food was delicious and the service was great. We will definitely go back next time we're in town.

The food here is amazing. I'm actually at the restaurant right now and just wanted to share my experience. So the waitress took our order at 11:38 pm. We ordered an order of 6 garlic pepper wings, among other things. At 11:55, the wings are brought out to us. At 12:00, the waitress brings us a happy hour menu, on which the wings we ordered are $0.50 each. On the regular menu an order of 6 wings is $6.95. We had not touched the wings yet, and the waitress claims she didn't realize what time it was. I asked if we could pay the happy hour menu price for the wings.
