She asked the manager and the answer is no because she had put the order in before it was happy hour. COME ONNNNNNNN. You didn't even mention that happy hour was coming up. You know if you were the customer, you would feel somewhat cheated... I wish this experience wouldn't have happened because I really like this place....

I didn't realize that I hadn't updated my review, because my 2nd visit was outstanding. My friend and I had a great meal, sampling several dishes, Service was much better this time around as well. 

Ordered:
slow braised pork belly in young coconut juice. This was divine! 5/5
the king crab legs in a garlic type sauce. A bit tough because the crab wasn't broken open as much but nevertheless good. 4/5
Beef and lemongrass wrapped in Betel leaves....so much flavor. 4/5
Mekong River Soup - my friend had this and she liked it. I couldn't sample it because she added plenty of peppers. 

Overall this was really a fun, delicious meal. We were there around 4pm on a Friday, so it wasn't busy but soon got packed with more people for happy hour. It was quite the improvement from my first time, which is why I felt the need to update this review.

Wanted to try some place new in Vegas and this place was recommended to me. Food here is great and service is so nice.

This place is like a Vietnamese infusion because they have traditional Vietnamese food but some dishes have a nice twist to it. I ordered almost all of their seafood dishes (I was on a seafood crave that day) and it was all great. Their snails were huge and the broth that it came in was sooo good. Their clams, oysters, calamari, pho, everything was just delicious. There wasn't anything here that I did not like. 

Needless to say, I will be returning here to try more of their specials when I visit Vegas.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! hands down one of the best oxtail places that i've been to. server was extremely nice and accommodating, and very friendly! food was totally amazing... oxtail pho was super tender and the oxtail locomoco was very tasty. the pork belly buns were very flavorful and slightly spicy, and the bun itself was soft and warm. garlic noodles were also really good... all the dishes we ordered totally surpassed expectations. would definitely come here again.

we ordered:
oxtail loco moco
oxtail pho
rib combo with garlic noodles

I VOLUNTEER AS TRIBUTE TO EAT HERE! 

Am I the only one who is reminded of the Hunger Games because of this restaurant's name?

Let's start off with the appearance of this place. Let's just put it simply.. I feel pretty freakin' cool eating here. I definitely wouldn't mind having a photoshoot against their wall of typography. You'll know what I'm referring to once you go here. Look for the words: WTF (Where's The Food) pretty clever.

Let's move onto the menu. They keep everything pretty simple on a clip board and one sheet of paper. Yes, you read correctly... One. Sheet. Each order is pretty much broken down on the menu. They also have specials, so be sure to ask your server on that.

I ordered the steak and eggs both times. What can I say? If I like something, I really like something. The best part of this entree is the steak! It is seriously COOKED TO PERFECTION and even already cut into perfect bite sizes =') They give you a good portion size of rice and an egg on top. I'm seriously still in awe over how amazing their steak is. My boyfriend got their oxtail fried rice, which I found pretty darn tasty. My friend gets their garlic noodles. Who knew that garlic noodles could be so FLAVORFUL?! 

District One, you have definitely caught my heart and stomach. I'll be back to explore more of your menu soon.

Absolutely love this place! The service was excellent and the food was delicious.
The hubby and I have been here a handful of times. My favorite dishes would have to be the bun bo hue, pho ox tail, and shaken beef salad. They are quite generous with the meat and the flavor is simply delish. Hubby went on and on about how great the razor clams were. We've also had their pork belly buns, crispy egg rolls, and garlic serano pepper wings. All were extremely tasty.
I can honestly say that I've never been to a restaurant where I enjoyed every single item that we ordered ... until now. :)
Their bar is now open as well, and I have every intention of visiting it.

Four stars because...

Tamarind Wings were a bit bland. You got the tang when you first bite into it, but after that, nothing special really. 

The Crispy Noodle Nest was superb! This place made it with the light brown sauce rather than the thick white one & didn't have as much seafood, but it was still excellent!

The beef sausage I believe wrapped in the betel leaves were soooo good! 

Service was great & they're very clean, always cleans up the plates and trash that are sitting on the table.

The restaurant that's brought you the whole lobster pho, also brings you full bone marrow!! @districtonelv knows their pho, pho sho!! They have all types of soups and noodles, and delicious oxtail fried rice as well! 
Bone marrow wasn't my favorite and it didn't come with noodles, so if I were to return, I would get a different special pho, and the oxtail fried rice again ;) 

And definitely don't skip out on their dessert! Best pandan creme brûlée and coconut icecream I have ever tried! Smooth and creamlicious!!

YES! I am a fan. Hubby and I tried to dine here once almost a year ago but was closed at the time we arrived. 

After dining here a few times within the past couple months, I am still eager to try more from their menu. 

Their modernized southeast asian cuisine has something almost anyone can enjoy. Every dish I've tried was delicious. 

They do have a weekly menu along with daily specials. 

must try: oxtail fried rice, pork belly buns ( fried), viet beef carpaccio

Can't forget the staff, each visit was served with an attentive and informative waiter. They knew the menu so well and even helped pack up my left over bone marrow soup. 

Great job  District one!

Visiting from LA, we met some local friends here.  We had 7 people total which was good because we were able to order many dishes to try and share.  Quite simply, the food is solid.  Oxtail pho is a must.  The shaken beef salad was also very tasty.  Atmosphere is casual and relaxed.  Service is excellent.  Full bar, moderately priced drinks!  This is a huge plus as a vodka drinker.

Doesn't matter what you're craving district kitchen and staff can accommodate. Whether you want a drink, watch a game, something sweet or savory, something small district one has it. Hands down one of the best off strip local eats to stop by. I guarantee you won't be disappointed or call me age I'll pay for your meal

Lively, wonderfully decorated, amazing authentic Asian food with a modern vibe. 

Love the oxtail fries!

I asked for HELLA CILANTRO! 

They delivered. 

Most amazing Ox Tail Pho. 
Decent venue.
Hella awesome servers!

This restaurant is amazing. I love the decoration, the service and the food! Got referral from a friend and I tries out the Lobster Pho bowl. It turned out GREAT! It costs $35 for a tasty big bowl ribeyes meat and half lobster and the broth is very good. We also had the Sea snails, Beed fried rice. They are all so beyond great. It worths for a trial and definitely recommend my friends this place.

Oxtail fried rice- 5 star. it's smoky, rich in flavor, and definitely a smaller portion enough for one to finish the plate. 

BBQ plate- 5 star. Short rib was so dang good, these people are up for competition with a korean restaurant. Marinade was on point, with enough sweetness and just the right amount of saltiness. my only complaint is why there's wasn't more. 

I didn't like the Chinese sausage too much. 

I must say that everything I've had so far minus the Serrano wings and Cajun fries has been a 5 star for me.

I was doing some shopping at 168 Supermarket and than I found out  District One was across the street so I gave it a shot and to tell you the honest truth it was a big disappointment. I came in around 3:10 PM and I was excited they have the special lobster fried rice and also their bone in ribeye special. I waited almost 35 mins for my meal to come out I guess they got some amateur cooks back there or some sou chefs making the food. I ordered the following it's a big disappointment I don't want to do a review on it but Yelpers must know.

Server 3/5 server was apologetic and seemed friendly at first but I think she got annoyed with me because I waited for almost 35 mins for my bland food.

Lobster fried rice with cavier 2/5 for almost $50 alone this has to be top five worst fried rice I've ever had because it was oily and seemed like they use oil for frying some kind of meats or something when cooking my fried rice. 

Bone in Ribeye 2/5 asked for Med Well and some of the parts came out Med cook and it was so bland and flavorless it makes Dennys ribeye mouth watering. 

Garlic fries 3/5 nothing special some sautéed garlic with regular fries.

Anyways District one is a fushion Vietnamese restaurant which the real Vietnamese taste and Unami is not there. I got comp for the ribeye the manager does not want to come over and asked how was things becuase she was too busy doing nothing but chatting with another male customer. Put all things aside TK the server or one of the owners was nice and apologize for my bad experience but it won't have me coming anytime in the future.

I really love that there is such a good atmosphere for friends and family's to enjoy good Vietnamese dishes. The staff is always very attentive and so personable. 
There's free Wifi for my kids to play on their iPads and have the best Oxtail Pho in town! Broth is clear and tasty, amongst other plates on the menu, this is by far my go to order.  
PLEASE expand another restaurant in Henderson!!!  
I would drive here every week if I could !

This is a second time my bf takes me here. Its a very young cool, hip vietnamese restaurant. Food is absolutely delicioussssss..

 This time we came right on their happy hour. How awesome. Service is super nice and friendly 
Must order: beef capaccio, house special oyster, sea snail.
Dessets? Creme bulee 

Definitely come back..

Treat off the strip! My parents and I had dinner here on a Sunday around 5 pm. We ordered their fresh fish (snapper), calamari, and shrimp pho. I took off a star because I thought it was a little pricey. It was all delicious! Our sever, Jason C., really made a positive impact on our experience. He made us feel like we were talking to a friend and was very accommodating.

I really wanted to try the beef bone soup. However, they were out of it by the time we arrived. According to our server, there were a lot of people who stopped by for Sunday lunch.

The fresh fish is charged per pound ($23.00 for our 1 1/4 pound of fish). The snapper we ordered was cooked with a delicious sweet and sour sauce service with white rice.

The calamari was a great sharing size. It comes with a mild spicy mayo sauce. The batter tasted a little heavier compared to other calamari I have tried. Still tasty!

The shrimp pho was fantastic and served in a good amount.

Overall, great experience. I would come here again!

We ordered the pho oxtail soup, beef lemon grass in betel leaves, fish tacos, beef carpaccio, pork belly buns and pork belly slow braised soup w poached eggs. I enjoyed the pho oxtail soup and carpaccio. Will come back to try more of their soups and entrees though.
We had a great meal here!  The oxtail fried rice was delicious and not too heavy.   The atmosphere is cool with a sports bar gastro pub feel.   We will definitely come back and try more!

If u like mediorce fusion, then u would like this place. Had the fish tacos (too fishy and was sent back)  grilled whole squid, bone soup, oxtail fried rice... all of it was - meh. The novelty of the big knuckle bones were cool but lackluster in actual taste and gratification. With all the great options in chinatown, money may be better spent elsewhere with a whole lot more options to choose from. Service was attentive and swift, deserves the extra star.

What type of cheap degenerate bastard sleeps all day and waits until midnight to go to a spot to hit up their happy hour menu?  ME!!
Needless to say I was not disappointed.   From the happy hour menu I  had the oysters, chicken wings and pork belly buns.  All were terrific and afordable.  I will definitely go back when I am up late again.
The only disappointment was the bone marrow soup.  For me it did not live up to the hype.  I was happy to see the oxtails in the soup, but they were luke warm and the broth was not hot either. Other than that I had a great time and the staff was friendly as well.

Had to try this place after yelping and seeing all the positive reviews! This place did not disappoint! Server was attentive and friendly and made some good food suggestions. Stand out items were the belly buns (pork belly), garlic noodles, and pho chicken. Good variety of different types of Asian food. Even my mom liked it which is rare because she's hard to please! Will definitely come back to try other things when I'm back in town!

I learned quickly that is a late night spot for industry folks and I can see why. Their menu is full of unique eats that will make your mouth water at all hours. Their mission? To create a unique dining experience that reflects their personalities. If their menu is any indication of the folks behind the business, I want to meet every single one of them. 

My (so-far) favorite is the the Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio. Thinly sliced with a mix of citrus soy, truffle oil, sesame, and peanuts. It's simply mouthwatering, melt in your mouth good.

I simply must try the Oxtail Fries and The Big Bone Soup.

I can't wait to plan my next late night Happy Hour experience, except it won't be a Tuesday, because they are closed,.

I like this place! Actually came here twice in like 4 days! It's great for groups since it's a decent sized place. First time was with like 20 family members including a bunch of little nieces and nephews who were running around the restaurant like newly minted 21 year olds on the strip. Just crazy. Staff was super cool about it. 

Interior is trendy, the food is like homestyle Asian/Vietnamese fusion, service was great, everyone had a great time. 

Favorite dishes -  

- Big Bone Soup - $15 (4/5) - Strait up #foodporn since you get this huuuuge crazy looking bowl full of marrow bones in this pho type broth. Kinda have to dig for the meat but I thought it was fun to eat. (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Mel59OcvfQjrZH2EH9_JOg&userid=pDfL8xt8F8ls0-kQIG_ADg)
- Viet-chelada! -  Easy to drink, they use a Vietnamese lager instead.
- Beef carpaccio with citrus soy, truffle and sesame oil, and peanut. $13 - solid. 
- Garlic noodles - solid rendition, Thanh Long/Crustacean is still the best tho. 
- Oxtail fried rice - $13 (4/5) - a decent amount of parted oxtail. 

Good
- Chicken wings with the garlic and serrano peppers. $8. Always a hit
- Belly buns $8 - pork belly bao's with jalapeno, cilantro, and peanut. Classic combo, they could get a little creative here and borrow from the Chairman Bao truck. 
- Grilled whole squid - huge. 
- Five spice roasted cornish game hen $13 - overcooked and little skimpy with meat. 
- Hue style beef noodle soup $10 - cha, pork blood cubes, the broth wasn't as deep as I've had. More fusion style. 

I'd come back. I'll try their lobster pho next.

Don't go there if you have reaction to MSG or favor enhancer. We ordered big bone soup and braised seasonal greens for me and our one-year-old. My tongue tingled after just eating some braised veggies and some meat off the bone in big bone soup. And my one-year-old got rashes & swelling all over his face and neck after I fed him about half cup of big bone soup and some broth and veggies.  We had to rush to the emergency to have him checked out. I don't mind spending $$ on a good meal. But the truth that my son and I suffered because of the food really pissed me off. All restaurant owners should have the guts to inform the customers about MsG if added to the food.

Definitely a must TRY!   Came in with friends and have been coming back ever since.  

Great atmosphere, with an exceptional menu.  Good service and clever dishes.  Whole lot of flavor.  

My favorite dishes are the oxtail frird rice, chicken pho, and the specialized desserts.  Oh my goodness.  Lol. 

I loVe this restaurant.
This "New Vietnamese" style restaurant is great! Get the beef carpaccio, the Thai style snails, and share the oxtail bone pho! And don't forget the pandang creme brûlée/flan with micro marigolds!

Holy food! Came here because Chada Thai had 30 min wait with 25% occupancy. I guess they had reservations lined up but decide to come here since it was right next door and I was starving. Had a bunch of different things from the steak n eggs to fresh oysters. All were ridiculously good. Server was friendly and had a ton of info. 
Loved it all. I'll come here from now on.

This place is really close to my job and the food is delicious, I love their veggie pho and their signature coconut cocktails. The service sometimes can be not so great when it's super busy which is understandable. But other than that this place is top notch in my book.

This place is one of the hidden gem of Vegas! The food is great and the atmosphere is lively and cozy. Whatever food item you order, expect it to be flavorful and satisfying to your palate. We've tried the Pho Oxtail, Coconut Pork Belly, Oxtail Fried Rice, and more of their featured dishes. All of the entrees were really good! This has been our weekend 'go to' restaurant. You'll also feel good about the friendly and attentive servers. Love it! Love it! Love it!

Over 800 reviews can't be wrong -- District One delivers a delightful, upscale spin on Vietnamese food. I'm Vietnamese, so I like to think of myself as half expert, half hater when it comes to Vietnamese food. My parents rarely took us out to eat growing up and when they did, they were always complaining about how nothing tasted as good as my mom's home cooking. Well, that was largely true... until I came to District One.

The food tastes as good as my mom's, but with much fancier ingredients! I can't make a trip out to Vegas without stopping here for the oxtail fried rice, oysters, or coconut ice cream. Most recently, we tried the black pepper lobster and it's the best Chinese lobster I've had outside of So Cal. Everyone I've sent or brought here (including my hater ass brother, we have it in our blood) vouches for this place. If I ever bring my mom, I'll be sure to update this review.

My friends and I came down for EDC weekend and stayed an extra couple of days and one of them recommend this place after a night of clubbing. Thank god! This place had that cool industrial atmosphere while staying clean, modern, and classy. But that's not what we came there for. Everything we ordered was AMAZING! The prices weren't bad either (besides the market priced Lobster Pho, which was BOMB AF and I don't even like pho). Did I mention it was happy-hour when we went? I can't wait to come back so I can order more of those fried Belly Buns!!

This is a must go for us anytime we visit sin city. The lobster fried rice and oxtail pho are delicious! Service can be rather slow so make sure you have ample time when dining here.

The Vietnamese iced coffee is on the sweet side so be prepared to add extra hot water.

5 star for food
4.5 star for atmosphere (only because it was kind of dark inside and it was hard to see menu) (maybe I should of went in the day time l, duh) 
To be honest I've never heard of this place nor care to know about it when people actually talk about it but I wish I did. Seriously the stuff on the menu are pretty wild.  Example: oxtail fries, oxtail fried rice, oxtail pho, lobster pho (with the actual 2-3 lb of lobster, not the ones they chop up and mix it in the bowel). 
My friends and I shared the oxtail fries and I thought it was okay (Note that I don't really eat fried food so if it's okay for me, it's probably bomb for some of you). My man and I shared the oxtail pho with extra oxtail and extra noodle and that was amazing. Omg. If it wasn't so expensive we would of ordered another one (I think about $17.99 plus tax). 
This is good food and it's definitely on the pricier side but you get what you pay for.

It's just, okay. I wouldn't find myself wanting to come here unless the people I'm with mention it. Their happy hour menu is just okay and every meal I've had was nothing special. The oxtail fries and garlic fries weren't crispy at all, kinda soggy. Their oxtail pho isn't anything amazing, and the wings we ordered weren't even fully cooked. Customer service is okay. There were many times we found ourselves wishing they'd refill our waters, when the server is nowhere to be found and the restaurant pretty empty. Pretty expensive for what you get out of it.

This place is amazing! Their selection is service is great and after visiting for the first time (drive by) with my husband, I ended up bringing a group of friends yesterday for lunch. As I was given credit for picking a great restaurant, I can honestly say I would continue to bring people over, especially the oyster lovers!

Pho is great, specials are GREAT (my husband had the red snapper with papaya salad, which was beautiful presented and great tasting), but I'm a sucker for fresh oysters and both visits, I had 2 dozen of their oysters as my entrée. They server Blue Point as their house special and I enjoyed the Fanny Bays. Topped with tobiko and done just right! 

Wonderful selection of drinks too. I definitely enjoyed Yamazaki which are quite hard to find at any restaurant. I only wish they had Hitachino Red Rice stocked yesterday. 

Nicole coincidentally was our server both times and she was not only helpful but was knowledgeable with both food and drink menus and couldn't have made our experience any better. Our table of 6 was bused frequently was checked up on several times. However another server who came over to check on us informing she will be taking over the section when I asked for our server so we could order additional items. This is when I ordered the Hitachino Red Rice and after she took the order she came back letting me know they were out. I asked what other ones they have as I was naming off the other types as she couldn't remember which one and brought us a drink menu (finds out it was IPA). I totally understand any restaurant will have certain items low/out but would be lovely if the servers could check the 86 list prior to greeting their guests. Not to mention, Nicole never informed us that Juliet will be taking over. However, she did have a very lovely attitude with a beautiful smile and I'd love to have her as our server one of these days! Long story short, everything was great! I am looking forward to trying your black pepper lobster. You will be seeing me again very soon!! Thanks again District One!

Very underwhelming. Heard great things about this place but it was honestly mediocre. We got the squid, fish tacos, pho filet mignon, oxtail pho, and pork belly. The only thing that was worth it was the fish tacos. Everything else was kind of blah and not worth the price. The service was also very slow. Our waitress was friendly, but the food took forever to come out. All the tables around us got their food faster than us. Some of our food actually came lukewarm, but we got so hungry from waiting that we didn't care. Don't think we'll be coming back.

Our original dinner plans for the night was yakiniku however for some reason Gyu-kaku was packed so we called a Yelp audible and settled on this place. Asian Fusion is what drew us to this place. 

Their claim to fame is here is the lobster pho ($33 mkt price today) which of course I did not order!

Fish Sauce  Hot Wings 5*. 
For those of you who do not know, this is the business. I know it sounds strange but the fish sauce glaze was very well put together and gave the wings a subtle salty flavor. 

Oxtail Loco Moco 3*
This dish was very deceiving as it was not a true loco moco. I was expecting the hamburger patty smothered in the oxtail gravy and topped with an egg. Instead, all I got was oxtail gravy and an egg. So basically it was just gravy rice topped with an egg.  

Oxtail fries 4* 
I like their rendition of the oxtail fries. It was generous serving. the gravy was loaded with the  oxtail meat and not just essence of oxtail like those other guys (bachi)

Spring Rolls 4*
These were your standard fair spring rolls. They were served the real way with leafy lettuce to wrap them up and eat with. On point!

Vietnamese Carpaccio 3*
This was a very cool and different take on traditional carpaccio. It was like eating the raw beef steak that comes with pho.  .    

Birdnest Noodles 3*
This was the "safe" dish that we ordered. Nothing wow about this one. It was Hong Kong style crispy noodles topped with veggies, meat and gravy. This is my favorite type of noodle dish hands down so it was a win for me.

  
I enjoyed all of the food that we ordered and think that we got a good sample of what this place is all about! I give this place credit in the creativity and skill in creating these dishes. Vietnamese food is very strong in flavor and can often be overpowering for the novice eater. This place is a good starter for those who aren't familiar with Vietnamese food but want to give it a try. For those of us who grew up on these flavors this place is a breath of fresh air from the traditional...

I Likey...

Eat with confidence....

Stopped in this place for drinks while waiting on another reservation. The staff was the most friendly of any Vegas establishment we have been to so far. The drinks were great and they helped my husband pick a nice Japanese beer. After our other reservation, we came back to finish out our night! I ordered the sea snails but didn't care for them. I don't have much experience with that type of thing but I am pretty sure they were over cooked (very rubbery) and they had sand in them still. Did not try anything else on the menu but will definitely go back.

Was excited to try this place after watching buzzfeed and it sadly did not live up to the hype. I ordered the oxtail pho and the bf got the lobster pho. Both soups were extremely salty for my liking (so salty it made ME salty). Go ahead and call me extra but I had to add water... we waited pretty long for both soups too and they didn't even come together at the same time. We came around 3 pm on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all. I got mine first and the bf waited an extra ten mins. Both pho had barely any noodles. I purposely didn't order a starter because I assumed I'd be getting a decent amount of noodles. I also ordered a matcha Thai tea because the tap water tasted nasty too. That also didn't impress me. Overall super disappointed but glad I tried it to get it off my mind.

I went here with a friend of mine recently.. 
The atmosphere is kinda like a crawfish joint.. has a bar.. has nice booth seatings.. The service was not bad as well. the parking is a PAIN in the butt tho... its always so busy in that shopping center so you literally have to circle around a bunch to shark for a parking spot. 

So lets talk about the food.. One of the first things i ordered was the pork belly buns.. it was tasty but nothing mind blowing or nothing. priced at $10. 
I ordered the coconut pork belly with boiled egg as my entree. Theres 3 big chunks of the meat  and an egg. The pork belly was tasty but I would prefer it to  be more tender! its on the chewy side. As a vietnamese person with having it made in my household.. its usually cut more on the smaller side and more tender! its priced at $13. It comes with a small bowl of rice and some pickled cabbage. 
I also ordered the papaya salad with shrimp. its priced at $12. Its BARELY SPICY.... so if you're used to the thai style made papaya salad this is not anything like it. its ok tasting but not what I had expected. I had them adjusted it to more spicy.. which was okay i suppose but not what Im used to. kinda disappointed in this dish. I would say PASS on this dish. 
my friend ordered the creme brûlée i believe and it was mediocre ..nothing that wows me. I had a taste of it ...but glad i didn't order it. 

Overall I would say this place is okay in food but needs lots of improvements ...service is okay as well.. ambiance is alright. I would not bend over backwards to come here.. Im not too sure if i wanna come here in the future.. probably not. I'm just not wowed by this place... pricing is kinda high and food isn't amazing.

Came here to try their Bone Marrow Soup. Broth was delicious and HUGE, but only came with broth and no noodles. I had to pay extra for a tiny portion of noodles that took 30 minutes to arrive at the table. My boyfriend order the grilled king crab at MP. He received one leg cut up in 5 pieces for $36. So not worth the money. It was overcooked and rubbery and left him hungry. He order a side of garlic noodles because the crab comes a la carte. He said they tasted good but cold by the time he got them. The staff ignored the table for most of the time. For a party of 8 it took an hour to bring our dishes one at a time. Some of the people were done eating by the time the last dish came to the table. Entree dishes were brought as appetizers and were cold by the time the actual entrees came out.  Just poor kitchen management. The only thing the table enjoyed was the coconut ice cream in the coconut shell. I won't be returning or recommending this place. Just mediocre Asian fusion dishes for higher prices.
Had the Ox tail fried rice, Spicy Hue, Belly Buns. It was all very exceptional, couldn't ask for anything else besides more spicy!!

I honestly did not know what to expect coming here; it could either be ridiculously overrated (I'm sure they've gone up in popularity since it was on a little video clip) or it could be amazing. There was still a wait around 11pm, but luckily we went right to the bar. The bartender was really nice and chatty, and they had a pretty good alcohol selection (sake flight yay!) The lobster pho was a whopping $50, which for that price I could get over 5 bowls of combo pho, so I had to skip. However, we still splurged and got:

Oxtail pho: The broth was very flavorful, and had definitely been simmering for hours to get that type of flavor. They put a good amount of lime in there when I got it, though I think I like the broth without the lime (or less?) There was a good amount of oxtail, though just a tiny bit of pho noodles. Comparing this to actual pho joints, you're really not going to enjoy the pho noodles, as there really isn't much, but definitely savor all that oxtail.

Bone marrow soup: At first I was thinking, "nah, it's just a big ol' bone and soup!" But no! There was plenty of meat still clinging to the bone, and the broth was ultra flavorful and yummy--it was the same as my oxtail pho broth, but without the lime. My husband was so happy to get this dish, as his tummy had not been feeling well and what better than a giant bowl of bone broth? This is definitely something I would get again.

Overall, we both left satisfied and full from all the yummy broth and goodies. I would definitely come again to try the non-broth dishes, but man, that bone marrow is just so tempting. This place is worth a try and worth all the hype, so give it a go!
I'm glad we tried this place.. we had the big bone soup and the double down plate... both dishes were great.. then we had the ice cream in a coconut.. and that was awesome!

I had a great time at this restaurant with my son.
Atmosphere was trendy, customers young, wait staff attentive.
We ordered the The Big Bone Soup...Chicken Wings....Spring Rolls....Slow Braised Pork Bellies....2 dozen fresh oysters...and Ox Tail Fried Rice.

Definite hints of Vietnamese Fusion in their one page menu.
Perfect menu before you go clubbing, raving, or whatever.

I focused my attention on the Big Bone Soup. 
Bone marrow galore....I felt primitive but happy as I gnawed on the bones like Scooby-Doo!

The Chicken Wings were inhaled by the son....so no reviews.

The spring rolls were great once I wrapped them up in the green veggie leaf, along with fresh green herbs...then dipped in the sweet chili sauce....delish.

The braised pork was delicious.....just take an extra Lipitor afterwards.

The 2 dozen oysters were inhaled by the son.....so no reviews.

Finally, the ox tail fried rice was delish....meaty....goes great with the bone soup.

My grade on this place.....good enough for a return engagement!

Used to be one of my favorite spots to snag a couple of appetizers and some drinks. Never had an issue until the bartender took it upon himself to turn a $20 tip into a $60 tip off of a $27 tab. Basically was scammed. Accounting admitted they were in the wrong, and that the bartender got a slap on the wrist. they were supposed to send me the $40 back, but didn't. Repeated attempts to get ahold of said accountant after this were useless. Needless to say I will not be going back.

Service suck so bad that the manager would not even spend any time to listen to our complaint that she send one of her servers to lister to our complaint.  Managers are more busy mingling with their friends at the bar instead of listening to customers complaints and rectify the issues.  This is my first and last visit to this establishment and I will make sure that I tell my friends to take their business else where.  This place is only a hype and careless about their service and customer appreciation.

I saw this place on my cousin's Instagram so I bookmarked it to try the next time I was in Vegas.

The first time I went was in September with my family. We ordered the: oxtail pho, oxtail fried rice, big bone marrow soup. Everything we ordered were delicious! My mom is difficult to please because either she thinks she can make it better or the food was too expensive but this is the first time she did not complain despite the fact that a bowl of oxtail pho is $11.95! (She was so happy that she took a business card) Her reasoning is that the bowl of pho comes with three pretty decent sized ox tails so she thinks it's worth it! The broth was tasty, the only thing is they need to add more noodles. Oxtail fried rice was decent to me. The big bone marrow soup was yum, it was like a mountain of bony goodness!! My dad wanted to take the bones back to my dog and according to the waiter, a lot of people do that!

Anyway, the second time I was in Vegas was this month and during my visit, i dined here twice! We ordered the same thing as my first visit plus we tried the garlic noodles, garlic wings, edamame. The garlic noodles were out of this world amazing! It was so simple yet so garlicky good! If you're a fan of garlic, you need to get this dish! Garlic wings were ok...I think they were like 6.95 for six wings, pretty pricey in my opinion. I didn't try the edamame but my friend liked it.

This place is more than a gathering to have dinners, everyone that works there is now our family/friend. We love everything from the decorations to the entrees to the desserts. From start to finish. I love the oyster features they have, the rice dishes, lobster pho. I've had everything on that menu can't say I have a favorite because it's all so damn good. My wife absolutely loves their coconut ice cream and green tea cream brûlée. Our family and all of our friends come here, so don't be surprised if you bump into some people you know. Come give it a try, it's amazing and very welcoming. We appreciate you Khai.
Tamarind wings, yum! I had the pho bo vien. My friend had the short rib combo. Everything was good.  Would return, nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

I had pork belly on my mind when I tried this place for lunch, but was a little disappointed to find out that they didn't have any since it was still cooking and it wouldn't be ready until dinner. 

Since I had my heart set on pork belly, it took me a little bit to recoup and figure out what to order. I finally decided on the combination rice plate with shortrib and my dining companion opted for the steak and eggs. The food came out pretty quickly, although my dish came out a few minutes before my friends, which was a little annoying. The lobster pho looked good as they were serving it to a neighboring table, so that definitely piqued my interest for my next interest.

I enjoyed my shortribs and everything I tried was solid, just nothing amazing. Service was good but refills were a little hard to come by. I especially enjoyed the kim chee which was on the spicy side. That was my favorite thing about the meal. I still couldn't get the pork belly out of my head, so I'll likely have to come back for that, but I've learned my lesson and will call in advance to make sure that they have it ready before coming in.
They have a great staff here :) all the girls are super sweet. Good vibe. This place is highly recommended. I always have steak and eggs or Pho

It was our first place at this restaurant. The service was ok. It wasn't that busy yet we had to walk the check to the host to pay.

As far as the food, it was good. The oxtail fried rice was really good, but there wasn't alot of meat. I would still get it again. The flavor was perfect and not too oily. 

The chicken pho was good, but again don't expect too much poultry. It was more than enough for one person.

Tonight we were able to catch happy hour for 30 minutes. Loved the variety they had on the happy hour menu; however I was a little disappointed that there were no cocktails, only beer or wines. The ultimate goal tonight was to get my hands on the Oxtail Fries(not on the happy hour menu). We got to try the wings, pork buns and fish tacos. The wings let me tell you are divine. Super crunchy and full of flavor without having to drench it in sauce. The pork buns are always a safe and flavorful bet. The tacos though were a disappointment. I saw no fish, only avocados and the other veggies that were inside. It had flavor but it's called fish tacos for a reason. The restaurant was clean, the waiters were friendly and there was no wait for a table. Can't wait to visit again!!!

It was really hard to park in this plaza, but I guess that the difficulty for the parking spot is almost worth the food. District One is a modern Vietnamese fusion cuisine that offers traditional plates like pho with a twist. There are a bunch of TVs in the restaurant and seating for tables, booths, and a bar.

Their alcohol and wine list is pretty detailed. I usually try different beers when I'm in here. They all taste yummy.

I had the steak and eggs. I opted for the normal steamed rice because I tried the tomato rice before and was not really a fan. The meat was good and the taste had a lot of flavor. No complaints at all!

The reason I can't make this place a normal go to is because the price is a tad bit expensive compared to other pho restaurants. Yes, they offer an amazing lobster pho and/or surf and turf pho, but that will cost you $30 for essentially what is still pho. If I want a normal pho bowl, I can think of a lot of places where I would pay less and probably pay as much as I would here but already have gratuity included.
Food and service was average not really worth the price. I think they charge way too much for its worth. I'd rather go to Pho kim long few minutes away from this place

This place is so awesome! Love the atmosphere, love the happy hour menu, love the bartenders (especially Tomas and Marcus)! Great beer selection, if you go, i mean WHEN you go, definitely get the belly buns, the edamame (comes with spicy cuttlefish mixed into it in a gooey way, yum yum! for all you azn flavor lovers) shrimp spring rolls, and serano pepper wings:) thank you districtONE!
